description:
PHILZ COFFEE! I almost always get the iced mint mojito. I like the taste of mint, coffee, and milk combined, and that is what you get when you order a mint mojito! I recommend taking out the mint before you drink it because it will keep sneaking into your mouth.

The house decaf is good too. I personally like discovering good decaf drinks because I love the taste of coffee but try not to drink too much caffeine.
author: Andrea T.

description:
Now that's what I call quality coffee.. super impressed by the taste, quality and smoothness...
I never knew fresh mint leaves tasted so good with coffee.. tried trantalizing Turkish coffee and it was an absolute delight.. on the darker side with cardamom, Herbs and Woody tobacco taste.
Will definitely try more coffees here. 
Philz won my heart, my second favorite after la colombe..
author: Meghna S.

description:
A Philz I didn't love??? What has the world come to?! I love Philz, so it pains me that this Philz location was pretty disappointing.

This spot is pretty crowded since it's near Caltrain and a busy area. It doesn't have much seating and feels cramped. The layout needs a lot of work... Don't know how it made much sense to them. 
Once you walk in from the front entrance, the seating area is to the left, while you order immediately to your front after queueing in line. Once you order, there simply isn't much room for you to wait for your coffee. You just stand awkwardly around, not sure where to wait. The way it's set-up doesn't make very efficient use of the space.

My go-to drink is always a Iced Silken Splendor straight-up (black). However, my coffee today was surprisingly bitter! Not as smooth as it usually is. Another issue is that it was somewhat slow since there were several people ahead of me and only two employees making drinks (versus the La Jolla location which can have like four). The employees were friendly, but it was just a "meh" experience.
author: Anthony T.

description: Was close by this Philz so I decided to pop in for a their mocha. The service was nice and friendly as always. However, the mocha wasn't so great - it didn't quite compared to the mochas I've gotten at other Philz locations.
author: Valeria S.

description:
So this is the Cal-stop Philz everyone has been racking check-ins at.

Very Grey. 

The line swells on and off between 8-10am. They are "dog-friendly" just as long as you leave your dog outside if that makes sense. A lady brought in some chihuahua mix and sat next to me by the window which I didn't mind.

Made me miss my own dog for the day and the other Philz in the South Bay that keep your Tesora hot; so ask for it Hotter!
author: Jason A.

description:
I'm into this Philz location. There were only 2 baristas though, which I imagine can be tough during busy hours. There are strategically placed tables in the corner to get work done, and wifi that's fast! Usually lots of meetings and coffee chats going on so it can get pretty loud but just get out your noise-cancelling headphones to block out all the networking haha.

Couldn't tell you about which coffee drink is best b/c I literally get the mint mojito every. single. time.
author: Thu P.

description: I like this location but it can get crowded and the wait can be longer than other locations. Great quality of coffee. I like the iced Mojito and the iced mocha. Great decor and good store layout.
author: Juan V.

description: not exactly the best coffee place. IDK what the hype is all about!!!! The service is very slow and there is no place to sit
author: Abigail S.

description:
Mint Mojito at Philz Coffee is where it's at.  So delicious!  Wish there was spot that serves it up this good in Atlanta.    The barista at this location was friendly and helpful.  This location is nice.  They have a couch and various chairs and tables to work, hangout, or read at.  They have free wifi available as well.  This location is pretty spacious but cozy.  

Highly recommend this location and their off the chain, Mint Mojito.
author: Esther K.

description: First time here. Visiting San Fran from Fresno, and the coffee was amazing. Service was fast and friendly. I was a little unclear where to start because you dont go to the register first like Starbucks. The barista gets you what you want, and then you check out.
author: Hunter B.

description: One of the smaller locations. Got a bagel this time which was decent.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Got a mint mojito iced coffee and a Mediterranean avocado egg toast. I paid $11 total, which isn't cheap for coffee and toast, but both tasted amazing!

So I didn't know this when I first came here, but you first order through the baristas, and then go to the register to pay! They are friendly and helpful if you ask for suggestions.
author: Hailey K.

description: I'm never happier than when this is in my hand, my fresh creamy Jacobs made by happy baristas in beautiful lil Mission Bay
author: Hareem M.

description: This was my first time here. The coffee and service were great. I generally put stevia and heavy cream in my coffee and was told that is how they make it. We actually came here twice in one day. I left the city with a yummy drink (I can't remember the name of it) that had cocoa butter!
author: Jenn D.

description:
The mint mojito coffee at Philz (lolz) is a complex coffee drink that is quite unlike any other. It's layered approach of sweet, creamy and mint hits you with a smile on first sip. 

Like puppies, this drink is a gift that keeps on giving. Even after burping an hour later, I could still taste that minty refreshment.
author: Mike T.

description:
I've been here a couple times now and always enjoy it. The baristas are quick and friendly, they have a ton of food options (including many beautiful-looking toasts!), and there's a good amount of seating inside and out.

The best part? THE POOCHES!! This Philz is always bursting at the seams with dogs. Love it. :)
author: Nic Z.

description:
Oh, of course.  It makes perfect sense that the first coffee shop I review in over a year would be a Philz.  One, because I chose to, in part so I could use that line as an opener (ha!).  And two, because, honesty, who doesn't love Philz?  Personally, I can't help but smile whenever I hear the barista call out drink and see my brown cup of delicious goodness waiting for me on the counter!

Compared to the other Philz locations that I've been to (this is the...ninth?), this is easily the smallest of the bunch.  With just a few tables around, there's really not much space to camp out at to do some work.  Though, with the way the meters/parking rates work around here, I'm sure most people who come here are those who live/work in the area or just happen to be in the neighborhood.  Like my friend and I, who just happened to stop in after one of the last Giants games of the season at AT&T.

Between the wealth of reviews/photos posted already and Philz's overwhelming popularity, there's really no need for me to break anything down (or post another photo).  If you've been, you know what's up.  And if you haven't, then you should just come here.  I'll just say - the Mint Mojito is one of my personal favorites (the Tesora is the other) and it was all too familiar and delicious here.  That being said, the balance of sweetness, cream, and coffee was a bit off this time around (light on the first, heavy on the second).

While none of them were all that bad individually, the totality of the lack of tables, unfavorable parking situation, and slightly off drink makes this Philz more of a (reluctant) four star location than five for me.  Love how clean and convenient it is, but my return trips would probably be limited to before/after a Giants game or if I was already in the area, as opposed to making it a point of coming here.
author: Mike L.

description:
I am lucky to live and work both, in close vicinity to Philz coffee . My favorites are Ecstatic and Gingersnap in cold coffee, and Silken splendor in hot. Absolutely love it. Love the fact that baristas let you taste and can adjust according to your taste. It would be great if they start keeping non dairy milks.

Edit: they do keep non dairy options!! So yay!
author: Tania C.

description:
Philz Coffee has great taste, excellent flavor and gives a clean buzz with no jitters. 

Phil Z. Ting used to be a local politician. 
That Phil Z. is not this Philz.
Philz is not like that Phil Z. Ting.  
Philz Coffee is my favorite coffee in the San Francisco Bay Area.
author: Ricardo O.

description:
This Philz is one of my favorite ones to go to. At first, the location seemed a bit out of the way for me but when I worked about a 5 minutes walk from this place, it made the perfect break and you get a delicious cup of coffee!

If you've never been to any Philz, just go to one, all Philz will carry about the same things when it comes to coffee and teas, some will carry different desserts but that's usually not a big deal for me. 

The famous one cup at a time process for making coffee definitely earns the $3-4 price. When you get to a Philz, you'll notice baristas making coffees and they'll signal you to order. 

Ordering is pretty simple, pick a type of coffee you want, how sweet and how creamy you want. Pro-tip: for sweetening the coffee, you can get it with whatever type of sweetener, like sugar, honey, agave, Splenda, or nothing and also how much of it you want. My favorite way to sweeten is to use about half the average amount of honey. Same goes for creamer, you can choose milk, half and half, almond, and depending on where you go, other options as well. 

My go-to drink is: small cup of Tantalizing Turkish with medium honey and medium creamer.
author: Muhammad U.

description:
Stopped by here as it was right next to the caltrain station that I got off at and the coffee was SO good. I usually only get the mint mojito but decided to try their regular coffee this time. 

I ordered a hot tesora with light cream and light sweetness and it was AMAZING. I don't know if the chilly weather made it even better, or if this specific location has great baristas, but I thought it tasted great! I also ordered a bagel with cream cheese, tomato, and cucumber which was also delicious, although I find that they usually put too much cream cheese on their bagels so I ask for less of it.

It's a pretty small location so seating is definitely limited. It was also fairly busy on a Saturday morning but I didn't have to wait long for my coffee to come out. I can't wait to try out their other blends.
author: Jiwon K.

description: Best coffee I've ever had. Bought four bags to take home and give to coffee loving friends.
author: Dennis H.

description:
Philz. Oh Philz. How much you have won over my heart as of late.

I also found out that they have these blends they no longer have on the menu but they still stock them behind the counter. I found that while Philtered Soul is amazing, it's hard to get a consistent pour because each barista does it differently. 

However, Hazelnut is still a blend! It's basically ... hazelnut coffee. It's one of their lightest roasts so it packs a ton of caffeine but has this incredibly smooth hazelnut smell / flavor that's also less sour than many of their other light roasts. Definitely super convenient location and great service!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
This location is on the corner of 4th & King, mostly a grab and go spot and not really conducive to studying/getting work done. The inside just has a communal table, a small table, a couch, and a bench. There are some tables outside as well.

That being said, it's a clean, convenient location. There's usually loud, upbeat music playing. The workers are friendly and will make modifications to your drink if you don't like how it tastes.

My go-to is a Tesora, with cream and light sugar. It does vary a little depending on the person who makes it. Twice-baked almond croissants are tasty as well!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Pompous AF
Wait time is wild
Honey you're making my coffee...
Be humble
New Manhattan is good
Review review review
author: Aleister C.

description:
Sweet, creamy mint mojito, you were delicious. Had it not been for the lack of clear signage and over-iced drink, I would've been happy giving Philz a perfect score. 

I enjoy going to coffee shops that have ample seating and wifi (it was on the small side, but I was just scouring for caffeine before taking a bus back to Southern California), but I also like getting in and out of there quickly. As soon as I walked through their wide doors, I was really confused about whether I should be ordering at the counter in front of me, at the register, or shouting my order at the heavens and hoping someone there would here me. It's not until you turn left and walk more into the shop that you see the wooden sign that says "ORDER FIRST, PAY LATER."

On the bright side, someone at the front said she could help the next person in line, but that made no sense when there was just a small cluster standing in front of the counter, waiting for their drink. They could benefit from some tape to make a line.

$4.25 for a small mint mojito was extremely pricey considering that my drink was filled to the brim with ice. Mint isn't cheap, but ice certainly is. I'd spring for a large next time I'm here, even if I don't want that much coffee. Philz is definitely a great place to get a specialty drink, but it's difficult to navigate as a first-timer.
author: Gwen W.

description: Philz is always amazing. This location is a little smaller than some, but still worth going to.
author: Brooke N.

description:
I love this philz!   Great location, wonderful people, and always amazing drinks! I love Ashley, she is amazing!   I always feel like my day is better just by coming in to  knowing I will soon receive my cup of love.  The line moves fast despite it being long at times, and everyone always helps you with a big smile!  The staff here are very friendly and always have a suggestion if I get stuck on what I may want for the day. 

Keep up the great work.  This location is by far my favorite in the city.
author: Stephen O.

description: This is my 5 day short trip and I basically came here every single day because all the different coffee I ordered had not let me down. Im a coffee addict and picky about taste of coffee. I love that they managed both black coffee and specialty coffee so well!! The mocha and mint mojito were amazing, the canopy of heaven and dancing water were also my highlight!
author: Cindy Y.

description:
We are Philz lovers, love the one on College Ave in Oakland, and now one closer to us in Walnut Creek! However we stopped at this one to get off the bridge and refresh with coffee... needless to say not happy.
As my college age daughter brought the drinks to the car hers was ok, mine was gross! No foam on top, which I seem to see is always a red flag... not sure how they make the drinks, but when there is frothy top you know it's a perfect drink! These drinks were bad, guy was rude... didn't even do the whole Philz "taste it and let me know what ya think" routine.
Definitely disappointed, and sorry we stopped and went out if our way to be disappointed by our favorite coffee co.
author: Michael E.

description:
Mint mojito all day everyday. They say they'll remake it if you don't like it, but I haven't taken advantage yet.

I do like it sweet and creamy, and some times it varies a bit. But regardless, on either spectrum, the drink is still always tasty.

Always crowded inside and out, so not great for lingering around / coffee chats. But, good for a grab and go.
author: Cynthia X.

description: Isabelle just made me the best iced mocha I ever had thank you !! Will keep coming back
author: Che B.

description:
I love coming here before a game or just on a day off. It's usually sunny on this side of town. The staff at every Philz location is always amazing and that's what you can expect here. Being close to the ballpark, you'll always see their collection of Giants bobbleheads and other stuff. 

Now, if you haven't been to Philz and you love in the bay...really?!  Get in one now. Stop reading this and just go. For anyone who says it's overrated...well shame on them. Philz has great coffee and they make it "one cup at a time." On a hot day their Mint Mojito is great. For any other day you want hot coffee, they narrow it down by roasts (light, medium, dark). I personally mix them up and get a Silekn Soul. Oh yeah, they'll do that. They will customize your drink no matter how crazy it gets. 

They also got some great snacks and food so get in to a Philz now...if you're lucky you might even run into Phil along the way.
author: Josh F.

description: I'm in line and actually did not order from the barista and walked straight to the cashier. She told me I need to go to a barista. I go to the barista and she tells me I have to stand back in the line. I'm like I was in line already. She like there are people in front of you in this line. I'm like What? I just want coffee geeeez! I get it but it can be a bit confusing with the line situation and gothic girl with nose ring was so rude about it. I'm like wow really ?
author: Anna L.

description: Good old reliable Philz. This location is a little small on seating options but the coffee/tea is consistent as ever with the usual great quality you come to expect from Philz. This location is better suited for ordering your drink and moving on, don't expect to come here to do work/have a meeting.
author: Peter P.

description:
I suppose I HAD to check out this place for all the hype, especially coming from the East Coast. I'm usually a latte sort of person, I appreciate good coffee but I can't articulate the subtle flavors or whatever. But Philz was a pretty amazing experience. 

I tried the mint mojito and the tesora on 2 separate occasions, and highly highly recommend the mint mojito, especially the creamy version!! The mint may sound like a pretty odd pairing but goes together so well. 

I wouldn't linger for a couple hours over a coffee here: it's pretty lively, loud, with scant table space. Seems like most people dropped by to get a coffee to-go.
author: Jia L.

description: I was in town for a conference and Philz was close to the conference hotel. I am so glad i stopped by this place. The coffee was great and the seating outside is great for the perfect balance of working and people watching. I got a Turkish blend with mint and cardamon. It was well brewed and had the perfect balance of spices.  Also the staff were super friendly which I really appreciated!
author: Maggie S.

description:
I'm usually not a fan of mochas, but something about the one at Philz just gets me. I always get the small iced Mocha Tesora w/ medium sweetness & less ice. It's the perfect blend of chocolatey sweetness and coffee richness.

Aside from the coffee itself, I just love the atmosphere of the store. It's bright, open & just very accommodating to the crowds of people that tend to gravitate towards Philz. The staff is extremely personable and it really adds to the entire experience. 

Tip: you can also order ahead if you want to skip the line and the wait time!
author: Vivian F.

description: This cafe is for grab and go. Not for study. If you want to study, just go to the public library next door. The service and coffee are pretty good though.
author: Kkkl Z.

description:
I must go to Philz on every visit to SF. It is indeed the best Hazelnut coffee I ever tasted.
Love the vibe and location.
author: Mahdi A.

description: Been going to different Philz locations for years and this one is definitely the worst.  Took 30 min to get a coffee with only 3 people in front of us in line this last Sunday.  Only one barista prioritizing mobile orders ahead of the line causing half the line to walk out.  Get your act together!
author: Warren M.

description: Yummmmm. Love their mint mojito latte. I ordered mine unsweetened and with almond milk and it was absolutely perfect. I tried to recreate it at home but I just couldn't make it exactly right.
author: Shaina P.

description:
Such a great find! 

I got the philharmonic which has cardamom ground up in the coffee bean! It's got a smokey warm feel and their signature mint on top gives it a fresh burst of flavor. I also got the bacon cheddar scone! Holllllyy cow, or should I say pig! Get it warmed and you're in for a warm flakey butter salty sweet sharp explosion in your mouth! 

Customer service was on point and the girl who helped me was really informative about what roast to pick!
author: Tamar B.

description: The coffee is Philz, so that's good. That's about where the positives end. It's cramped, the music is offensively loud, and OMG - I'm usually pretty tolerant of idiosyncracies, but there's one employee whose piercing and incessant laugh cuts through better-than-decent headphones and makes me want to hide. If you need a spot to wait for a train, it's good that something's there. Sad that it's Philz, though, because some people will only know *that* as the Philz experience. (If you're one of those people, check out the Minnesota location in Dogpatch/Potrero - they're awesome.)
author: H.E. O.

description: So I came in a couple of days ago and I was on a routine Postmates shift when I needed to use the restroom. I was on a nearby delivery on king street and decided to stop by and use the restroom. I came in at about 7:45 and I was on the phone. I kindly asked the guy to use the restroom as I saw that they had a key pad and also asked him if I needed to buy anything. I was OK with buying something as long as I got to use the restroom. Mind you they closed at 8 so I had a good 15 minutes before they close. This guy doesn't answer me and ignores me and another girl from comes up to me doesn't mind even looking at me and yells to me we're closed. Ok so I ask her since she doesn't obviously know why I'm here. Again, I go on proceed to ask if I can you the restroom and if i NEED  to buy anything. she ignores me again and says "can't you listen? We're closed! Bye!"  So here I am on the phone and walking away for being there 15 minutes before. And the the way, I wasn't the only one in there. There were still about 4 other customers in the shop. Never coming here again. And for the girl with the shaved head, red sweater, treat others the way you want to be treated
author: Marisa L.

description: I strongly dislike this particular Philz location. Seats are limited and dirty. They have a couch in there that looks like it got picked off the street. Long unreasonable waits for drinks with variable quality and taste. Music is loud and tasteless.
author: Alice W.

description: Meets Philz Coffee's standard - friendly baristas and tasty coffee. My favorites are iced mint mojito and hot mocha tesora. If you have not been to a Philz Coffee, this is a great location since it's within blocks from the Caltrain station and AT&T park.
author: Sandy H.

description: I come here before giants games whenever I go to the games! I am a fan of philz and it is a treat for me because I don't live near philz its always a bus ride away! I can't walk to one from my house in the richmond district.  I like the outdoor seating better then the inside here as there is a lot more compared to the inside! I like to get the mint mojito, which is good sweet and creamy! The staff is really nice here!
author: Alix J.

description: I come here often when I'm about to hop on the Caltrain for work. These guys are great. Tea or coffee they always have a smile for customers. Plus can't do no wrong with their donuts! Solid choice
author: Christian S.

description: Philz Coffees in SF are the best. I've decided it's because they have so much experience dealing with people and the different mods they could want on their drinks and their different moods that they've perfected their game. Whatever it is, this place made my drink perfectly and it was the perfect place to go to wait for some friends on a rainy day.
author: Apoorva D.

description: You always know what you get with philz... a quirky method of serving which I like... you queue up and tell the server what type of coffee you want whether with cream and sugar etc... lots of choice of brews from a light roast to a dark roast... all in all a decent cuppa and worth the queue!
author: Reg B.

description:
PHILZ! You've won over my NYC heart with your mint mojito coffee! 

This place has such a cool vibe and is a must stop for anyone visiting SF. Good service, although there's a bit of a wait because their coffee concoctions are made the old school drip coffee way - yes, they pour hot water over a filter and mix the coffee beans as the water drips!!! Starbucks this is NOT!

Mint mojito coffee was so tasty and I'm surprised this combination hasnt hit it big in other cities. Philz is also very eco-conscious (so SF of them) which is cool in my book.
author: Percila Z.

description: Simply the best and the freshest ! Each cup starts with fresh ground selections and goes up from there.  Go to give it a try if you're near.  You always see a line out the door,  but it moves fast.  Cheers!
author: C F.

description: I love this spot, a bustling shop convenient to the train and tantalizingly delicious smells waft from it in the evening. Really friendly crew keeps the rush in check and always with a smile. My only change would be some benches that see sunshine but otherwise a staple in my day!
author: Angela D.

description: If you're looking to treat yourself, I recommend getting a Mint Mojito extra sweet and extra creamy. The taste will differ a little every time because each barista has a different style, but it never fails to hit the spot!
author: Mitchie N.

description: The service is actually what you would expect from a coffee shop. The food is tasty. Iit's a fun place to hang out. The outside seating is very pleasant.
author: Bishop G.

description: By far THE BEST coffee I've ever had. Nothing compares to this place. Loved the staff, the atmosphere, and the cleanliness. PERFECT
author: Amir K.

description: Visiting a friend and this place is right across the street. Got the philtered soul (black) and it's delicious. Kind of a coffee snob and this place lives up to the hype. Buddy got the tesora which is great as well.
author: Martin B.

description: 4 years after my first Philz, I am back to the city and this is one this I definitely wanted to do: get my philz. There is nothing new that i can add about Philz coffee. It used to be the best part of my morning for a year. Hope they come to the east coast soon.
author: Vabs S.

description:
This Philz is next to the ballpark and also next to the train station.
It's pretty busy. 
It has your standard Philz coffee which is always great.
author: Kevin S.

description: This is a good Philz. It's by Mission Bay and they serve coffee. I usually don't have to wait very long. That is all.
author: Paul M.

description:
If you take Caltrain to come into the city or you've lived at the SF Avalon complex at any point, this is the Philz for you.

Always timely and now expanded and remodeled since my last visit, this is my favorite Philz location. Parking could be difficult, but with crazy expensive meters everywhere it shouldn't be that hard. That being said, you're usually here on foot and really there isn't a much better situation where you can grab your cup and walk along the Embarcadero or back home.

Keep it up Berry team, I'll always be rooting for you as the Philz empire continues to dominate and expand.
author: Joseph L.

description: Great coffee place. Go get your daily coffee fix here!  Close to Caltrain, the piers and AT&T park. Lines can get pretty long at times but it's worth the wait. They probably need to revise their pricing to make it more competitive with other coffee place.
author: Cheryl E.

description:
Philz, your line sitch is weird, ok? I'm an introvert, and I did not like having to dither about on the spot, wondering if I should heed the impatient HARRUMPHZ of the early morning grumpz behind me and step up to the counter, or wait to be called by one of the baristaz. I went with the latter and all was eventually well. 

I needed my morning suztenance before heading off to the weekend job in China Basin, and my coworkers are always raving about the epic Philz Coffee. It was not at all underwhelming and I'll definitely be back. I tried the Gingersnap Latte and HOLY ZWEET NEBULA was it fantastic. I was even asked how I would prefer it, sweet, creamy, and/or spicy, so I elected all three tastes, please and thank you. Yum. I also appreciated how the iced coffee came in a paper cup as opposed to the leaky slippery stupid plastic cups one gets at other coffee joints. 

I'll be back as soon as I can Philz, even if the morning queue is confuzing.
author: Jenny P.

description: Tasty coffee blends crafted to perfection by cheerful folks.   An enjoyable way to start the day. Indoor and outdoor seating a bonus.
author: JD L.

description:
Delicious-as-always old-school pour-overs. Best coffee option in Mission Bay.

Tip: if you're planning your visit in advance, order ahead on Caviar. Will save you the time of standing in line and waiting for the coffee to be prepared.
author: Sravanthi K.

description:
Super convenient location in SoMa near AT&T Park! It was a close walk from my hotel and also just a block away from the Caltrain station - so there's no excuses for not having a yummy cup of Philz Coffee to enjoy while riding along the bay.

My standard go-to is, no surprise here, the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. I don't always drink coffee, but when I do, I like it mildly sweet and easy to drink. I tend to stay away from the heavy, darker coffees, simply because I don't want to upset my sensitive tummy.

Even though Philz has expanded to SoCal, it still doesn't feel complete until you grab a cup of coffee at Philz whenever in SF.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: I went here for the first time as I live close by. They stated they do not serve lattes so I ordered a soy coffee decaf?? 5 bucks. Then i ordered a burrito i thought was a good deal 5.5. 10.50 altogether. I waited 5 minutes and expected amazing coffee. What i got was nothing like a soy latte and instead just black coffee with a smudge of soymilk. It was so bitter i threw it out. The burrito was microwaved and very small. I am going to stick to starbucks and never come back here again. The customer service is just fine and the atmosphere is welcoming... but the coffee is terrible compared to starbucks. Why does Philz not do lattes?? I tried this place once and that will be it.
author: Nick S.

description:
I don't have anything new to say but holy crap, Philz was like a spiritual awakening. I am not a coffee connoisseur nor do I drink it that often, but the Mint Mojito changed my life. 
I decided to get off Muni early on the way to work and grab a coffee, hoping to remedy my headache. Upon first sip, I suddenly realized what a beautiful day it was. It was THAT good. Wow.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I don't drink coffee but was looking for a place to spend some time on a windy Sunday morning.
Philz coffee has a lot of coffee blends but also tea and I decided to try their Fresh Chai. It was really creamy and spicy just as it should be! Delicious!
The place was pretty crowded (Color Run happening few streets away), but staff was really nice.
author: Coralie S.

description:
I L-O-V-E Philz! You can order ahead, which I do often and it is so convenient. 

Around 3pm the office needs a pick me up and Philz does the trick. The staff is always nice and the coffee always strong. 

The occasional almond croissant is a must as well!
author: Mona A.

description:
Philtered Soul was like my best friend while I was visiting the great, great city of San Francisco. That's the flavor...or type of coffee that really called to me with hazelnut being the big descriptor. It was a very nice touch to have a short paragraph on each type of coffee they serve displayed for everyone to read. I suppose with quirky names, the signs probably save A LOT of questions from customers. I tried a couple of other flavors from my friends' cups, but we all agreed Philtered Soul really spoke to our...soul ;)


The Philz Bagel was also pretty decent, but coming from NY, there's no way my snobby taste in bagels could be met. If I wasn't on vacation and had to get work done, this spot (or any of the other 10 bajillion Philz locations around the city would be a great choice to sit down with a quality coffee, and type of chat away.
author: Matthew L.

description: I love this Philz. Close to where I work. The tesora coffee is great to have in hand to go for a walk by the waterway that's a block away. Also just recently had the veggie quiche and it was amazing! Freshly made and toasted to perfection.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Philz Coffee is dependably good coffee. Made special by the cup, you get a personalized coffee every time. My favorites are the Tesora which is medium roast full of body and the Dancing Water which is a lighter roast more for my everyday taste buds. For the more serious coffee lover their signature the Turkish tastes good but smells amazing as well because of the mint! They also have pretty good breakfast burritos so you can join the hipster, Apple computer, designer coffee lover in your company hoodie crowd and sit and enjoy a quick breakfast and coffee before heading to the office.
author: Tina P.

description:
Every time I visit San Francisco I always have to make a stop at Philz Coffee and pick up a Mint Mojito iced coffee. This is actually the only drink I've tried here and I love it so much that it's usually the one I always order when I come here! 

The Mint Mojito iced coffee is almost like a minty sweet and almost creamy latte. Very delicious and refreshing! I highly highly recommend this drink! 

I've also only gone to this Philz's location on Berry St in SOMA because it's the closest one to where my friends and brother live. They are always busy with a line of people out the door but the line goes by pretty quickly. This coffee shop is also very unique because each barista customizes your order to make sure it's to your liking. When they finish making your drink, they will call you over to taste it to make sure you are okay with it. Great coffee and great service as well!
author: Sarah C.

description: Best service at a coffee shop I've ever had. The gentleman with the glasses walked me through choosing my coffee and mix the milk perfectly. The lovely curly blonde girl was also helpful and got me a DELISH avocado toast with egg! Can't wait to go back.
author: Jamie M.

description:
Four words: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. It's heavenly and I miss it when I'm not in California. You won't find espresso coffee here, it's all filter cone drip coffee, made by the cup. It's from San Francisco and locals love it. They really make your drink, ready to drink, so you can ask them to sweeten it or prepare your milk anyway you like. They have so many different origins and blends, and you can spend all day long trying them all. I usually go for the ice coffee, either Mint Mojito if you want enjoy a hint of mint, or just Ecstatic if you want a nice strong, non-fancy iced coffee. I always treat myself to one with a piece of baklava as well. So good!

They've opened in Santa Monica, in LA, as well now. Oh and keep an eye out for the Philz Truck! It's often in the Financial District and I'm always happy to stumble on it.
author: Billy S.

description:
I'm always looking for a cafe to do work in and this Philz was closeby. The same menu, different location. The only differences I see between the branches are the food they offer (although the pastries are typically the same). 

I opted for Mint Mojito Iced Coffee with almond milk substitute and light sweetness. My barista made it well, but I should have asked her to make it a little sweeter (since the ice melts). 

I wanted a bagel but they ran out of everything so I chose a butter croissant to be warmed up. I'm pretty sure they get their pastry supply from Goodie Goodie Cream & Sugar but don't quote me yet. It was the best butter croissant I've ever had D: wonderfully flaky and buttery. 

Otherwise, decent amount of seating outdoors and indoors but it gets busy pretty frequently so it gets packed and hard to find spots. Good wi-fi though and generally friendly people everywhere.
author: Sofia R.

description:
OH PHILZ - when i think of coffee in SF, I definitely think of Philz. This location is clutch if you're commuting from / around Caltrain, and the staff is extremely efficient and friendly. I grabbed my coffee and tucked myself into a window corner to burn some time on my laptop in relative peace. While the foot traffic is intense, the turn around is so fast, you'll be in and out in no time.

Be appreciative of their blends and don't doctor up your coffee too much - this is the stuff you can drink black and enjoy the flavour!
author: Vicki L.

description:
I'm just going to leave these 5 stars here, and come back when I can fully articulate my experience, which was (short version) FANTASTIC!

Let me just say that if they had Philz in LA I'd have to create a budget just for them. 

Just kidding I don't make budgets, but I might have to start!
author: Bree M.

description: Iced Jacobs wonderbrew with vanilla soy and honey was perfect on an unusually warm sf day. I'd get half honey next time!
author: Grace N.

description: My first time at this philz. It was a decent place nearby the Caltrain station and the staff was friendly. They are little slow on their service esp wait to order. Overall not a bad option.
author: Saumya A.

description:
Arrived around 3:30 and to no surprise there was a line out the door. Luckily, the line does move relatively fast. You place your order first, then to pay at the cashier next. The workers are all super friendly and outgoing. I ordered the infamous iced mint mojito and it was delicious! Very subtle mint flavor with every sip, but definitely a little pricey as well ($4 for a small).

The atmosphere was very chill, a  lot of people just on their laptops and phones. There are a few couches and tables inside and outside. And also super close to AT&T park! Perfect for a chilly night, if you're already in the neighborhood!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Did anyone say mint mow-hee-tow?!

I was a bit thrown off at first, but I said, why not? And so I walked up to the end of the very long line that had formed outside the café. The line didn't move fast at all. It was a little too chilly in the city for the minidress I was wearing that day, but persistence wins. Persistence wins strange, good coffee drinks. 

I finally got my turn and asked for a mint mojito iced coffee. Coffees don't come quickly here either, but someone just vacated an indoor table, thankfully, and I got to sit down while waiting. 

I loved the ambience of this place. It looked modest and felt very genuine. Baristas were friendly and casual. 

And then there was my mint mojito! Wow, I thought. I never knew a mint mojito and a coffee could make such good babies! It was a perfect, refreshing mix. Nothing overpowered the other. I could smell and taste the coffee and the mint equally! It's definitely different and exciting. It's worth all the hype for sure!
author: Claudine M.

description:
Prices went up, but I still love you!!

This Philz, in my mind, is the ORIGINAL Philz..because I had it for the first time at this location. I don't think it's the actual original location, but this is the spot that stole my heart!

My default orders:
1. Tesora - Medium/Medium (Philz Way)
2. Philtered Soul - Medium/Medium
3. Mint Mojito - when you feel like treating yourself on a beautiful sunny day

For someone who wasn't originally a drip coffee fan, Philz can quickly convert any fru-fru coffee drinker into someone that can really appreciate the subtle notes in coffee. It helps that they write it out on the menu too! :) One thing I WILL note is that they use cream in their coffee until you specify otherwise -- so if you are extremely lactose or have a sensitive tummy, you should just be aware that they have other options. One of my friends complained that Philz always made them a little nauseated and never sat well with them..we quickly figured out that it was actually the cream! 

Lots of seating at this place, but it usually PACKED full of people. Outdoor seating is pretty good too, but it tends to be quite windy - so bring a hair tie if you plan on sitting outdoors.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Mint mojito is always awesome.  Tesora is great, as I'm a dark blend black coffee person. 
Baristas can be nice or sometimes moody.   It's you, your luck and their hormonal periods.
author: Ahmad A.

description: Philz is my favorite coffee hands down. Some other places do really good specialty espresso drinks or other fancy stuff. But when I need a really solidly good cup of coffee, I go to Philz. Drink of choice: ecstatic sweet & creamy
author: Kevin C.

description:
The test:  Mint Mojito using Sumatra blend de-caffeinated, with stevia and soy vanilla milk.  Quite a bastardisation of how it is standardly made, but I was curious to see if this wildly popular beverage worked, on my coffee terms.  Hot, not iced.  It was... okay.

Go-the-extra-mile service earns Philz a bonus star.  Barista took great care to have me try it first, see if it was to my liking.  Because I could not really taste the vanilla, she added extra vanilla soy milk to this drink brimming with mint leaves.  A++ for effort.  But then the coffee/creamer ratio was off, and the coffee-ness was lost.  Eventually I got in line and asked to be topped off with more de-caff.  They did and heated it in the microwave.  Better.

Also got a vegan dough-nut, plain glased.  Unexpectedly tasty, with a large crumb-y muffin consistency, or like one of the better powdered dough-nuts.  Whaddayaknow, I *can* be vegan (for a few minutes)!

This is a busy shop, right next to the MUNI metro T-line stop and China Basin.  There are comfy couches inside.  Customers are courteous of each other's electric outlet needs.  Bone-shape treats fill a cookie jar at the cash register for the canine-caring crowd.

Great service and coffee, good atmosphere and Pepple's dough-nut make Philz a keeper.
author: Jade T.

description:
Philz Coffee
SF Soma
11am Friday 17th April 2015
Five Stars

It's definitely an intimidating experience but there is a how to wiki: http://m.wikihow.com/Order-at-Philz. 

Summary:
1. Pick a coffee
2. Order with one of the barista
3. Pay at cashier
4. Pick up your order
5. Taste it and ask to have it adjusted

I had the small ecstatic ice coffee with heavy cream. It was $3 which is extremely reasonable for a hand crafted coffee. The coffee was perfect - smooth, rich, low acidity, and packed with caffeine. There was relative low amount of cream which I thought was great. I had no idea they had a reputation as crack coffee. 

There are few things out there that live up to the hype. Philz coffee will blow you away!
author: Leonard L.

description:
I am not a huge coffee person, but the Mocha Tesoro here is SO good. Not too sweet (I got medium sweetness) and the cocoa and coffee flavors blend perfectly. It also didn't leave a sour aftertaste (which is one of my main turn-offs with a lot of coffee.) The hot chocolate is also great! Not too thick, but very rich in flavor.

The interior is very cozy, with couches and tables you can sit at, but it is pretty busy and seating is limited during the day. Staff is super friendly.

After going back a few times, I am a HUGE fan of their mint mojito iced coffee with house levels of sweet and creamy. It is refreshing and perfect for the summertime!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
This was the first Philz Coffee I ever went to, and it was lifechanging.

It was 2009. I JUST received my Starbucks gold card in the mail, and then I read an article in the chronicle that Philz Coffee was voted best coffee in San Francisco. Conveniently, my dad worked for the SFFD nearby so I went to this Philz location on my way to visit. The barista recommended that I order the ecstatic iced coffee before I try the mint mojito or the gingersnap, and to this day it's still what I order. I'm not even being sarcastic-- my first sip of Philz was as magical as the first time I ever tasted pizza. If mouths could orgasm, that moment was probably the climax of my oral cavity's lifetime. The feeling was just... divine.

2009 became the first and last year I was a Starbucks gold member because once you try Philz, there's no going back to regular coffee. The plethora of flavors they have are unlike anything I've ever had at any other roaster. Not to mention, this shit will keep you WIRED. Now if I have no choice but to go to Starbucks or Peets, I almost always take an impromptu nap because the caffeine content is simply not up to par with Philz. Luckily, by the grace of the Philz god himself there's now locations by my place in SSF, my work in San Mateo, and my bf's place in FiDi so I'm never deprived of my fix
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: First time @ Philz Coffee and it was an experience! It opens around 7am and is bright, vibrant and full of life. There was a small line waiting outside the door but it moved quickly. I really like that there was hip hop playing. The downside is that the coffee is EXPENSIVE and nothing short of specialty. There wasn't an opportunity to just get regular coffee. Also you cant control how much cream and sugar is put in your coffee because they do it for you. For coffee lovers, it may be a great place, for the causal coffee drinker, you may want to rethink it
author: Rhett B.

description: First time at this location. A bit small but that was no problem. Got my usual philharmonic half half. Did a two hour meeting and knocked it out over coffee.  Service was good. People were dope and I was happy.
author: Robert B.

description:
I've been trying to wean myself off coffee because it exacerbates my heartburn/gerd, but it's a lost cause since Philz came into my life. The iced Mint Mojito is so freaking good and refreshing! The combination of their espresso, fresh mint and whatever crack-goodness they put in it is extremely addicting.

It's a little pricey but what addiction isn't?

I still need to try their other coffees..I keep getting the same thing every time I go :/
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I want to give 4.5 but I do enjoy the service,  food,  and atmosphere so 5 will do.  After reading about this place from yelp, I know they're known for the mint mojito,  yet once I came to visit, it's too windy for an ice drink,  yet my boyfriend insisted,  so upon ordering the mint mojito,  I got it lightly sweetened since we are both sensitive to sugar,  it changed the drink drastically, I can see why people like it,  there's a hint of mint but also since we got less sweet cream, it was a little diluted.  

No worries though, my boyfriend redeemed himself and got the drink I originally wanted which is the mocha tesora with almond milk-omg so yummy& it's warm.  Taste like chocolate almond,  so almost their own conjunction of hazelnut,  pretty good. 

Plus got the nut bar and the coconut chocolate cookie,  both amazing.  Just being us two,  ended up with three drinks and two pastries, will come back (btw he got the philharmonic - bold and they make it with the cardamom in the filter).
author: Jackie O.

description:
I like my coffee the same way I like my ice cream -- with no tomatoes.

Now that I've cleared that up, let's talk about Philz and their coffee.

To me, Philz is a coffee shop designed to push back against modern, conventional coffee shops.  I like to think that Philz's objective is to bring coffee to the forefront of the food and beverage world by making it seem like more than just a simple beverage that people drink on a regular basis.  

And why should the preparation and serving of coffee not be treated with the same time, precision and emphasis that is placed into, say, the preparation and serving of wine?  When you walk into Philz, you start off by placing your order with the barista instead of with the cashier.  You can specify how you want your order prepared and the barista will get right on it and will call you when it's ready.  You then go to the cashier and pay for your order.  You can also get coffee beans, tea, bottled water, pastries, parfaits and other food items too.  Once your barista lets you know that your drink is ready, they have you taste it first to make sure that it was prepared to your satisfaction.  Any adjustments that you want made will be taken care of without hesitation.  I like this because the service is more personalized and the baristas at Philz are treated like sommeliers in a fancy restaurant.

Thus far, my beverages of choice have been hot chocolate and Ambrosia Coffee of God.  The hot chocolate has been the best hot chocolate I've ever had.  Not burning hot, but not lukewarm and very rich in flavor.  My Ambrosia coffee has been very flavorful and wakes me up very quickly. 

Prices are fair, transactions are quick and I don't have to deal with my name being butchered like at Starbucks or Peet's.  

This is how coffee and coffee shops should be everywhere.  Sorry, Peet's.  I've found my new favorite chain coffee shop.

5 stars all the way
author: Michael F.

description:
Question: What can I say about Philz that no one has said before? 
Answer: Not much.

I don't usually drink coffee, but when I do, it's Philz Coffee!

This is the closest Philz Coffee to my office, so my coworkers and I frequent it when we need our caffeine fix. It's located next to the Caltrain station, AT&T Park, Safeway, and Panera Bread. Pretty convenient! They've changed the layout of the store so now there are a ton more tables and seats. 

Try: 
- Philtered Soul
- Tesora
- Ecstatic
- Mint Mojito 
- Gingersnap 
- Mocha Tesora

Philz Coffee is a nice hug in a mug. :) Cheers!
author: Christine S.

description: There's been a fair amount of employee turnover here over the last few months,  so service had gotten a little slow while new hires ramped up to the Philz way. I'm happy to say it seems they've nearly reached the same great level of service I'd come to expect from this location. Well done!
author: Teresa D.

description: Absolutely fine. Their coffee is not bad, but for sure not worth the wait if you're there when it is busy. Better than a Starbucks or a Pete's. The way you order is needlessly convoluted as well. Everyone who works there is very nice though. I just don't get the hype.
author: Brett P.

description: My go-to coffee spot. Everyone is always friendly and even when theres a line it moves quickly. I usually get a Dancing Water w/ cream and my partner gets Tesora w/ cream. I've also had a plain croissant which was delicious and fresh. I'll have to branch our and try some other flavors.
author: Debra D.

description:
My favorite coffee. I wasn't even into coffee until I moved to San Francisco. Then I tried blue bottle. It was amazing. But then I tried Philz and I fell in love. 

I prefer Jamaica blue mountain (for something stronger), Mint mojito iced (on a hot day), or the Turkish (my usual).

They also have a tasty turkey sausage sandwich. 

Pro tip: the lines are always long. Avoid them by using Order Ahead or some other app to get your order in as you're headed there.
author: Will L.

description:
Convenient location - walking distance from the Caltrain.

Came on a weekend afternoon and the place was packed but I still found a place to sit and study. There are some tables/couches inside and tables outside that would be nice on a sunny day. There a lot of baristas so the line goes really quickly. You order with a barista, pay at the end of the counter, and wait for your barista to call your drink (took about 10 minutes for me).

Ordered a small iced mint mojito ($4) which is minty, sweet, and creamy. SO GOOD! It's still my favorite coffee and definitely lives up to the hype!! I highly recommend getting this if you haven't already.
author: Linda X.

description: Never has caviar pick up enabled. Please please enable it otherwise the wait could be up to 30 min
author: Han L.

description: The coffee they make is great. the seating is crappy, but great small cafe that gets the job done.
author: Honesty Matter S.

description: Staff were really friendly. I just told the barista "creamy and delicious" and he gave me one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had. Gets really busy around the after and hard to find a spot to sit down but the service and coffee alone are enough for 5 stars in my book.
author: Eddie T.

description:
the happiest place in Mission Bay.

Swarmed with local Avalon residents, ballpark fans, and cops with dogs, Philz always has a 20 minute line. The classic fan favorites are always a great first order: the Mint Mojito, Mocha Tesoro, or Philtered Soul are perfect. Even though this place is always slammed, the baristas make sure to have you taste your order before you leave so that it is the right personal milk/sugar combo for your tongue. 

You can purchase a full sized coffee bean bag for $15 and it will last you at least 2 months. I had to buy some before I left the Bay Area.

Snoop Dogg is a key investor so you know it's good. Please open a NYC location soon!!
author: Tara N.

description:
Food: 4.0/5.0
Service: 3.5/5.0
Value: 3.0/5.0
Decor: 3.0/5.0
Overall: 3.5/5.0 

Awesome iced coffees that pack a punch but the ordering process is so convoluted there's almost no way they didn't design it that way on purpose.  Maybe there's a hipster vibe argument in there somewhere or maybe it makes regulars feel special, but c'mon guys...
author: Damian W.

description:
Went to san francisco on the weekend and decided to see why a lot of people were raving about this place. I went on my little foot mobile and walked about two miles from the Hyatt Regency Hotel. My heart was racing and was excited to finally have a cup of coffee.

Location/Ambiance: One block away from AT&T park. Liked the ambiance here and a line had formed when I got there.

Service: Very nice baristas. So the concept is to give an order to a barista and then after she is done getting your order, you go pay at the register and wait for your drink to be done by the barista that took your order. 

Drink: I had the iced mojito. Didn't really think too highly about it. $5 gets you a cup of expensive cup of coffee that is mediocre at best. 

I'll give you guys another chance, found out their is a location in Santa Monica. Will go here when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: John T.

description: I love this place. Coffee is great. Music is great. I accidentally spilled my drink the other day, but after I sheepishly told my barista, she immediately told me she would make me a new one without even me asking. And she remembered that I got Ecstatic Iced Coffee with light cream. Wow such service!
author: Alton Z.

description: Sad! Sat at Philz on Berry Street. This place is not the same, customer service wasn't good at all, my coffee priced and toooooo sweet. I think they are getting bigger and they are loosing the "family touch"... this is now another "coffee chain" and expensive one $4.50! Well, I will be going back to Starbucks!! SORRY!!
author: Joe V.

description:
I'll keep this one short and sweet. 

USEFUL: This location is near AT&T Park.

FUNNY: A horse walks in and orders a Mint Mojito to go. The barista ask if he is Matt Cain. The horse replies, "No, I'm Angel Pagan...can't you see my caballo shirt?" Then a panda walks in, followed by another horse, a giraffe and a great white shark. 

COOL: It's PHILZ. Voted the BEST Coffee in San Francisco.
author: John G.

description:
Philz Coffee is a San Francisco staple! This one is conveniently located to a ton of awesome stuff, and it's right next to the 4th and King CalTrain stop! So stop by on the way to wherever you're going, or grab a drink and take a seat at one of their outdoor tables! It's also conveniently located next to AT&T park, and only a block way from a wonderful walk along the water.

They always seem to be crowded and it's not hard to see why. Like everybody else says on Yelp, go for the Mint Mojito! :) I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I could always go for a Philz!
author: Tsyria T.

description:
Besides tons of hipsters hanging out at all the Philz, the reason is simply because  it's great coffee! You really taste the difference in richness, flavor, and freshness from a single pour-over cup. The best part is, there are so many blends you can choose from on their menu. If you're feeling a light roast, you can have it! If you're feeling like having a medium or dark roast, there are many to choose from! And the names of the coffee blends makes drinking Philz coffee that much more enticing. 

They pride themselves in brewing the coffee one cup at a time with the pour-over method, which is great because they can control the temperature of their filtered water and the amount of coffee they use to brew each cup. Your cup of coffee is highly customize-able. The blends are very rich, and I noticed its less harsh on my stomach because of its lower acidity. The baristas have great product knowledge and are very friendly. Some of my favorite blends of the Medium Roasts are Tesora and Ambrosia Coffee of God. My favorite Light Roasts are Sooo Good and Canopy of Heaven. They all have very complex flavors and are very smooth. It takes longer to brew but its worth the wait. I am currently in love with the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, sweet and creamy, it really hits the spot! Its made with fresh spearmint leaves which adds an amazing aroma that wakens you!

Really, if I could afford to go to Philz everyday for a cup of coffee, I would! Luckily they have a coffee of the month for $12 a pound (compared to $16/lb) that I bring to my office's coffee club when its my turn to contribute. We all love it so much and can never turn back and drink stuff from the Bucks of Star. We love to buy beans that are roasted locally because its so much fresher and Philz definitely does it for us. I even use Philz to make homemade coffee ice creams and they taste amazing!!! No joke! My next ice cream batch will be inspired by Philz Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, of course made with one of my favorite Philz blend!
author: Janny S.

description:
I had no idea what to get but a few customers told me that everything was good. Very helpful. Decided on the ever so popular mint mojito iced coffee. It tastes amazing. I would definitely order this everyday if I lived next to Philz. 

They have a good amount of seating both inside and outside. This place in particular has huge lines going out the door and around the corner but I wouldn't expect any less from San Francisco. 

Th only con I have is the fact that they don't have blinds on the windows so it can get really hot inside and it also affects those who are working/studying/reading. 

I love Phillz. Definitely my new favorite spot!
author: Jenelle B.

description:
I only appreciated this place, after I left...

True story! The whole set up seemed hokey to me, but as I reflect, I realize how cool this place truly is. So for that, I'm sorry for my pre-judgement Philz!

One cup at a time movement, says it all! They literally make each cup to order and also add the cream and sugar for you. If you cringe at the word cream, then don't fret, they have soy milk too. As for sugar, they use cane brown sugar...if I remember correctly.

I was a newbie with no prior knowledge about what I was about to experience. I thought the logo looked too commercial and I wasn't going to get a good cup of coffee. I was a little nervous, because their menu is overwhelming, to say the least. If you're anything like me, reading all that is too much time, so I just asked the Barista what she recommended in the medium roast family. She told me and I went with it - Philtered Soul and Tesora. Both were tasty, but the since I can't decide if I do or do not like hazelnut, Philtered Soul was my second fave out of the two. Tesora was good, not too bold, but not wimpy either. Both coffees were sweetened and had soy milk!

After you order at the coffee bar, you head to pay. But they do have a case that holds pastries, donuts, and breakfast goodies. They had these burrito's that were individually wrapped in white paper. They looked a little suspect, but it said Bacon so I ordered it. I also ordered the Vegan Coffee doughnut! I was wrong again. That Mame's Bacon Burrito was so damn good, I immediately found them online and tried to order some - still working on that, by the way. Oh and that doughnut, was pretty amazing. It was moist, the glaze had coffee grounds in it too. Just enough to bring a delish coffee flavor through, but enough to feel like you're eating coffee beans straight up.

Now I know whey this place was so busy and NOT because the SF Giants Race just finished. It's because their craft is what is important and they only sell the good stuff, from their coffee to their food. Not to mention, the Barista was so sweet, with my newbieness and awkward self. 

They have indoor and outdoor seating, but it's high real estate. You gotta grab it while its there. The line can be out the door, but it goes fairly quickly. For all those other newbies, such as myself, just enjoy the experience and remember you get your coffee from where and who you ordered it from...this ain't no Starbucks ;)

A coffee movement I can get behind!
author: Steph G.

description: I love Philz Coffee! The shop is a little small. There's not much seating. I wish they had more seating. The ordering line was a bit confusing. They had a counter and you can just go up to order, but there was also a post in the middle that looked like it was there to guide you into a line. Not too sure. Went up and finally ordered. The line wasn't long. I ordered my Mint Mojito Coffee. I made sure to say cream and sweet! I've had this before at another one of their shops and it was perfectly sweet. I got my drink and it was just perfectly creamy, but no sweet. I had mint leaves in my cup, but I also had stems floating around. It also took a bit long for my cup of coffee. I'll have to come back again. Maybe it was just an off day. The customer service wasn't that friendly or inviting. Next time we'll try again. I love Philz, but this experience kind of hurt!
author: Crissy G.

description: This is probably my 3rd review for Philz(there are so many locations now)- it's the best, and never under 5 stars. For a cold drink, definitely get the mint mojito. Hot drinks, the philtered soul is my favorite, if you like hazelnut like me.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Philz and was excited to move in a few blocks away from this location! It is really close to the Caltrain and by far the best coffee within the vicinity of the Caltrain. The baristas here are the best! They're incredibly enthusiastic about the work they're doing and they do an amazing job with every drink they serve. 

Favorites:
* Mint Mojito Iced Coffee
* Gingersnap Iced Coffee
* Philtered Soul (Hazelnut-y)
* Tesora (Buttery and supposedly Caramel-y though I don't taste the Caramel)

PRO tip: They just finished renovating, and it now has an Order Ahead counter! To avoid long lines in the morning, just use the app and pick up on the way to the Caltrain.

Oh another thing I have to mention. The restroom is co-ed, so don't be alarmed like I was the first time I thought I had entered the men's restroom by mistake!
author: Sally C.

description:
Yelp pretty much has this covered so far. I'll only add that ...

1) I found it a pleasant surprise to see such a great variety of coffee beans, ground/roasted and THEN iced (if you choose) on the spot. However a small downside is the bottom of your iced coffee is still kind of warm when you get it. Delicious and fresh, worth the five minute wait for the cool down... If you can hold out that long.

2) As newbies to SF (and Philz), My husband and I expected to have a hard time ordering or feel awkward and unprepared - especially given the menu. However, the staff was super friendly, patient and accommodating. I love that they heard us out and made their recommendations (e.g., "you should probably have that sweetened or it will be pretty bitter.").

4/5 just because it's on the pricier side for coffee, as delightful as it is
author: Catie F.

description: Following some serious jet lag, I decided to stop by this place because it looked cool and calm. Upon walking in, I was greeted by Shaggy's "It Wasn't Me". Not what I was expecting and I loved it. Not knowing what to order, I asked the barista to give me their strongest, most delicious coffee. She whipped up a cup of a light roast called "Greater Alarm". I was expecting it to be bitter, but it was actually pretty fruity and sweet. It was one of the best coffees I've had in a long time. I also got a baklava and that was yummy as well!
author: Ariel R.

description:
First thing first... Coffee, the breakfast of champions! I know a lot of people who cannot start their day without a lovely cup of coffee. But, sometimes it is nice to have something different. That is where Philz Coffee comes in.  

One of my lovely friends recommended that I check out Philz Coffee while I was visiting San Francisco. In particular, I was recommended to try the Mint Mojito. What an awesome idea! An iced coffee is the best in warm weather. 

The set up in Phliz involves a line of Coffee Percolators and very busy staff. You speak to the next available staff member, give them your order and they will then make it to your palate. You can try it and ask them to increase the sweetness or add more milk. Love those customer services. This is something that definitely does not happen at home.  

The Mint Mojito was nothing like what I expected. I thought it was going to have mint flavouring. But alas, it had fresh mint in it! Such an amazing fresh flavour and something I would have never thought of combining before. I highly recommend it if you are wanting to try something different. 

I really wish Phliz Coffee were set up back home, this is a quality coffee shop and worth waiting in a line.
author: Anita D.

description:
Although I didn't get a space to do my work and had to settle for the bench, the coffee was still good enough for a five-star. 

It's a great atmosphere and has lively, energizing music. One of the coolest things is getting your own barista, who makes your drink as they tell you interesting stories. I highly recommend the Tantalizing Turkish with cream - very balanced, herbaceous and is topped with a mint leaf! 

Definitely feelin' Philz.
author: James S.

description:
I've been here twice so far, I've never been a really big coffee fan, but this coffee is pretty awesome! It's really close to where I live and I'll definitely stop by more often. Now I understand when people say the drink coffee for the taste. I've had coffee at a variety of places but this place is really nice because of the many options of coffee beans and they display the aromas so you know which flavours you'll be getting.

My personal favourite so far is the Philtered Soul with Hazelnut, Cocoa and Syrup aromas. The other one I've tried was the Dancing Water but I don't like it as much. I'll definitely be back to try some more of their different flavours.
author: Christopher L.
Erin H.

description:
We got what the barista recommended: iced mint mojito, creamy and sugary. 

All I can say is YUM and even YUMMIER at the bottom of the cup.
author: Yi Xian R.

description: Excellent selection of coffee. The staff are super friendly and helpful and will help you find the blend that is perfect for you and customise your drink to have just the right levels of cream and sugar for your taste!
author: Celia R.

description:
New and improved Philz 2.0 on Berry St. and 4th is now complete!!!  They now can do OrderAhead app orders for you so no more line waiting and standing in queue for your caffeine.  Usually the wait time to order through the OrderAhead app is 30 mins so by the time I get here from Caltrain, my drink is sitting there on the counter with my name on it.  

One drawback of ordering ahead is that you can't do the $1 discount of bringing in your own cup and paying to get a larger size for the smaller size price.  Still, the line hasn't been that unreasonably long since they remodeled.  The Internet orders must be making the line shorter.

Also make sure to check out the whole bean coffee special discounted bags near the entrance.  If your favorite blend is on sale, then grab it usually at a $3 to $4 discount.
author: Ben H L.

description: Quite a popular coffee spot, with an extensive menu for different roast types and fast service despite a line. I had a nice light roast "greater alarm" without sugar and cream, and it's pretty good.
author: Julia Z.

description: I stop in here on occasion when I am in the area for solid coffee.  The lines are long during the morning rush but not as bad in the afternoon when I prefer to visit. I have tried their froo froo chai, mojito, tesora and others but prefer the straight stuff.  I really like the scones, the bacon one is my favorite. The workers here are friendly and fast with orders. I sometimes take my dog, but leave him outside so he doesn't bother the patrons inside.
author: Sam M.

description: I just got an iced mint mojito which tends to be heavenly, but it was quite the opposite this time. It was not creamy at all, watery actually. Worst Philz experience I've had in my entire life. I wish I could get a refund or a different drink :(
author: Joti L.

description:
I come every single time I attend a Giant's game, and I always get a mint mojito. However, one time I couldn't get a my favorite drink because they ran out of mint! So, I ended up getting an Estatic Iced Coffee. It was pretty good, but not as good as my mint mojito. Also, expect long lines before a baseball game. 

One time my mint mojito was not sweet enough, so my barista was happy to fix it for me without spitting in my drink.

Bottom line: Great drinks, great service!
author: Anna L.

description:
I had heard about Philz coffee, I was told to try it, but it's an experience. 

We got to Philz right before going to AT&T park. The line was out the door. I LOVE coffee, but the coffee can't be THAT good, can it? Oh yes it can. 

I'll admit, the menu was very overwhelming. Blonde roasts, dark roasts, medium roasts. This one has cinnamon, that one is minty (they love the mint here). 

While the line seems long, it does move fast. You get your own personal barista, you takes your order and makes your drinks. Need a recommendation? They know their coffees very well, so just ask! Tell them how you like your coffee, and they will help! 

The coffee was delicious. Perfect pick me up for right before our ball game. I don't think I've ever had a more perfect coffee. Their hot chocolate is nothing to sniff at either. 

I do wish they had the little cardboard holders to put around your coffee. Mine was a little too hot to hold, and I needed to wrap a bunch of napkins around. 

Philz, please move east!
author: Tova B.

description: The location is really good. I sometimes need to wait for Caltrain more than 30 min, so I can grab a cup of coffee. I like Turkish coffee at Philz. The baristas here are friendly.
author: Kaori M.

description:
Oh Philz, what would I do without you?

Shamefully, I must admit that I frequent this Philz location at least once a day if not more. It is practically my second home at this point. You know you come too often when you are on a first name basis with the barristas and have your own mug (which gets you $1 off each drink).

Philz coffee is, in my opinion, the best coffee around. The plethora of options, the ability to customize your drink however you want it, friendly atmosphere, good music, variety of pastries, specialty drinks and pour over only style makes for the complete package. The manufacturing cream they use is so creamy that it is hard to ever switch to the other healthy options they have (and they have them all... soy, almond, fat free, 2%, etc). 

My favorite drinks here are in order: Gingersnap iced coffee, Ether, Philtered soul, Silken splendor and Julie's ultimate. However you really can't go wrong with ordering anything here, and if you need any help, the barristas are more than happy to help you find your perfect drink.
author: Mark O.

description: Hands down - the BEST coffee in SF - this is there newest location. Yes, there IS a bit of a wait.
author: Nick S.

description:
This place is legit. It's close to the ballpark and a nice spot that differentiates itself from the s-bux by making your coffee one person at a time. You can choose your beans, roast preference instead a of a 1 size fits all coffee like S-bux.

The last stop here I got the mint mojito iced coffee. Not only was it refreshing and use fresh mint leaves. It really does taste like a mojito with some coffee.  The staff is super friendly and they even have a water bowl and tie up spot for your dog. They have a few tables outside but it gets a little windy there so you can't always sit there. They do have indoor seating but I usually get it to go as my friends have a place nearby and we are usually only stopping in for a pickup. 

If you don't want the same boring old coffee, come here. The staff is great and you can tell they all care about the customers. You can have the coffee your way.
author: Vincent W.

description:
I came across this place looking for parking in downtown. I'm not a coffee person, but I thought I'd give this shop a try. A nice, chill environment with helpful employees. 
     The struggle was real choosing a drink. Fortunately I heard a voice from behind the bar offering assistance. She was quite knowledgeable about the menu to help me decide on my order. I didn't catch her name, but she makes a mean decaf Mint Mojito. Definitely made my day kinda magical.
author: Dino Dee L.

description:
Never disappoints. 

I live across the street so that's a plus! Lines can be long if u happen to come during a rush. So don't come during a rush. 

Baristas are always on point. For whatever reason you don't like your drink (don't know why you wouldn't!) they will happily fix it for you. This is no Starbucks :) 

Mint mojito iced - you can never go wrong. Refreshing on a warm day.

Mocha tesora for all you chocolate lovers.
author: Shellie H.

description: I love Philz! If I could drink coffee for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, I would! Ever since moving near Philz, I always find myself ordering their tasty cup of coffee every morning. Forget Starbucks! The staff here are very friendly and always happy! Iced mint mojito is very popular here and my favorite. I'm trying my best to try all their different coffees and have not been disappointed. You can choose the level of sweetness and creaminess of your coffee. Other popular coffees are Ecstatic, Philharmonic, Philtered soul, and Tesora. Their chai is also really good here and they use honey vs.sugar. Can't wait to try their whole menu. Officially a Philz addict :)
author: C O.

description:
I love the Philz on 24 th st and I recently tried one of the newer Philz that opened in the Castro. This coffee shop works well in this location. They had outside side walk seating as well as indoor. I actually met people and had a great conversation, which doesn't usually happen. 
I am unusual in that I like light or medium blend, I had the Manhatten and fell in love with it and the vibe. They had some fantastic cookies too. I was being very bad that day, but it was delicious! Chocolate chip with coconut. I'd post a picture, but I totally ate it all! 
I would like to see them incorporate more art and authenticity, like 24th st has, but that could come in time. Maybe they could host gallery shows?
author: Rachel L.

description:
Don't get me wrong. I love Philz coffee and I was so happy to see a location open in FiDi. 

However, the employees in that location are still too green. Either that or Order Ahead's timing calculator is off. A 15 minute lag in the morning can mean the start to a crappy day that many people tried to avoid by using the Order Ahead tool. I was better off standing in line with everyone else considering how long it took to get my order.

To top it all off, the girl that ended up making my order didn't even bother to wipe off the nasty coffee water at the top of the cup. That's just gross Phil. Not okay.
author: Regine L.

description:
I love this Philz location that sits in a neighborhood with Tech companies, the ball park, CalTrain, WholeFoods, and Panera. Has this one the funkiest employees or what? Consistent drink quality throughout - my favorite, the TRANQUILIZING TURKISH (no sugar, a little bit of cream, $3) is bold and strong, almost black, like a good coffee needs to be. My other favorite is the GREATER ALARM ($3), which guarantees max caffeine intake, a little bit on the nutty side.

Glad Philz made it to this neighborhood.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
So much better than your Starbucks and Peet's! Yes, the lines get long and you'll have to come at weird hours to avoid waiting, but it's worth it!

Each cup is made fresh with love and somehow they know the perfect amount of cream and sugar to add to each brew (though you can specify exactly what you want when you order, too). If it's your first time, order the Mint Mojito -- you can't go wrong with this delicious iced beverage. 

You order at the counter and then pay another employee at the register, so it's kind of an honor system. They also serve your typical coffee shop foods like cookies, donuts, pastries, and breakfast burritos.

They have a decent-sized seating area, but since most of SF works off their laptops from wherever they want, it can get crowded. And if you're a Philz frequenter, feel free to leave your coffee mug at the shop! They'll hang it on their board for you to use next time! Now that's enviornmentally frienly!

It's surprising how I've been able to limit my Philz intake seeing as it's just down the block from my place. Probably good for my bank account, too.
author: Leana L.

description:
I'm speechless.

Philz Mint Mojito is the tastiest, most refreshing coffee I have ever had.

I only have three days left in San Francisco. Expect to see me at Philz every day until then.
author: Kelly R.

description: I had the iced mint mojito coffee and it was amazing! Definitely some of the best coffee I've had in San Francisco.
author: Kremi A.

description:
If you need a coffee fast-- you've come to the wrong place. If you commute on Caltrain to SF, this is your Philz. If you're a Giants fan-- this is your Philz. 
Always crowded. Seriously. Even at 10:30AM. There's a line that can wrap around the outside of the building. I can't decide if it's brilliant subliminal marketing or if they just need to expand to a bigger location. Either way-- always a positive experience and always a good cup of coffee. They have outside tables (though just a few) if you want to sit outside + have a dog.
author: Brianna L.

description:
Native to the Bay Area, Philz Coffee is (insta)famous for its mint mojito coffee. 
We stepped into their SoMa location, very spacious with plenty of seating. I really appreciated the large windows, photosynthesizing from the Nor Cal sun.
