I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee. Coffee with my other all-time-favorite drink, mojitos, equals perfection. They put plenty of fresh mint leaves and ice in it. Super refreshing!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I came here with my friend from Champagne, France. 

The best coffee ever. They brew each cup individually. 

I ordered the "it's the best coffee".

Yea it's the best coffee!
author: Jenner B.

description:
I've been passing this Philz for nearly a year during my morning commute. Being a fairly new Bay Area resident, I didn't know what Philz was and why that place constituted a long line each morning.

I decided to try it one morning. I was a bit confused about the different stations but I waited until I was called. I told the barista that I was new and I wasn't sure what to do. She was incredibly friendly and gave me instructions and informed me that they put in the sugar and cream. 

So...I was a little trepidatious because..."I like my sugar with coffee and cream". When the girl called me she told me to try it to make sure it was perfect. Holy moly. So good.

Now, I make it a point to go at least once a week because it's freakin' delicious and the service is amazing.
author: Viyada S.

description:
The quality and flavor of their coffees are topnotch, and the location is really convenient and easily accessible. Because of these things, there is occasionally a line out the door during a late morning/pre-lunch coffee rush. 

That being said, the staff works pretty efficiently. They've added more places to sit, and have controlled the entry to the shop in a way that allows for a relatively reasonable place to sit and converse. Some people work here ... somehow ... I wouldn't recommend it though. 

Every time I've ordered a mint mojito - hot or cold - they've delivered the correct sweetness and creaminess that my tongue desires. On one occasion, I actually came up on an extra coffee because they had redone somebody else's drink to get it just right. 

Great coffee shop. Come here on a sunny morning to chat, or in the evening if you have a long night ahead.
author: Giovanni R.

description:
What is there not to like about this philz?!

Right by the caltrains station and off of the T train. Grab a cup of coffee right before work or anytime in the day. Perfect!

Once you walk in, wait in line, greeted and served by your personal barista, order and specify how you want your drink, walk over to pay, and wait for your drink. 

There's indoor and outdoor seating area. The times I've been there, indoor seating area is always packed. Noise-wise, it's pretty loud. So I wouldn't choose this cafe as a study cafe. 

The cafe is clean and organized and they have a gender neutral bathroom.
author: Shirley M.

description:
There are many shops in this coffee shop around downtown.
In my image, this coffee shop is usually crowded and have a long line.
However, It makes me want to go to there soon!
Because I love "Mint mojito coffee."
When I drank it for the first time, I got a quite big shock.
The flavor feels fresh mint and not too much sweet. I have never drunk this sort  of coffee.
I can refresh and relax after drinking.
Service is friendly.
The cost performance is probably general. 
There are many kind of menus items but I always order same thing. 

(Rating: +++ is perfect)
Mint mojito coffee+++: 
Fantastic!!
author: Hiromi S.

description:
Before Philz Coffee blessed us with it's Mint Mojito, coffee was a necessary evil. You need it to get through the day, but it'll surely give you the coffee breath of doom. There's nothing good about coffee breath. Here's why.

Potential Friend: Hey how are you doing?

YOU: I'm alright, yourself? *coffeebreath*

(Potential Friend digivolves to....... Disgusted Colleague!)

Disgusted Colleague: None of your business.

The Mint Mojito helps you avoid disastrous situations like the one up there. And it's SO delicious. It's cold, minty and it has a sweet coffee taste (but you can get it with less sweetened!). It's kind of like the Mint Chocolate Chip of coffee. Best of all, even your burp will smell minty afterwards : ) tmi tmi haha

I hear Philz other coffees are also pretty good, but at 4 dollars, I ain't about to gamble on a new flavor. Mint Mojito for life!
author: Ringo M.

description:
I cannot stand the taste of coffee unless it's masked in a ridiculous amount of sugar. Not being a fan of anything minty, I opted for the Mocha Tesora. Once the barista gave it to me, I immediately knew it was way too strong so he added more cocoa in it. It was also a hot day so he turned it into a Iced Mocha Tesora.

WAY better than Starbucks or Peet's HANDS DOWN. The service is super friendly and they really do cater to make sure your drink is made to perfection. They make your drink foamy and airy so it's like drinking a piece of fluffy clouds from the heavens.

I couldn't stop licking my lips. So yummy!
author: Lauren K.

description:
A must for coffee lovers. 

Within walking distance from the train station. I actually came here after my stop from using Megabus, and it was no more than 2 blocks away. Grab your drink, and tour the city - I explored ATT park since that was nearby. 

And by drink, I suggest 2: 
Feeling hot? Get the gingerbread coffee. Great gingerbread flavor with all the holiday warmth. 
Or
Feeling cold? Get the mint mojito. It's somewhat popular from what I hear (insert sarcastic face here). It is different, and it does taste good, but it may not be for everybody. Don't knock it till you try it. 

I'd choose Philz anyday. Move over big green mermaid looking lady.
author: Steven N.

description:
I realized I never wrote a review for Philz and Philz by far is one of the best go to spots in SF for coffee. If we are talking about coffee, Philz is the alpha male, the one hit killa, and the thrilla in manilla of all coffee shops. Bottom line it's legit and I come here like it's my 2nd home.

Pro Tip Drinks:
Mint Mojito- This is probably what they are known for and what you've all heard about and it definitely lives to the hype. Take a sip of this and shit just got real. Keep in mind though the mint mojito is sweeter and creamier by default amongst all other drinks. So if you say "Philz Way" which is default for normal there, it will come out sweeter and creamier. Oh and the mint mojito is a mixture between hot and cold which is unexpected.

Philtered Soul: Ahhh yes. The drink that is made for the elite. Philtered Soul is one of my default for hot drinks that I usually get. It's very nutty and has a sweet hint of aroma to it. It definitely pairs well with a multitude of different pastries if you are interested in that color matching stuff. Highly recommend this one if you are conflicted.

Silken Soul: This isn't even on the menu, but my sisters bf recommended it to me. Just a heads up. At Philz you can mix and match your beans so that you can come up with the one that you like. So be creative and think outside the box, before someone tears up your box.

Food Selections:
Burritos: Dude you can't go wrong with the burritos here. It's legit. Although something that's interesting is that for some reason the last bite is always the best. It's like all the crap just sunk to the bottom or something. I wonder...
author: Nathan L.

description: They have a lot of gourmet coffee, which I think stands out from Starbucks in a way that theyre not sweet! They are pretty affordable too. I like that they mix different flavors, the sight of dogs outside (as they cant come in) makes it such a delight for pet lovers! They give free treats to the dogs too!
author: Pauline J.

description: I love Phliz Coffee. It's coffee and the quality of coffee. Have a cold one on a warm day or a warm one on a cold day. It warm me up and cools me down. haha..cheers to Philz.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
I love and hate that this phiz is right next door to my masters program at UCSF. This place has definitely supplied me with an academic school year's worth of caffeine to get through all the midterms and projects, and at the same time eaten a hole through my bank account. 

My go to drink: the legendary mint mojito. It's a must try for new comers. It's served chilled with a blend of mints. And when your attendee asks if you want it sweet and cream do not hesitate to say yes! .com

This place is slowly taking over the Bay Area and I love it. New places opening in my home town in Cupertino and sunnyvale. Sometimes I go to San Mateo and other local cities and see they have an established philz as well. Overall I would give this place a 4.5 but since it's a little on the pricey end I would have to lower it around a 4.
author: Joe Z.

description:
The coffee is great.
The logistics are terrible. If you want to get only food you have to shove through the coffee line.
The service for food is super slow and often incorrect.
And today they stopped taking cards - cash, apple, or android pay.  So even though I have been going there 2-3 times a week since they opened, they lost my business.  I do not carry cash, am too security conscious to put financials on a mobile phone, and waited in a line then found I could not pay for the coffee.

If they change that, I will be back.  As the coffee is great.
author: Tia B.

description:
Caution! This can be an addicting experience!
As others have explained already, Philz's claim to fame is that each cup is individually brewed.  And there are no lattes or espresso drinks here. It took me a few visits to figure out what I like here - any of the bolder flavors. Both Jacob's wonderbar and Turkish coffee are amazing! I take them with cream and sugar. The flavor is bold, rich and complex. You feel like you drank something super special. One you taste Philz, you just don't feel like going anywhere else! To anyone who is thinking of trying this place out - I say go for it! To those who get their coffee here regularly, I say "great choice!".
author: kumar k.

description:
LOVE IT - had a cup the other day and it's just soooooooo good. so delicious. anyone that likes coffee is going to find a delicious brew here - and it's all poured by hand. 

Makes me want some coffee right now. Sometimes there's a hint of cinnamon or mint and it really adds a nice nuance. because it's nuanced - and I like those nuances. 

NUANCED Coffee
author: Rew C.

description:
Generally, I love Philz Coffee, but I dislike this Philz Coffee's unisex restroom!  

An incident happened to me on my first visit here.  There are 2 restroom stalls, but when a guy goes in and do his thing, he left the door opened and I, being a female, entered the restroom...It was awkward, but I quickly went into the other stall without him noticing.  They should have a division or a sign that says to please keep the restroom door locked when using one of the stalls.  No one needs to walk into a unisex bathroom and be dumbfounded on what to do next!  

Besides that point, I love their coffee and the dining layout of this place!  It is a great, convenient place to grab coffee near the Cal-train station and AT&T (GIANTS) Stadium!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I want to preface this review by saying that I *LOVE* Philz coffee. It is some of the best I've tasted, especially the unique blends you can really only get in San Francisco...

That said, a few things need work at the Berry Street location:

1. the attitude of a select few of the staff who work the register -- if you're going to offer Apple Pay, FIX THE DEVICE WHICH READS THE CARDS, and stop acting as if it is my fault that I am upset that I cannot pay with the payment method I pay with *every other day*. If it breaks all the time, call Stripe or whoever you use for your merchant processing and get another one! It's unacceptable that it works some days, and not other days.

(By the way, paying with my mobile phone works with Starbucks every single day -- so, my friends with mobile phones who are told to "go away", they'd be happy to take your business that day!)

2. People falling asleep on couches -- if people want to sleep, they can do it, but just do it somewhere else. I find it distracting to do work or hold a conversation with someone snoring loudly on the couch right next to me...
author: Joshua D.

description:
One of my favourite coffee places to go to in the morning.  Long lines, acceptable wait time, and great coffee.

I really enjoy the outdoor seating when there's no dump-truck around and or sewage pipeline repair going on. 

Overall, the Ether (Phil's Way) is best at this location.
author: Chi T.

description:
Dear Philz,

Pleaz pleaz pleaz make your way up to Sacramento!

Your awesome crew custom-made my drink order (surprisingly not on the extensive menu) for a "Mexican hot chocolate" mocha.  It was perfectly spiced and sweetened just how I like it, with the right amount of bitter chocolate flavor and medium- roasted coffee.  Thank you for having baristas who know what they're doing!  $5 for a large cup and a 10 minute wait was well worth it.

If you were in Sacramento, you'd see my smiling face everyday.

Yourz alwayz,
Carolz
author: Carol P.

description: Great coffee, bagels & toasts! Super friendly staff as well. I usually go there on Saturdays & Sundays for breakfast.
author: Martin F.

description: Be warned of a barista with some major saas. I had a simple order and asked a question and her response had so much unnecessary attitude. Sticking to Burlingame Philz. They are friendly and helpful there.
author: Farha A.

description:
I usually go to the Noe Valley location because it's closer to my house, but I never been to this one until recently! Little did I know (and not surprised at ALL) that it gets CROWDED here. WAY more crowded than at the Noe one (then again, it was one of the days of the World Series.. packed with Giants fans! And probably Caltrain commuters) 

Lines move fast, staff is always friendly and helpful. Can't go wrong with their gingersnap or mint mojito iced coffee ;). They also have a lemon-raspberry bundt cake I have yet to try! Other than that, they still have the same ol' vegan donuts, breakfast sandwiches and burritos, and their croissants. I don't think I'll be at this location often because of how busy it gets, but if I'm ever in the area you know where I'll be stopping off to get my cup of coffee!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Loved my coffee! Excellent service, and great baristas!

Mmmm...Minty.
author: Guilie H.

description: the 5th star was for the SFgiants clientele!! :) beside Philz having the best iced coffee, their selection of healthy food is above par... my fave is the avocado toast and the avocado sprout sandwich, and i'm not even vegetarian.
author: Aileen A.

description:
What a colossal disappointment. Based on the reviews, I ordered the Tesoro, expecting a real fusion of chocolate and coffee. What I got for my $4 was coffee with all the chocolate hanging out in the bottom of the cup. I've made better mocha coffee at home using Nestle Quik! 

I could've overlooked that if it hadn't been for the "bros" behind the counter carrying on a non-stop conversation at the tops of their voices. Conversation between paying customers was virtually impossible. Aren't coffee shops supposed to be relaxed and moderately low-key for a nice relaxing coffee with a friend in the middle of a Saturday afternoon? if it were only a few minutes...but it went on...and on... while trying to have a business meeting. 

I didn't bother to get their names, but what a bunch of tools they were working there on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Lydia S.

description:
Awesome place. Awesome coffee. Honestly, can't think of any complaints, except I guess the lines get busy since they're so popular lol

I've been here a few times (here and at other locations too), but most recently on a weekday during rush hour time, so I wasn't really surprised that it was busy. It's a bit chaotic inside. There's a line to order, and a separate line to pay, then they call out the order when it's ready. 

The staff is friendly and especially helpful when it comes to narrowing down their extensive coffee menu. Even with the busy-ness, the girl who prepared my coffee was able to listen to my preference and suggest something good. 

There's some seating outside which is really nice on a sunny, warm day, and some seating inside as well. The intersection is somewhat busy, but not too noisy or anything. 

I will definitely be back again!
author: Bianca C.

description:
Mint Mojito FTW.  And I dropped in for my iced Mint Mojito when Giants were playing Game 1 and Phil was there running the register!  I didn't know at the time he rung me up, I found out after he liked my Philz coffee photo on Instagram and realized he was the one that rung me up and was working that day during the game at this location!   

I want a Mint Mojito now!  It's better than Blue Bottle's New Orleans iced coffee!
author: Chris L.

description:
If I gave this anything lower than a 5, my girlfriend would murder me :P

It's pretty good coffee, it's interesting to taste different types, I'm partial to the Wunderbar or the Philharmonic. The iced coffee is good too, but a little pricey.

The staff is enthusiastic, but can be a little slow. Some of their other locations have order-ahead online capabilities, which I would love for this location
author: Samir K.

description: The Philz Berry location was recently closed for remodeling and opened up mid-September. The most noticeable changes are the new counters for the baristas and orders, a new line queue that kind of weaves you to the left of the entrance and the dedicated orderahead area with its own door entrance, making it so much easier to pick up your order. The new line area makes it a kind of mosh pit for those waiting for their drinks and those waiting to pay for their  drinks. Drinks are still great though and a few seats outside for your al fresco pleasure.
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
Good coffee spot but I wish there was more seating.

ICED MINT MOJITO with an added scoop of MOCHA POWDER
ummmm yes. Best thing ever. EVER. 
You can taste the mint, the coffee, and if you get a scoop of mocha...it's like heaven on earth.
author: Debby L.

description: Love, love, love Philz Chai.  So yummy!!!  We live in Petaluma sure wish there was one closer to home!  Can't wait to come back again :).
author: Kristy M.

description:
I got the iced mint mojito here (reduced cream and sugar!) and it was FANTASTIC. It was extremely refreshing and not too sweet and not too creamy (ofc haha). I would definitely recommend this place in general since my friend ordered something else and it was equally amazing. Does it live up to the hype? pretty much. 

In terms of seating arrangement...it kind of sucks, in terms of how to order and waiting time...it's kind of confusing as a first-timer. Everyone else seemed to know what they were doing and I kind of just stood there super confused. I won't ding them for that since that's just me being pretty clueless.
author: Victoria C.

description: Awesome spot!!! Great staff and the coffee here best in the city. I'm a happy customer:)
author: Syed K.

description:
My BFF brought me here and I loved the decor.  They had SF pride everywhere and the place itself seemed so comfortable; with the tables, couches, and all.  Ordering for your first time can be quite intimidating especially when it's peak time ... so I would recommend coming during their less busier times so that you can have all the time and attention needed to get the exact cup of coffee you're wanting.

The employees have always been very helpful and nice; and all-in-all this is just a great coffee shop in an amazing neighborhood.

Keep in mind though that there isn't an abundance of seating, so you may have to take your cup to-go.
author: Pia V.

description:
Philz Coffee was on top of my list as a must visit spot in San Francisco. Everyone I know was raving about their Mint Mojito Coffees so I had to try it for myself...

I'm a dark, black coffee kinda girl, but every now and then, I like a little change up. The mint mojito coffee was refreshing and I enjoyed the fresh mint that they use. The hot one was perfect for this cold day wandering around San Francisco! I'd love to try to the Iced Mint Mojito next time. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to try any other coffees, but I'll be back. I hear the Tesora is pretty good too. They have quite a large variety of beans and I'm looking forward to trying them when I'm back in SF!
author: Leslie L.

description:
Came here with a friend on his suggestion. He also told me to try the iced mint mojito. Wow it was amazing. I did wish it didn't have so much ice in it, since I ordered a small cup and if you just drank it quickly, there wasn't much coffee in it. I think I'd order a large the next time. 

There were probably 5-6 people ahead of us when we got there, and we had to wait about 5 minutes to place our order and another 5-10 minutes to get our drinks. It didn't seem that long, and remember that each cup is brewed fresh after you order. The staff was super friendly and made us feel very welcome that day.

Place was pretty busy around 4pm, but luckily we were able to find one table for two to sit and chat at. The store is really chill and not that noisy. A good place to stop by on your way to the Caltrain station.

Highly recommend the iced mint mojito! Will be back the next time I'm in the area.
author: Dennis K.

description: I love Philz Coffee, and I usually get a black iced mint mojito (or tesora with muddled mint leaves) whenever I go to a Philz. This Philz is located a block away from the Caltrain station, and it doesn't have very many seats/tables (few tables outside). I've been here multiple times, but today was the first time that I sat inside for a while. I came to read some books, and I heard "m.A.A.d city" playing in the cafe, and I thought to myself, "Oooo my jaaaam!" Then I caught myself thinking, "Oooo my jaaaam!" for every song that played afterwards. The playlist was so bumpin. I hope this Philz always plays hip hop because I'll keep coming back just for the playlist. It made it harder to concentrate, but whatever. It was great hearing people rap long to Ignition (remix) and attempting to sing along with Thinkin Bout You.
author: Annie S.

description:
Real friends don't let you go to work without caffeine in you! 

Especially if that friend is Mish L, goddess of all things coffee. 

My mind was awake but my body was sore from yoga class yesterday, especially since I haven't done yoga in two weeks. (it's so hard to snap out of vacation mode!)  Philz was conveniently located near the Muni train on King st (also near Caltrain for you South Bay commuters) so I had to get my fix! 

The Mocha Tesora gave my body the awakening it needed: a medium roast that's smooth, full-bodied with a little bit of chocolate taste .... YUM! It was lightly sweetened but I had to ask for more half and half because I really like my milk! As a woman, I make sure to get my daily RDA of Calcium. I told Mish, "it's better to get it now while I can than later on when I'm old!" 

The barista heard this and he had this Cheshire-cat smile on his face and I said: "wait a minute, are you saying That's what she said in your head?!"   

Well, great minds think alike! ;-)
author: Janice C.

description: Pretty impressive coffee chain in the South Bay. I love to drink coffee and this place was great in a pinch. They have this coffee mojito drink that was pretty legit. Would recommend.
author: Jason S.

description:
Philz Coffee's famous Mint Mojito Iced Coffee has tons of fresh mint leaves and a really frothy creamy consistency. Philz Coffee is known for their "one cup at a time" philosophy - they brew all their drinks one cup at a time and will custom blend a coffee to your preferences. They have several locations around San Francisco and the South/East Bay. My coffee addict friends from instagram would always post pictures of mint mojito iced coffee with the leaf on top of the drink always make me want to try it but the drive is far from where I live! One day I was in the SF area on a nice Sunday, I went to a random coffee shop and it didn't satisfied me then Yelped out Philz that was nearby. 

The lines were no joke, they were pretty long.. up out the door! I was super excited to try out the mint mojito. The workers/staff were super friendly at this shop. Very upbeat! You wait in line, order what you like from the barista/coffee maker then you go pay and wait for your drink.

The mojito is outstanding. Great, frothy, and tastes yummy. I just need to tell them to put less ice because it took up most of the volume :(. But overall, awesome place.

I LOVE MINTS!
author: Jan P.

description:
$4.50 large gingersnap iced coffee = legit ground-up cinnamon in yo' drink. Amazing.

Also, yes. The signs are counterintuitively accurate. You place your order on the right, and after it's made, you pay at the cash register on the left.

Legit cinnamon. Legit.
author: Adele F.

description:
Coffee is good but the wait is terrible.  4 baristas just
Standing there talking to each other and I'm the only
One in line.  Took 4 minutes til someone took my order.
author: David S.

description:
One of the best drip coffee places with insane amount of choices. I have tried them all and love mostly all of them. 
some of my favs are 
Iced mint mojito, ecstatic Iced, Jacobs', So good,  turkish, philharmonic, 

but you cant go wrong with any of them really. 
one of my go to spots for coffee in the city.
author: Anuj C.

description: A couple blocks away from the Caltrain/ Megabus station, I had some time to kill and knew I wanted to go to Philz. Didn't want anything with caffeine in it since I wanted to sleep on the bus so I got a hot chocolate, 100% sweet. Despite it being full sugar, it was the perfect sweetness so that you can taste the sugar, but not so much that it gives you a toothache. I'm not too much of a chocolate person (I know, I know), but this was perfect! It was rich, smooth, sweet, creamy, and tasted so natural and well made. I also asked for a couple sprigs of fresh mint which my-oh-my, that's when I fell in love! If it was close to me, I'd be in deep trouble.
author: Stella Y.

description:
Is it cheating if I didn't actually step in here?  I was picking up a friend on the corner and I couldn't resist asking her to buy me one of the infamous Mint Mojito drinks while I waited outside.  Since I don't do too well with caffeine, I asked for a decaf and she happily obliged.  

She hopped in the car and said "Whoa that was pretty good!"  I took my first sip into the icy goodness and I was almost shocked at how delicious it was.  Since I don't drink alcohol, this was the closest I would get to a real mint mojito and I was a happy girl.  

I opened the lid of the coffee cup and there they were-- the fresh mint leaves looking straight up at me almost saying, "Surprise, Betcha didn't think we were in here did you?!"  

Oh Philz, I get the hype now.  I will be back just for this...
author: Lorie N.

description:
So good! The baristas individually make each order. Per other yelpers suggestions I got the mint mojito iced coffee which was definitely the way to go. It was freshly brewed over ice, with the perfect amount of froth on top and plenty of mint leaves. I should have ordered a large!

As far as the physical location, there is some seating both indoors and out--seems like a good place to sit and stay a while.
author: Margarette N.

description:
With 1000+ reviews -- most of them positive, and many of them raving -- Philz doesn't really need my review. And yet, here I go anyway!

I'll admit: I had a very "meh" experience my first time here. The coffee was fine, but I wasn't blown away. This "meh" was probably colored by the fact that I revealed it was my first time at Philz... and then was sorta spoken to like I'd never had a cup of coffee before. Given all the woo-hoos of friends and yelpers alike, I decided to try it again, and I'm glad I did. I think the barista you get makes a big difference, but it's not like you have a choice about who calls you up. 

Granted, Philz takes a bit of getting used to. You order, then pay. And it's not like you just say, "I'll have a mocha" (or whatever), then move on. You choose your roast and blend, decide if you want it with milk or with sweet, and then they make the whole thing for you. In that respect, it's sort of like ordering at a bar. If you don't know what you want, you may sit there for a second and ponder... all the while phearing that you may be holding up the line. But the good thing is, the phine pholks at Philz are happy to make recommendations. 

Eventually, trying out the different roasts gets to be kind of fun. So far, I've tried Code 33, Philharmonic, Ambrosia, New Manhattan, and a couple of others.  As someone else mentioned, I do kind of prefer it with the milk. But, I realize that's a bit of a heresy among some hardcore coffee drinkers, so let's put it this way: Philz coffee seems to be designed to pair nicely with milk, but it can be enjoyed nicely on its own as well.

PRO TIP 1: Even if the line's out the door, it may not actually take that long to get your coffee. The line sticks out because it starts kinda far back from the counter.

PRO TIP 2: Ask your "coffee-maker" to make you his or her favorite drink. It's fun to explore their menu this way, and you're sure to try something that you wouldn't have thought of yourself!
author: Tami S.

description:
Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee - my second time drinking this coffee flavor. I don't recall having bad experiences at Philz and Starbucks. The customer service here at both of these coffee shops are very good. I never thought I'd make a stop here for coffee until I walked over from Caltrain Station today. This is the second Philz location I've been to since I went to their location on 24th & Folsom back in September. I didn't think I would actually be able to taste a cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee here in SF until I started going to Philz. From my coffee shop experiences, Philz Coffee is the one coffee shop with Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee available. Overall, I had a very good first time experience here at this location so I'll definitely come in here again. If you are looking for a coffee shop to order a cup of Jamaica Blue Mountain, then Philz is the answer.

11/28/2012
I came in today and ordered a small hot chocolate with medium sweetness. Friendly baristas and some of the customers here are friendly as well. My favorite beverage items here are the Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee and Hot Chocolate. I love the design of Philz Coffee cups, paper sleeves are not needed. All you need is the cap on your beverage and you're good to go. This is my third time coming to Philz Coffee; the members behind the counter are very friendly. I don't recall having a bad experience at Philz so I'll definitely come back.

11/29/2012
Today is my third going to Philz Coffee at Berry St and I love it. I ordered a Turkey Sausage Breakfast Sandwich and a Large Hot Chocolate when I came in here today. Someday, I'm going to make a stop here to try their breakfast burritos. As a consumer and coffee shop regular just like me, I'm sure there is a pastry item and a perfect cup of coffee waiting for me. I decided on going to Philz just because it is always good to try something new.

I like going to Philz because
1. The staff and customers are very nice
2. Wi-Fi signals are purely crisp and crystal clear
3. There are seats available inside and outside - some customers order their food and beverage items to go.
4. The restroom look very clean and that is always a good thing

All in all, I enjoy my experiences at this Philz location so I'll definitely return if I am near the library or Caltrain Station. Perhaps I should try a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee on my next visit.

12/6/2012
I have passed by, seen and heard people raving about Philz before. So I started going to Philz to try it out for myself and to see how good this place is. The staff and customers turned out to be friendly so that is a good thing. I said I will order a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and a Breakfast Burrito when I go to Philz, so I did and I am loving it. Breakfast Burrito with a cup of Mint Mojito Iced Coffee - a perfect combo.

Some of the items I've tried during my visits to Philz are:
- Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee
- Hot Chocolate
- Mint Mojito Iced Coffee
- Turkey Sausage Breakfast Sandwich &
- Breakfast Burrito

Overall, the coffee shop looks very clean so it is very well worth the visit. Positive experiences for my recent Philz visits so I am coming back. I can just walk over here upon getting off the train since this place is so close to Caltrain Station.

Staff members - friendly
Services - efficient
author: Bennett W.

description: Before I met Philz, I never thought I could appreciate a chain coffee brand so much. It's been two months since I first tried Philz and I've been to multiple locations in the Bay since, but this location was the first one that I visited. I remember the day clearly: it was a sunny Friday evening and I ran into a friend who was sleepily walking into Philz. Engaged in conversation, I decided to stand in line with him and order myself an iced coffee. I got the gingersnap (sweet & creamy style) and have never second guessed a craving for Philz since then! The service here isn't that quick (you'll have to wait about five minutes) but it is pleasant and always of high quality. I'll miss Philz so much when I move back to the east coast- please expand!
author: Meryam B.

description:
I really really like Philz coffee. 

The philharmonic is my fav. That blend of unique flavors always makes my taste buds happy. 

This coffee wakes me up! Actually, wakes me up to the point where I shake from caffeine overdose. 

My recommendations - watch out and if you're sensitive to caffeine, do not get the light roast - it's the strongest. 

Also, get ready to wait in line. You're not the only one craving a Philz coffee. 

My only negative is the mint in the coffee. I hate mint! Philz baristas - you guys should ask if customers want the mint. Sometimes I forget to say "no mint" and I'm unpleasantly surprised.
author: Irina R.

description:
Philz is always my morning work pick-me-up! 

On dreary SF mornings, the Philharmonic is perfect. For hot SF days, the Mint Mojito is by far the most popular. For the in- between days, Ecstatic iced is great. 

Might even consider buying a bag of coffee beans myself to bring Philz into my home daily.
author: Kristi L.

description: If you don't like their coffee, they will make it until you love it! They honour their customers, and ensure that everyone is enjoying their drink. They have a myriad of coffee that you can choose from. Also, their almond croissant is to freakin die for!
author: Katrina W.

description:
When it came time for my morning coffee the other day, my boyfriend insisted that I go to Philz (he grew up here, I'm new). My first impression is what lowered my rating from a 5 to a 4. If you're a local, you know how this place works. But walking off the street as a stranger, it wasn't clear, and I find that frustrating as a traveler (I travel 100% of my life).  

Here's what you need to know:  The cashier line may be empty, don't approach until you have your drink ordered. There IS a line to order from (because of the way it's laid out, if you are like me, you may think it was people waiting for their coffee). They are actually in line to give their order. Get in that line, Philz is busy. Once you give your order, you go to the cashier & let him/her know what you ordered. The cashier is also where you put in your food orders. Your barista that took your order will also be the one that calls out your coffee order when it's ready. Keep an eye on that person. 

My order was simple, I like my coffee like my granny made it with lots of cream & sugar. Trusting someone else to get the proportions right is unnerving, but my barista nailed it!  The coffee was full flavored without being bitter. It was delightful creamy & sweet. 

I also ordered oatmeal. It was pre packaged Umqua Oats, but not bad at all. Of all the prepackaged oatmeals I have had, that one ranks the best. 

Would definitely make a return trip to Philz.
author: Marian M.

description:
Great coffee! Made "one cup at a time". I got the darkest roast and loved every drop. It was crowded but the line goes fast even though they take their time with making your cup. 
All the tables were taken but no matter-we found a bench outside in the fresh air near the ocean. Oh, and they have a clean bathroom-that's hard to keep achieving in SF! I'll definitely come back here when in that area of the city.
author: Sharon S.

description:
I do not drink coffee, i quit a few years ago. But whenever i get out of work half day and find a spot to finish up with out having to actually be at work i am in. 

The location is cool, with a patio, some nice at home furniture set up, and clean. WIFI of course,but no parking. 

The breakfast sammies are ok, not amazing and the other non coffee beverages are decent. The staff is just super nice and awesome though. Makes it a fun environment.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Had Philz for for the first time, went with the iced mint coffee. Initial thoughts: minty and strong!

If you're going to get iced, go for the large otherwise there's not that much liquid to drink. 

When I got to the bottom of my drink, I noticed how much mint they put in...not a bad thing just surprised. 

Now that this chain is popping up all over, I'm sure I'll be back
author: Melissa L.

description: Love this place and wish they had a Philz in the Midwest! I know their "iconic" drink is their mint mojito, and while it's quite delicious, I couldn't drink the mint mojito as an everyday coffee. For me, I've tried pretty much all of their medium roast coffees and they're great! Some of my favorites are Dancing Water, Mocha Tesora, Philtered Soul, and Sooo Good. What's also great about Philz is that they list three of the key flavors in each drink right next to the drink, so you somewhat have an idea of what you're getting prior to ordering. I really appreciated that my first time going to Philz. Their service here is always great, and I'm never disappointed when I come! Please come to the Midwest!!!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: This location rocks just like every other Philz Coffee location. I like this location because it is in a nice area. It is cool that it is near AT&T park. It is very nice inside this location. Philz Coffee rocks!
author: Isaac H.

description: Can never resist a iced Mint Mohito. This Philz works fast and always has a good buzz. Lines can go out of the door for the morning caffiene hun
author: Charlie H.

description:
Wow. WheneverI I visited SanFran I usually popped into the Creamery as it was the first place I'd see when I arrived here. But at 630am on a rainy Saturday, they were not open yet. Thankfully Philz is and much higher rating is well deserved.

Gimme a dark roast and a warmed up ham and cheese croissant... Thanks... mmmmmm cheesy but not much ham.... but great croissant...light , buttery and very flakey... mmmmm

I beat the crowd forming and snagged a table... another hit of my coffee confirms this is an awesome spot. Barrista Cibby made me a kickazz individually brewed dark roast. The rain dashed My plan to have brekkie at Tartines... but I didn't really want to wait for 30 min in the rain...

Thank you Philz!
author: Darrell L.

description:
Ether!!! Need I say more? 
Excellent pastries, breakfast sandwiches and breakfast burritos! 
Stones throw from PacBell park for all u Giants fans ...just remember 1989...go A's!
author: Paul D.

description:
When I went to this Philz location I was warmly welcomed by a BEAUTIFUL baurista named Darleene. Looks, charm, coffee wizardry that a mere mortal like myself could barely comprehend... boy howdy she has it all. 

She made me a cup of philharmonic with a pinch of cinnamon, no sweet, heavy cream and it was almost as smooth as she is. Now, not only am I in love with this gorgeous woman, I am also in love with this fantastic cup of coffee. I don't even know if it's appropriate to call what she served me coffee when it is made to the standard of perfection she promotes. I belive she really served me a cup of spritual healing with a dash of love potion. 

Great job hiring such a wonderful, sassy, bubbly, overthetopdoanythingtomakeyouhappy employee.
author: Aaron R.

description:
Ever since my first time having Philz up in Berkeley, I've been craving Philz coffee because I live in so cal. So, on our first day of the SF trip, we made a mecca towards Sight Glass, Philz, and Blue bottle(could this be the holy trinity of coffees in SF?)

I was gonna order the regular iced coffee, but just went ahead with the mint mojito. I love how your coffee isn't pre-made, but actually formed in front of you, from start to finish. There's no large bin that they pour your coffee from. This might be a faster alternative(Starbucks) if you're in a rush, but I really appreciate the "one cup at a time" and the personalization that goes into my coffee. 

Just a great and super refreshing cup of mint mojito, that I can't get in so cal...
But I'm glad they don't have one in so cal, because, otherwise, I'd probably spend a lot of $$ on coffee..
author: Daniel L.

description:
Just go with the mint mohito hands down. This coffee joint is always packed and for good reason. There are couches for lounging and also tables and chairs for the squatters who are reading a book, enjoying the day and even some working from cafe. 

All the coffees here are pour over, you can try the mint mohito. sweet and creamy is the way it was meant to be so don't let anyone tell you otherwise. the marriage is also a good option for those who want a black coffee. 

You order with one of the baristas, then you go pay for your drink and then go back to wait when the barista calls out your order. a bit different from the normal stand in line and order queue, you get a "personal" barista in this sense. 

Wish there were more of Philz around and maybe one day they'll do a Philz card or something as well.
author: Ander C.

description:
I won't lie, the few times I've been here, I may or may not have had a friend behind the counter who encouraged me to get what her favorite item on the menu was.  I'm one of the most indecisive individuals in the world, so having a friend point me in the right direction was incredibly helpful.

The Tesora is my go-to, and nothing feels better than a nice hot cup of coffee while gearing up to brave Safeway across the street.  The "neighborhood coffee shop" ambiance helps the concrete condo jungle it's around; you really don't feel like you're in SOMA/Mission Bay at all.  I most definitely kick myself for not coming here more frequently, especially since I'm only a few Muni stops away.  Check this place out, it's definitely worth it!
author: Lisa I.

description: Stopped by for a quick drink yesterday since I was in the area, but normally don't go here because most of their employees are not the most helpful nor friendly. However, Charles made me the most delicious mint mojito, and he was just the sweetest! Best customer service I've ever had at any Philz location. Thank you, Charles!
author: Genesis A.

description: Finally got to try the infamous Philz. I wasn't prepared for the fairly large menu and ended up ordering a sweetened latte. I also tried the mint mojito (good stuff). Berry pastry was good too. It was a weekday and the shop was jam packed. Coffee was pretty
author: Mel L.

description:
My first Philz visit! Line wasn't bad at all when I was there. Had to get the iced mint mojito, of course! I think the ordering process can be tricky and confusing - order with a barista then pay and go wait for your drink - it does seem initially efficient but it may be difficult for customers to keep track of which drink may be theirs, especially if, say, multiple people are ordering mint mojitos.

The drink was delicious and just the right amount of mint for me, I'm glad it was not overwhelming. Very refreshing, plus looks cute!
author: Pamela S.

description: I worked remotely from Philz on Berry one afternoon. Ordered a cup of the iced Mocha Tesora coffee which was phenomenal. Wifi was adequate, not blazing.  Good spot overall, and not too crowded, though that was likely due to the holiday weekend.
author: Charles W.

description: I went in and said it's hot outside can you recommend a good iced coffee that doesn't need a bunch of cream and sugar.  "I will give you my special coffee that I make for some of my favorite guests".  I'm thinking excellent as I just scored the secret menu item.  And up pops a hot coffee.  "Oh you wanted iced coffee"  plop plop.  Two ice cubes hit the cup.  So much for the secret menu.
author: Brad S.

description: One of the best coffee shops hands down. This place is always busy and usually have a long line. But so worth the wait
author: Cal N.

description:
When you see countless people recommend something, best bets are its probably good, or interesting at least. Skim through the reviews and pics, and you will see mint iced coffee mojito mentioned frequently. So what did I get, a normal coffee. The boyfriend got the iced mint mojito coffee thingy and it was LOVELY!! I sat there with complete and utter coffee envy, I must have been pure green!

But this is not to say my coffee was lacking. They have a choice of a ton of beans, for whatever strength. I tried the Dancing Water, hints of choc, nuts, cinnamon, and it was realllly good too! They put the milk and sugar in themselves which I was dubious about, as I always need a ton of cream and sugar, but they sure know what they're doing here as it was just right :) Of course when I leaned over and took that sneaky sip of the mojito, suddenly everything paled a little in comparison. 

We walked quite a distance to get here, and I plan on doing it tomorrow before we fly out  of the city, need my fix!
author: Trudi C.

description:
So San Fransisco.

Baristas r hip, fun, & friendly.

Coffee is great too.

Limited seating & it's always packed.
author: Kiely N.

description:
Yeah, this is probably my favorite place for coffee of all time. I have yet to face any disappointment with a cuppa joe from this establishment. 

Of course there are my ultimate 'go tos' whenever I drop into Philz such as Mocha Tesora and Mint Mojito. Being the creature of habit that I am, I don't normally veer off from my usual norm, but today, after running out of cocoa powder, I was recommended to try The Jacob which I am totally coo coo bananas for now! My new favorite addiction! Deep, complex, dark roasted coffee all brewed individually and not by the pot. If you ever wanted to feel what it's like to be hugged from the inside out, that's exactly what a cup from Philz can do for you. Overstatement? I think not. Everything that embodies smooth and soulful can be found right here in the form of Philz coffee.

Now that I've ventured out a little more from my usual selections, I pretty much think that it's a no fail.

This is a great location, just a short distance from AT&T Ballpark, restaurants, trendy condos, Caltrans Station, and even a dog park. 

The baristas are always friendly and personable and are sure to create a flavor profile to your liking!

Yay for Philz!
author: Ann S.

description:
Philz is THE top notch coffee place to go to in SF or any of their Bay Area locations. But this location in particular sits close to my heart. :)

I've come here on so many occasions from my daily commute into the city via Caltrain, to getting ready for interviews in the area, to the first day of work at my first job in the city on a rainy day with no umbrella... I guess they're all work-related, but that's why Philz is so wonderful because despite being in the city for stressful situations, Philz is there for me like an oasis of warmth, coffee, and happiness.

And it's not only because their coffee is amazing. I don't need to talk about their coffee. Everyone knows how awesome it is already. (I get the mocha tesora most days.)

I want to talk about the PEOPLE working at Philz. The service at this Philz is AMAZING - from their friendly baristas that ask how sweet you like your drink, and remind you to try the drink after it's made to see if it's to your taste, to the people at the register who are always there with a smile asking if you need anything else even if you're just waiting for your order, even the guy heating up the food is friendly - they've all been just genuinely bright and NICE, which is such a nice contrast in this foggy bustling city where people usually hesitate to make eye contact.

I am in no way a morning person. Every time I go this Philz, I walk in grumpy and stressed, and in a matter of minutes I walk out transformed, smiling with some pep in my step.

They're also dog-friendly! How cute is that. The signs around the shop remind you to keep your pups outside, but they have a big jar of dog treats at the register, dog bowls outside, and little dog decor around the shop. :) Who doesn't like seeing some happy puppies in the morning.

I also come here for BREAKFAST BURRITOS. If you haven't tried one of their sausage or green chili breakfast burritos, you must. They're delicious, and they toast it up for you in the oven beforehand so it's nice and hot and cheesy on the inside with a crunchy tortilla on the outside. It may not look very big, but all those cheese, eggs, and potatoes will fill you up for sure!

Love Philz!!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I was being my awkward self and spilled a waterfall of coffee all over my coat/scarf/pants/boots/face because I didn't put the lid on properly... I went to the register in shock with an "OH NO, OMG" expression, and they immediately handed me a fat stack of napkins and a towel while offering to give me a free Mint Mojito... Uhh, I definitely didn't deserve this. It was my fault for spilling that shit everywhere, resulting in a lake of sweet & creamy goodness by the entrance. And there was a decent amount left in that cup for me to slurp. Yet they insisted they'd give me the free drink. 

I smelled like Mint Mojito the rest of the afternoon, but I didn't really care because 1) everyone later said I smelled good for some reason; and 2) the staff just made my day for being so quick and responsive, saving me from even more awkwardness/embarrassment. I mean, imagine me just standing next to the puddle not knowing where to put my hands, while a stereotypical snooty barista guffaws and continues to clean up my mess with a condescending "wow" death stare. (Something I expected, since a similar reaction has happened to me before... but thankfully, a reaction that did not repeat itself in today's mishap.) 

Overall the whole staff were super friendly, & I just love the small, cozy vibe of this particular Philz... Not to mention, it's right across the metro and near AT&T park and tons of other hot spots, so the location is pretty ideal. 

Didn't get to catch their names, but to everyone who worked today at 2:30 to 3pm-ish, thank you. :)
author: Valerie F.

description: I've had the Phillz coffee by my work in the FIDI, but dropped by here today before running a 5k. The place is small, but has a very homey feel to it. I ordered a Manhattan and asked the barista to make it sweet (it's still a bit too strong for my taste regardless). My friends got drinks of their own and really enjoyed them. I also ordered a croissant which was fantastic. Nice and flakey just like I like them. One small note the bathroom was gender neutral which takes some getting use to! Overall, a nice spot for a quick bite and coffee.
author: James R.

description:
Philz Philz, why you must use drugs?
I'm hooked on whatever you put in that mug.
Makes me so happy I wanna give you a hug
My favorite coffee is your mint mojito
Delicious, but don't give it to your bebito (spanish for baby)
It's more delicious than a taco bell taco that has a shell of a Dorito (and that's saying something!)

But one warning I give it's an expensive addiction
Your wallet may be, the one important restriction

Needed to refine my rhyme this time.  Make sure you get some coffee, they have flavors like mint, chocolate, but I don't think toffee.
author: Dennis K.

description:
This location on Berry street has 4 coffee maker "rockstars", yet a line still forms outside this location on a Sunday morning at 10am. They brew their coffee one cup at a time, but it's not only in their technique that makes their coffee so freaking good, but it's also the quality of the coffee beans. 

Order the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and you will never step into a Starbucks for an iced drink again. Philz Mint Mojito is seriously the best coffee ever.
author: Linh N.

description:
I used to live in the apartment building across the street from this Philz, and having gone to several others (the one in Berkeley, the one near 24th & Mission, the one near Civic), this one is as good as it gets!

The service is amazing. Every barista that's been here (and I've gone through like at least 3-4 hiring cycles I think) is incredibly nice and attentive. They pretty rarely get my drink order wrong (and if they do it's usually the new hires anyways, so they're probably still learning the ropes) and if anything most of them start remembering me as a regular and know my order my heart (Julie's, Philz way). 

There was one barista who even upgraded me to large for free every once in a while if I looked super tired that morning or anything like that!

The coffee is of course great, but Philz always is. 

Don't be deterred by the long line! It goes super fast.

It can get really crowded and be hard to find a table, but the WiFi is pretty solid if you can find a spot. There's also not a lot of outlets, so that's kind of a downside, but honestly this is more a cafe to grab a quick cup and go versus trying to sit and do work.

Summary of this review would be: what really makes this Philz stand out from the rest (or any other coffee shop really) is the service. :)
author: Whitney L.

description:
Cute coffee shop with plenty of seating. Very comfy chairs for catching up with friends or just getting some work done. 

The Mint Mojito is amazing! Fresh mint leaves with a kick to it.
Ginger Snaps reminded me of Gingerbread cookies but was a great cold drink as well. 
-  $0.50 upgrade from a small to a large cup.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Ugh SO EXPENSIVE FOR COFFEE, BUT SO GOOD. It's more like an afternoon treat than your everyday coffee. Actually, it would be my everyday coffee if I was ballin' out of control. For now, I'll settle for a weekly/bi-weekly treat.

They make each cup individually. So every cup is made to perfection the right amount of creaminess, flavor, and ice. Never too sweet. I usually get the iced mint mojito coffee, but the regular ice coffee is just as good! The foam is one of the best parts. How do they get it so thick and flavorful?! True baristas right there!

Great service too. If you haven't been there before they tell you a little background of Philz, how they make it and recommendations. 

Tip: At this Philz, the person that your order from is the counter you get it from.
author: Sunanda P.

description:
Wow! I'm not usually a regular coffee drinker but holy hell this is no regular coffee. It may be one of the best I've ever had. I was in the San Fran area and my boyfriend mentioned I should try Philz, well of course! this man doesn't have a bad suggestion E.V.E.R. I saved the best for last apparently, because this was my last stop before departing the city and boy was it a fantastic decision! 

I have to admit I was a bit loss when I first walked in, I usually only order non fat lattes so there I stood a wee bit confused looking at the menu board like an amateur - a little frazzled because it was almost my turn to order when I spotted two options I thought I may enjoy.

I asked which they thought I may like more and then chose the Tesora (large with cream). Just perfect! Fresh, smooth and extremely delicious.

I also tried the vegan espresso donut, it was ok.

We need a Philz in LA pronto! I brought a bag of Tesora beans home for the man behind the perfect recommendation, so maybe he'll grind them up and brew me a cup in the meantime.

Can't wait to get back to Philz the next time we are in the area.
author: Candace L.

description:
As you walk I. You place the order directly with the barista and then wait as they actually brew your order right then and there. Depending on what you order you have a chance to taste to your preference. 
Then you pay and end up leaving with a great feeling because you didn't pay all that money for some imitation gourmet coffee.
author: D.j. V.

description:
mMMm... Philz Coffee... what a great start to my morning. The mint mojito is my favorite (are you surprised??)! The staff here is very efficient and accommodating. I love that this place makes my coffee right in front of me. You can also request light ice.

There's plenty of seating inside and out, and there's also wifi. One negative is that there aren't many places to plug in your laptop, so even if you want to work at a coffee shop, the max time you'll spend there is the length of your computer's battery life or you can sit on a couch with your laptop.
author: Christina L.

description:
You know your drink is good when you're sad that you finished your first one and you immediately started craving more.

I don't drink coffee, but my co-workers keep raving about Philz and luckily there was one that we can go to off the 101 exit. Of course there was a line and I had no idea where my sister parked, but there is parking somewhere haha.

I got the iced mint mojito after hearing about it so much and I loved it! It's made with their ecstatic coffee which is a bunch of different coffees combined and they add fresh mint for the minty flavor. And they use something called the drip process where they make every single cup individually. My drink was light and medium sweet with a good hint of mint. YUM. 

The guy who made my coffee was super nice and informative and I'm pretty sure he knew that I knew nothing about coffee based on my on-going questions that I rambled.

Overall, I would so be addicted if I lived a lot of closer, but I guess it's a good thing I don't. Definitely coming back when I have a chance though!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Went to this location twice because I was working close by and it is a busy location but drinks were made well. I notice it was a little less sweet than other locations. The baristas were all very friendly and helpful. Over all good experience with good vibes. I will come back here if I am in the area. 

Oh yea. They're pastries are the shit. Screw your diet. Get your pastry on.
author: Monica R.

description:
So after a shitty experience at Philz, Phil had mailed me a $10 gift card. My fiancé and I decided to give Philz another try so we came back today on my fiancé's birthday.

My fiancé ordered a Jamaican Blue Mountain and our barista JJ had the nerve to say, "you know that's $10, right? How rude and offensive! 

Phil, you got two bad apples that's a cancer to your business. We are switching back to Starbucks. How dare she question us if we can afford a $10 cup of coffee.
author: Darlene M.

description:
Philz knows what it's good at, and sticks to it. They make a mean coffee. 

Their coffee is great, and of course I'm a sucker for the mint mojito. For me it's way too sweet Philz way, so if you aren't into really sweet drinks, make sure to tell the barista making your drink that you want it only lightly sweetened!! But for real, who knew mint and coffee paired so magically well together???? 

Always try and have a Philz stop whenever I'm in the neighborhood! Sets ya up for a great day!
author: Marilyn M.

description: I love Philz, I think it's the best coffee in the city.  Whenever I go, I have to get their Mocha Tesora.  If you've never been to Philz before, they individually make your own coffee.  They are able to make it to order.  For being always busy, the staff is always friendly and helpful.  They have their select coffee bean of the month and you can grab a pound for cheaper.
author: Justin Y.

description:
It's a morning ritual for me now a days when I come home to San Francisco to have a cup of Philz's iced mint mojito. 

I usually wander around to different locations, but this one has been my most consistent one, and the fact that this location is close to the Giants ballpark, gets the brownie points and a review. 

Ever since I've started coming to this locations, it's been a rather pleasant experience. I get asked to try my mint mojito after it's been made everytime and they never skimp me on the mint (my favorite part). 

The gentleman that helped me recently was awesome! I wished I got his name so could give him a personal thanks on this review. He made quite possibly, the best cup of mint mojito I've had to date. 

"Hello, may I have 2 large iced mint mojitos made with vanilla soy please?"

"Absolutely! So that's 2 large iced mint mojitos made with vanilla soy. Is there anything else I can make for you?" 

"Nope, that's all."

"And you want that made to perfection right?" 

"Yes please!" 

And perfection it was. 

WORD OF ADVICE: get it made with vanilla soy! I was recommended that by my buddy Susy and I've been hooked on having it made like that ever since. Thanks Fatty!
author: Mike D.

description:
We moved to San Francisco a little over 1 month ago, and were fortunate enough to find a place just down the street from this Philz Coffee. Our first experience back in June was a little rocky, though. If you haven't been to a Philz Coffee before, the set-up is a little different. You wait in line until one of the baristas calls you, and you place your order. I was a little taken aback when they asked how I wanted my coffee, as I am used to adding my own sugar and cream. What does "light" or "medium" mean anyway? After you place your order, you have to walk over the to the register to pay --- however, no one is actually checking that you pay for your coffee so I'm sure people have gotten away with free coffee here! We ordered a couple warm breakfast sandwiches, and again, no one asks for your name or any identifying feature.

So, of course, there's quite a bit of confusion when there are a lot of people in the shop (which is often). You don't know if it's YOUR medium Philtered Soul with light cream up on the bar or if it's someone else's. Additionally, people who ordered after you can snatch up your breakfast sandwich, no questions asked. Or actually, they can snatch it up even if they didn't even order it. That's what happened to my husband's breakfast burrito. We kept waiting and waiting, and it turns out someone took his burrito so they had to heat up another one, but only after we inquired about where it was.

The coffee is good, but the cream can be a little heavy, even if you ask for "light" --- I've stopped asking the baristas to sweeten it because "light" always ends up too sweet for my taste. I really wish that I could add the sugar and cream myself. All in all, I'll still come here because it's our closest coffee shop and the coffee is pretty delicious, but I don't like the set-up of this business. We also decided not to order any food that needs warming up ever again, especially when the place is packed and chaotic. Once we use up all our existing coffee beans, we'll definitely be buying our own Philtered Soul to use with our Chemex to avoid the awkward set-up. Maybe I'll start bringing my own coffee thermos to help distinguish it amongst the many Philtered Souls that get ordered... :)
author: Janet L.

description: A friend highly recommended this cafe. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. I ordered mint mojito iced coffee which is one of the most popular in this cafe. The flavor of mojito and coffee mixed. It is difficult to describe. All I can say is brilliant.
author: Nancy S.

description: I love Philz and go at least twice a day. Maybe not this location, but I love it. This location is smaller than the others (seems that way, anyway). My favorite? Tesoro (medium roast).  Once you've had coffee here, you'll ditch those other chains.
author: Ralph R.

description:
I've been hearing nothing but rave reviews about Philz Coffee and as I slowly become a coffee connoisseur across my cafe travels, I absolutely needed to give it a try.  Upon arrival, there were tons of people with their dogs at their outdoor tables in front and this is a fantastic place to fuel up as you start the day.  Philz makes each cup by hand, individually brewing and prepping your pick-me-up with love.

The mint mojito iced coffee stood out on the menu and it was exactly the combination I wanted right then.  They used whole mint leaves and really tasty coffee that gave me a very mild buzz, and not the kind that keeps me wired.  The flavors were really robust from the high quality ingredients and it is now one of my favorite coffee drinks out there.  At $4+ it's not cheap, but it makes up for it with every sip.  I'm definitely getting this again next time.

Philz has an awesome atmosphere and people are really friendly.  Figuring out how to order the first time can be a little confusing but it all makes sense after a while.  The energy in the room is great and the WiFi signal is strong.  Bring your pup with you while you enjoy your cup of coffee, but make sure they stay outside.  Sadly, they can't come in.

Food: 9/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Coffee quality: great.
Waiting time: super awful.
Seating situation: poor. always no seats.

Conclusion: good for take-outs.
author: Frost L.

description:
When i first saw the menu i was overwhelmed.... because I am used to the same old menu at Starbucks and Peet's. I LOVE the variety that Philz offers and the UNIQUE flavoring... really can't get this anywhere else!!!!! Love watching the baristas make the coffee on the spot!

I thought the Baristas could be more friendly though! would help if someone could stand around and sort out the crowd and help people with menu and lines! that would be super awesome when it's really busy ... it's a chaos there!
author: jess c.

description:
This was the second location we visited.
I was literally on a PHILZ high. 

Got sucked in with the iced mint mojito. Serious crack. I kept craving more. Perfect sweetness and enjoyable cup of iced coffee. The fresh mint, slightly crushed, brings out such a punch in the coffee. I want more now! 

When we left SF, I was having serious withdrawals! 


-MUST TRY! 

P.s. Walking distance from AT&T park!
author: Jocelyn V.

description:
I was in San Francisco visiting family and looked on Yelp! for some good coffee and found Philz Coffee.  I ordered the Mocha Tesora and was not disappointed.  Jetta, my barista, offered three levels of "sweetness".
I will return here anytime I am in the city - Thanks Philz Coffee for an awesome time!!!
author: Francisco S.

description: Gingersnap iced coffee is the best iced coffee I've ever had. They have vegan as well as gluten free baked goods available at the register too. Staff is really friendly, which isn't always the case at good coffee shops
author: Christian C.

description:
Philz Coffee is a perfect representation of San Francisco in a coffee shop. It's upbeat, delicious, and ever so hipster. They have an unconventional way of doing things compared to your traditional Starbucks or Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. 

There are 2-5 baristas at the "Phil Up Station" in which you may order any of their various roasts. They make each cup individually specific to your java needs and will mix in your milk/sugar to your personal liking (lowfat milk, 2%, half and half or sweetness levels ranging from light-medium-heavy) 

Some of their popular choices include:
-Philtered Soul - A medium roast blend of hazelnut, cocoa, and cinnamon
-Tesora - Another medium roast of butter, nuts, and caramel
-Code 33 - A dark roast of apples, nuts, herbs, and a punch of caffeine 
-Mint Mojito Iced Coffee - Minty, sweet, creamy cup of deliciousness
-Mocha Tesora - The best mocha you'll ever have. Very smooth, silky, and so dangerous. 

The staff here are great. They're always high energy and very friendly. The customer service is always fantastic. They ALWAYS ask you to take a sip and make sure that your drink is perfect. I know the Starbucks has their "love it or we'll make you a new one" policy, but you don't ever really hear them reinforcing it. 

Prices for standard coffees are $3 for a small and $4 for a large. Specialty coffees like the Mint Mojito and the Mocha Tesora are $4 for a small and $5 for a large. If you're put off by the price, you'll quickly overlook it once you take a sip and see that you really get what you pay for.
author: Cara O.

description:
I love the Mint Mojito and Tesora. The line gets pretty long in the morning, but the staff is very friendly, helpful and can make recommendations based on what your drink preferences are. 

I get the Tesora Medium cream and sugar and the Mint Mojito sweet :)
author: Stacy H.

description: The wifi at this particular philz coffee IS INCREDIBLE. I was live streaming and had no problems at all. The coffee here is great, and although I'm not a fat of the desserts, they are very healthy. The coffee is earthy and the staff is nice and friendly. They ask you everytime to taste check your beverage to make sure it is perfect, and they go out of their way to do their best to make your cup of coffee exactly how you wanted it to be. They have plenty of chairs and sofas inside and out and many outlets. They even have chess if you feel like playing. They have a working bathroom, complimentary water, and even a order online/pickup at store function. It was recently renovated and an all around great place to get coffee. The coffee is like 3 dollars for a small too!
author: Alisa K.

description:
Philz is delightful! When I first moved to SF I heard about the famous Philz Coffee and low and behold it was pretty great.

I'm not much of a coffee drinker so to appreciate coffee it's kinda tough I would rather have tea. My first time at Philz I had the mint mojito which it's probably one of their more popular drinks and it's tasty. As someone who isn't in love with coffee it was delish. I like how they hand-craft the drinks and make them with love. You can definitely get that vibe from the place. The concept is also very simple - they ask you what milk and how sweet you want your drinks. It's just a really nice personal experience. 

It's just shy under the price of Starbucks and a more authentic drink. I'm a huge chai fan and have had their chai at two locations and it's just not the best chai - my only minus to Philz! I think it's because coffee is their thing.

I love the Castro location - so cute and charming! The SOMA one is pretty cool too. 

Overall, it's a must try and if a coffee lover I see how my own friends are hooked.
author: Priya S.

description:
Don't let the line scare you - it moves quickly! 

Tesora. Cream. Sweetened. It's the only way to go.

Experience real coffee. Experience Philz.
author: Mansi A.

description: This has definitely been the most consistent of the Philz I've been to. Sometimes the line can be really long and they have less of a selection on breakfast treats but it's still all worth if for a sip of yummy Philz.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Working in Mission Bay, this place is a nice pit stop during the last leg of my morning commute all the way from the East Bay. I usually roll through between 8:30-9am, which is around the time the line starts poking out the door. It's all good, because the baristas tag team the line keeping the flow smooth and efficient. This location definitely has a high churn rate, unlike the Berkeley location. Outlets and tables are scarce, but I'm not here to linger. 

Blends currently on my rotation: Silken Splendor, Philtered Soul, Tesora, Dancing Water.
author: Paolo V.

description:
Best. Coffee. Ever.

Friendly baristas and a welcoming atmosphere make Philz a must visit in Berkeley.
author: Andrew E.

description: I've tried this place several times now and I still don't get it. I've never had a  cup of coffee that was any better than any I've had at dozens of other places. They must put Kool-Aid in the coffee or something to explain the line out front.
author: Bib G.

description:
I've had phillz beans before but the cafe experience was even more enjoyable. Call me a hipster, but I love the cup at a time thing they got going on.  I've tried a number of the medium roasts and they've given tips on what goes well with almond milk (huge plus that they don't charge extra for almond milk! The guy at the register just smiled at me through gold teeth and said "no, that's bull shit - have a great rest of your day!" Love that! It does get tiresome to be charged an extra .75 for dairy alternatives) 

Order anything with the mint leaves it takes the afternoon perk to a whole new world. 

I might just have to walk to this location daily and justify it being next door to the library :) 
My only real complaint would be it's always so windy outside - but that would make me sound like a country bumpkin in the big city.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I love this spot, and they FINALLY have OrderAhead again :)

No moh lines for me!
author: Cruz K.

description:
2 blocks away from my office, come here close to every day. The staff is always incredible, and the coffee speaks for itself, there's a reason Philz is so popular.. At times this location can be very busy with a line way out the door, (early morning & afternoon), but the line moves very quickly and it definitely worth the wait. 

Try the ecstatic iced coffee if you want something less sweet, or the famous mint mojito (obviously) for something different.
author: S F.

description: This place is always hoppin'... I don't think I've ever come by here and not seen a line out the door! Service is friendly, coffee is good so I don't think that I have any complaints. This place also feels much more like a neighborhood spot compared to other places on the weekend-- people sit on the porch with their dogs and (the inside is slightly larger than other Philz I've been to) people hang out inside in larger groups or individually reading newspapers. I love it.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
4.5 stars

The only two words you need to know walking into Philz: Mint Mojito.

Made-to-order coffee by the cup with quick descriptions of all of their blends plastered on chalkboard signs.  You can choose the milk (and how much) and sugar (and how much) and they will brew and stir until it is frothy and perfect "to your taste".  Takes a while to grab a cup of coffee but it's worth it when it's just the way you like it.  A little pricey, but so is every cup that is made to order with such care.

Small selection of baked goods, too but the ginger scone is to die for!  Ask for it warmed and you won't be disappointed!
author: Jess Y.

description:
This Philz location is nearby the CalTrain station, so you have a lot of people running in all directions.  At the same time, there are plenty of people just lounging around "studying."  The place can get a bit crowded but the staff was quite friendly about making sure everyone was helped.  It seemed to take a little bit longer than my usual Philz experience (compared to some other location visits), though it may have just been a busy time.  They still make sure to make your drink to order- having you taste it to make sure it meets your standards, before you pay.  

The staff was very cheerful, like overfly cheerful- which was a kind of surprising plus.
author: Samantha L.

description:
If I lived across the street they would be my go to coffee shop. Heck, I wouldn't even own a coffee maker! But I don't live across the street, and so I will take every opportunity to pass it on my ways.. So worth it. 

Long lines, yet fast service & tons of yummy choices! Good iced coffee :) (mojito mint coffee FTW)
author: Matea F.

description:
OMG SOMA location!

My yellow ass is obsessed with their Tesora coffee!  Perfect cup... lightly sweetened, strong, and I finally bought a bag of beans (ground)!!! Been enjoying a cup at home here and there.

Service = friendly, somewhat.  But they get the job done.

Outside seating = nice and shady.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I don't know whether this location or the mission location is better.
One of the managers here (african american male) has extraordinary customer service and has always been super cool and caring! 
The baristas here are very talented and the vibe here is awesome as well.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
I stop in EVERY Morning. I am so blessed that Philz is steps away from my office. I never really was a die hard drip drinker. Ever since I started working in SF, I can't start my morning with out Phil.

ORDER AHEAD App will save your life and time for this location. I order when I am on the train approaching SF. I get off, strut my ass in from the side door, smirk at the people in line, grab my coffee and I am on my way. Never skip a beat on my itunes. LOL
author: Lily M.

description:
Great customer service!

I walked in and tried to order a latte. Obviously I was a newby.  They walked me through the coffee picking process and made some great recommendations. 

Loved the end result and the pastry I had as well!

My recommendation: Tell them what you like! Don't be shy!

PS: don't worry, the line goes pretty quick!
author: Heather H.

description:
Philz Coffee takes a bit longer than a readymade-brew, but with great time, comes great quality, yes? Cups are individually filtered for optimal flavor and seasoned where requested (sweeteners, cream, etc. are put in by the barista and a part of the cost). Flavors range from light to dark and generally include a few different beans (though single origin coffees are also available). My favorite, coming highly suggested from a friendly local, was Tesora, a medium-roast with nutty tones and a smooth finish.

The process here was understood, the lines were consistently manageable, and customers always seemed content with their individually filtered drips. Baristas will work with their customers to craft coffees similar to the standard latte or machiatto, but here the focus seems to be on the coffee itself, without the fluff.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Be prepared to wait in line, Philz is popular.

Tasty coffee but very strong, which is why they have to balance it with full-fat cream! If you don't want to grow in size at the same rate as a calf becoming a cow, they also have great soy and almond milk options. Hopefully they'll introduce matcha soon.

I'm very impressed with Philz's willingness to adapt to customer feedback -- they're a small local chain that likes to make sure their customers are happy. 

Even their ugly decor won't scare people off. Not with free wifi, which is great if you can hear yourself think above the crowd -- or the caffeine buzz!
author: Be F.

description: You must try the mint mojito ice coffee!! Sweet and creamy! It can be hit or miss but try the coffee before you leave they will fix it if it's not perfect.
author: Tina T.

description:
I have heard friends raving about this place so I had to check it out for myself during a visit to SF.
