The menu board made it really easy to pick out the type of coffee I wanted light, medium, and dark roast.  The flavor descriptions then made it even easier to decide on which one I wanted.   I went with the Tesora coffee, sweet and creamy, and was not disappointed.  We liked it so much that we frequented Philz every morning of our three day visit in the city.

I can see what all the rave is about!
author: Payal V.

description:
this philz just so happens to taste better than the other philz ive been to... i dont know why, but it does. 

i love the no bullshit staff here. their friendly, curt, and witty all at the same time. LOVE!
author: Judy L.

description:
My first time at this location. I've mainly been to the original and then the Shattuck location once.  I always have a hard time ordering, because I don't quite understand the concept or the brouhaha. However, after having my small mocha tesora today (which was, quite tasty, but not hot enough) and feeling a bit hyphy about an hour later, I kinda get it. It's liquid speed.  

Although there was a line (and it was super windy in the doorway), it moved fairly quickly. Friendly staff and great location right on the corner. I'm debating if I will visit on my way to work each morning, as it is right on the T line. We shall see...
author: Felicia P.

description: I recently discovered Philz Coffee after moving to SF a few months ago, and have fallen in love with the mint mojito iced coffee. It is unlike any coffee I have ever tasted. Seriously, it makes Starbucks taste like burnt water. However, this location specifically was a little disappointing because I always look forward to the Philz Bagel (any true Philz fans will know exactly what I'm talking about), which this location does not have. There is, however, a Panera next door, so my day wasn't completely ruined. Overall, the service was great and there was a consistent line out the door for the 4 hours that I was there on a Sunday (cranking out some job apps...don't worry I have a life...sometimes). I will definitely be back!
author: Ilana B.

description:
The Phi's chai tea with almond milk..the taste is very strong..i like the strong spices..anise, nutmeg and cinnamon..it's good..on the other hand I don't know about the almond milk..but i do like how it's not just watered tea, it has a milky consistency to it which adds another layer of depth...this place doesn't have much pastries, but it's ok..will try their cup of joe next time.

o yea free wifi!
author: Minerva L.

description:
I hate coffee shops.  Not because I can make a better cup of joe, but because I'm cheap.  I purchased a large cup of coffee and it came out to about $4 +$1 tip because my barrista? was nice.  I'm coming back here to purchase another cup.  Not on a daily basis because $4 for coffee is pricey in my mind, but just as a treat for when I work hard or I want to "Live life to the fullest!".

The coffee I had was one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had.  It was as if the worker could read my mind and know exactly how I wanted my coffee to be prepared.  Maybe I'm just a stereotypical yuppie that likes the same amount of cream and sugar as the next yuppie, but my god was it tasty.  

Only downside is the line in the morning, but it only took maybe 10 minutes to get served, not bad when the line was as long as it was.

I finished my cup before I made it back to the office...firstworldproblem
author: Kailo R.

description:
Came back to SF for a visit and my friends took me here for my caffeine fix. 

As soon as you enter, you'll notice the extensive menu listing the different blends.

Since I was lost, one of my friends ordered me a Julie's Blend w/ light dream, light sugar. I usually don't use sugar and cream only sparingly but this is one terrific combination. One of the best cups of coffee I've ever had, ever.  

Each cup is made to order. The variety of blends are amazing. The staff is very knowledgeable about everything they offer and are more than happy to make suggestions. 

The atmosphere is great w/ a younger lively crowd who probably occupy the high priced condos nearby. Parking is a nightmare when I went. What little spaces they do have (metered) were all taken. We ended up parking across the 4th St. Bridge, but it was all worth it. 

I didn't try their desserts/pastries nor the other blends yet as I've become an instant fan of Julie's Blend. I often find myself fiending for it. 



Note to owner: Philz, please open one in So Cal, near my house (Arcadia) Much thanks.
author: James L.

description: Best coffee ever. The iced Ecstatic and the iced tesora are my favorite. The philtered soul is also really good.
author: Omar Q.

description:
This review isn't for the coffee, as we all know how good Philz coffee is. I give this Philz a 5 star because the people who work there are always so friendly and accommodating to your taste buds. I'm one of those health freaks, and use almond milk instead of soy milk to be "paleo-friendly" with my coffee. The workers who make my drink don't seem to mind like most baristas at some chained-coffee location. 

The location is hidden on a one-way street, so it's not so busy. I usually come here mid-afternoon before I start work at 3. The only downside is parking can be hard, so I only stop by if I'm lucky to find a spot. But it's a good walking distance from the Caltrain station and ballpark!
author: Liezel D.

description: Probably my favorite coffee shop to study at in the city and one of the only few located near Mission Bay. Philtered Soul and that basic Mint Mojito are always my go-to's. The baristas are always very friendly and make sure you like the drink they make for you. There's just enough seats inside and outside the coffee shop to chat or study. I really appreciate that Philz has free wifi that actually works unlike most of the other coffee shops in SF.
author: Elissa S.

description: First time here, asked how it worked - like the line, there was no clear place to order. Got no answers when I asked and was told to go wait behind someone who came in after me? I could maybe understand if it's busy but there was just 1-2 people. Incredibly rude staff; I won't be back.
author: A S.

description: Was recommended while visiting and is a great place for coffee lovers.  Has a great selection.
author: Ernest W.

description:
If you haven't, you should. If u dont, well, do it next time...it's euphoric (the coffee), the Istanbul Treat (favorite tea) two honies, cream, & mint leaves- absolutely ZEN!!!!  

Top down on the embarcadero, favorite tune, and my Istanbul Treat...
something everyone should experience, I highly recommend it :)))
author: david s.

description: San Fran has AMAZING coffee and Philz is definitely an example of that. I really liked the ice mint mojito. I asked them to make it less sweet because I'm not really a fan of sweet drinks. The barista was super friendly about changing the drink and it turned out really delicious. I also thought the coffee itself was just excellent - it had a really deep, good, complex flavor. The fresh mint leaves were a nice touch, too.
author: Riva L.

description:
I've heard a lot about the mint mojito, but after trying a sip of my friend's (half sweetened--50%?) I decided to get something different.  It wasn't overpoweringly minty (yay!), but it just didn't strike me as life changing.

I ended up getting the MOCHA TESORA with what the barista and I agreed was a sweetness of 7 on a scale of 10.  IT WAS HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH!  Chocolately, but not too rich.  I also got it iced, which made it nice and refreshing when it could have been heavy and cloying.  

The barista we got was a dark-haired white guy with thick rimmed glasses.  He was super nice and made the perfect drink!! 

The next time I'm near a Philz, I'm definitely getting the mocha tesora again!
author: Kristy S.

description:
** 3.5 stars **

This Philz was super crowded on a Friday morning, which shows this brand's well-deserved popularity but the lack of order in the space. People were standing around everywhere waiting for drinks. Having four people pouring over coffee is great for the amount of customers this location receives, but I wish there was a less confusing way to get my coffee.

Nonetheless, high-quality stuff and smart staff.
author: Jess L.

description:
Awesome place.  I've been coming here at least once a week for the last year or so.  They have great, energetic, and exceedingly friendly baristas making excellent coffee and Teas.  My favorites are Mint Mojito iced coffee in a hot day and  Mocha Tesora or Istanbul Treat tea in a cold day.

Five stars for the drinks and ambiance. Minus one star for the annoying flies that have been infesting this store recently.  They really should do something about these flying pests.
author: perry h.

description:
I can't believe I haven't been to Philz. I had been a big fan of Blue Bottle espressos, so somehow I missed this. The variety of blends that Philz serves is amazing.

I've never really liked drip coffee much, but I liked what I had at Philz (Tesora with cream). I think the variety more than makes up for the differences in individual tastes.

If you're like me, and you walked in looking at the big board, puzzled, you should just ask them to recommend a blend. They will add cream and sugar for you as needed.
author: Alice C.

description:
Here's another branch of Philz that I've visited a few times & gotten coffee to go.

I tend to get their ice drinks, the iced ecstatic & mint mojito.  If you'd like a hot cup of coffee, & you aren't sure what you want (there's not really much description on the menu), let the barista know what you like, & they will help you with recommendations.  

As far as I know, they're all set up kind of the same way, with one line that feeds to several spots at the counter.  Once you order, you can go pay, & then you pick up your drink from the barista you ordered from when it's ready.

A wide variety of seating:  tables & chairs, outdoor seating.

What makes this location great is its proximity to the ball park, Caltrain, & Muni stops.  I've gotten coffee to go & gone & walked around in the neighborhood on a nice day, hungout by the water by the ballpark.  Or at times, other visits have been related to Caltrain (waiting for Caltrain, etc.).  

Street parking.  Otherwise, it's close to Caltrain & Muni stops (1 block away).

Located on the south side of Berry St., just west of 4th St.
author: Linda T.

description:
The Iced Mint Mojito is a must-get if you like iced coffee.

Here are all the Philz locations in SF! http://vurb.com/thomas/Philz-in-SF?rhash=6caf142c1cebdc80d4f4b220c9c81144
author: Thomas C.

description:
Mint Mojito. Get that.

One of the best coffees in SF. While my favorites are Blue Bottle and Sightglass, they're the only ones who have the best speciality coffee that I will return for. 

Am I the only one who wish they would add a shot of rum in their mojito? :)
author: Colleen L.

description: Amazing coffee mojito!! Great service and good make-each-cup-when-you-order coffee brew.
author: Vivienne K.

description:
Tried Philz Coffee at 2 different locations during my 3 day weekend trip here in the bay area.  I can see this place being really great to come to chill, study, or maybe even a day date?

Awesome selection of different style coffees. I tried their mint mojito coffee which I love, and the 2nd time I tried their Chai Tea Latte. I must say I like their mint mojito coffee more.  They are super generous with the amount of mint they put in it, which I loveeee~~~  See you again soon, Philz!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The sheer variety of coffee beans is astounding! With the help of my Barista she suggested I try the Philtered Soul: medium dark roasted, burst of chocolate and hazelnut finish.

While I didn't detect a lot of hazelnut, it was still present enough to taste it but I will admit the chocolate wasn't as notable. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my coffee and will return to try the other selections, right now Tesora is on my radar but who knows how I'll feel when I get there.

Overall Thoughts

Superb coffee bean selection really does set Philz apart from other micro coffee breweries and will keep me coming back for more!
author: Eddie W.

description:
I love the coffee here. I live near by so been coming here for years, but I am very much disappointed with the new remodel and the new crew of baristas. The place became even more cramped now with the permanent bar to devide people in line which makes it impossible for people in the wheelchair or with the stroller. Order ahead is the saving grace but one can't always be that prepared. 
I really miss the old crew, people were very nice and friendly and very understanding. Since the place is usually cramped,they would bring the coffee seeing that you have a stroller or sitting in the wheelchair.  That's what a great service is! The other day I went there just to buy a pastry and the girl made me go and wait in the long line to pay, even though I was not waiting for coffee I had to wait for all the people getting coffee first just to pay for my pastry, where is the logic here?  Meanwhile my infant in the stroller was screaming! 
Very,very disappointed!
author: Julia G.

description:
SO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!

Friend posted a pic of her Mint Mojito Iced Coffee on Instagram. Found out this place was fairly close to my new office and checked it out on my break. The line was OUT THE DOOR, but it moved fairly quickly and the staff was fun and friendly. 

I got the drink my friend posted. The barista accidently made mine with NF milk and offered to remake it, but it tasted fine for me. Didn't even notice it was a "healthier" version, but then again the standard one would've had creme in it. Regardless, I loved it. Great atmosphere, I did some work there.

The staff is very friendly and kept checking up on the customers. Def a ton of regulars chillen around. I like that customer merchant relationship thing they have here. Too bad I'm only visiting SF, I shall come again.

Def come here!
author: Joy M.

description:
This like many other Philz establishment has tentative and friendly team of coffee brew masters that will make each cup of coffee with love and one cup at a time. 

Ones who go to Starbucks often will not like this place or may have a change of heart. They don't make frapps or sugary syrup drinks. This place is 100% coffee and tea. You can't say you're a coffee lover until you've been here. 

Thank you Philz Team!
author: Thomas C.

description:
I can tell you the worst  thing about this place. Something that is pretty much unforgivable. . .

its only available in California.

Much like the much maligned In-and-Out burger (though it has continued to spread). . .or that evil Wegman chain which sticks to the mideast. . ..

Yet lets get this straight -  this is not a coffee experience with a close competitor (I have Five Guys after all, but to Philz I have no comparison.  Whole Foods is okay, though no Wegmans)


Why is Philz on its own?

1) A selection of coffees beyond anything you will see elsewhere. Around 35 coffees at least

2) every coffee is brewed on order.  They grind, filter, and brew when you order. No big running jug of coffee

3) I don't know what they do to the cream, but its good and frothy

4) You get the coffee in your hand, with a taste to make sure its excellent

Really its worth the wait.  To me its like trying to compare all you can eat (made before you arrive) Golden Corral  (Starbucks/Dunkin/etc) to Del Frisco (Philz).  Sure Golden Corral is quick, but really. . .I don't do quick with quality at sake.
author: Christopher G.

description: Haha, if you haven't tried their Mint Iced Mojito Coffee, you are definitely missing out! I didn't use to drink coffee but a cup of coffee from Philz completely changed my mind. Sweet and minty just complement each other so well. Very summerly!
author: Jin Y.

description:
Really convenient location just a block away from the SF Caltrain station. Too bad I don't have enough time to run over for my coffee before hopping on the bus to get to work in the morning, otherwise the Iced Mint Mojito might because a bit of a problem for my wallet.

I came here with some friends on our SF trip; jumped off Caltrain and skipped over to Philz. When you get there:
  Step 1: Wait to be called up by a barista to place your order. 
  Step 2: Go to the register to pay
  Step 3: Move to the side and wait for your barista to call out your drink
  Step 4: Enjoy!

I fell in love with the mint mojito. You might have a swirl the coffee a bit before the mint flavor comes out; mine came out part way through the drink. It's delicious! Not too sweet, not overpowering. I can't wait to come back to try more of their coffees! Man, I love the SF coffee scene, so many places to try out and each has something unique about it!

It was a nice sunny day, so there were quite a few people sitting at the tables outside with their dogs. So relaxing...
author: Katherine S.

description:
I'm normally a huge fan of Philz and come to this location everyday. I always get a large Ecstatic, medium cream+two splendas. 

I came by today and they were super busy so I understand why the baristas would feel a bit slammed. I got to the counter and ordered my drink and when the lady making my drink (blacked rimmed glasses, curly/wavy hair) called me back up again to get it, I asked her if it was medium cream and two Splendas and she replied with "you said medium, medium." I told her I did not and she proceeded to argue with me and tell me that's what she heard.

First off, never argue with a customer. I wasn't being rude. If you mistook what I said just apologize and make a new one. Arguing with me won't make that line go faster not will it solve the issue. Second off, I order the same thing every single day. I didn't suddenly forget and confuse my "two Splendas" with "medium sweet." If you heard that, then you weren't listening. 

I'm still a huge fan of Philz and usually get decent service from this location but this lady blew me away today. Her crankiness stuck out like a sore thumb compared to the rest of the pleasant employees working there. Steer clear of her station!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Excellent drip coffee and the mint leaves are a nice touch. Keep in mind the mint leaves go into every drink, so you must request it without if it's not your thing. The coffee is brewed to order and the Baristas put a lot of care into making each individual cup. Once done, they allow you to taste for approval. You can ask them to sweeten it, reduce sweetness, or whatever your little heart desires. The Baristas always have loads of energy and so much enthusiasm no matter what time of the day, so it's a nice change from the dead stares and outright disdain for customer service you so often see at some of the other coffee shops nearby.

Standouts: Jacob's Wonderbar Brew, Tantalizing Turkish, Mocha Tesora, and Yerba Mate.
author: Clare B.

description: This is a cool spot.  The line can get long due to the fact that each cup of coffee is hand made.  There are something like 6 baristas that can make about four cups of coffee at a time.  When a barista is ready, they will call your name, and you order your favorite coffee..then you walk over to the register to pay while your barista prepares your personal cup o' coffee.  When it's ready they will call our your drink.  My personal favorite is the mocha.
author: Paul W.

description: I love philz coffee, the first drink I ever got was the minto mojito and ever since ive been obsessed. The customer service is also great! The staff is extremely nice and friendly can't wait to go back.
author: Michael D.

description: I am a huge fan, the filtered soul for those of you who likes it  hot and their famous mint mojito for those of you who likes it iced.  I had the opportunity to meet the current owner of the Philz organization at a 40 under 40 event and he received an award for his business ventures.  He is a great guy and definitely going places.  Philz has quality tasting coffee with unique flavor pairing and combination.  They always play pretty hip music and there is always a line at Philz.  I enjoy Philz and Blue Bottle in the city.  This particular Philz has a regular patron of city, county and federal employees since it is centrally located around these buildings.
author: Angela V.

description: As someone that comes from LA and is constantly getting my coffee fix from Starbucks, I have to say that Philz Coffee is my new favorite place for coffee. I ordered the iced mint mojito and it was so delightfully refreshing. At first I thought that it would be a strange tasting mix but I was so wrong. With each sip that I took, the more I loved the drink. Now that I'm back in SoCal, I completely regret not drinking at least a cup a day before I went home.
author: Kristin C.

description:
Mint mojito coffee.... hm.

(+) awesome customer service. the store manager actually contacted me about the barista that wasn't being very welcoming and offered a gift card to remedy my experience. props for caring about the customer. I'll be back to try something else at Philz Coffee

(+/-) The mint mojito coffee uses real mint leaves. I don't really like mint leaves so....
(+/-) It's a bit sweet but that's how I would prefer it to be like since I'm not too big of a fan of real coffee

The mint mojito coffee is something to try since it's very unique. And it can be a hit or miss depending on your own tastes. So I do encourage you to try it out!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Thought it would be a great place to sit and work but it's so crowded and noisy with tech talk you can't hear yourself thinking.

coffee is not great here, or actually any other philz. over priced burnt coffee.
another SF hype fueled by good marketing. there are some good coffee places around, don't compromise on your java!
author: I A.

description:
I'm typically the snobby single-origin pour-over water-between-195-to-205-degrees drip-coffee connoisseur, so when it comes to coffee that's been adulterated by other non-"coffea arabica" substances, I usually steer very clear.

But let me talk about Philz Coffee.

I happened across this very busy establishment after a long walk, so I was in some relatively first-world-level desperation for a cold beverage. Lately, I've taken to a certain appreciation for mojitos, especially in hot weather, so I ordered the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.

Now, I cannot vouch for the quality of the coffee alone, but I consider that a good thing. The combination of milk, mint, coffee and ice in this beverage is proportioned to a heavenly standard. I have never tasted anything so deliciously refreshing. Go and taste one -- you will never have had anything like it. There were enough fresh mint leaves in the cup that I could take a couple out and chew on them to freshen my breath.

In my mind and to my body, the mint-coffee-milk-ice combination is absolutely perfect. Caffeine takes a solid 15 minutes to kick in. If you have a hot coffee, the stimulant properties of the drink is even more muted. The ice takes care of that -- the drink is immediately refreshing and cold. The mint adds another layer of freshness. The milk rounds out the entire experience. What results is an wonderfully balanced refreshing beverage that elevates your consciousness to a place of blissful zen focus. 

You will never forget it.

The wifi is also blazing fast. Too bad the lines are really long.
author: Matthew K.

description:
To bitter and over rated. This place is for Virgin coffee drinkers. Way better places for Coffee & Tea. (Peet's blows this place away) (Blue Bottle) (Sightglass Coffee) 

http://www.timeout.com/san-francisco/restaurants/caffe-trieste

Explore people, explore what real coffee is all about! 

I won't return!
author: TJ U.

description: never have i thought mint leaves in coffee can taste so good!  A must try when in SF!
author: Alice W.

description:
I've now switched over to their green tea, which strangely enough tastes just like their mint tea. It's great to see Philz surviving and doing strong in this area. Philz really adds an excellent community feel to the hood. That each barista makes every cup by hand - really establishes Philz as a model for customer service in a cup.

Truly what's up.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Hey Philz, I'm going to marry you. Is that okay? 

Tragically enough, they were out of mint (of ALL things, and of ALL days) when I dropped by but one of the baristas put together pretty much the same mint mojito iced coffee, sans the mint. It was still the best iced coffee I've ever had. Seriously. Friend had the gingersnap iced coffee which was pretty heavy on spices but still good, per friend. The next morning I just had to go back because it was that good, and they were still out of mint. Yes I cried a little inside. Hence the 4 stars.
author: Cathy C.

description:
Best coffee in San Francisco. 

This location is somewhat out of the way for most people but it's great for CalTrain commuters.

The line often looks longer than it appears. It's an awkward interior so the line tends to stretch out the door, even though there may only be a handful of people in it.

I don't like establishments that replace S with Z, but I'll make an exception here.

Again, best coffee in San Francisco.
author: Nick K.

description:
I'm a huge fan of the mint mojito, and on my most recent visit you better believe I got me a cup of the greatest coffee concoction ever made.  Also during this visit and just by chance, my beautiful wife Clara K. (aka Clara C. LOL) decided to try a new drink and to our surprise it was even better than the mint mojito.

Enter The GINGERSNAP iced coffee!!! ZOMG!!! Its like christmas in a cup and with each sip you're transported to wonderful winter wonderland. 

 BEST CUP OF COFFEE EVER!!!
author: Michael C.

description:
THE MINT MOJITO!!!

I can't rave enough about it.

When I heard about Philz, I didn't care much about it as I'm not a huge coffee drinker despite being a Seattlite. But Philz definitely left a very memorable impression with their mint mojito. The creamy and sweet flavor added with a refreshing scent of the mint and this stuff just got real. Even though my friend has told me that they use industrial whipping cream to make this drink, it don't matter, it's a MUST try. Screw eating healthy, try it first, and let me know if you can say no to this delicious cup of coffee (though I wouldn't hesitate to call it dessert).

My only complaint is the long wait. There's always a wait out the door since people know it's good. But not only that, the drinks take time, but their end result does warrant the wait.
author: Navi R.

description: If I could give it 100 stars, I would. These people make the most delicious coffee I have ever had! I love this location as well; I have visited it three times in the past week and by the third time the wonderful staff was saying 'Welcome Back', noting that they remembered me! I love that feeling! My favorites so far are the Philtered Soul and Julies Ultimate, sweet and creamy! Highly recommend to anyone, even people who aren't as into coffee as others, because you will be after this experience!
author: Kuhray V.

description:
I've been in this neighborhood for a good year and a half and used to come by this location and grab a cup almost everyday. I started off ordering the Tesora but eventually came to favor the rich, aromatic blend of the Arabic. I've tried them all however whenever I was in need, this blend is the one that made me feel like myself again. 

This location is probably what spawned the strong Southbay and Peninsula followers. It's a mere block away from Caltrain (where all the aforementioned commuters travel to and fro) ultimately leading to requiring locations of their own. From what I know there are two in Palo Alto and one in SJ.

I've since weened myself from consuming caffeine everyday as the amount I was intaking was getting ridiculous and out of hand. But whenever I need that jolt of sanity, Philz is my go-to. (words of a true addict)
author: Esther A.

description: It's going to take all of my willpower to not come here all the time when I get off of the train seeing how convenient it is! They staff was super friendly and my drink was awesome.  Will be back soon!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
There's just something about Philz coffee. I didn't really drink coffee until I drank Philz coffee. 
You gotta try if you already haven't. They also have certain coffees and teas with fresh mint. Oh! add a touch of refresh to that daily energy dose of mine please, Thank you! :)

Usually in the mornings there's a line out the door, so if you want Philz on your way to work, spare 15 minutes else you be sad and won't be Phil'ed up ;)
author: Kinjal S.

description: I now understand why Philz has a cult following. I wish there were more locations in SF. Each cup of coffee is made utilizing the 'pour over method', so the coffee is extremely fresh with a robust flavor. The mint mojito was excellent and can be prepared cold or hot. There is just enough real mint flavor that adds to the depth yet brightness of the coffee flavor. The drink is prepared with cream and sugar but you can request adjustments as necessary. The philtered-soul was also super smooth and did not have any lingering acidic flavor. The funky interior and friendly staff made Philz one of the highlights of my trip to SF.
author: Julia K.

description: my first mint flavor coffee. love it. but no shop in tokyo. missing.
author: Micky M.

description: I come here before or after school for the caffeine hype, it's at the right location being close to the muni stop. Line forms and gets busy from 6-8 am and somewhere around noon. Can't beat philz Coffee, it's the right place for quality and taste and it's close to the AT&T park.
author: Rick M.

description:
Rich creamy intense fresh mint coffee brewed individually and made completely fresh

French cheese Puff served toasted warm gooey flavorful and flaky
author: amy m.

description: Philz has the all time best hot chocolate, hands down. Phil made it for me himself and I haven't gotten hot chocolate anywhere else since. It's just the right consistency and flavor, you'll love it!
author: Samara C.

description: Best coffee in sf. What i like about them is how they have an insane amount of different flavors for you to choose from and everytime I go it's always a new flavor! Their best drink by far is the Mint Mojito (as many will agree). You can also make any drink iced! Everytime they finish making your drink, they will ask you to take a sip and see if its good, superb service.
author: Andy A.

description:
Tesora and philtered soul blend... Iced!

My first time trying their Spinach and feta cheese croissant & ham and cheese croissant... So flakey and warmfully delicious!

Always a must to get something from Philz when visiting the bay.
author: Kathy Y.

description:
Always ready to pour me freshly brewed meth when I need it. 

Also, if you feel bad about having cream in your coffee every day, ask for a low-fat version where it's a mix of milk (skim perhaps?) with a splash of cream.
author: Jenna H.

description:
People go to Starbucks because they want coffee masked by sugary syrups. Frappucinos and caramel lattes are not "real coffee". People who come to Philz know what real coffee is like.

This is one of the strongest coffees you will drink. Every time I drink a cup (and I always get a small), I feel like someone injected my arm with an IV of caffeine. It's almost too much - sometimes I feel jittery and I'll be awake forever, but the taste is so delicious.

I usually get the Tesora, the Mocha Tesora (this is rich and indulgent - like the perfect blend of chocolate + coffee), and the Philtered Soul which is my new favorite. It's just as sweet as the Mocha Tesora and has a hint of chocolate and hazelnut, but not as rich.

The price is only slightly more than Starbucks but the quality and taste is 1000 times better. My friends from out of town love coming here when they visit me in SoMa. It's really crowded in the morning and not the best place to have meetings since it can get a little loud during the rush, but overall, best coffee in the South Beach / SoMa area.
author: Christina L.

description: Great friendly baristas that help new people figure out their drinks.  I recommend their iced specialties.  Snagged a mojito and a ginger iced coffee.
author: David L.

description:
This is my go-to coffee shop, most likely because it sits right behind my apartment. 

I've pretty much tried most of the coffee they offer, and the ones I like the most are: 
-Ecstatic Iced Coffee
-Mint Mojito iced Coffee
-Philtered Soul

The coffee here is obviously amazing, and you'll never go back to a Starbucks after. 

Given that statement, I knocked down a star because it is a little on the pricer end (try getting a $4-5 mint mojito coffee every morning and you'll easily spend about $100 here a month, for all you coffee addicts) and the wait can be a bit daunting, especially in the mornings. I'd also like to see a bit more tea options, if possible!
author: Judy B.

description: This is the first Philz I ever went to and still my favorite location! Usually has a line, but it moves quickly and yet the coffee isn't rushed--my barista today urged me to take a moment and try my coffee to make sure it was exactly how I wanted it, Tesora with vanilla soy, light and sweet. Even the cashier took a moment to ask me how my day's going AFTER I'd paid. Now, working in the restaurant business myself, I'm well aware of how important hospitality and customer service is. Thing is, nothing about the staff here ever feels disingenuous, and that's rare! I'll never forget my first ever cup of Philz at this location, when the barista handed me my drink and said, "This will make your day a lot better." I had been on my way to my first day at a new job in a city I'd only just moved to, and needless to say, it meant a lot.
author: Kristina B.

description:
First time I went to Philz I ordered the large size of Jacob's WonderBar which was just delicious but got me very jittery. I ordered the small size of the Tantalizing Turkish this time, and the barista let me know he could make it half-caffeinated. I still couldn't fall asleep until 2 haha,, but no jitters and it tasted&smelled wonderful. I also got a peanut butter cookie which wasn't chewy like they usually are, and I really enjoyed that as well. 

Wanted to edit my review because I ordered the Tesora and it tasted very sour..added milk which did not help and instead covered up the nutty roasted flavor :(( was not satisfied with the visit..will stick to dark roast perhaps?
author: Aleena S.

description:
You know when you're forced to eavesdrop because the people next to you are speaking loudly? Well these people in particular were going on about how much they "hated gentrification and like what's happening to the city and like how obnoxious people are".

They clocked back into their shifts shortly after the rant...

Awkward.
author: Anders L.

description: Philz has a coffee called It's the Best, and this name might as well describe all their coffee. Philz, you the best.
author: Marissa M.

description: Order the mint mojito!! So so so refreshing and puts other coffee chains to shame!! Also, don't be like me if you're a coffee n00b and down the entire cup within an hour.  I was so wired!!
author: Monica H.

description: This is my hometown, local Philz! Outside of the original 24th & Folsom location, this is my coffee HQ & home! Excellent staff and baristas~~~ especially Sandi and her awesomely perfect Ether, Philz way! :)
author: John M.

description:
Now this is a place that "gets" coffee - and I say that as a Certified Seattle Coffee Snob (tm).

Everything from the massive menu of all different coffee flavors to suit everyone, to the individual brewing method they use, to the flourish they put on when transferring the coffee from the brew cup to your to-go cup makes Philz a cut above the rest.

Plus the coffee (a New Manhattan) was delicious. Bold and flavorful without being overly nutty or in any way burnt.

Worth all the 5 star reviews it gets from people.
author: Joshua B.

description: This Philz Coffee gets crowded as they all do, but there are usually plenty of places to sit and do whatever it is you decide to do at coffee shops. The coffee itself is on-point, but the location is not the best because of residential noise, i.e. garbage trucks and trains going by. The baristas are friendly, and this particular location is very intuitive in terms of where to order, where to pay, and where to wait. Philz is always a wise choice for great coffee and great company.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The coffee is good! (And so is the tea). It's strong and so it keeps me awake and the baristas are super friendly. 

I had never gone to a Philz before this one but they always ask me to try my drink to make sure it's just the way I like it.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Phil takes this coffee very seriously. Had the Tantalizing Turkish coffee and a fruit danish. I'm by no means a coffee snob but this was incredible &totally worth the 3 bucks for a small cup! Hands down the best coffee I have ever had. It makes starbucks tast like hotel room made hog slob. The danish was awesome as well. The coffee and tea selection is huge. If you want good coffee... keep walking past starbucks.
author: Scott C.

description:
Philz was recommended to me during a visit this past January by someone I stayed with who owns a very nice expresso/latte machine. I went one day and was helped through the process: pick your coffee, add milk/creamer? add sugar? If you're unsure, I recommend starting the sugar and milk off light, then when you pick it up, the lid is off so that you can take a sip to see if you like it. More sugar? Sure! More milk/creamer. Sure! If not, ask for their recommendation and you end up with something the majority likes. I came back the second morning with a similar experience. I like that they read into your body language as opposed to rushing you through the process and assuming you're an avid coffee drinker. Sure I know what I want at Starbucks almost every time, but not all coffee is made the same and I'm no expert. 

Line was long both days, but it's just a little more wait to have your coffee freshly brewed and line goes faster than you'd think because they have between 3-4 people making the coffee (cashier separate). Also, you don't have to wait in line again to add your own milk and sugar if you normally order your coffee black.

I didn't visit on my third day since we found it appropriate to use the machine at home at least once during my visit. Tasty.
author: Lisa M.

description:
If you're not American/are a tourist then it's probably best to skip Philz. It's basically American style cone drip coffee that's extremely bitter and over roasted. There is *a lot* of caffeine in one of these coffees. No idea about the iced drinks -- maybe that's why people love Philz. The hot coffee was average, but it could have been the specific bean I tried.

There's no espresso here -- go to Mazarine, Blue Bottle, Sightglass etc instead if that's what you're looking for.
author: Omar K.

description:
one star for the restroom it was clean and it was unisex. 

2nd star for the good coffee they served it was creamy and strong. 

3rd star for the quick service they did. 

4th star for the vibe and surrounding it was ez to find a spot to sit and sip on my coffee. 

one star down for the lack or organization line system especially for a first time going there. so ur suppose to order first then pay not the other way around. 

overall will be back and try mint mojito ice coffee next time.
author: Alex T.

description:
I have grown to really like Philz Coffee :) I didn't even know this location existed until my brother took me here last week. 

A corner location very close to AT&T Park. Parking is tough in this area though. We ended up parking on King Street & walking. Not bad of a walk though. There were a good amount of people here...people sitting outside & inside. Nonetheless, I was excited to get some Philz Coffee! :) BUT... 

I was waiting patiently in line with my brother. Two customers were ahead of us & had already ordered. Within a couple minutes, the line got longer & there were about 6 people behind us. 

My brother ordered the drinks. Here's how the conversation went...

Brother: One large iced mint mojito
*Employee didn't say anything for a couple seconds*
Employee: Okay, a large iced mint mojito
Brother: Yeah & I have a couple more
Employee: A couple more?
Brother: Yeah, 2 more
Employee: Okay, I can do 2 more

The way the employee said "A couple more?" made it seem like he just didn't want to make multiple orders. Is there a rule to one person per drink?! I DON'T THINK SO!! Are you freakin' lazy or something?! Are you antsy because you have a long line that's almost out the door?! Whatever it was, it was HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! He came off very rude in my opinion. 

I'm really big on customer service. All other locations I've been to has had really good customer service, but the customer service we got that day was NOT okay.  

The drinks were a little on the sweeter side (than previous drinks we've gotten from Philz Coffee..maybe it was this location?). It was still good though. 

I'll maybe be back to this location if it's convenient. I've gotten better customer service at 2 other locations.
author: Jessica A.

description:
This place is awesome.  Best coffee and the best people.

I had my iced coffee spill on my laptop and they offered me a new drink, all the whole constantly asking if the laptop was okay.  I've never seen this kind of empathy and great service.  Very very friendly people.  Will always come back here.
author: Kaleb P.

description: Great service and friendly staff!  Loved the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and the Vanilla Bean Scone.  We're going by tomorrow to try the Chai.  Unique flavors and pleased with the prices.
author: Joni L.

description: Great place! Fantastic coffee and fun environment(: the employees do a wonderful job and have great customer service.
author: Natasha L.

description:
I love Philz and go there at least once a week for the Iced Coffee. Coffee is great, however - I order the exact same thing every time & it tastes different depending on who makes it. That's a little frustrating, but manageable since, if I have the time, I can have them add more milk or whatever. 

But the most frustrating thing is when I pick up the cup & the coffee in the bottom of the cup is still hot. I mean....can you at least mix it up with the ice (and milk & sugar)? I'm paying $4 a cup and by the time I mix it up on my way to work - the ice is all melted & the coffee is room temp instead of iced. Plus, I don't realize until I'm halfway down the block that I needed more milk too. Grrrrrr! Please mix up the iced coffee, Philz!
author: Reese G.

description:
If you have not had Philz Coffee you have not had the best coffee in the world. 

I don't know how they make it so good, but seriously there is nothing like it. 

All of them, go get one or 10, you'll love it.

Breakfast burritos are bomb too.

I subracted 1 star because you will never find an open place to sit, so plan on taking your coffee to go.
author: Nolan M.

description: Philz provides a great stopover before or after hopping on/off muni. Always bustling, the baristas are friendly, but sometimes the staff at the register are a bit sour-faced. :/ Grab a squishy couch seat if you need to do a little work, or enjoy the outdoors at their tables if the weather's right. Always fun to try seeing if you can taste their listed flavors for the individual roasts, or going with the mint mojito for indulging a guilty pleasure every now and then. ;)
author: Linus W.

description:
This place is amazing ! 
When you arrive, sleepy as we'll, the staff wake you up with smiles and good atmosphere ! Then the coffee is amazing ! So many choices ! 
So don't be afraid about the long line , it's gonna be a wonderful experience :)
author: Laura B.

description:
I am OBSESSED with Philz right now. It is so close to me so i literally wake up, rub the crusties out of my eyes, and head over to philz so i can chug an ecstatic ice coffee or a Mint Mojito Iced Coffee (when I'm feeling skinny). 

The staff at this location are so friendly and know my name. They never ever ever ever make a mistake. Ive frequented other caffeine dealers and this by far is the best. They even make you sip it before you take it to make sure that it is perfect. 

Philz rocks!
author: Luigi A.

description:
"Crack in a Cup"  "Heaven in your mouth"   "Black Jesus Juice" .... The list goes on. This place is NO JOKE amazing! If you love Coffee or want to try something that is going to change your life, STOP reading this and come here now!


Here's how I would rank Philz amongst other coffee joints:

1) Philz
1.1) Philz
1.2)Philz

2) Blue Bottle
3) Peets


Dead last) StarYucks!


The coffee is very complex with many layers of Flavors.  I highly recommend Cream & Sugar (medium sweet or barely sweet). 


My top 5 Blends/Flavors so far:

1) Philtered Soul - (very smooth, nutty and chocolatey after taste. Been stuck on this blend for the past 6+ months)
2) Mint Ice Mojito - (simply amazing! The best ice coffee I've had thus far!)
3) So Good - (super strong light roast, will keep you up while thinking the words "So Good....")
4) Jacob Wonder Brew
5) Tesora - (very smooth simple, equiv to a latte)


The food ...since Philz doesn't make them...but do offer them, I won't score them on this. I do have recommendations:

1) Ancho Buritto - simply delicious, hot sauce a must...cheese, potatoes, and ancho chilies
2) Double Chocolate vegan donut
3) Blueberry vegan donut

These food items typically sell out fast...so come early. 


I've trying to become the Mayor of this place and it's dayam tough but I do go here 6 days a week on average (since I work nearby). There is DEFINITELY a big difference on who makes the coffee! The staff is friendly but definitely NOT equally talented. If you order a coffee and it comes out 2 minutes later...sorry but the experience will not be the same.  It's SLOW dripping coffee so expect to wait for quality. 


Here's a safe bet on who to order from: Pick any Female with DARK hair and they will make it well. If you must refer by name, here are my top 3 choices:


1) Roxie
2) Jen
3) Melody (she's more brunette-ish but she's good)


Get Ready to Experience an Orgasmic experience!
author: David N.

description:
MY FAVORITE COFFEE JOINT!!

I've only tried the mint mojito ice coffee. I want to try the other items but everytime I come here, I just can't stop myself from ordering the mint mojito. It is just so good. Those fresh mint leaves crushed in the coffee + the ice make the the drink so much more refreshing. 

The service here is great. They are so friendly and always ask me to taste the drink to make sure it is to my liking. They are willing to replace the drink if it is not the way you want it. So pleaseee...if you come here and if you love the service, tip well. These guys deserve it.

I am hoping they open a Philz in Los Angeles. We need one here!
author: Nhimo P.

description:
I don't give out the Cinco Estrellas to just any Yelp find but the stars were all aligned after a day on Treasure Island for the Treasure Island Flea Market. 

I google mapped "coffee" and 2.4 short miles away was Philz in China Basin. I made a b-line to Berry St parked in the metered parking spot and crossed the street into coffee heaven. 

I was shaking in anticipation while perusing the many choices before me.  Not good for a guy who suffers from "option paralys."  I felt like an addict attending a court mandated narcotics anonymous class.  

I was greeted at heavens gate by an angel who brewed up the two most perfect cups of coffee I've had in forever-a Turkish and a Mocha Tereno...large size of course. A sprig of mint in the Turkish sent my olfactory senses into overdrive and my taste buds salivating. The coffee was magnificent.  The temperature perfect. The paper cup designed as the perfect vessel to hold such liquid gold. Nothing more to say..Philz coffee is out if this world wonderful. 

Everyone I encountered during my experience were pleasant and the sitting area was the usual coffee interior. A bit chilly though with the wind blowing off the bay. 

Here's my biggest mistake...instead of sitting down at the available chair and table, I decided to continue my drive home...Southbound on the 101 then 280, I achieved caffeine induced speeds which turned my GPS speedo red. I was making great time pacing along at ** mph with a black Escalade when the Golden State star of justice appeared on the driver's door of a late model Ford Crown Victoria. LIDAR'd for sure, foot off the gas now coasting, I began to conjure up all the reasonable excuses I could think of. Like: Philz made me do it! Thankfully the push bar of justice whizzed past me and nabbed the Escalade.  As I passed the perp and long arm of the law, I rose my large cup of Philz Turkish to my lips and set my cruise control to 65 mph. It was truly a fantastic day.
author: Kalipo K.

description:
I have a sick little secret: Philz was part of my motivation in moving to SoMa. 

Hi. My name is Cindy. I am a closet caffeine addict. I drink more Philz than I care to admit. I even use the app Order Ahead to order my Philz in order to avoid the odious, ever present line out the door and so I can breeze in and out without anyone judging me for my caffeine needs. 

Why do I love Philz? Their coffees are brewed to order there are so many blends to choose from. Something to match my every mood. Also, they have a bazillion types of milk to choose from (ok, more like 6 at last count). My personal favorite is vanilla soy. It adds just a touch of sweetness. 
 
Word to the wise: light roast = more caffeine, dark roast = less caffeine.
author: Cindy T.

description:
So there is not a lot that can be added to place that already has more than 1000 excellent reviews. However, my two cents is this: delicious coffee, excellent service, and bustling atmosphere. What's not to like? Try the beverages iced or hot, all are good. Each one is created specifically for you.

If you don't trust me, take the word of San Francisco's finest police officers, who also frequent this place. Check it out.
author: Brent W.

description:
One trip to SF, I came here 3x's in a span of 3 days. I love this place. 

Parking can be a hassle sometimes, but there's usually random spaces along King St. 

Get the Mint Mojito because it's delicious or if you're looking for something stronger, get the Tessora or Mocha Tessora. So good! 

Another plus, the baristas are so nice!
author: Amy S.

description:
I wandered in here after a baseball game, and it was a good call.  The Gingersnap iced coffee was the perfect pick-me-up following a very hot day at AT&T Park. It was definitely a better idea than dropping in at the nearest Starbucks, and well worth walking a few extra blocks.

In general Philz is top-notch stuff, but beware: it is REALLY strong. You will surely be bouncing off the walls an hour later, unless you have an iron tolerance for caffeine.
author: Janna M.

description:
Philz is by default an awesome coffee shop. 

BUT this one has amazing staff so I was compelled to write a review.  

The barista who made my coffee was singing and dancing and completely immersed into making a spectacular drink.  Her contagious positive energy added caffeine to my decaf iced mint mojito! :D
author: Jister Y.

description: Amazing Tesora blend with cream and sugar! Also a gooey warmed up apricot bar! These were highly recommended to me and I'd highly recommend to everyone else! Great customer service as well!
author: Ashleigh F.

description:
Dear Philz Coffee,

Your mint mojito iced coffee blows me away time and again. The bright green hue of the mint leaves is easy on the eyes, and the subtle hint of mint is both expected and unexpected. My appreciation for you is the same as the day we first met, and you are a must have every time I visit SF! Good thing you are open in Santa Monica now! 

Love,
Phoebe
author: Phoebe C.

description:
I was in San Fran back in May and I have got to review this coffee! First off - if you have the means Philz Coffee Corporate, please open one up in Chicago!!!

Ok, so, now, the coffee. THE Mojito Coffee. Drop. Dead. Delicious! We went in with my friend right as they were closing, and they had closed their registers, BUT they were kind enough to make us the Mojito coffee AND give it to us for free! 

Caring staff, amazing mint coffee, and cool look of the inside of the cafe. That coffee is a fiesta in your mouth. It's just, just.. ahhh amazing!
author: Kalina N.

description:
I've only had Philz Coffee once and am looking forward to going back for seconds, thirds, fourths, etc.  Philz is a very different environment from the likes of Starbucks and Coffee Bean.  They offer sooo many varieties of coffee it was kind of difficult to choose.  I had to spend a good 5 minutes reading the descriptions of each coffee before choosing the one that had the word CHOCOLATE in it!

I liked how friendly the baristas were and how they didn't act snobby towards this new fan.  Parking blows, but then again, it's SF.  You can take the public transportation and it will bring you close to Philz.
author: May W.

description:
Philz, sweet Philz. All the locations have reliably great coffee, but this one has the bonus of being super close to the SF 4th and King Caltrain (just walk a block past the Panera). Getting a mint mojito iced coffee after a long Friday is the best!

Nice staff, cozy atmosphere, and a comfy couch to sit on while you wait for your drink to be made. Cute drawing of a happy mint leaf at the counter, too.
author: Fanny C.

description: Everyone was so friendly and the coffee was just right! Love that they ask what sweetness level you want.
author: Maroula G.

description: The Ecstatic is definitely one of the best iced coffees around along the lines of Blue Bottles' and Mah'velous' Kyotos. Staff are ultra friendly, they enthusiastically know they're coffee and are always up to helping you decide if you don't know what to get. The near Caltrain/Muni  locale is ideal for me as this is a frequent travel hub. Throw in a nice sunny day to enjoy said Ecstatic and it doesn't get much better.
author: Kim N.

description:
Everyone raves about the mint mojito iced coffee. Truly innovative and surprisingly delicious, though I prefer my caffeine hot. I ordered the tesora (the equivalent of a latte) during my second visit and think this will be my new go-to drink.  It was super strong -- ideal after a night out drinking. When I arrived on Saturday morning, the line was out the door but moved pretty fast.

Unlike Starbucks, Philz adds cream and sugar for you (I asked them to go light on both and it was mixed to perfection). The baristas wait for you to take a sip and give them your approval before making the next drink -- just like a mixologist at a fancy bar would. That's how serious Philz is about the quality of their coffee.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
What is a mint mojito you ask? I honestly thought it was an alcoholic coffee drink but little did I know. lol..... And if you're an idiot like me, and too ashamed to admit that you also thought it was an alcoholic drink, well now you know its not! Saved you from publicly embarrassing yourself like I did! You're welcome. 

Ive tried the tesora and the mint mojito. Between the two, the iced mint mojito is HANDS DOWN the BEST coffee ever (but if you don't have much of a sweet tooth or you like your coffee bitter, stick with the tesora). 

Their drinks are fairly consistent too. The last time I came here, the barista accidentally up-sized my drink so he gave it to me without an additional cost. Unfortunately, I had to pay the price of not being able to sleep all night because of the caffeine overload! But ah well, mint mojito is always worth it!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Needed a caffeine fix... Super long line, but the line went fairly quick.

Ordered the Mocha Tesoro. They add the sugar and creme for you, so I didn't know what to expect. Not bad!!!

I also ordered a cheese danish. They were happy to obliged when I requested it to be nuked for a few seconds.

Overall, service was friendly and quick. Def recommend if you're in need of a cup of joe.
author: Maria C.

description: I'm between a three and four star for Philz.  The mint mojito coffee was pretty good, but I don't know if I would get this coffee often even if it were closer to where I live.  The mint and coffee went better than I thought it would (I never liked the holiday mint coffees that Starbucks does).  It's perfectly sweet, but there's definitely a more tangy taste to this coffee than I would like.  I think that's why I generally prefer expresso drinks.  Also, I just thought the coffee wasn't quite worth the price tag, if it were a dollar less it would be fine.
author: Nina H.

description: I like the service really fast and quick also the best coffee i ever drunk im really offer to go to this place
author: Sasha L.

description:
Ok -  I have to admit.  I've passed by this place plenty of times and never stepped in.  I didn't know what the hype was all about.  Plus I'm not much of a coffee drinker - I prefer tea.  So after hearing about Philz from all the facebook posts from my friends, I decided I needed to try it out.  My husband loves coffee so I decided to drag him along as well. 

After stepping in, I felt loss and told the barista that this was my first time and I didn't know what the heck to order.  I asked for the strongest coffee (caffeine wise) for my husband and he suggested the Ether so I settled on that.  I settled on the chai latte and asked for it on the sweeter side.  The barista was awesome!  He was super helpful and I love how they freshly brew every single drink.  

The chai latte was the best chai latte I've ever had! I wish they had one close to work because I would be there every single day.  LOVE it.  

Definitely a MUST try when you're in SF. Parking is difficult in this area so definitely allow for some time if you're in a rush.
author: Christine P.

description: I always love coming to Philz! Any location I've tried, the staff is always friendly and attentive. Usually I get the Mint Mojito (medium sweet) but since it's iced, it doesn't always work in colder weather. Last night I tried a Jacob's Wunderbar, creamy and medium sweet. It was absolutely delicious -- chocolatey and nutty. I'll definitely try it again next time!
author: Alysha V.

description: I always find myself here after an early morning Caltrain ride at the ATT Park station. Friendly baristas, great drinks, and a chill place to just sit down and pretend you didn't just ride the Caltrain for 2 hours.
author: Jay R.

description: I love Philz! I always go  whenever I'm visiting San Francisco. It's a bit pricey (hey it's San Francisco), but their brews are so tasty. I'm no coffee conossieur but I can taste good coffer, and Philz has good azz coffee!
author: Lana L.

description:
My walk of shame was to Philz coffee wearing my high heels and leather pants from the night before. I'm pretty sure the guy helping me, noticed my raccoon eyes and saw that my faux eyelashes were falling off.  It's not what you think. I wanted to get out of there ASAP, so I ordered a coffee. Oh, wait. That's not how it works. The guy thoroughly explained to me that I needed to choose what I wanted. When I say thoroughly, I mean thoroughly. 

My brain wasn't working, so I ordered a latte. I needed it fast so I could go. Oh, so you have to pick a blend? What? I'm confused. A group of firemen walked in and stood behind me in line. I started to panic. It's 8 am and I'm dressed like this! People are going to work. 

I think the guy helping me saw my frustration because I couldn't even read the menu. (I took out my contacts.) I gave up and told him to make me whatever he wanted. 
It was a good choice because it was damn good! I left there with great coffee but left behind some of my dignity. I walked past the firemen totally embarrassed. Luckily, a cab was approaching and I hopped in. 

Whenever I'm in the city I come here. Lines are sometimes long but it's worth it.  Megan is awesome!
author: Marilu R.

description:
Ah Philz. Great service and yummy coffee. I've tried the decaf (Sumatra), iced, and the mint mojito. All delicious. Must stop in SF! 

This branch has decent seating, but can get busy in the morning.
author: Sneha P.

description:
Preface: I'm probably one of the few people who just can't get into their coffee : ( 

Since I'm a coffee fanatic, I usually love all the artisanal varieties, but this is the *only* coffee shop where I don't have an affinity for the taste of their brew!

Customer service is awesome and laid-back, and the baristas are super helpful to Philz Coffee newbies. 

I've ordered Jacobs Wonderbar, Tesora, and Julies Ultimate multiple times, (each time recommended by the barista) and customized to my taste (milk type, sweetener, etc.) 

Love the customization crafting process. Take a seat on their comfy couch and don't mind the wait; they take their coffee as seriously as Blue Bottle http://www.yelp.com/biz/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-6#hrid:V1wcypxjaUhzfpj2-cBk-w).

Sadly, my palette just can't get accustomed to their coffee. Ah well, back to Blue Bottle, I guess : )
author: Diana V.

description:
Seattle may be the self-proclaimed coffee capital of the world, but until we get a Philz Seattle ain't shit for coffee.
Tried a lot of the medium and dark flavors and I like many but will always be partial to the Philtered Soul. 

Staff is mostly friendly, I've only had one bad experience with their service but nothing worth noting.

The order ahead app is sweet. Saves you from having to stand in line, which usually goes quick even when it's 30 deep.

If you buy a pound, your order is free. At least that's what they did for me. Not sure what the actual policy is but if you're at the register with a lb and you ordered a cup of coffee, you might the cup for free, not the lb.
author: Jesse K.

description: I love the vibe at this location.  The staff are super friendly and fun, and of course the coffee is fabulous!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I went to Philz because the place that makes blue bottle around the corner was closed.  I'll admit I'm spoiled by great coffee, and this is definitely better than Starbucks or Peets. (Drinking battery acid is also delicious by comparison to those) I'd probably be very impressed if I'd never tried any of the other great locally roasted coffees one can get poured over in any number of little cafes around the city.

But I have.  So I'm not.

The medium roast I had might have been considered a dark roast by others.  It wasn't really what I was expecting.

The guy who made my coffee was very nice, if a bit too insistent that I try the specialty cream from Berkeley instead of the milk I'd asked for.  Look.  I'm tired and I'm paying 4 dollars for a cup of coffee at the only place that's open this early.  At this point I just want the caffeine! But the guy made me taste it in front of him and then fake my way though this whole moment of being impressed. Kind of awkward. At that point I didn't have time for him to make me a replacement anyway.

The special cream is kind of heavy and greasy tasting.  It seemed to fight the coffee for attention from my tastebuds.   If I get stuck in line at Philz again, I'm just going to take it black if the guy behind the counter starts trying to change my mind about dairy products. Or maybe bring my own milk.

Overall.  Kind of a headache.  But if there's absolutely nothing but this or Starbucks, it'll work in a pinch.
author: Poz L.

description:
in absolute love with the mint mojito coffee. Delicious. Sweet. Creamy. Changed my life. 

the staff is always so nice and willing to make special accomodations to make sure you get your coffee right.

The parking can suck in this area especially if there's a giants game, but the coffee is worth it!
author: Christine B.

description:
My relationship with Philz is all one sided - I love them, and they ignore me. I have begged them via email several times to open in Oakland, swearing my life long fidelity, my big mouth telling all and sundry (among those who don't already know about Philz), and my soul (due to some misadventures in my 20s, I was off to hell anyway). But why should they care for my measly soul when they own most of San Francisco's??
I'm forced to experience perfection only occasionally, only when I am in the City, only when I am in SOMA. Seriously? About twice a year (I have kids, people!)!
But, ah - how I dream...wanna hear it? Here it is: Me, on a cruise in Greece, with an iced mint mojito. Ah, bliss!!
author: Michelle E.

description:
I love Philz everything. So much so that I would appreciate it if my future husband's name was Phil. During the Bart strike, I was forced to embrace Muni and the T-Line. This Philz is located right at the stop on Berry. While waiting for my ride, I was going to wait on the nice patio outside. However, they started playing "Dirty Diana" by MJ! Woah! Someone help me NOT break into song! So I decided to sit on this really comfy red couch. Oh no...Must get off couch...

I usually opt for..well... My usual, Sweet and creamy ether! It's on sale right now as it is the coffee of the month. I bought a pound and got my small ether coffee for free! Saweeeeet! 

I then started diversifying. I tried the "Philtered Soul"... Toooootally helped wake me up at 6am! Then, in an effort to be 'healthy', I opted for the "medium sweet and creamy" Tesora...so delicious! I can never go back to Starbucks! 

The baristas make sure that your drink is perfect. They are so sweet, understanding, and human!! 

Last anecdote... I forgot my wallet in my yoga bag. I was so sad!! But then the barista was like don't worry! And then! I found a $5 miraculously... And he said "Are you sure you won't need it all day?" I said.. No no, here, but thank you!!! Now, now... Don't go taking advantage of the nice man and pulling the whole "I forgot my wallet" mess...But I have to say how appreciative I was when life happens and they were still accommodating :)
author: Leena B.

description:
I just love their individually brewed coffees and teas. This one is close to the ballpark and I try to stop by every time.

They have free  WiFi and comfy seats.
author: Tony L.

description: Usually I'm not a coffee drinker but as always Philz has the best ice coffee in town...on the downside...it was a bit tough to find parking near by....
author: JoAnna L.

description:
We recently went here to try work from a cafe on a typical sunday Study & Work Sesh.
BUT there are limited tables no plugs and no a conducive environment. I would keep this spot as a quick coffee grab! 

The Coffee is amazing: My personal top picks are - 
* Iced Philtered Soul with Cinnamon in the filter
* Mint Mojito
author: Cameron M.

description:
Philz Coffee is an amazing coffee shop. What other places offer hand crafted coffees, emphasized to your taste? They have an exceptional variety of coffees to choose from and even have almond milk as a non-soy, non-dairy substitute. 

Now I'm a fan of Philz but after numerous orders from Order Online, I have consistently had mistakes. These mistakes range from no sugar, incorrect milk (cream instead of almond milk!) and hot instead of iced.  

It's a small gripe for their great service. I'd recommend ordering inside and not "Order Ahead"
author: Richard F.

description:
Holy potatoes, talk about great service!

Let me start off by saying that when I'm in a hurry, I will not read signs. In fact, I'm much more likely to instinctually do the opposite of what your sign says. I'm not trying to be difficult, it just comes so naturally to me. So when the signs said 'order first, then pay', I of course, paid first. The guy at the register was smiling and friendly, even down-charged me for a small when I told him I wanted a large. After a few minutes, I realized my mistake and that no order was coming. My train was departing in 6 minutes and the place was packed. Gah!

When I told the gentleman behind the register, I was guided over to a young barista to take my order. (I think her name was Stephanie? I wish I had taken more names, I love giving personal shout-outs for great service.) She found out it was my first time, started to give me the full Philz welcome story, but when I told her I was in a hurry, she quickly whipped up my drink as fast as she could with a smile. 

I got my coffee and made my train. Great job, Philz. I'll definitely be back. If you haven't been yet, go.
author: Kevin B.

description: I don't drink coffee, but when I do, I drink Philz mint mojito iced coffee.
author: Christine C.

description: I always hear people raving about this place and their amazing coffee so of course, I had to give it a try while visiting San Francisco. I stopped by here before I had to leave back to Los Angeles and it was a quick 5 minute walk from Cal Train! Super convenient for me. When I arrived, I was quickly greeted by the workers. I looked at the menu and was overwhelmed by all the choices. I asked one of the workers for recommendations for first timers and should proposed the "Mint Mojito Iced Coffee" or "Philltered Coffee". Both sounded great so my friend and I ordered both and shared. The Mint Mojito was an iced coffee with a super refreshing taste. It literally felt like a smooth waterfall going through my mouth. I would defintitely order that one again. The "Philltered Coffee" was a hot coffee with a pretty mild taste. It relaxed you and I got it with medium cream and sugar which gave it a better taste. I usually like my coffee sweet with milk so this was perfect. I would recommend both to anyone who wants to try Philz!
author: Grace E.

description: Love Philz coffee. I was visiting the area and came to Philz twice to get my coffee fix. The first time I got their drip coffee and it was super strong and super delicious. Second time I got the mint mojito which is probably their most popular drink. I got it without milk and loved it. Clean, fresh and sweet and lots of mint leaves. Also,  just be aware to order your drink, then scooch over to pay for it at the register. My friend almost left forgetting to pay because the person who takes your order does not take the payment.
author: Katti W.

description: Quality coffee as always, as everyone knows for Philz. Even better, they have great service at this location! Came in super close to closing and they were cleaning up, but they still welcomed us with open arms and a delicious mint mojito.
author: Jade L.

description: I absolutely love coming here and super lucky to live right across from it. It's a east cafe, very friendly staff and a great place to sit outside with my dog. I love their teas and I love their MINT MOJITO! It's the best coffee I've ever had! It's delish and iced and heaven in a cup! The food is pretty good too, I had their spinach croissant and their bran muffin - all delish!
author: Heather S.

description:
I live in San Francisco and sometimes go to these high-end coffee places like blue bottle, sight glass, and wherever else that sell their beans at $16+ a pound. I though they were all good tasting coffee but nothing that special. I wasn't particular to any coffee brand or shop really.  Until finding Philz. Admittedly, I'm late to the party. :)

Here, they certainly make getting a cup of coffee an experience. Each guest is met with a level of customized service that I've not come to expect. They patiently walk you through the various tasty flavors, and then ask for your sugar/cream preference. They prepare your drink, and then call your name. They ask if its made to your satisfaction and wait to make adjustments. The result is a perfect cup of tasty pick me up, along with royal treatment. 

I am very stingy with my 5-star reviews.  Come here. Early and often. Enjoy your coffee experience.
author: Leo C.

description:
Without a doubt, this is my number one coffee shop of all time. When I moved away, this was on my top 10 things I would miss. There is not one time when I visit the city that I don't have at least one or two cups of coffee from here. I can't imagine the sadness I would experience if I wasn't able to make at least one stop here when I visit.

Their brews are absolutely fresh and delicious. Each cup is brewed individually and the service is stellar. And their creations are definitely one of a kind. My favorites are their mint mojito iced coffee and Jamaican blue mountain latte. But there has been nothing on their menu that I did not enjoy.

If you are visiting San Francisco, this is a must-try.
author: Brent C.

description:
everyone was raving about philz, so i had to make a trip to try it for myself. i went this morning, and while i enjoyed the cup of coffee, it was fairly expensive and not necessarily superior to other coffees.

it is really cool that each cup is individually hand-brewed, and the coffee definitely tastes fresh. i tried a large tesora, which was a medium roast described as butter, nut, and caramel. this one had stood out to me from the menu and was also recommended by the barista. the flavor was good, but less sweet than i expected. i also found the coffee to be heavy in texture, sort of thick (and i took it black so this was not due to cream or sugar). perhaps i would have enjoyed a lighter roast, but i couldn't pass over the recommendation.

i was a little disappointed that they had run out of the turkey sausage sandwiches and were currently not carrying 2 of the breakfast burrito options and ended up not getting any food.
author: Jamie H.

description:
First timers, try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee! :)

I love Philz coffee soo much! 

I love getting Philz before my morning commute on Caltrain (it's only a 2 minute walk from the San Francisco Caltrain station!), it makes me feel less sad about Mondays and waking up incredibly early... For mornings, I usually get a Hot Mint Mojito Coffee with almond milk and a tiny bit of sugar and it's perfect!

On a hot day, I usually order a Mint Mojito iced coffee. They use fresh mint and you can ask the baristas about ways you can customize your drink (different types of milk, amount of sugar, temperature, etc.) 

I've also tried the ginger snap iced coffee. If you love cinnamon and nutmeg, this is the drink for you! And if you love bitter sweet chocolate, I recommend the Mocha Tessora.

Yay for Philz! : ))
author: Monica T.

description:
I have to change my review.  The store manager Rob contacted me and ever since, I have had nothing but great service.  I've gotten to know some of the baristas here and they are actually quite friendly.  

There have still been some mistakes to my order, however my drinks have been re-made from scratch and with a nice little apology.  

I don't expect perfection, mistakes should definitely be allowed in life.  But now, there's no more unwelcoming disposition.  Thank you for the change, duly noted and appreciated!
author: Kristine S.

description: I don't drink coffee regularly but this place is awesome.  The vibe and environment is great.  The drink selection is amazing and they make the drinks the way you like it or they'll fix it on the spot.  I know other places probably do the same but Philz actually ask if the drink is okay before you walk away.
author: T L.

description:
Special.  Philz just makes you feel special.  Every cup is unique and you tell them how you like your coffee and they always come through--making your coffee just perfect.

Mint Mojito-- it comes cold, but I like mine hot.  Love coffee.  Love mint.  Mint coffee?  Genius.  I'm not talking fake mint syrup mixed with coffee.  No, they smash in fresh mint leaves and drip-brew each cup.    

Normally when you have too many choices, you might think the quality of something is diluted.  Like when a restaurant has so many options and they don't specialize in anything and the food is just mediocre?  Well, not Philz.  They have a ton of coffee choices and I like the fact that they explain each bean or brew with simple descriptions (kind of like wine descriptions but for coffee beans).  You could never go wrong ordering anything here, or ever get bored because they  have so many different kinds of beans and so many variations to make it. 

Customer service is awesome.  Everyone is pretty friendly here; not the type of independent hipster coffee shop where the employees think they're so cool for looking like they don't care.  These peeps are friendly.

Grab a cup, walk to the bay, breathe in the fresh air of SF and be happy you're alive.  Yes, Philz is an essential part of that equation.
author: Tammie C.

description:
I really shouldn't drink coffee, I REALLY shouldn't - caffeine does not sit well with me but Philz Coffee's refreshing mint mojito is just too tempting to pass up. 

It was my first time at this location and they did not disappoint - I came here on a Sunday afternoon so it wasn't as busy as a weekday but it was still busy (if that makes any sense).

Mint mojito was perfectly minty and creamy, loved it.
author: Mona L.

description:
You and your husband love this franchise.
Barista talent can vary, it's a gamble sometimes.
Whole beans to go is the way to do it.
author: Victoria D.

description:
Happiness = Black bean breakfast burrito + Ecstatic Iced Coffee

I 'drag' my boyfriend here every Saturday morning - the trick is, you get up early to avoid the lines. Hipsters hate getting up early.
author: Dora C.

description: Good, affordable coffee! Made to order and custom created for your taste buds. I told my barista I liked my coffee medium sweet and she knew what that meant! Got the philtered soul - what a cute name lol
author: Maricris D.

description:
This is one of the first places I was introduced to in the city, obviously by someone who appreciates strong coffee. 

Since then I have been back here regularly to get my caffeine fix. Even though it is out of my way, I'll stop by with extra time so I can read in one of their comfy chairs. They also have outdoor seating. 

Large Philharmonic please! (or Mint Mojito Iced if it's a rare summer day in SF!)
author: Sara P.

description:
I ordered the turkish coffee which was good and tasted a bit like chicory...i always drink my coffee black but in hindsight i think this blend might have been better with some heavy cream and a little sugar.

The iced mojito latte was both good and interesting.

I bought a pound of the ether and jacobs coffee beans.  Both were very good
author: Ben Y.

description: First time here to give it a try. Not sure how to order coffee here as it's different from regular coffee cafe. I went up to the cashier and he was kind enough to let me know how it works here. He even offered me a free medium house coffee (Tesora). I love it very much and will definitely come here again.
author: Alex K.

description:
One of my favorite coffee places in the SF Bay Area. I posted a longer review of the Palo Alto Middlefield location, so go read that for an overview of the coffee (tl;dr it's really good).
