The ambience at this particular location is excellent, with a few outdoor spots and some nice leather couches to relax or work on. Great hangout spot or a great place to grab a brew on your way to work or whatever it is
author: Ilya V.

description:
You know how most coffee places sell everything, just so they can say they are a coffee place a la Starbucks?

Well, I walked into Philz Coffee for a coffee date this morning and saw nothing but lots and lots of coffee selections on the menus (yes, plural). Peered behind the counter for an espresso machine, blender, you know the usual fortifications of a coffee shop. Instead, I saw lots and lots of coffee beans and staff carefully brewing coffee concoctions. 

I ordered a coffee off the menu that promised more caffeine than most. The guy behind the counter asked me if I take sugar and cream in my coffee. Now, normally I don't, but since he was so nice, I said yes :)

Was distracted from the line at the register by dee's mini donuts (organic!) and olallieberry pastries. Both were delicious!!!! Coffee came back smelling and tasting PERFECT. Add the free WiFi and comfortable seating for both singles and groups -- I am now a Philz Coffee evangelist!
author: Angie C.

description:
I think I've visited every Philz Coffee that's ever existed. And ALMOST tried every coffee blend they offer.

That is all.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
I went to this particular Philz the day it opened. If coffee can be a revelation, coffee at Philz is that revelation. Every cup of coffee you have after that you will rate against what you had at Philz, even the cups of coffee you have at Philz you'll rate according to that first perfect cup. I'm spoiled. My first cup was brewed by Jacob, son of Phil. It was perfect. No cup has matched it since. That's probably more my fault than theirs because I could go back and say, sweeter or less sweet or just make a face and the staff will interpret it and make the change.

I went to the original location in the Mission after learning about them and you get the same service there and the same attention to quality. I just need to learn how to complain to get what I want and then once that person knows it, they seem to be able to produce the same thing over and over again.

OH! and don't let me forget they have incredible hot chocolate there too. Try it one time with just hot water. If you're a purist, you'll appreciate the flavor of it.
author: Brian M.

description: Mojito iced coffee was a success.  I don't normally like iced coffee, and I really don't like mint in most things.  At the recommendation of a friend I tried it out and was surprised by how good it was.  The coffee certainly was strong enough to 'hold its own' and didn't get drowned out by their cream or by the mint.  These folks are definitely dedicated to their craft and it shows.  Service is excellent and I wish I was closer.
author: Al C.

description:
Very unique style coffee and service. 

You wait in line and one of 4 baristas helps you when it's your turn. They personally make you the style of coffee you choose. Then you go to the register to pay then pick up your coffee when your name is called. You can also order ahead of time to pick up the coffee. 

This place has a mix of hipster/chain coffee ambiance. If there was a speakeasy version for coffee, this place would kind of be it. I enjoyed my experience here for sure.
author: Titus S.

description: Yummy Mint Mojito Iced Coffee - "sweet and creamy" as my barista said! Been coming here long before I moved to San Francisco because the coffee and tea is unique and delicious and the nice peeps in this place really enjoy their jobs!!!
author: VeeMaria L.

description:
This was the first Philz I ever visited, I've since been to several of the other locations. The coffee, as well as the preparation of it, is great.

This location can get a bit crowded.

I've tried almost all of their medium and dark roast coffees, all of which I liked. I've also tried their Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee, which goes for about $7/cup. I like darker roasts, so that one wasn't to my taste, it was a bit too fruity.

The croissants are pretty good too.
author: N G.

description:
How is it even possible to get an overall of 4.5 stars? Philz is definitely a 5 star place!

Here are the reasons why I LOVE PHILZ:

(1) Friendly service: Very friendly staff. There's one guy I get it from all the time. He's so cool! He makes my prefect drip coffee. I tell him - not sweet, but sweet... and he knows what I'm talking about. He just gets me. Philz' Batista are mind readers.

(2) One-cup-at-a-time: Despite the long lines one has to wait, especially during the morning rush hours, it's worth the wait! Every time I get Philz, it's never, ever disappointing! But, always over and beyond satisfaction!

(3) Mint Coffee Mojito: pretty much what I get from Philz. Hot or Cold day... it's away a mojito. It smells good and it taste good - why change when something just hits your spot all the time.

**OVERALL: Philz ... they are mind readers there - always a perfect cup, each and every time.
author: Mindy Y.

description: Sure friendly staff. Pick your choice of creamer and amount. Pick your type of sweeter and how much. Get the Code 33 with medium nonfat milk and medium honey.
author: Robin L.

description:
ANYBODY WANT SOME ETHER???

Finally! 
This is one of those places that always brings me to my happy place.Its a great pick me up no matter what time of day and its as fresh as it gets ....unless you wanna go pick the coffee beans yourself and well yeah that would be a totally  different story.
You cannot go wrong with any of their masterpieces.
author: Ladybird G.

description:
WOW!!!!

When I saw how many reviews Philz had... i almost didn't want to go, but a good friend of mine said "Chaka, if you like coffee, you have to go to PHILZ!!"  I trust her opinion so we went and I ordered the "Ambrosia Coffee of God" blend... which is a medium. It was sooooo tasty!!!

Let me tell you about the experience though, we walked in and she said.. just tell him what you like (because the list of coffees/ blends was a little overwhelming). I told him I liked medium to dark roast with a little hint of sweetness, he responded by saying "you should try the ambrosia, I'll make it for you and you can see if you like it."  That was awesome, and it was very good!!!

I can understand why Philz was voted "best coffee in San Francisco!"
author: Chaka H.

description:
Yes, I am a coffee snob.  I weigh my beans.  I weigh my water when making my coffee.  I use a chemex.  I also measure the temperature of the water for my coffee.  I drink my coffee black.  So, yeah, I am a coffee snob.  I don't deny it.  With that said, what the heck is the big deal over Philz?!?!?!    

The beans are burned.  You can't tell where the beans come from and they are charred to a crisp!  I guess this must be great coffee for those used to starbucks, peet's or coffee bean.  And what in God's name is a mint mojito?!  I tried it and I had to apologize to my taste buds.      

I'll stick with the big four in SF - Sight Glass, Four Barrel, Ritual and Blue Bottle (and the big 3 in Los Angeles - Intelligentsia, Handsome and Portola).

I do have to give credit where credit is due -- the folks here are very nice and friendly.
author: Jaymee C.

description:
It makes me so sad to leave this review because I have loved Philz for ages. The one in the Mission is usually my go to but today I tried a new location. I was so excited to introduce a visiting friend to them and the experience was absolutely horrible. The girl at the counter doing the food was just plain rude. Not only did she give away our food to people who had just ordered but we then had to remind her that we still hadn't received ours. After that she proceeded to just through the food in the microwave. Her first try apparently exploded in the microwave and the next try that she handed out to us was still raw. Watching my friend bite into a still frozen/raw burrito was not the impression that I was hoping to make. We tried to  tell the girl this but she just ignored us probably hoping that we would just go away.

Needless to say I will not be returning to this location. Hopefully they at least learn better manners before too many others come through.
author: Susan P.

description: Coffee so good you could just die. Rockin tunes and very friendly staff make this my fav spot in the city. You can't help but feel good leaving Philz.
author: Deanna C.

description: So, after 7/8 hours on the Megabus, my friend and I finally made it to sf to celebrate a friends bday. Since we were going to be picked up and head straight to breakfast, my friend and I brushed up in the bathroom at Phil's and ordered a drink while we waited. I'm not a coffee person so I can't comment on what they're most known for but I do love me some tea. Got myself a black tea with non fat milk and a smidge of honey. It's not the best tea "latte" but pretty good tea. The place itself is pretty cool. Located in the city, cool plush leather seats and the workers seem chill! Cool spot!
author: Di L.

description:
It must be a requirement that Philz employees are on Ecstacy. Because I have *never* seen employees so happy and friendly at *any* coffee shop. And at this point in my life, the number of coffee shops I've been to is probably in the low 4 figures. Every single employee must have Canadian blood, they're so polite.

As with any Philz coffee shop, your drink is made to German engineering specifications. A slight amount of soy, lightly sweet, and the well oiled Philz baristas prepare a drink that comes out ridiculously good every time.

The Tesora is the classic starting point, for the Philz noob. But after that, I'd recommend being going down the list since I haven't had a blend I *dislike*. This isn't Starbucks, you don't need to hide the mediocre coffee with milk and sugar. Get it black lightly sweet, or if you want to take a bit of the edge off, have them put in a small amount of soy. But don't bastardize the complex flavor profiles of these beans with too much extra stuff.

If you're in SOMA, this should be your caffeination home base!
author: Rishi G.

description:
One of my favorite coffee places in the bay!

I highly recommend:
- mint mojito iced coffee
- philtered soul
- mocha tesora
author: Karen K.

description:
On a blustery evening in the vacant-feeling Mission Bay area, I felt a need to break into an old Olivia tune...

"Maybe I hang around here 
A little more than I should 
We both know I got somewhere else to go 
But I got something to tell you 
That I never thought I would 
But I believe you really ought to know 

I chug Philz 
I honestly chug Philz 

Philz don't have to answer 
I see it in the cup they made for me 
Maybe it was better left unsaid 
This is pure and simple 
And Philz should realize 
That it's coming through my lips
...and not on my pants

I chug Philz
I honestly chug Philz

I'm not trying to make Philz feel uncomfortable
I'm not trying to make Philz anything at all
But this feeling doesn't come along everyday
And I shouldn't blow the chance
When I've got the chance to say

I chug Philz
I honestly chug Philz

If we both were born
In another place and time
This moment might be ending in a caffeine fit
But there you are with Peet's
And here I am with Philz
So I guess we'll just be leaving it at this

I chug Philz
I honestly chug Philz
I honestly...chug Philz"

(...the sound of one hand clapping)

COFFEE - 5 stars...this, Blue Bottle and Peet's are the SF troika of fine coffee, and the one-cup-at-a-time prep is unbeatable here, especially the $3.50 Wunderkind
AMBIANCE - 5 stars...quite spacious (with cushy couches) and awfully empty on weeknights...it does make me worry about its longevity here
SERVICE - 5 stars...the baristas are super-friendly and attentive
TOTAL - 5 stars...I chug Philz...I honestly...chug Philz

P.S...Are there people who honestly don't know this song? Oh man...I do feel old.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kn6tBYUiWKQ
author: Ed U.

description: Mint Mojito is the best coffee concoction I have ever had. This mix of fresh peppermint muddled with brown suger over iced coffee. While the stores appear California cool, they take their coffee very seriously and usually ask that you taste it before walking away.
author: Michael C.

description: Tesora is to die for  !!! one of the best coffee  places , even though is a chain. love the personal touch they provide to each order , to ensure we have the coffee experience we sought after.
author: Priyanka K.

description: Mint mojito is basically crack.  I had it hot and it was delicious, even though I was advised to try it iced.  This particular location seems to be busy all day long.  Great for people watching (job interviews and Hinge dates in particular).
author: Yue X.

description: The first time I went to Philz was to this location. I was dumb and didn't feel like reading the entire menu and they knew I hadn't been to one before. Instead of being annoyed, they proactively helped me order and gave me the drink for free. I still remember that and even though this particular location is not convenient for me, I always pick Philz over other coffee shops when there's one nearby.
author: Oli J.

description: Ecstatic iced coffee!!!
author: Katie N.

description:
Julie's Ultimate
Julie's Ultimate
Julie's Ultimate
...or Ether
...but Julie's Ultimate

AMAZING! Snack choices limited though, may need to go to Panera next door if you are craving more variety to nibble on. But get your drinks here... #Julie's Ultimate [dark roast].
author: Mahsa K.

description:
This place knows how to make a mean cup of joe! Not sure which specialty coffee you'd like? Ask any of the baristas to help you choose! They're all so knowledgeable about their products and are really helpful in helping you decide which coffee would suit you best. 

My two personal favorites are Jacob's Wonderbar and Tesora. Those are always sure to hit the spot for me. 


The only thing I hate about Philz??? It's located in NorCal ONLY! :(
author: Serena C.

description:
The coffee is good.  Start with Tesoro and go onto Philtered Soul.  
Friendly atmosphere and friendly service.  Most of all, a good cup of joe.
author: Paco B.

description:
I love coffee, but I'm not a fan of mint.  Never thought that these two things could go so well together!  

Love the attention they put into making the perfect, fresh cup of coffee just the way you like it.  There are so many blends to choose from - but a Philharmonic or an Ecstatic Iced Coffee never fails to make my day.  Service is always great so don't hesitate to take a sip before leaving to make sure it's perfect.  Can never resist stopping by whenever I'm in SOMA.
author: Iris K.

description:
Ehhh... Philz on Van Ness does it better.
Baristas just didn't seem to really give a dam and the quality of my coffee was less than subpar. How freaking disappointing for a Philz fanatic.
It's the small things I appreciate the most - when the barista insists I take a sip to taste test my coffee first before letting me take off. Here? Nope. Call out your drink and move on. 
It's not just me either. My friend said the same exact thing without me even bringing it up.
Meh.
author: Susy C.

description:
Philz tops it off when it comes to coffee/customer service and quality flavor. Also, they don't charge extra if you want soy! I like that the barista presents you with your coffee, just the way you ordered it, and asks you to taste it to make sure it's perfect...it always is! Know why? Because they know their shiz, they listen to you when you order, and their coffee is yummy. 

I love picking up a cup on the way to a Giants game or on a quick stop before heading to the office. Philz, will you set up shop in the FiDi pretty pleaz?
author: Tiffany E.

description:
Seattle Coffee Scene.. Step the F Up

This shiz is legit.  There' s a reason why there is a long line at all hours.  I like their dark roasts.  More recently, I've experienced the Mint Mojito coffee drink... No questions.. if you like coffee and mint, (and ice?)  

Do ittt.  

I will say for the amount of work they put into making the drink, it's almost bearable to pay the 4.50... almost. Hence, the docking of a star.    Similar to blue bottle, every drink is hand made to order.  I'm talking every cup.  By. Hand.   When I get that heavy paycheck to afford my Chloe or Ferragamo, I shall have Philz coffee errday.  

Truth.
author: Cat A.

description: Got the iced mint mojito coffee at the location in mission so decided to try another one at this location.  Ordered the ginger iced coffee and ginger scone. I preferred the mint mojito over the ginger iced coffee. The ginger scone was delicious though.
author: Nhi R.

description:
The iced mint mojito coffee is the best! I would recommend customizing it by saying "light sweetness" because this brings out the coffee and mint flavor.

I would also recommend the mocha tesora for a "heavier" version because it's very chocolate-y, but is probably one of the better mocha coffees I've had.
author: Lisa L.

description:
One coffee. The Mint Mojito. Try no other. 

This spot is for the quirky, for the adventurous and for those who are not afraid to experiment and take advice from the Baristas! Stopped by here on a friend's recommendation on our trip to SF last year, and millions of coffees after, the taste still lingers. Will go back, if only for the Mojito.
author: Shuchi M.

description:
Oh philz coffee I love you, I really do.  That's why when you disappoint, it hurts me. Mostly, my wallet. 
I alway go for your kick ass mint mojito, which, when done right, it has the ability to soothe my senses. However, this review is for 8/25/2015 in the afternoon. The chubby guy in the fedora made my coffee. He was not busy when I ordered it but still managed to take almost 10 minutes to make a large cup of ice coffee. When I finally got my drink I had to go so I couldn't taste it to know if it was made right. It was a cup of VERY WEAK coffee. He put extreme amounts of ice and chunks of sugar on the bottom. Not enough cream which pairs terribly with a drink that barely resembles coffee. I had to toss my drink after getting home without even drinking a quarter of it. This drink is a $5 cup of coffee and I feel ripped off. Come on, care about the quality of your product or/and get better baristas!
author: Pony R.

description:
Favorite Philz ever ... Silken splendor is my favorite here .. Always made with love from Verne ... Zach is really awesome too.. The ladies are super sweet... My fav coffee place in SoMa...  

My recommendations are 

Ambrosia of the gods = sweet, w/ mint leaves, & cream 

Dancing waters

Philharmonic 

Mint Mojito 

Black ice tea sweeten 

They use Califia Almond milk (hearts!!)
author: Faith C.

description:
Someday I will drive around to look for a juicy parking spot just for that one sip of Phiz! Really really awesome coffee, the name of the coffee are interesting and the way they drip coffee make it really unique. Plus a little fresh mint to spice it up, I love Phiz!  

The pastry there is very nice too. Cheese croissant is my favourite. 

People who work there look cool and they can remember the customers lining up while dripping multiple coffees, pretty amazing!
author: Shell J.

description:
I come here all the time and love hacking and meeting other entrepreneurs. There was a month where I came here almost every day! This is where I come to half-work, half-socialize because so many awesome people from all over the bay area come to this location. I've made many good friends just chatting up the person next to me.

And yes, the coffee. I've tasted just about every blend on their menu (back when I used to frequent the 24th and Folsom location more) and Phil has even treated me to secret blends he's made that aren't public yet! 

After trying all the blends, I've gone through different flavor phases coming here. There was a phase where all I drank was Jacobs. Then it became a Tesora phase, a Four Great Horses phase, and currently I'm consuming Philtered Souls like crazy. 

Phil is incredible. All the baristas here are incredible. (Shout out to Max and Marcus!) High five ya'll!
author: Erin P.

description: Their mint mojito iced coffee is AH-MAZE-ING! That's all you need to know. Now go to Philz and have one.
author: Claudine D.

description:
Matt was on his way to a site in the Hunter's Point area, so first he stopped off at one of Mr. Phil Jaber (founder of Philz Coffee) newest Mission Bay location.

Being a first-timer at this new location, Miss Barista doesn't know Matt well enough, but she can easily tell Matt is in a frantic need of a cup.

So he ordered the large (16 oz) Tesora blend. The $3.25 blend beverage, which is equivalent to a medium-strength blend, was prepared fresh in a filter to drain the fresh coffee-grounds directly into Matt's approaching cup. Just by reading Matt's review, you can easily tell that the cup of coffee is extremely fresh, unlike some of the places that have their coffee sitting in carafe or a pot for a long extended time. 

Although the coffee is off the record classified as Medium-strength, it sure was compelling enough to make Matt dance to any slow song on KOIT. He also topped off his breakfast with $2.00 flakey Almond Croissant. 

The newest Philz location also sells Coffee beans, tees, caps and Mr. Jaber's famous brimmed hat. Matt might come back and purchase his famous hat, so he can be like Joe Friday from Dragnet.


Ooops... Matt just revealed his upcoming Halloween costume.
author: Matt G.

description: Love other Philz locations, but my Ecstatic was really watered down :( hopefully just a fluke!
author: Abby S.

description: I don't drink coffee all too often, but I must admit that the iced coffee here (whatever the first one is called...) was pretty good!
author: Phi N.

description:
It's good! I'm not sure if it lives up to the hype, but it's good. 

If you want something interesting, try one of the mint infused coffees. I liked the Turkish one.
author: kiehl c.

description:
i'm a newbie to SF.  my friend raved about philz coffee for quite some time, so he finally took me to this location.  he was right, now i'm a loyal follower...sigh.  i hate it when other people are right.  

my pick...mojito coffee.  as far as i know, there is no liquor is this cup of d-lite...and it's still good!!  i heart you philz...
author: Gia C.

description: I work in the city so naturally I'm a regular here. The moment I had Philz I knew I had been missing out on COFFEE. Starbucks, Pete's, or anything Seattle based doesn't compare to SF Third Wave Coffee. Philz is phenomenal and the iced mint Mojito is my go to drink. If you live/work in SF chances are you've said this heavenly drink, if not what are you waiting for??? GO TRY IT!
author: Rahul M.

description:
I love the new menu board! For each drink they list 3 distinctive flavors like chocolate, cinnamon, earthy, etc. It's sure to make newbies feel a lot less overwhelmed when ordering and great for regulars who want to try new drinks.

Also I only recently learned that you can bring your own mug/thermos, and no matter what the size you'll only be charged for a small! How did I not know about this??
author: Alice J.

description:
I always saw the folsom location packed but never went in... 

I went in here about 2-3 years ago (worked right next door) And OMGAAAAAH I've been addicted ever since. I've tried pretty much every type of philz strain from light-dark roast.. lol

If you are in the mood for something REALLY GOOD try the jacobs iced on a hot day :o) I get mine philz way every time. Staff is always friendly. If you're a philz noob like I was try either  the tesora, julie's ultimate, or the philtered soul. You won't be dissapointed ! :D


philz way for the win ^___^
author: Yeni K.

description: This coffee is worth the drive from Portland to San Fran. Very unique, mint Mojito coffee is bomb
author: Amanda L.

description:
Single brewed cups. The coffee is like crack. One coffee in the morning and I'm honestly WIRED all day. No exaggeration. I don't know if what's in that is legal, to be honest. 

The coffee I get is so good. Literally, it's called "so good" and is SO GOOD.

Another thing I like about Philz is that a small coffee is exactly $3.00. I hate dealing with change and they make it so convenient.

Definitely a good place to go for a pick me up.
author: Megan F.

description:
Friendly staff, comfy couches, good coffee. When I wanted to get more coffee for my buck & asked the barista if she could make me a Large Iced Philtered Soul but served without the ice, she did it without rolling her eyes (try asking for that at Blue Bottle without an eye roll). 

I go here to chit chat with friends and to relax in their comfy couches. The high ceilings make the acoustics of the place pretty loud, so if you're looking at a quiet place to study, bring headphones or go to the Philz on Van Ness, which has a quieter study area. Or, you could order your cup of joe at this Philz and go enjoy it at Panera Bread next door.
author: Valerie F.

description:
Wow, I'm usually an espresso drinker because coffee tends to be not as good, but I was definitely impressed with this place.  This is not your typical coffee shop where you pay first , and then receive your order. They'll ask you what you want first and how much cream/sugar you want...and then ask you to try it to see if you like it before they put the cap on the cup when they're done making your coffee. Paying for the coffee tends to happen in the middle of this process when they're busy making the batch for you. 

Compared to the likes of Starbucks, this stuff is not only way better, but cheaper as well. 

I ended up going back the next day for another coffee because it was that good, despite the fact that it was pouring cats and dogs outside and it was like a 2 mile walk from where I was staying. 

The two I got over those two days were : Philharmonic and Ambrosia Coffee of God. Both were awesome :D. 

Best coffee place ever.
author: Anders C.

description:
Great coffee as was expected, tried the mint mojito and will definitely be back for more.  Philz definitely has the coffee thing down better than most other places.

This specific location has a cool vibe and the baristas were efficient and obviously know what they're doing.  FYI: It is a little on the noisy and busy side.
author: Jason H.

description:
For a coffee lover, I'm a Philz noob. I visited Philz out of proximity at the moment and was previously taken a back by the cult following. With that said, I had a very nice experience here. No mint mojitos for me, but I wanted to get a feel for their roasts. You won't find single origins, but their blends are wholesome and full bodied. You know, when you sit down, sip, and "ah" involuntarily. I had the Anesthesia To The Upside. 

I was confused walking in, not knowing where I order and paid and in which order. I walked up to a drip station and the guy working there was more than happy to walk me through their blends as a first timer. Then I went to the register and paid. The process was different, but doesn't deter from the experience. 

If there were more of these closer to me, I'd make trips to Philz more frequently. Are they worth the hype? Perhaps. And even though I'm not one for sweet drinks, the mint mojito sounds interesting enough for me to try. Until then!
author: David O.

description:
Great location, great coffee.

This location is near the old headquarters of my old employer and I use to walk over between breaks and prior to hitting the pavement in heels (after the desk flip flop change) and I would order their zebra mocha on my positive more creative days or the breve latte on recruitment days.  In addition, this location was useful when I was going over new employee paperwork with the employees and I'd take them over there for a break to smooth their transition, especially if the employee was a relocating from the East Coast.  I found Philz did the job each and every time.

I am not much of a coffee freak when it comes to standard lattes, but I know that I cannot order a caramel latte unless it is from Old Soul @ 40 Acres.  Breve Lattes are done right and every time I've ordered from Philz.  I just found it deplorable that there were none in Noe Valley.......although I suppose I was saved by Martha & Bros. coffee when I meandered down 24th.

Great baristas and great coffee.  No fail!
author: Miika M.

description:
How can anyone ever complain about Philz??

Philz is the best, hands down.  I just discovered this location right next to my apartment, and I have no doubt I'll be coming here every morning before work and night after work.  Their coffee is absolutely delicious, and they few times I've gone to this locations, the lines have been pretty short... never more than a 2-3 minute wait.

Ah! I can't wait to wake up tomorrow for another cup of Philz!
author: Ian C.

description:
Oh my goodness, the people here are excellent.

Typically, I get really flustered going to Philz. I've been in the Bay Area just over a year and have more or less avoided it since my first time because I find it all so confusing.

Cut to me, walking into this Philz for the first time, and as usual, doing the wrong thing. I was trying to order at the register, silly me, and that is where what COULD have been a nightmare - where it not for the excellent staff - started.

A fellow standing behind my cashier (The Manager?) noticed what was going on, and stepped in. "I don't think he ordered with a barrista." Then the guy - Rob, I think was his name - guided me over to the barristas, where you are supposed to order. When I mentioned I was looking for a Vegan hot chocolate (fingers crossed) he knew enough to check the cocoa powder for milk ingredients. 

He then made my drink himself while I spaced off thinking about work. When a barrista called out "Hot Chocolate!" and nobody stepped up to the counter immediately, I thought perhaps he had handed my drink off to her. When I tried to ask if my drink was the one she had just put on the counter, she was gracious and helpful in informing me that the drink would come from the person I ordered with.

Like I said, I've avoided going to Philz coffee in the past, but this one has the kind of staff that just might get me over the hump when it comes to becoming familiar with how things work - especially now that I know I can get an EXCELLENT vegan hot cocoa. ^_^
author: Jonah P.

description:
If you like novelty coffee drinks, but are still picky about getting a superior roast, Philz is the ultimate SF coffee spot for you. Their menu is so extensive that the line is even set up in a manner that allows you plenty of time to stand back and decide what you want. You can get a personally brewed cup of coffee or indulge in a mint mojito iced cofee, depending on your mood. The mint mojitto iced coffee might be the most enjoyable cup of coffee I've had in the Bay Area. They stuff so many fresh mint leaves in there. It is perfect.

The staff are super friendly & they take cards. Wins, wins and more wins for Philz.
author: K M.

description: Great coffee, obviously. But what sets this place apart is the often rotating quality group of coffee professionals that take time to really get your order right. Want more or less of something? No fuss, and no green aprons sooooo......great seating available and worth the occasional 15 minute wait
author: Tim S.

description:
Finally made it to Philz after hearing so much about it from my friends. 
The line up was long at about 10am, I hear that there's always a line up?

Anyway, I got the Wonderbar which was delicious.  I love how each coffee is made on the spot making so much fresher and tastier.  Wonderbar is a dark roast to it's full bodied and as you can tell by the name there's chocolate and nut flavours in it.  You really can't go wrong.  Mmmm...
author: Tanya N.

description:
Mmmm...Philz.  Coffee is great quality and very strong.  I always order it medium-sweet, with cream and sugar, even though usually I drink coffee black.  Here they just do the cream and sugar so perfectly, I don't want to miss out.

My favorites are the Ecstatic Iced Coffee, when I need something cold, and the Tesora or the Silken Splendor when it's a cold, windy SF day.

I've tried the vegan donuts that they have, and they are okay.  Pretty dense, but I like the icing on top! :)

I've heard good things about their croissants, but I haven't ever tried them.  Usually when I get Philz, I'm on my way to study at Panera next door, so I skip the food and just go for the amazing coffee.

Beware if you are caffeine-sensitive...this may give you the jitters, or may keep you up if you have it past 12 noon.

I get a little annoyed by some of the "i'm-way-cooler-than-you" attitudes I get when I go in there sometimes, but usually the people working there are really nice and helpful.  They can give you advice on what coffee to choose if you've never been there before.

I guess it's pricey for coffee, considering it's like $2.50-3 per small cup, but when you factor in the amazing quality, it's worth it.  The way I think about it is this: if you were going to get some mocha or latte elsewhere, you'd be spending ~$2.50 or $3 anyway, and for that, you can get an amazing quality coffee w/ cream and sugar.  Perfect, I say!
author: Caroline K.

description:
This coffee shop is highly recommended by the San Francisco relatives.  The first attempt from other relatives who never try it before say it is very very good, even better than Starbucks!

There are a lot of mixtures of coffee beans.  Once ordered, it will be specially brewed.  You can even download apps to place your order.

I have a Hot Chocolate which also has very good tastes.  I choose sweet but I can also choose other tastes.

If you are in San Francisco, don't miss it.
author: Frank L.

description:
This was my favorite go-to before catching the train to work in the morn. Normally the baristas work magic when brewing my cup, however Philz seriously needs to retrain their newer staff. 

The grey v-neck, pencil mustache, glasses-wearing dude who made my cup today totally f-ed it up. Everyone who ordered after me received their coffee timely fashion. I ended up waiting 5 more mins then asking where it was. The guy couldn't even remember what blend I had ordered or what I had wanted in it, he must have been asleep as he took my order.

He then handed me a cup(the wrong size) and the wrong blend, I took it as I was now minutes from missing my train and booked it to the station. 

It was awful, no idea what I was drinking, but it tasted like muddy water. Ew.

Get it together glasses-boy. -_-

Ended up just tossing the cup; too terrible for consumption.
author: S ..

description:
I walked in with a craving for a iced mocha. A 1st timer here I felt pretty dumb when the attendant said they have different blends/names for their coffee. I had just said iced mocha please but now I was faced with the daunting task of deciphering the menu. Listen I'm a simple woman with simple needs and I was already feeling out of place with how crowded the place was with all the hipster types that all had their noses in the air and pants on tighter than a highschool girl. But I digress..

 I asked the kind fellow behind the counter to make me whatever they call their version of a iced mocha and he did. It had some silly name that I can't remember, sorry. Being that the place was too crowed and to be honest not that inviting to non-regulars I decided to take my drink and enjoy it and some fresh air on a stroll through SOMA. I have to say the coffee was FANTASTIC. Also the fresh air was refreshing. 

I will come here again. But the order will be to go.
author: Jo M.

description:
Philz consistently serves some of the best coffee I've tasted. They have a huge selection to suit nearly any taste - The Philharmonic is my favorite - and provide very friendly service. The food is good, too, which is a triumph for a coffee shop, in my experience.

This location is a bit small and cramped for seating, but that shouldn't stop you from getting a cup to go.
author: Brett B.

description:
Ill take an ecstatic iced coffee sweet and creamy please!
Love their coffee soo good I think I'm hooked..my bf liked his mint mojito I did try it it's really good too can't go wrong.
author: arlene d.

description: First time here, I am from Atlanta and was recommended to come here. the staff was very helpful and nice. She recommended the Philtered Soul and this was really great medium roast and made a great start to my day. Will be back again
author: Danielle F.

description: Very good coffee, excellent service. I have to say, though, that there are just too many choices, and the menu descriptions are not helpful -- they all are described as "THE BEST COFFEE IN THE WORLD", more or less.
author: Cory K.

description:
Holy crap! This place was packed at 10:30am on a Tuesday. Insanity, but I love it!

Tucked in an awesome little neighborhood, where apparently people don't have the greatest need to work in the middle of the day. This coffee shop was definitely not filled with college students studying, unlike the one over in Berkeley or Van Ness.

Tons of baristas, and although its busy, they keep it moving pretty quick! Great customer service and amazing coffee as always. Good luck finding a table though!

Love it.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Once you have a cup of Phillz, you'll forget Red Bull even exists.

Cost of coffee frequently generates a lot of debate, but the value-per-sip quotient at Phillz blows Sbux away. Boooooooom

OrderAhead is a great service, you should use it if you're in a rush.

Customer Service is OUT OF THIS FREAKIN WORLD
author: Joel C.

description:
I love Philz drip coffee!  I love that they have a location is SOMA which tends to lean towards the more basic boring coffee cups for business guys.. Thank goodness for Philz to make me feel more at home with a cozy cup! 

The staff at Philz is great and if you are overwhelmed just tell them what you like generally and they will whip up something awesome for you based on your preference! This location takes cards too! :)

I love the variety of spiced and  flavorful coffees here! As everyone says the iced mint mojito is great, but I would only order it on a really warm day. I just love the aroma and cozy essence of hot coffee. The mojito is perfectly refreshing on a warm day though.

Pumpkin cookie with cream cheese frosting! The pastries in general here look fresher and better than those at the one in the Castro. OMG definitely an upgrade from red velvet! I love anything pumpkin, but paired with cream cheese, this is just too good!
author: Angela K.

description:
Philz is coffee on a new completely different level, both in flavor and quantity of caffeine. 

Had the ambrosia and can't wait to return to try an awesome variety of flavors. The baristas are really friendly and the coffee was served at the perfect temp (I have a sensitive tongue, ok? Its a big deal). 

Coffee at 2PM kept me buzzed until 1AM.
author: Kiel L.

description:
Perfect place to stop for a snack before starting your day in the city.

I came here in the middle of the afternoon and ordered the cranberry apple muffin and hot mocha tesora. Both were delicious and service was super friendly and attentive. One of the baristas even brought my drink over to my table for me. 

With super comfy couches, this little coffeehouse had a really chill ambiance to relax in for a few minutes after hopping off the Caltrain. The only turn-off for me were the flies buzzing around...yuck! Other than that, definitely stop by if you're in the area!
author: Jeanine W.

description: $3.50 for a small cup of coffee. Yikes. I tasted it. Definitely not worth a 10 min wait for the price. The only coffee in SF worth it's price is Golden Bear in Inner Sunset.
author: Hugh M.

description:
I lived in Mission Bay for a year, and while the neighborhood is severely lacking in options when it comes to good quality places to eat and drink, Philz single-handedly redeems it. The people who work there are all AMAZING! They genuinely care about the quality of the drinks they're making, and they're super friendly, not only to me, but also to my little pekingese sidekick who quickly learned that Philz is synonymous with treats (they have a huge jar on the counter) and cuddles from the staff. I came here about two or three times a day in the weeks before I moved, because, why not? 

I still try to find time to stop by whenever I'm in the area. I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I LOVE to treat myself to their mocha tesora and iced mint mojitos once in a while. Having spent some time in Argentina I'm pretty picky about my mate, but Philz' spin on it is delicious, definitely my signature drink (for real, apparently I was the only one who would order it using OrderAhead twice a day). 

Also, you can use OrderAhead which is awesome for when the line is out the door and you have to catch a Caltrain in 10 minutes or just can't be bothered to line up for 30 minutes.
author: Vilde E.

description: Ok, this will be very short and sweet. I am too blown away to be coherent or eloquent. I get the hoopla. The hoopla is not even enough. The best coffee I have had as of yet. I will revise this once I get over the awestruck stage and regain my composure. Philz, come to the Walnut Creek area ASAP and make me a happy, happy girl.
author: Clarice O.

description:
Philz Coffee is so good I go out of my way to have it and I don't even drink coffee. They have the best tea ever, too. Like I said, i don't drink coffee, but from what I hear, Philz is the G.O.A.T., which I can totally understand because I love their tea. 

The workers are required to encourage you to try the cup they just made for you. I NEVER find it obnoxious or insincere. Consider how many times I've been there plus how many times they have say that per day no matter how busy and it's astonishing. It's the neighborhood coffee spot you'd hope to have. 

If you are a transit commuter and you miss the Caltrain, this is the only place I can walk into and forget all my no-car-having rage. Relaxing way to kill an hour. If it was up to me, Philz apricot bars and iced tea would be available intravenously.
author: Danny A.

description:
I was looking for a quick cup of coffee before hopping on a Caltrain. This place is set up a little strangely. The menu is a bunch of pour-overs and specialty drinks with uninformative names. One of the friendly baristas asked me about my preferences (light roast, black) and recommended a beverage called 'Sooo good'. Or possibly 'Soooo goood'; I didn't think to count the O's.

Anyway, it was a pour-over of one of their blends with a sprig of mint. It was actually a pretty good cup of coffee (preeetty goood?), and the mint was perfect for a sunny day. Made me think of Arabic coffee.

I'd rather have coffee labeled with the origins rather than the goofy names, but I guess they've found a way to market good coffee to the Starbucks crowd; that can't be a bad thing.
author: Nath A.

description:
This is my 3rd Philz in 4 days and I don't know what compelled me to come here to study when Game 4 of the Giants vs Tigers is on. Thank god that at least it's not a home game so that SOMA isn't swarmed with noisy intoxicated fans. The servers here seem less fun than the ones at the other Philz and more like servers at other coffee stores. It just felt like they took my order but there was no barista-customer connection, whereas at other Philz I always leave feeling like they care a lot about whether or not I'm having the best coffee.

Mint mojito is still well-made. I don't think you could ever go wrong with this drink.

Tips: This Philz has less seating than the ones on Van Ness or the Mission, and the set up is more reticent of a coffee store in the suburbs. However, there IS a TV, which is kind of cool since I'm pretty sure they only installed it so that people could watch the game (this Philz is super close to the baseball park!)
author: Melody L.

description:
This is our go to spot after a Giants game! Though the line is backed up, it is def worth the wait! 

The workers have great service and even get my mint mojito hot instead of iced on a really cold windy day in the city!
author: Chrissie G.

description: I'll be late to morning meetings, and drive knowing I have to pay $40 to park my car across from work for the day, just for a cup of Julies ultimate with cream. If you ever fall in love with me, bring me Philz, i'll love you back.
author: Angela B.

description:
On our way to a Giants vs. Rockies game, our friend recommended this coffee spot to us.  It was convenient because it was down the street from AT&T Ball Park.  She always posts pictures and raves about the Mojito Coffee.  I just want to make this clear; it is not an alcoholic drink...insert sad face.  None the less, it was an amazing cup of coffee.  The coffee was fresh and it had a great flavor to it.  The mint was quite intriguing, in a good way.  I rarely go to specialty coffee shops, so this was a treat for me.  Another great thing about this place is that it is very pet friendly.  We waited for almost 20 minutes to get a cup because the line was out the door.  Would I do it again? Heck yeah.  But I wish I wore a jacket because it was pretty chilly.

4 stars...

Enjoy!
author: Tony N.

description: Came here mid day and tried the Turkish. They prepare it individually and even ask you how much cream and sugar you like. The Turkish was a bold dark coffee with a hint of ginger and mint served with steamed milk and topped off with mint leaves. It was surely not your everyday cup of joe. If you like trying different hand crafted gourmet coffee, surely give this a try.  I liked it. I would recommend it as a post meal coffee. Caffeine level was high, I felt it even a few hours later.
author: Benjo S.

description:
Came to the city Sunday morning to meet my friend for breakfast after her half marathon race and decided to swing by for my daily coffee fix.

I was in the mood for something sweet so I got the mocha tesora. At $3 it doesn't seem so much more expensive than most coffee shops and its definitely worth the price! 

I didn't think I would make it to brunch in the ferry building later on an empty stomach so I also picked a seasonal fruit scone. I was pleasantly surprised that they warm your scone. On a cold, Sunday morning in the city, it was very comforting!

I ended up sitting, savoring my coffee, watching Olympic basketball and occasionally chuckling at their musical selection for an entire hour until my friend was done with her race.

I've read reviews about the workers here being on the grumpier side but I have to disagree! Their greeting and attentiveness was warm and genuine.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
went there on a Sunday morning. very crowded. but there were five baristas working at their own station. my wait wasn't so bad. i was told that my barista appears to be more efficient most of the time. she typically made more cups than the other baristas. too bad i didn't get her name... she checked to see how the coffee was. very different from my previous experience at the Castro location (very cold customer service. i wouldn't go there again: http://www.yelp.com/biz/philz-coffee-san-francisco-2#hrid:vXnVWQd323N4QwJ3-m_E5w).

tried their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee this time. it was good. different. not too sweet. depending on the weather, but i would try their mocha tesora or stick with mint mojito iced.
author: Diana C.

description:
Tesora extra sweet. =) I'm not afraid to douse my coffee in extra sugar and milk. The coffee here is very rich and strong. I love all the funny names and the various choices. At this Philz, they don't ask you to taste it before they pour. I kind of liked the novelty of that. This Philz is also much bigger. It's bright and open with lots of seating. It's bustling but not too crowded for a Saturday morning. The people are extra cool here. 

Dirt bomb or snail? Well, they ran out of snails so dirt bomb it is. The dirt bomb is a cinnamon like muffin with sugar crystals. The whole time I couldn't get it out of my head that it tasted like dirt =P They definitely got the texture right. Next time, I'll opt for something a little more tame.
author: Minda w.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco. Try to get here every weekend a sit is conveniently located in SOMA near my apartment. Love the ecstatic iced coffee philz way. So consistent and staff is always super friendly.
author: Cody F.

description:
I love me my Philz!

It's true, as the sign says, the moment this Julie drank her Julie's Ultimate, she knew, she found her favorite brew!

Nice location, I usually grab a cup, a book and I head out toward the near by river/stream and read for a bit... ;D Awesome days... ;D
author: Julie T.

description:
The mint mojito iced coffee. That's all. 

Oh, I also want to best friend all the baristas.
author: Laura D.

description:
Let me tell you, the Mint Mojito is delicious.

I come here at least 3 - 4 times a week. It's located across from China Basin and the Cal-Train Soma station. 

The Mint Mojito are served ice cold and when you get the drink, it feels like it is lukewarm.  Definitely wait for the ice to cool down the coffee before you drink it. It's just delicious and refreshing. Great quality, made slowly and with care.

There are a good number of seats at this Philz.  But it gets crowded because Dropbox and some other tech companies are near by. The seats are not the same, so it doesn't have the corporate feel, which I like
author: Eugenia C.

description: Hands down one of the best coffee places in the city. Never have I been disappointed coming here. Every visit was pleasant in it's own way. The baristas are very welcoming and entertaining. Even though there are rushes which can lead to a line going out the door, one can find entertainment in watching the baristas dance or sing while they are making drinks. When the employees are having fun working, it just creates such a positive and welcoming atmosphere. The coffee never disappoints either. The iced mint mojito lives up to the hype. There's nothing better than having an iced coffee with mint, sweet and creamy (especially on the rare hot days in SF). Philtered Soul, Silken Splendor, Sumatra, and the Tesora are my go to blends. I usually get my coffee sweet and creamy but sometimes I feel bold enough to order my coffee with vanilla soy and honey which makes all the difference. The Chamomile tea is amazing too (especially with extra honey). Even though all the baristas in this Philz are amazing, my go to baristas are Puka and Abby. You can count on Puka to entertain you with her singing and dancing while she's making your drink and Abby's mint mojitos are mind blowing!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Despite being crowded. 

Despite taking a large volume of orders. 

The personable dude behind the counter fixed me a damn fine cup of coffee. Rich, robust, enlivening. I wish every coffee shop could be this good. I'll definitely be back.
author: David S.

description:
Any place that makes your coffee by the cup is a win in my book. Wonderfully blended coffees, hand picked by the buyer. So many different blends so it's best to talk with the barista when ordering. 

I know it's been said but their Mint Mojito coffee is just amazing....really. If you have a sweet tooth in the am then this will definitely satisfy.
author: Meredith M.

description: This place has a very cozy and warm feel to it. The employees love dogs are really friendly. :) thank God it's only a 2 minute walk from where I live!
author: Claire Y.

description:
Looked for a good coffee in the SOMA area and found this coffee shop ... came with low expectations due to some disappointments I had with other coffee shops in the this area ... 
AND - was so amazed !! Tried to Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and I can defiantly say - it was one of the BEST iced coffees I've ever had.

If you are in the area - do not skip this one ...
author: Oriel B.

description: Came in here before a Giants game as my fellow companion was interested in picking up some caffeine before we went into the park. I had no intention of getting something for myself, especially since I'm not a big coffee drinker but of course the friendly barista offered tea and hot chocolate as alternatives to Philz plethora of coffee listed on the menu. I say, no thanks. After contemplating about how much I do want something sweet, minus the caffeine, and how much I don't want to pay for a ghiradelli sundae or hot chocolate which are ridiculously inflated in pricing at the park, I flag down the barista and tell him I actually would like a hot chocolate. Although he looks at me with that, mmhhmm I knew you couldn't leave here without something look, he concocts a hot chocolate, medium sweet, in no time. Smooth, rich, chocolaty goodness. New name: Philz Coffee and Hot Chocolate.
author: Maya S.

description:
Single drip coffee with like 40 different coffees to choose from. Honestly i drink folgers at work so i don't have the right tongue to make an opinion about coffee but it was interesting to say the least.

I couldn't imaging coming here before a work day, but on a quiet saturday morning it was cool. The barista was to ask our opinion of how we take it and to make sure the taste was to our liking.
author: Johnny C.

description: I work super close by and they seem to always be slammed, but 5 stars for positive vibes and efficient service.
author: Emm B.

description:
Great coffee, staff has always been friendly to me. 
Though I wonder why they ever ask how much sugar/cream I want in my cup since only one of them has ever remembered or written it down, so they almost always ask for a reminder. 
Haven't tried all of their blends, but the New Manhattan is incredible and is easily one of my favorite coffee blends. Its pricey for coffee, but its coffee done correctly and I'm willing to pay it.
author: David S.

description:
I stopped drinking coffee about 6 months ago and today, I decided to get a cup of coffee cause my mind and body was extra tired. 

Came in with my co-worker and told them that I never been here before. They warned me that the coffee will be strong! I got the half philtered soul and half canopy of heaven. Man was it strong! If you don't like your drink, let them know and they will fix it. 

Price for my drink was $3.13 for small (medium roast and medium on cream and sugar). I am having the jitters as I write this review... but I can't stop drinking this cup of joe! AHHH
author: Erica T.

description:
ginger snap iced coffee is my faaavs during the holiday season. 

what surprised me about this location is that they sell breakfast burritos?! not sure if this is just this location or all locations... anyways. it's a nice alternative to sweet breakfast pastries!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
We arrived right at closing, but a very nice gentleman, "Polo," helped us out the best of ways.  He greeted us happily and not as some places do when you enter at closing time.  We definitely appreciated the gesture.

I went with the Jacob's Wonderbar Brew because I remembered it as being "the most ordered coffee."  Oh my, what a great decision that was.  Polo explained the coffee-making process with intricate detail because we were going to take home a 1/2 lb of the Jacob's coffee beans.  

I felt like I was being thoroughly educated while being served the most amazing coffee imaginable... perfectly sweetened, perfectly brewed... wonderful.  

P.S. - I was wired for the next 6 hours.  Yikes, that's some powerful stuff!

5 Stars... as amazing as I remembered it to be.
author: Johnson N.

description: It's good. Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Grab one, then go walking along the bay. It's quite nice. The people are friendly, the line can be long, there is plenty of seating inside, but this area of SF is quite nice and it's a nice stroll down towards AT&T park and beyond along the Embarcadero.
author: Tony C.

description: Found my drink and I LOVE it! The Arabic coffee has such a smooth texture and is incredibly addictive. The pumpkin spice iced coffee is also excellent for those warmer days. Only downside is that it can take up to 20 minutes for the coffee to be made (but it's totally worth the wait).
author: Shireen K.

description: I usually go to the one in South City on Westborough but since I work at AT&T Park I get my coffee here. Very friendly staff and fast and coffee always tastes good.
author: Dillon K.

description: I love me some Philz but this location has had their OrderAhead system shut down for like a year (since a car crashed in the 4th street side windows), so I can no longer order my coffee from bed and just roll in and pick it up. I hear they are remodeling this location and OrderAhead will be back soon. I hope that is the case because I love my Philz but the Giants fans will be back soon and the line will be crazy long.
author: laura f.

description: Came into Philz this morning and ordered a "black coffee," the barista could already tell I was a first timer. She walked me through their selection of dark to light roasts and suggested an incredible blend of "first alarm and ether." She even had me try it before I left to ensure I liked it. Everyone I met was very friendly and my barista left me with a "welcome to Philz dude!" I highly recommend this place to any coffee enthusiasts!!!
author: Alexander G.

description:
My second review for Philz Coffee (the first was for their Berkeley location) but I just have to rave about this place; this is probably my favorite Philz! The baristas go out of their way to make sure you get a perfectly customised drink. My friend, who was visiting, was quite confused about what to order, and her barista took the time to talk her through ALL their roasts and flavors. The amazing customer service at Philz never fails to make me happy. I truly cannot be satisfied by any other coffee shop anymore. My go-to favorite is the Mocha Tesora with sugar (medium sweet), cream, and a pinch of cinnamon. However, I was persuaded by my super friendly barista (I wish I could remember her name, she was awesome) to try the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. Really hit the spot!

The overstuffed sofas here just complete the laidback, serene ambiance. They have a lot more books here than I've seen at other Philz locations, and quite a few interesting board games. My friend and I had a great time just playing Scrabble over coffee. Philz is where I've had some of my better bonding moments. A true gem!
author: Meghana S.

description:
B e s t
P h i l z
location
i   n 
S F
...period!

On two separate stops,
I got caffeinated in a Tesoro Mocha and Pfiltered Soul manner.
Azn Fistpump!
author: Derek N.

description: Best coffee in town - love the mint mojito. Great atmosphere. Only downside is the never ending queue!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
This Philz is next to my office and I came here almost daily during the week, if not more.

Their staff is awesome, with fun and friendly customer service, who really care about making the right cup of iced/hot tea or coffee. 

They know how to take care of their customers and make sure the drink has the right flavor, sweetness, and enough cream/mint to make a difference in your drink.

They do have a long lines, so use the Order Ahead app, if you are in a hurry. This isn't a place to meet people and have a long drink, as it can be hard to find a seat. This is more of a grab a drink and go place.

If you are hungry mid-afternoon, stop by for a pork sausage breakfast burrito with some hot sauce. While I typically am not a hot sauce kinda guy, I have a burrito about once a week, just to have their hot sauce (though realistically) their isn't much quick food in the area, mid-afternoon, unless you want Panera Bread.

I usually order my Iced Green Tea, Mocha, or once a month, get the Blue Mountain Coffee.

Buzz me if you ever visit here.
author: Joseph Y.

description: My first time at this coffee shop and I was so pleased. The barista was so warm and welcoming, he was able to really help us find a coffee we both liked! I would highly recommend
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Philz is the first place that ever made me realize coffee was not just a medium to deliver caffeine into my body. Mocha tesoras are highly highly recommended.
author: Jessica H.

description:
They know what they are doing; my review is not specific to this particular location but it is about overall service and coffee that Philz provides..
First and foremost all of their coffees are u unbelievably amazing.. You can't go wrong with any of them..2 of my favorites are Tesora and filtered soul.. My least favorite (believe it or not this is very hard to find as everything is very good) is tantalizing Turkish.. 
They are quick, efficient and friendly.. I love Philz and I can never have enough of their coffees.. Well done!!!
author: Seda M.

description:
I love Philz on 24th, but the Spirit of Philz seems to be replaced by the Grinch of Coffee at this SOMA location.

Having the same great coffee blends and yummy bites are about all the two distant locales have in common.

The grinch lady seems to be the manager.  Over the course of a few visits, I've seen her yell at employees, tell one to stop taking her break because they were "packed" (with only about five people in line), give me an extra samosa and then come to my table to take it back, and generally permeate the entire cafe with stress and tension.

I'll take the boho atmosphere of the other Philz, where the presence of Phil himself seems to help maintain almost total tranquility.

+3 for the friendly employees alongside this frazzled woman, and the delicious coffee they serve.
author: Joanna M.

description:
I got the Philharmonic. They made the coffee perfectly though I didn't really ask for anything special done...the mint leaf on top afterwards was cute. There were many options and many ways to customize your drink, and the people were very friendly and helpful, especially nice to see early in the morning.

I don't really drink coffee but if I had to get some and was in the area, I'd go back here. It's also next to the station, which is useful if you're about to go on a trip somewhere.
author: Alex K.

description: Wow.. full service coffee. They grind, prepare the coffee pour the milk and sugar for you. I feel special here. Very full service. I ordered the coffee the firefighters drink, because I like my coffee strong and wow. I was too high on caffeine to sleep.
author: Mocha G.

description:
3.5 stars

Ever since I stepped foot in the original location and had my first cup of Philz, I was hooked.  This is a good location because it's closed to Caltrain so a good stop to meet up with friends or colleagues for a meeting.  

There are chairs and tables outdoor, as well as some indoor along with a few sofas.    If you are not familiar with the choices, check it out and decide before getting in line.

I like the Ether with a bit of cream and sugar and a couple of mint leaves, simply delicious.
author: Gloria H.

description: The best iced mint mojito that I've ever had! Hand crafted coffee, unlike Starbucks. I love Philz Cofffee!
author: Ray S.

description:
My dream coffee! I wish it weren't $3.50 a cup, BUT if its a treat, its well worth it! Ambrosia is my go to, but I also know that Turkish and Jacob's are amazing too! People with a  sweet tooth, definitely try Itz the best!

Best part, they have organic creamer, AND have stevia! The more you go, the more the staff will tell you about their secret coffee concoctions (i.e. Red Sea).

The staff is always friendly, and the shop has a good vibe. i would be comfortable hanging out here for hours.
author: Jessica S.

description:
These people are serious about the Joe.  Each cup is made individually with such care you just can't imagine it. I am not a huge fan of coffee in general, but I love tea.  Try the mint tea, it is made caffeinated or decaffeinated and uses REAL MINT LEAVES.  

The only other place I can get this kind of tea is at my own house, where I grow my own mint in my garden.  

Philz staff is always wonderful, always positive and always happy.  Comfy chairs to sit in too!
author: Denise S.

description: I am not a big fan of mint, but i still love the mint coffee here! It's creamy n good flavour! I will come back for the second timeeeeee!
author: Carrie K.

description:
Great customer service here. Very friendly when I asked for a recommendation. I ended up getting the so good which is a lighter brew with medium sugar and cream. It was really good! My friend got the mint mojito and my other friend got the ginger snaps which they both loved.

It's great that they have a big selection to choose from. 

Definitely my favorite coffee place in the city as of right now!
author: Christopher C.

description:
I'm not a great fan of espresso coffee - Philz makes freaking awesome drip coffee fresh and by the cup.

If you're new to Philz here's how it works: order with the barristers. They make it all for you. You'll need to specify what kind of coffee, how sweet, kind of milk, how much, etc...  This threw us for  a loop the first time we were here -- I don't know, what does medium sweet mean to you? What if I want to make it sweeter? Can't I just do it myself? Sometimes great customer service can go too far and get all up in your grill with decisions - not pleasant if you're still waking up and looking for coffee. That said, we've been back many times now, know how to order and the coffee has always been outstanding.
And if you don't like what you get, they're happy to fix it -  the only part of customer service that's important to right.

Sure, Philz has it flaws. Its seating is limited. Its full of hipsters hogging the seating with their Macbooks. Sure the lines can be quite long and slow, and their drip coffee prices are as high as espresso drink prices elsewhere, and Philz ordering process could be easier for noobs. But, heck, its hard to find coffee this good anywhere. Thumbs up.
author: Stuart R.

description:
This is probably my 3rd Philz coffee review and I'm proud to say that so far, I have gone to 4 out of 5 Philz in the city.  (There is 5 right???)  I've even gone to the one in Palo Alto.  

This time I came here the day after Christmas.  The coffee is like crack!  Super freaking addicting.  I usually stick with the usually--mocha tesora, medium sweet with soy.  Yes, so addicting that I've gotten bags to brew my own.  And of course I don't mind paying $13 for the bag.

I love how this is not your typical Starbucks or Peets and all the shops are owned by a SF native --or at least I think he is.  Makes me feel good that my money is not going to some far off God only knows where--hmmm maybe that's why I don't mind putting my buck where it belongs ;) we definitely need more places like this. Yup, my coffee buck stops right here.  Keep on brewin' Philz! I love you forever!!!!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
Asked for a latte, noob mistake. They don't make espresso drinks, only coffee. Guy behind the counter, sipped coffee as he worked the cashier, he recommended the Tesora.  i asked for sugar and creamer which they put in for me when the coffee was ready. Also got a cinnamon twist, which was huge, it was relaly good warmed up. 

Comparable to Barefoot, artisan coffee, and its like 3 bucks a cup for coffee. you're paying for quality.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I'm at Philz at least 3 to 4 times per week. I can honestly say that this place supplies me with an enjoyable community feeling and the upbeat staff really makes my morning or afternoon. 

Just a couple of months ago I was a Philz virgin and started out with a recommended Tesora. I love my coffee Black so it was a good starting point. I have grown to love the Philharmonic and the Greater Alarm, but like to twist it up with a Mocha Philharmonic from time to time. You can have coffee any way you like there and that's what's really great about it. Unlike most of the chain coffee places where it's pretty standard and normal. 

The music is cool and spans all genre's. I think this makes it comfortable to sit and chill, do some work on the computer or meet up with friends; all of which I've done. I highly recommend Philz Coffee if you love coffee.
author: Rich T.

description:
In my more recent years, I've unfortunately become more & more obsessed with coffee.  I can say without a doubt that the reason most people get coffee is just for the caffeine, and not usually the taste.  However, since that is not the case for me, I can easily tout that Philz Coffee is the best I've ever had, ANYWHERE in the world (And I've been around!)

The flavors are absolutely intoxicating, and are listed as either Light, Dark, or Medium roasts (of which Light is the most caffeinated, Dark the least, and so on).

They brew each cup individually, and NEVER fail to ask you just how you want it.  They also will not let you walk away with your coffee until you've confirmed you are satisfied with it!  

Bottom line: Coffee - 10/10, Service - 10/10.
author: Antonio A.

description:
Philz please come to southern california.

HOLY MOLY. SOOOO FREAKIN DELISH.

The atmosphere is really interesting as it is almost like you have your own bartender once you enter that will make your drink opposed to other coffee shops.  
I go there just for their Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  It tastes just as good as it looks. 
The coffee is strong, bold and rich when you first start but the type of cream they use makes this lovely blend and it smoothes out the coffee. Once the cream hits then you can feel the vibrant taste of the fresh mint they use that adds that pop of flavor. This coffee is unlike any other and I have not found any other place that makes a mint mojito iced coffee or an iced coffee as good as this.  

I think if you do not like coffee, that this will definitely open your tastebuds to enjoy coffee.
author: Kristina L.

description: The line was longer than I would have liked but then again it was new years day. I ordered the New Manhattan with 2 stevia and almond milk. It came out splendid and def gave me energy for the whole day. Staff was very friendly and even remade my husbands drink bc he wanted it iced.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Update:  The manager reached out to me and offered a free replacement of my coffe.  That was a very nice touch, that's why I will increase the star rating.  I really appreciated that he offered.  I will not take the free drink, but I kind of do want to give them another try.
author: Julie K.

description: I came in to Philz in a terrible moods and was met with a smile and positivity. Sarah gave me a pound of Tesora and then offered me a free coffee. So nice. Great customer interaction and the coffee was delicious.
author: Ben G.

description:
LOVE this place. I've heard about and seen Philz plenty of times, but never made a visit until last weekend. I wish I had known sooner about the uniqueness of this coffee shop.

I love my coffee, but since I drink it daily, I usually want to opt for espresso when I go to shops - when I looked at the menu, I uttered "uh babe, they don't have an espresso menu..."  I thought, interesting...

The girl who was working was very helpful - we each told her what we liked and what we didn't, and she chose very appropriate blends for the each of us. For me, I told her I wanted strong, dark, and similar to African blends - she chose the Ecstatic for me, which I loved.. for the boyfriend he likes Caramel Macchiato type drinks - I tried his, and she made it taste just like one, although when it comes to sweet coffee, no thank you for me, but it did taste great.

While we were waiting, I realized the coffee took a few minutes - so I nosily peeked behind the bar and realized that they do hand drip. I was very excited to see this and after asking the barista, I also found out that they grind the beans to order and drip to order. LOVE! I used to work at a coffee shop where we carried and brewed Blue Bottle, and that's when I learned all about grinding beans to order and hand dripped coffee. And it makes a world of a difference.

To sum it up - great, friendly, attentive, informative service; delicious coffee; laidback environment. Definitely coming here for my fix from now on - it's close to home!
author: Tiffany K.

description: Mint Mojitos.... Enough said ...... It's creamy and smooth.... This is the BEST coffee I have ever had. Nothing in Portland or Seattle compare. Their is nothing but Giants love here!!
author: Liana L.

description:
Coffee= 5 stars. Service= 0... ok I guess I have to give at least 1 star. So, three stars to meet in the middle.

The coffee is great and absolutely delicious but what keeps people coming back is the service, right? I've gone to this location about 5 times now and 5 out of those 5 times I have yet to receive a warm welcome from the employees. I don't know if it's just me but every time I walk in, I feel like the baristas are always grumpy.

I was amazed by their menu & all of the different coffees the first time I came in here. Of course, I wanted to study the menu so I'd know what to order. HOWEVER, the baristas kept yelling "I can help who's next" when clearly, there was no one else there but me.  Again one would yell, "I can help who's next" as if they were implying "hurry up and order" or something. I felt rushed so I bought I drink I didn't really like. 

The next time I went in, I decided to go with the mint mojito that everyone kept talking about. I walk up to one of the baristas and ask for a mint mojito. I could've sworn he rolled his eyes at me. Seriously! That made me feel like I ordered a drink that was such a nuisance to make. 

Overall the coffee makes up for the lack of service in this location. I'm a barista at another coffee shop so I know how important the quality as well as the customer service is. In this case, the quality succeeds but the service fails terribly. 

I might just have to try another location to get great quality & service.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Uh, I have only a few things that I am highly addicted, coffee is my one true vice and thanks to Philz, my vice is very specific.. Philz Tesoro.. The only thing is that it is so far from my home..  

Anyway, the service is wonderful, friendly and patient to describe the process and pour out the most delicious, smoothest cup of coffee..

I am not sure it is purely the filter drip process or the beans, but the most awesome coffee.

For chocolately goodness, the Mocha Tesoro was just heavenly..
author: Jen K.

description:
what the fuck?  amazing.

i had the ambrosia coffee of god or something like that.  randomly picked it off the menu because it was my first time there.  i usually don't like cream or milk or ... anything in my coffee, but wowwww they did it well!!  wasn't too sweet or anything :)  just perfect.

i'm NOT a coffee connoisseur at all so i felt kind of shy coming in... i know it sounds stupid, but people get so pretentious about their coffee sometimes... like hipsters.  ANYWAY, the girl who helped me was super nice about it and didn't make me feel stupid sooo greatly appreciated!

wish i lived closer!  definitely coming back :)
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great Coffee. $3 dollars if you bring your own cup. Enjoy the estatic ice coffee a lot! Also love the greater alarm and new manhattan in the morning. Great coffee made cup by cup and friendly employees.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Friends brought me to Philz one day. That one day changed my life.

It was a beautiful, sunny Fall day amongst friends. Friends that had much to say about this one coffee spot by the ballpark. I was very intrigued, because these are friends I never thought would be coffee drinkers. They were talking about how good it is, how friendly the service is, and how much they crave it now. Wow!

We stopped in right before noon on a Sunday. There weren't many customers in at the time. That gave me some time to decide. There were so many roasts to choose from. Thankfully, they had a board with descriptions of what each roast had to offer. That still didn't help me! I wanted to try it all. That's when I decided to tell the barista, (who was patiently waiting with a smile) that I was new to Philz and what she'd recommend. I told her how I like my coffee. She gave me the whole spiel on Philz coffee, and then recommended Jacob's Wonderbar Brew. Sounds good! After about 2-3 minutes, my drink was ready. She asked me to taste it to make sure it was good. It was perfect! Just the right amount of sugar, and definitely flavorful! It didn't even burn my tongue, as I thought it would. At that moment, I could've sworn I heard a harmonious song.

I sipped slowly to enjoy all the subtleties. Ahhh..         

This is how my coffee drinking life has changed. I now come to Philz to try a different roast every time. They're all really good. When I don't have Philz, I have to "settle" for something else. I come from San Mateo just for it. Addicted? Maybe. You can call me a PHILevangelist.

I highly recommend Philz Coffee. Oh, and as it says on the cup.. Tell A Friend.
author: McWendell R.

description: Philtered Soul and Jacobs Wunderbar are my two faves!!
author: Jon F.

description:
I am a regular based on my infatuation with this coffee house. I have been to every Philz location (call me intense) and this one is by far the best. The customer service is nothing short of perfect and I feel so welcome every time. I have tried close to everything on the menu and have yet to find a flaw. I love that the staff members are my friends and we know eachother on first name basis. It gives me more reason to go daily, sometimes even twice if I'm feeling crazy! I highly HIGHLY recommend Philz but even more this location if you want excellent service and even better quality of coffee.

Oh, and I agree..the old manager a.k.a. the "grinch"...let's just say it's a good thing she is now known as the "old manager"...SHE SUCKED to be brutally honest.

Anyways...I love you Philz! See you tomorrow ;)
author: Bree G.

description:
Wow... just... wow.  Coming to SF definitely has opened my eyes to the world of single drip and I might just like Philz more than Blue Bottle.  

Everything is made fresh after you order on the spot via one of the talented guys/gals working behind the counter.  You go in, order through one of the guys/gals, then pay at the cashier.  The whole process could get a little messy but its well worth it.

First coffee I had was the Tesora which is the house blend.  Great medium roasted coffee with really balanced flavors.  Also got to try the Philharmonic, which is medium roasted beans brewed with cardamom.  The cardamom gives it a really exotic taste and aroma to the coffee.  

Plenty of dark and light roasts for you to choose from too and if you don't know what you like, just ask.  They are friendly and good at making recommendations!

A little pricier than your average SBux but yes, it's worth it.
author: Duke C.

description:
Had my second cup of Turkish coffee here and things didn't taste the same. My original cup from Van Ness tasted a lot smoother. 

The atmosphere was completely different and so crowded I couldn't even sit down on a Thursday late afternoon. I had to sit outside and this is the beginning of the winter winds.
author: M C.

description:
