Love Philz. Best coffee in the Bay Area. Location is a bit obscure, but glad that there's one in my hometown (Palo Alto) and my school (Berkeley) and my shopping area (SF - ok this one is not quite true, it's a bit hard to get to without a car. Closer to caltrain than it is to BART) 

:) mint mojito coffee errday!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Love Philz coffee, the best tasting coffee in SF. The way they individually make each cup and add sugar and milk to your liking is the best. I like the way they have 4 or 5 baristas to make your order and look you in the eye.  It is a lot more personal than say going to other coffee places where one or two people make everyones orders and they could care less how you like your coffee.  Great seating area and comfortable sofas. It's great to take my kid here too.
author: James W.

description:
Soy Iced Mint Mojito Coffee - WOW!

I am not even a huge coffee fan, but I do love mint and the barista did tell me this was one of the most popular drinks.They ask if you want it not too sweet, unsweetened, or sweet. They use honey and don't even charge you extra if you want soy milk.

My drink itself went down smoothly and the drink itself was incredibly creamy and the mint even coated my tongue which left a nice refreshing taste.
author: Kathy V.

description:
My co-workers and I love Philz so much we have weekly meetups here. And now its Philz Rhyme time.
Gabriel: Yes, Philz tomorrow
Angela: (cool)
Gabriel: We's gonna chilz at philz
Angela: don't fall off the window sillz?
Anthony: http://hotmeme.net/media/i/e/1/on1-ya-ll-got-any-more-of-that-philz.jpg
Gabriel: Don't go too much, you can't pay yo bilz
Angela: what doesn't killz you makes you stronger
Gabriel: run for the hilz, or maybe just drink some philz
Angela: Jack and Jillz
Gabriel: when I don't get my philz, I have to take some pilz
Anthony: Philz makes good coffee
Gabriel: you suck
Anthony: you guys already used all the rhymes
Angela: I do it for the thrillz
Anthony: :|
Gabriel: you still have time
Anthony: I'm literally running through rhymes in my head
Anthony: nope nothin
Angela: Gotte get me some milkz
Anthony: better hold that Philz, before it spillzzzz
Gabriel: don't have a sense of dread
Anthony: oooooo!!!
Angela: saw millz
Angela: eat some dillz
Gabriel: do some drilz when you drink yo philz
Angela: I eat krillz with my philz

Get the Philtered Soul. It's by far the best coffee they have.
author: Angela B.

description:
I am addicted to Philz.  

They will make your coffee the way you like it.  I normally have Ambrosia and Decaf Ethopian.  Yummy.  On a sunny day, you can grab and cup of Philz and go wonder along Berry Street and sit by Islais Creek.
author: Bessie T.

description:
A personal brewed coffee- it's delicious.  Add the mint for an extra unique flavor.

I personally like the $1 mini-cupcakes they also sell.  :D
author: Laleh J.

description:
This is my week for honoring threats b/c Philz is now off my list.....for their Chocolate Gingerbread Cookie

Result:  OMG - TASTY!!

Soft, gooey-ish cookie, really intense gingerbread flavor & the chocolate was mixed in & not necessarily a chip, if-you-will, but wowzers was it gewd!

Covered in sugar & broke apart as I tried to pick it up & that was *just* fine w/ me

Mocha was again super tasty & this time the temp was nice & hot so I can now officially report back that the previous lukewarm mocha was a fluke

Will DEF be coming back for Mochas & Cookies!!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I'm torn as I'm writing this review - I absolutely LOVE Philz coffee, and the coffee at this location really is great. 

My issue: the food. I've gotten heated food (quiche, breakfast burrito, etc) from the counter 3 times at this location, and each time I have gotten food poisoning. Handle your food properly Phil!!!!

Also- the layout of the store sucks. I have never come here and not bumped into people accidentally while waiting for my order.
author: Tailor A.

description: This location is clearly tailored for 9-to-5ers and not as hipster as the original Mission one, but the coffee's still just as amazing and made just the way you want it! I like some hardcore dark roasts and the Jacob's Wonderbar is SERIOUSLY dark without any sour aftertaste - it actually tastes a lot like a stout. Coffee this good doesn't need any diluting with sugar or cream - just take it straight up black and you will be blown away!
author: Clarice W.

description: My boyfriend and I are a homeless couple currently sleeping outside in San Francisco near this location of Philz Coffee. Sometimes at night when they are closing, the employees will bring us a bag of pastries they were going to throw out. It's so kind and considerate of them to take the time out of their night to think of us, and give us something to eat. All of their staff are super friendly and helpful, including the manager. I bought a large Philtered Soul coffee this morning, and it was worth every penny. Hands down the freshest, richest, coffee I have ever had. This flavor consists of hazelnut,  cocoa, and cinnamon. We love Philz! :)
author: Winter B.

description:
Philz is a great institution in San Francisco and I was happy to see that they opened up a location in mission bay.  Although I don't live in walking distance and have limited street parking, I still manage to drop by for morning coffees and love their selection.  Some of my favorite roasts are the Tantalizing Turkish and New Manhattan.  The turkish is a dark roast, great for coffee lovers with strong taste preferences.  It's especially great when they add in some cream and mint.  As for the New Manhattan, it's a medium/light roast that I like to enjoy straight up, nothing added.  I usually go back and forth between these two and try others whenever the mood strikes.

The location itself is a block from Caltrain, so it's nice to pick it up before hopping on (if you commute down south).  Otherwise, the other options if its not walking distance is MUNI or sometimes I just drive into the Safeway lot, park and walk over.  If you buy the min $5 in Safeway, validation is free.

They have free wifi, which is great, but it's intermittently out.  That seems to be the case for several coffee shops I've been to, til they finally get 4G up and running and into all devices, this'll what you'll have to deal with...
author: Alvin Y.

description:
Great coffee, lame customers!

I'm a big fan of Philz and their tasty coffees.  The tesora is a great introduction to Philz's large lineup of coffee blends. 

After hopping off the train in the morning I enjoyed going into this location and grabbing a cup of calming (yes, it's ironic) coffee (usually a Greater Alarm Mocha) to start my day.

One of the things that makes Philz coffee great also makes the experience annoying.  I love the "one cup at a time" care they put into individually brewing and crafting each drink but the way the lines are set up resembles some insane traffic jam.  You go in and order on one side....then proceed to the left to pay...then you have to wait around and recirculate back into the center of the store or mix back in with the line of people ordering. A bit chaotic but necessary because it does get crowded sometimes.  The worst part is that some morons insist on behaving like spawning salmon and squeezing out the "entrance" door where everyone's lined up waiting to order.  There is a nice "exit" door past the register that people never use because it's easier for them to just crash through 5-10 people waiting in line.  

Well, that just summarizes San Francisco for you though... =)

We now have Philz in my office so I'm a happy camper and am happy/sad I don't have/get to visit the Berry St store any more (except if I'm in SF on a weekend...then I must go there to get my Philz Phix in).
author: Richard C.

description:
I LOVE YOU GUYS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We swung by here to meet w/ the rest of the group before we sojourned out towards the Gilroy Garlic Festival.  

I stood in line behind 5 other people (out the door) at 10:30 a.m. and  finally heard the call "Next!" and jumped right up to the counter.

Me:  "Small Non Fat Latte - with the Wonderbrew beans please"
Barrista:  "Uh, you've never been here before, have you." (Statement of Fact - not a question).
Me:  (confused laugh & tentative smile) "No, I'm from SoCal"
Barrista:  "We don't make lattes or cappuccino type coffee drinks.  We do drip & we can add sugar/milk to our coffee."

--A few minutes of discourse of what type of beans there were, how popular Jacob's Wonderbrew is but not that much caffeine, do I want milk added, etc --

Me:  "Ok, may I have a small Wonderbrew black?"

I got my coffee after waiting about 5 minutes, during said wait time I had boytoy order me a chicken flaky crust bun thing.  She warmed it up for us but the inside was still cold.  Flavorful but wish it had warmed through.

I had my first sip of the Jacob's Wonderbrew and it was just heavenly.  *sigh*  I drank the whole cup & that caused me to have the peepee incident during the 3 hours of horrendous driving wait time to the Garlic Festival & caused us to detour out of the wait line to go find a restroom.

So uh, guys?  When are you going to open up a branch in Los Angeles?  Preferably near Glendale or Alhambra?  I will gladly give up my gold card VIP status at Starbucks to walk up to your counter any day!
author: Julia L.

description:
Cool...I like this place. The staff is really sweet, and the coffee is yum! 

I seem to always get the same couple things: sooo good, tesora, mocha, or istanbul treat. 

I order for me and my bf, and we get different things (ex: soo good and tesora) ..sometimes they mess up the order and make it all the same (soo good, no tesora).

After waiting 10 minutes, I really don't want to wait again, so I let it slide. 

Overall, I like it, will keep coming back. 

P.S It would be AMAZING if they had an app which let you buy the drinks online, place the order online, and then just walk in and pick it up with your name/confirmation number. sigh...
author: Maryam R.

description:
OKAY. I came back here JUST to purchase the most expensive featured coffee they have ($7 for a small)---Jamaican Blue Mountain...the beans are grown on some blue mountains region in Jamaica.

First sip. smooth. delicious.  and the caffeine rush was so awesome.... but not cray cray like Greater Alarm.

WOW!

last splurge for me before I become a broke ass grad student again.

=8)

UPDATE: OHHH DANG THIS IS SO SMOOTH and DELICIOUS! my gadz!   I feel so much clarity in my surroundings. WOW.
author: Grace M.

description: I'm addicted to coffee -- meaning, if I don't have coffee in the morning, someone will probably die. As such, I consider myself relatively well-versed in the world of caffeinated beverages. And Philz Coffee is divine. My NUMBER ONE FAVORITE is the Ecstatic Iced Coffee (seriously, you have to get it)... their Sooo Good, their mocha, and The New Manhattan are also delicious. Their blueberry danishes [warmed up] are bomb. The people that work here are very friendly & helpful, and the drinks come out pretty quickly considering the amount of attention given to each cup. Definitely a must try.
author: I. L.

description: I've been here twice and had to try the infamous iced mint mojito both time.  Each time is was equally as good.  The baristas was very helpful when I told him it was my first time to Philz.  He explained how the creaminess and sweetness scale worked.  I noticed they all ask you to try your drink before you leave to make sure they have crafted it to your liking.  I will definitely go back every chance I get.  Maybe on my next trip I will be more adventurous and try something else.
author: Annie E.

description:
Mocha Tesoro is all well and good but I don't think I will be worshiping the temple of Philz anytime soon. (Sorry guys)

The people behind the counter are knowledgeable and friendly and keep asking if that's the way (uh huh uh huh) you like your coffee. She asked if I wanted sugar and I told her I didn't like any sweetener so she customized my mocha tesoro just right with milk and cocoa. I also ordered the turkey sausage sandwich and I loved the fact that they microwaved it first (to heat up the meat) and then toasted it (for the crisp factor). However, maybe the unhealthy carnivore in me prefers the piggies so I would have preferred a regular meat patty. 

The coffee was good. I didn't have fireworks go off. Maybe i'm just a pretentious latte and cappuccino lover so I guess that's why I will always go to my two faves - curbside and Blue Bottle.
author: Karen K.

description:
Philz, the home of the mint mojito, is a SF institution. They serve great coffee, and their baristas are very knowledgeable and passionate about their jobs. You can tell that the people that work at Philz have bought into the mission statement because they go the extra mile to make sure your drink is perfect. They always ask me to take a sip after they've made my drink to ensure it's to my liking. I've never had to send my drink back but I'm sure they'd replace it if I didn't like it. 

Every time I go I like to get something different but you'll hear a lot of people talking about their mint mojito specialty drink. It's great tasting, refreshing and perfect for a warm summer day. I also like the ginger version, but I'm finding that I their simple dark roast coffee's best. They prepare each cup of coffee individually so that also adds to the artisan feel. You're looking at spending about $4-5 on a cup of coffee so it's not cheap but totally worth it when you consider the quality of the coffee, and the level of service you're getting. If you're looking to just satsfy a cheap caffeine fix then this might not be the place for you but if you want to try a well prepared coffee drink and savor each sip then give Philz a try. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: Finally went in here after seeing many check-ins from friends and FB posts stating this is the best coffee ever. I gave in during my recent trip to SF. Do they meet the hype? Pretty much. I had their gingersnap iced coffee, well worth it! Friendly staff and although they don't have the nationwide presence compared to the machine(aka Starbucks), I see why the City likes Philz. Definitely would go back for their iced coffee or check out their SoCal location in Santa Monica.
author: Neil N.

description: I really do not like this place. I was treated with much contempt the first time I walked in: the staff was shocked that I didnt understand their senseless system, and that I am a vegan, and that I enjoy my coffee the way I like it. No, I don't want to leave my 5 dollar drink up to some random guy. And the finished product was awful. Never again
author: Sarah B.

description:
I finally made it over to Philz to give it a whirl and to question what the hype is all about.

Amazing cup of brew!  Jacob with cream and extra sugar... WOW!!
 
It's very smooth and didn't have that burnt roast that you would typically get from a cup of Peet's.  Two thumbs up for Philz will definitely return for more.
author: JADE L.

description: Pure awesomeness. By the cup or the pound, damn, it's orgasmic! We've also been making it with our home espresso machine. Heavenly
author: Ottis M.

description:
I love you Philz!

I've become addicted to the gingersnap iced coffee. I have a bad feeling that it is "seasonal" (quotes are because SF does not really have seasons).

I think there is a cookie at the bottom that disintegrates into your coffee. And even though the last sip is a bit unpleasant (read: grimy)... the rest is just so damn good you won't care. They usually put cream and sugar in the iced coffees so make sure you specify. I usually take just a little cream in my coffee but the gingersnap needs a little sugar too. It really is a treat! 

Oh and I tried their turkey sausage breakfast sandwiches and they are actually very good (pepperjack cheese? yes please). Too bad they don't have ketchup. (Is ketchup on eggs an east coast thing?)

As for regular coffee... I really like the Ambrosia blend. 

I also like the Tesora, Canopy of Heaven, Silken Splendor... and probably anything else I get around to trying after they discontinue the gingersnap and break my heart. (please don't)
author: Melissa H.

description:
I honestly hate to be a hater.

But after being in the corporate coffee industry for such a long time and never giving Philz a try- I thought that today should be the day.  I was actually pumped that I was finally trying the much-hyped PHILZ.

I was stunned, literally, when I couldn't make in the doorway because of the line of customers waiting to order at 3pm this afternoon.  This really made me think that the I've been such an idiot for my love of Sight Glass, Farley's & Equator Coffee all these years...seemed to me that the crowd at Philz should have been an indicator of an amazing coffee experience.

I'm a regular latte, cafe a lait, or cappuccino drinker.  Espresso and HOT milk.  That's all I'm really after.  No sugar, no fuss.  Just espresso and HOT milk.

I was told:  No espresso (even though it was on the menu?).  No hot milk.

I explained that I NEED hot milk.  I even own a one-hundred dollar electric hot-milk-maker-thingy at home because I NEED hot milk.  No luck.  

The "coffee maker dude" (not an actual "barista"...because barista's actually pull a shot of espresso) suggested that he'll make me something great.  Insisting that they prefer to "shake" the milk which is promised to be a superior experience to my beloved HOT milk.

After a long, LONG wait.  I ended up with a strong, STRONG cup of coffee.  SO STRONG in fact, that I couldn't drink it and brought it home so that I can warm it up with some DAMN HOT MILK tomorrow morning to make it drinkable.

I am utterly stunned that this institution is gaining serious momentum in the marketplace.  Don't get me wrong, I'm all for tipping my hat to any business that is thriving in this economy.  But I am sincerely shocked that in our "have it your way" society this place is thriving.

Simply:  Not for me.
author: Stacey M.

description: Had a bad customer service experience here and after writing about it, the owner contacted me and apologized. I love a company that actually cares enough to do this and listens to the experiences of paying customers.
author: Julie S.

description: Love coming to this one once in a while, and sit outside with my perfect cup of coffee. The batistas seem really happy here, even though it gets super busy. Recently tried their tantalizing turkish, and I think I've found my new favorite here.
author: H K.

description: Love this place their mint mojito is the best. It is the perfect balance of mint and coffee I have ever had!  You wont be disappointed  :)
author: Carol C.

description: Easily the best coffee I've ever had...and I love coffee whether it be gourmet or instant.  Philz has something special for everybody.  The service is impeccable as well.  Really happy to have a Philz close by!!
author: Brad A.

description: Due to bad store space planning, the line is usually out the door which makes me want to continue down the street to somewhere else that's less crowded. If they moved around equipment a bit they could keep their line shorter.
author: Tory C.

description: Philz coffee is my absolute favorite!  The taste is quite unique and I am hooked.  My all time favorite is the greater alarm, it has the most caffeine.  I also really like the soo good.  I like this location because it is right by the ballpark and about 5 minutes form work.  A major negative though is the parking around there is very limited and metered.  The space is nice, but not big enough for the demand.  I wish they had one big table down the middle.  It always seems to be cold in there too.  Despite all that, the main attraction of course is the coffee!  I go there to get my beans too and I make it at work every day since I cannot always get there.  I also got to the Berkeley location, which I love!  I so wish there was one right next to my office and one in the Walnut Creek area because then I would go more often.  If you are a coffee drinker, then it is a must!  You have to go and try it!!  Even if you aren't, maybe you can be converted.  I do beleive they have some teas and decaffeinated options for those of you who don't like coffee or are sensitrive to caffine, but who doesnt like coffee, thats crazy!!  Go to Philz, you won't regret it!  In fact yu will be hooked!
author: Megan M.

description:
Are you a coffee connoisseur? No, really- do you LOVE coffee?

 If the answer is "of course", "yes", "maybe" or "I prefer tea", Philz is a place for you. Why? Not only will you find a roast that you'll love (if you are a coffee lover) but you'll also get educated on coffee beans in general and start liking coffee (if you currently prefer tea)

This place has over 30 (yes, THIRTY) different roasts. I've been getting my coffee here for years and it's STILL my favorite coffee place in San Francisco! Their motto is "one cup at a time" so make sure to tell them how you like your cream and sugar (none, light, medium or regular!)
author: Elma C.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee--that was what hooked me into Philz primarily. They have pretty good pour over coffee. Ive also bought coffee beans from them. They have a large selection of coffee beans that are fresher than the ones you can buy at starbucks.
author: Pam Y.

description:
*how i fell in love with philz (coffee)*

like a legend, i've always heard about how great you are but put off coming to see you because you're in the opposite direction of my morning commute. you were always a mystery to me because after countless minutes of perusing your website and yelp reviews, i was left confused by all your drink choices. 

well philz, this morning was sunny and warm so i took a stroll around the hood for you. i came in and stood in what i thought was a line, except it wasn't. anyway, back to the point...when i finally approached the counter, i asked for a large turkish. your lovely barista suggested i try the red secret instead. since i was a philz coffee virgin, what did i know? she asked if i wanted cream/sugar, i said a little of both. i perused the pastry case and asked for a fruit bar and your cashier suggested i should get it warmed. 

finally, the lovely barista called out "large red secret" and the girl behind the register handed over my warm fruit bar. i found a sunny table outside, sat down, took a sip of my red secret and it was love at first sip. it was bold, creamy, and the sweetness of cardamom kissed my senses in all the right places.  i reached into the paper bag and broke a piece off the warm, gooey, and crumbly fruit bar.  it was so buttery, sticky, and warm...oh my god.

i savored every sip and bite and was sad when it was all over.  as i walked away from you, a smile came across my face as memories of the red secret lingered on my tongue.  we were meant to be, philz.  i'll be back.  

until next time...
author: Sally T.

description:
My favorites are Ecstatic Iced Coffee and the chunky Big Oat Bar (from Nabolom bakery)! 

Prime location (right by SF caltrain station)
Friendly staff
GOOD coffee
Customizable drinks (half sweet, decaf, low-fat version = skim milk with a dash of half and half - If you don't specify which milk, they use half and half)

I try to stop by every morning. I am a fan of philz!
author: Eunice M.

description:
I first tried Philz coffee by buying the Jacob's Wonderblend at Whole Foods and brewed the coffee at home. I was sorely disappointing and couldn't figure out why...until i visited Philz Coffee themselves! 

I visited Philz after the Hunger Bowl and my impression totally changed. 
First, they offer like 30 something blends with helpful descriptions plastered around their store. I ordered the famous medium roast Tesora, at the recommendation of my friend. 

Second, they ground each cup fresh and brew it through their special filtering process. What was supposed to be just a simple cup of coffee turned out to be a frothy smooth and aromatically/tastfully strong cup of coffee- enough to waken the senses after a long day but not so bitter that it tastes like Starbucks. 

Third, I figured out why my home brew tasted so bad. I asked the staff how they brew their coffee and told them how my home brew came out so bland. The girl at the counter asked me a bunch of questions and we determined that I wasn't grinding the beans fine enough. NOTE TO PEOPLE BUYING THE COFFEE FOR HOME: Do a fine grind on the beans, not medium coarse or coarse. That's how much they grind it at Philz. 

Thank you Philz! I'm excited to try their dark roast blends now that I believe in their flavor. Big possibility I will change my rating to 5 stars once  I find my dream beans among their variety!
author: Cecilia T.

description:
I don't get what people find to this place.  Maybe they have great beans but they only do drip coffee so their great beans all end up producing watered down drinks.

About anything will produce a much richer and bolder cup: from the mocha pot to the cheapest espresso machine.  When you consider that you can get a very dense and bold espresso from Ritual beans at the Creamery one block away, I am very unlikely to ever return to this place.
author: Yannick G.

description:
"Large  Jacobs medium medium" are the only words you will ever need to say inside Philz.  Like everybody else, I am addicted and can never go back to Starbucks.  You can also catch ESPN or I Love Lucy in the mornings on their TV while you wait.

Parking at this location in the mornings is not bad.  You can usually find a meter spot in the residential areas.
author: Danny P.

description: YUM!! I can't believe it took me so long to try Philz! I tried the mint mojito iced coffee and omg it was amazing. I ordered as is, which is sweet and creamy. I love how the coffee is made per order..but that does cause the line to move along at a slower pace. It's so worth it though..and I think there's an app where you can order ahead! I can't wait to try the regular coffees.
author: Vaishali S.

description:
Hahahaha the dood behind the counter, sipped coffee as he worked the cashier....So casual here.

My boyfriend said they have the best iced-mocha's here. And I agree. This place deserves 300+ reviews.  Thats telling you something. *HELLA GOOD"
author: Tiffany M.

description: Coffee done right! Just how you want it! Can't get any better than this !  Barista Brosnan Rhodes and fellow staff are very knowledgeable in the various blends, tastes and textures! Made to order this is a coffee aficionado's dream ! Selections are quite wide ranging and exotic... conveniently located, friendly and quite cozy the coffee shop also offers various sweets with many gluten free vegan options.
author: Lauren R.

description:
I was a sceptic walking in. It doesn't look that good from the outside. But you get a sense things might be slightly different when you see dozens of different beans on offer. 

You can just tell from the questions they ask and the advice they give that they're really serious about what they do.

And... the coffee did not disappoint. I consider myself a serious frigging coffee drinker, too. These guys know their stuff. Highly recommended!
author: James A.

description:
I LOVE their ICED COFFEES and their Iced Coffee w/ Mint! YUM! I wished I had a Philz near me. I like how they ask you how it tastes and if they can make it more customized for your taste buds. I enjoy going there!

My friends and I just lounged and caught up on their nice comfy couches.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Holy Cow this place is good!  I've tried Blue Bottle and Farm: Table in SF.  Both places had great coffee but I still needed a lot of cream and sugar to put it in that excellent category.  Not with Philz Coffee...serve that stuff black to taste the smoothness, then add just a little sugar and cream to taste.  These folks are coffee experts.   When you walk in, they know if you are a regular or not, I obviously wasn't.  So the barista explained to me the various coffees they served and asked if I wanted to try any flavors.  After deciding on "So Good", she made it right in front of me and then asked me to try it to make sure I liked it.  No one at starbucks does that, ever.  The coffee was excellent.  It didn't have that gross acidic aftertaste that most coffee has.  It had the caffeine buzz of authentic Turkish coffee without the sludge at the bottom.

What I like about Philz is that they don't try to be a jack of all trades, they just do one thing and do it well....Coffee (heh, and tea I guess).  And their shop is a comfortable place to study or hang out.

Definitely going back.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Walked from Union Square to this place.
Loved!

Got the ecstatic iced coffee, medium.. which was, indeed, ecstatic! 
They brew every cup. Fresh, bold and smooth.
Employees were very friendly and recommended specifics, which I love. 
Lots of seating, both tables and couches.

I just wish the cups were bigger =( Will be making a trip there again if I'm ever in SF!
author: Candice H.

description: Mocha Tesora or Mojito are my favorites.   Worth the price, but it's best not to develop the daily habit.
author: Jon H.

description:
Philz coffee can turn a non-coffee lover into an addict.  I already love coffee and have been trying to give myself a break from it but then, I walked by a Philz location in San Francisco and was tranced by the aroma.  The menu seems a bit overwhelming as I wasn't familiar with their preparations and flavors. But thank goodness for the hip, friendly, knowledgeable baristas, they broke it down for me. They asked what notes of flavors I prefer in a coffee and if I like it more on the sweeter side. 
So I was recommended the Jacobs wonder bar to break me in for my first time.  It was perfectly sweetened with just enough foam.  They add the milk and sugar depending on your taste.  The barista made sure that I tasted to see if it was to my liking or else he would make another one. That's some friendly service. I was hooked! This cup was enough to wake up all my senses and felt like I could take on the world. 
 I went back over the weekend and tried another favorite of mine the Philtered Soul - Holy-coffee! I was feeling my philtered soul. 
After trying this place, I'm sure your ordinary coffee will get the boot and you will crave  some Philz.
author: Veronica C.

description:
I came here for the first time this week on my way to a jobsite during work.  I had been wanting to try their coffee after reading positive and interesting reviews on Yelp (not necessarily for this location but for the company overall).  I went in and was almost overwhelmed by the coffee selection.  It helped that they had a chart that describes each one and also categorizes the roasting of each (light, medium, or dark).  Finally I asked a server for a recommendation saying it's my first time here and she came up with a very good one (I forgot the name but it was excellent).  I definitely will return for more whenever I have chance to pass by here.

Another unique aspect of this business is that it's a full-service coffee bar. They add the creme and sugar for you if that's what you want in your drink.  There are no sugar packs, etc., around unlike other coffee locations I've been to so far.
author: H K.

description:
I think I don't get the Philz thing. But if I do, it's 'coffee for people who don't like coffee'. Yes, I know I can control the levels of sugar and cream, but most people don't. And black? The coffee is average.

The mint mojito is super tasty, but so sweet that it tastes only vaguely of coffee. Ditto the Mocha Tesora (though you can get it not sweet, and it's actually fantastic!).

My final complaint is the menu. With dozens of blends, it's hard to remember what is better or worse than anything else, especially since the tasting notes bear no resemblance to the beverage (I certainly don't get grapefruit or currants in my Soooo Good, the way I might in a single origin Kenyan coffee), the blends taste similar, and there seems to be some amount of variation cup-to-cup and store-to-store.

When in a pinch I do get Philz, I OrderAhead, which I can't do any more at this location. :(
author: Justin M.

description: Went to philz today and yea it was good great and actually awesome as usual. Mocha tesora is good but I like the mint mojito now. It's a great blend of coffee and is rather unique. Get some before they run out jk but in all seriousness philz rocks!
author: Darryl S.

description: If you don't love Philz, you either 1) don't like coffee, or 2) have poor taste. Don't be afraid to be picky; if you don't like your coffee, tell them and they will fix it.
author: Winston L.

description: Philz is a quintessential piece of San Francisco and Bay Area coffee shops / brands. It's basically the high-quality answer to Starbucks, with custom and individualized attention to each drink, quality ingredients, and a lovely atmosphere. All that while still having assurances that you know what you'll get regardless of the location you go to.
author: Milan T.

description:
A coffee addict at heart! 

Originally from Chicago where only Starbucks, Peets, and Gloria Jeans were available. Starbucks was always first on my list, but not until I moved to SF, met my roommate who introduced me to Philz! 

Before walking into Philz, I was hesitant because all I knew about was Starbucks.  

As I walked into Philz, I can smell coffee in the air. I was impressed with the way the coffee bar was set up. Confused with the different flavors offered, my roommate ordered for me. 

"Philtered Soul"

As I was watching the barista mixing and brewing my cup off coffee, no cream & no sugar please! I was so excited, I couldn't  wait. 

I finally got my cup of coffee. It felt hot & toasty. I closed my eyes and inhaled the aroma. Place the cup to my lips and sipped away. 

The cacao, chocolate flavor burst in my mouth. I walked out the door with one big smile. 

I have to admit, this is seriously an amazing cup of coffee that I've ever had. 

Scratch Starbucks, scratch Peets, scratched Gloria Jeans............call me boogie, but I'm all about Philz!

Thanks to my Roomie, David!
author: Jessica P.

description: I'm having my last mint mojito today and will be leaving for Chicago tomorrow...this will be what I'm gonna miss the most from the bay area's food/drink.
author: Anony B.

description:
HOT CHOCOLATE and FARMER CHEESE, PLEASE...!

Ever since Philz Coffee was introduced to me, I come here every morning before taking Caltrain to work. The staff are so friendly and quick to take your order.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Two girls walk into a coffee shop in SF with one fiending for her coffee fix and the biggest die hard Dunkin Donuts Coffee fan.

The non- local girl asks "What do I get?"

The Barista responds, "What's your mood?"

"Umm.. I like coffee.. Dunkin Donuts kind?"
"Well.. What we do here is %&^*&@#@#@(*# fancy coffee talk &)(*^%$^& and make each cup at a time and %&^#$&#(*$l"
"Huh. Ok. I'll try the #19"

And the process began.  I'm not too sure what the #19 is that I ordered, but it was tasty.  She sweetened it and creamed it according to my liking and the whole process was a show and entertaining.  

It's good and I won't deny them that.  But it's a show.  Perhaps, my palate simply is not refined, but for a gal who likes Hazelnut Dunkin Donuts or even McDonalds Drive Through coffee.. This place was just a bit too much for an everyday thing, and a bit pretentious.  Once in awhile.. sure! But not a go to place for me.

And to the ever so handsome esque barista that my friend said, "HEY! My friend is going to yelp the shieeeet out of this place." As you can see, my review simply will be lost in your sea of 500 some odd reviews. :)

***UPDATE: 04/20/11: Lily followed up via Yelp regarding my review and invited me back to try them again.  It was a cordial message and would consider coming back there again.

***UPDATE: 04/24/11: Lily sent me two bags of coffee to try them again.  The excellent customer service and follow up has definitely upped this place to 4 stars and brought them down to reality.  Brewing their coffee on my own without their fancy ways still worked well.  I enjoyed thoroughly the Julia's Ultimate over Itz the Best Blend.
author: Natalie G.

description: Wow!  I've been recommended Philz Coffee for months and finally got around to dropping by.  While the menu was a bit overwhelming, the barista was incredibly friendly and helpful and recommended a delicious iced coffee, added a perfect amount of sugar and cream, and even some mint leaves (and she properly smacked them, rather than mashing).  The coffee was delicious!  Absolutely worth the extra 3 block walk from the Starbucks.
author: Greg B.

description:
Oh.My.GOSH! 

I've heard about Philz for years from my friend who went to SJSU and how she raved about it. (This coming from a girl who didn't like coffee so I should know it's THAT good huh?) I love how they brew every coffee right then and there and add cream and sugar to your liking.

Me being not a big coffee drinker, I had to have them add a LOT of sugar and CREAM! Therefore, a sweet and creamy. The one drink I really wanted to try was the Mint Mojito but, I opted out and got the Philtered Soul.

I was looking at the board for a coffee that'll suit me because I'm just not a huge fan of just coffee. It's so bitter to me.  I took a gander at the board and see the golden word.."HAZELNUT". That sold me on the Philtered Soul.  I was hesitant on getting it but why not? I'll just try it as a small.  I told the barista that I NEED it not bitter...I'm a mocha kinda girl.  She understood and just made this amazing cup of hazelnut coffee. Omgsh! Creamy and sweet with a hint of hazelnut. I was SO bummed I just got a small! I was oh so tempted to get another cup but if I did, I don't think I would fall asleep that night. Hah. 

Then something was bugging me in the back of my brain. I REALLY wanted to try the Mint Mojito. I called my mom right away and asked her if she wanted to try it. Best of both worlds, i get my amazing philtered soul and try the mint mojito.  

I finally got the drink and my goodness was it amazing! Oh so minty and creamy topped with mint leaves.  It's an iced drink so it's a nice cool drink for the summer. Now, every time I'm near a Philz, I HAVE TO GO IN! I was in the UCSF area yesterday and I to go to work. Psh, I didn't care! I didn't mind circling around looking for parking just to get a coffee from there. That's how legit it is! =)
author: Denise L.

description: FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE! Extremely attentive and responsive management as well. Best I've experienced at any establishment, anywhere -- as if Philz couldn't rule more than it already does.
author: Cam Y.

description:
Came here today around 4ish pm. It was pretty crowded. My friend and I ordered a mocha and a iced tea. The tea was mine. It took a while for our drinks to be made. I got cream and honey with my tea. I didn't really like mine. =[ It had a weird after-taste.
The couch was really comfy but its less home-y than the one on van ness.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I love the muffin, its tiny and pricey but its not that sweet. 

jacobs coffee hyped me up -_-
author: Cloudy P.

description:
Crack in your coffee? Nope! That's just a perfect tasting coffee!
If you haven't come to Philz to grab a coffee then it's time to give starbucks a break and try this place out!

They have so many choice of coffee!! It's so hard to choose! I usually go with the Chai but, I want something new so I went with the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee. Yes it may sound weird but it's one of the most delicious coffee ever! I definitely recommend this!

The best part about Philz is that you kind of have your own barista. They make it, "one cup at a time" and makes sure you leave the shop happy :)
author: Lianne D.

description: Honestly, what's not to like about Philz.... the only think you need to order is the Mint Mojito.
author: Joyce M.

description: The coffee takes time to make but that's ok.  It's a great cup of coffee!  I am glad I have discovered this location that is so close to the ballpark.
author: Brent T.

description:
I'll preface this review--I don't drink coffee.  Through the swooning of my friends and line out the door, I'll assume it's good.

I came in to order a tea and a bite as I missed the Caltrain by about two minutes and had an hour to kill.  One of the few places worth going to within a block of the station (especially on an early morning when trying to get home after waking up in the City in someone else's bed), I needed to get a fix of something to get my day jumpstarted.

A very local vibe, I saw Phil and his baristas working the line.  I could tell there were regulars, as he knew what to get started for someone just getting in queue toward the back.  Everything ordered is custom-made, with the obligatory hipster vegan (wouldn't comment on the food) serving me a straight-up black tea at the perfect steep and temperature.  She barraged me with options of mint, honey, sugar, and others, but I don't like a lot of sweet in the morning.

I moved up the line to pay and on Phil's recommendation, picked up a bacon breakfast burrito.

It wasn't hard finding a seat, as the majority of the patrons were scurrying back to their mornings in the office.  Things were organized and efficient, so there wasn't any friction in getting in and out.  A TV with ESPN hung in the corner and there were comfortable couches and arm chairs full of people typing away at emails and reading their morning Bloomberg business reports.  On a shelf lay some books and board games, indicating that things slow down at some point for a casual hang out.

The burrito was microwaved and surprisingly sufficient, while the tea was perfectly balanced and ordinary.  I'm sure the coffee is to die for, and my experience got my day started without. A hitch.  I would recommend checking it out if you need a new stop better than Starbucks or Peet's for your commute.
author: Max K.

description:
Though Philz has a reputation for turning coffee into a sweet treat, their coffee served black is quite good as well. I haven't had a bad experience with any of their beans. The wide variety of beans and roasts available makes for a fun, new experience every time.

Though I drink my coffee black, the cream and sugar at Philz has been described by my coworkers as crack. They add the cream and sugar themselves behind the bar, so it could very well be crack...

Must try:
Mint mojito iced coffee.
Any coffee with cream and sugar
author: Brian L.

description: This is the bomb.com. I really am not a coffee drinker, but my non-coffee drinking boyfriend recommended the Iced Mint Mojito coffee. It is as good as everyone says. Get it!
author: Belyn L.

description: That place is coffee heaven! I really love that you can order your coffee directly with milk/ cream and/ or sugar and the barista adds it directly keeping the fine coffee taste to perfection...but bring some time, the place is usually packed!
author: Joerg B.

description: Coffee lover's nirvana.  Line can be a bit long during rush hour(s) but worth the wait.  Lots of tea options too. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating available.  Bring a newspaper.
author: J R.

description: I went here on Election Day last year on my break from working at the Elections in SoMA. I spotted Philz on the way to the voting place and decided to go back during my first break. My first impression, it's for hipsters. But, the coffee there is the best. They have all these different blends there and being a caffeine freak, I went for the 3 Way Alarm(?) blend. The blend had a smokey, chocolatey aroma to it and it tasted amazing! For once, coffee that tastes exactly the way it is priced, a bit pricey but exceptional in quality. Overall 5/5 stars guys, I will be back soon!
author: Richard L.

description:
Deeeelish! I had the coffee mojito - it was a mix of coffee and sugar and mint -- just the perfect amount of sweetness. I felt like I was having a coffee milkshake.

I don't think I've ever met staff that is this friendly and knowledgeable. They seemed truly passionate and educated about their product. Next time I go back I'll go with something a little more hardcore than my minty frothy iced coffee -- will report back.
author: Michelle T.

description: Good coffees and teas. They have solid customer service but can be inconsistent in the preps of their chai teas. It would be amazing if they had nutritional information on their drinks because I suspect that they use a 1/4  cup of heavy whipping cream which is super caloric. Their pastries (forget what bakery they come from) are mediocre bordering on bad. Good vibes.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: I love Philz! Try the mint mojito coffee, it's the perfect blend of creamy, sweet mint, coffee and ice. The line does get pretty long and it can be confusing for new visitors. Tip: wait by the front door until a barista calls you up, order your drink and then pay.
author: Aimee O.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I'm still addicted to the crack in a cup coffee that Philz serves but am more than a bit perturbed for several reasons, 1) my "go-to" crack magician is no longer there which has directly affected my coffee experience..I've been experience less than stellar coffee ever since she was let go which leads me to the 2nd reason I am perturbed. There seems to be a whole LOT of turn over at this particular location!? 

Needless to say, having to retrain a new Philz employee to make my coffee just the way I prefer it takes patience & time which I don't have a problem with BUT, the problem I DO have is having to deal with the inconsistency!
author: Soozie H.

description: Went here for the first time last week and was fully satisfied with my drink. There's a lot to choose from ; and you can request how strong, creamy, sweet...your cup of coffee should be. Nice place to sit and relax. Sometimes paying a little more for coffee is worth it. As a coffee drinker, it's always a plus to drink freshly made coffee while you wait .
author: Nixon L.

description: A tad bit pricey, but I treat myself at least a couple times a month to Philz's Ecstatic Iced Coffee. Legit. Amazing!
author: Anthony W.

description:
Unfreakinbelievably awesome drip coffee!!! They are to drip what blue bottle is to espresso.

Phil we love you -- whoever you are, wherever you are -- thank you for bringing your awesome love for coffee to the Bay. Each employee I've worked with strives to make every person who comes in the door the "perfect" cup of coffee and I can attest that they do this amazingly well. I've only sampled a few blends, but what I have tried is smooth, fresh, and so so tasty. Yum.
author: John A.

description: philz, you got me! now i am not a coffee drinker at all like AT ALL, so i can only comment on the teas and hot chocolates (hehe) i usually order the hot chocolate with no sugar and it is probably the best i have had yet. Caffinos in the peninsula was the one to beat and it happened. Teas are amazing when they put the mint in it very soothing, you got me man and im glad!
author: Nessa H.

description:
12.19.10

Philz to me is a little burst of happiness that caters to your every specific need.

Each cup is made individually, with TLC.  I've never had a bad experience with any of the baristas.

Mocha Tesora, 2% milk, semi-sweet, extra hot.

If it's not the most amazing cup of java designed specifically for you, well, they'll just tweak it and make it truly yours.

Stolen my heart.
author: Jenny L.

description: I got the estatic iced coffee.  My taste buds were bombarded with all kinds of great coffee flavors.  I can't explain it, kind of like if you were to walk into teavana and asked them to put all the amazing flavors into one cup.  If I could I would drunk five cups but I'm nursing ;_;
author: Giang D.

description:
Came here this morning after a longgg night of partying. Needed something to wake me up and I've never been to Philz before so my friend took me here to get some caffeine in our system. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the huge list of choices. I'm extremely bad at making decisions so I had my friend pick something for me as long as I got it black. He ordered me a Tesora which is one of his favorites. He got the Greater Alarm with soymilk and light sugar.

I must say, this was the best cup of coffee I've ever had. I like my coffee black, and I've had some coffee thats tasted like straight dirt water. But Philz was bold, and packed with flavor. It woke me up after the 2nd sip. I tried some of his coffee which was also good, a little stronger in my opinion but I assume thats why its called the "Greater Alarm." There aren't any Philz Coffee's in my neighborhood which sucks but after today, I have no problem with traveling to any of the locations for their coffee. I will definitely be back !
author: Tammie P.

description:
Muni was late, no surprise there, so I missed the Caltrain and decided to pass the time until the next departure at Philz. Of all the times I've been screwed by the molasses-grade transportation in this city, I was pleased with the opportunity that resulted this time around. 

I had a delightful yerba mate that was perfectly balanced, not at all bitter or over-steeped like some places. I also had a breakfast burrito that was pretty tasty as well. It was pre-made but they use a little toaster oven, not a microwave, to heat stuff. The toaster oven is definitely an underutilized appliance. Anyway, it was toasty and I enjoyed it. 

There's plenty of staff so not much of a wait, even at peak hours. The only thing is that they all just help whoever looks like they need to be helped, but in no particular order. If you're a stickler for lines and proper queue etiquette, this may annoy you. I guess its good for quick service, just seems a little unorganized. The atmosphere is pleasant and I really dig the throwback emo jams they were playing. Overall, well worth the short walk past Panera.
author: Jessica M.

description: Philz coffee never fails me. Get it sweet and creamy and enjoy the complex molasses flavor brown sugar adds to really deep rich coffee. They have the formula down here.
author: John H.

description: Love the easy and close freeway access. I pass a lot of Starbucks/Peet's et al on the way here.....for a reason. Great coffee.
author: William S.

description: Best coffee I've ever had in my whole.entire.life. This is not a good thing, however. Philz have just ruined me for all other coffee shops. How will I ever go back to other coffee chains? Had the Tantalizing Turkish and Jamaican Blue Mountain. Both are very good, but I think I prefer the Turkish one because it's a dark roast. It's coffee crack, I tell you. Coffee will never taste the same again!
author: Annie L.

description: Less crowded than the Van Ness location, faster and cheerful service, and who can really pass up the iced mint mojito?! Best thing about Philz
author: Diana Y.

description:
Philz is known for great coffee, but many people don't know they have great tea too!

By the time I got to the bottom of my first cup, I was hooked. Now, I'm a regular. My only warning is once you drink Philz tea, you may not be able to go back to other, lesser teas.
author: Ed M.

description: Philz Coffee only serves drip coffee and as unpalatable as the idea is to me I might actually like steamed milk more than I like coffee, but not more than I like caffeine.
author: Erich V.

description: It's worth the wait.  Customized coffee to your liking 1 drip at at time!  They even ask you taste it if it needs any adjustment.  Best coffee out there!  My favorite is the mocha tesora.  My husband is the code 33.  Helpful descriptions of the coffees you can order which helps you decide when you're wondering what to order.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Great mojito iced coffee. Very unique coffee drink and if you are in SF near AT&T park it's a must see.
author: Mike M.

description: Good lord that's good coffee. The menu goes from dark to light roast, with each bean featuring tasting notes. As a chocoholic, I went with the Jacob's Wonderbar but I also had to get a mint iced coffee so I could try both. Oh man, I'm really, really glad I don't live around here or I'd be coming back several times a day. It's easily the best coffee I've ever had, anywhere.
author: David M.

description:
If you like chocolate and coffee, Mocha Tesora is the way to go :) The first sip itself is so energizing and refreshing.. You will just want more ..  One of best mocha  I ever had :) 

Mint mojito is also a must try here ..
author: R P.

description: It takes between 7-12 min to get in and get on your way for those stopping in before catching a southbound train. My go-to is the ecstatic iced coffee when it's hot out, and the silken soul when it's cool. Never get more than light cream and sugar if you actually enjoy the taste of a good coffee roast. Most of their blends taste best black. I will add light cream and sugar as a source of fuel for my morning bicycle commute.
author: Rich W.

description:
I can never look at another cup of coffee the same way.

Once you've experienced Philz, you'll realize that you've never had a real cup of coffee in your life! Philz has a wide selection of special, black coffees, ranging from light to dark with interesting names like "Soooooooo Good" and "It'z the best." And yes, they really do have the right to give their coffees such cocky names.

Admittedly, I was overwhelmed by all the choices and uncertain about which to try. The barista told me that Jacob's Wonderbar was a popular choice, so I decided to go along with it. He then proceeded to make my coffee. No mass production here. Each cup of coffee gets equal TLC from the baristas. They even sweeten it for you and ask if you want more sugar.

My coffee had the overwhelming flavor of love (sorry, that was cheesy). But really, it was delicious. Chocolatey, but not sweet in the sense of a mocha. It was perfect and unlike any blend I've ever tasted.

I should be angry that my self-brewed Folgers coffee in the morning is no longer enjoyable, but just a cup of regular Joe.
author: Emily T.

description: Customer service sucks, a whole bunch of hoity-toity hullabaloo to get a simple cup of coffee. Don't patronize this place, you'll only add to the trend of coffee being more important than it needs to be...I went to a big chain coffee house instead and got service with a smile.
author: Jordan G.

description: Super friendly and helpful staff.  Don't drink coffee, so I tried the mint chai tea.  It looked cute and was good.  The breakfast burritos are yummy too!
author: Lily N.

description:
i'll preface this by saying i used to be a passionately loyal starbucks barista who hated on all other coffee places 24/7. then came philz.

the coffee is soooooo good. sooooooo good. i went home (chicago) for two weeks this spring and literally what i missed most about sf was philz. when i was looking for a new apt in a different neighborhood i made "close to a philz" one of my criteria. i won't even complain about the fact that you pick up your coffee from the same place that you order it (organizational no no) because yummmmm simply amazing. cute baristas at this location, too! 

sorry sbux!! we might hook up again when i'm in another city and feeling tired/abandoned but i'll be wishing you're someone else when we do. :(
author: Liz F.

description:
Great (strong) coffee, tasty edibles and friendly relaxed atmosphere. 
Though, not perfect with the 3 ways to queue for order, pay, pick up coffee and all cross each other.
author: Al A.

description: It brings me great sadness to knock them down to 3 stars.  Past 2 visits, the coffee has been BLAND.  We always get the same coffee, Julie's and Jacob's and first bland occurrence, wrote it off to new barista we've never seen.  Second time, shame on you Philz.  May be time to move on to somewhere new.
author: Will I A m.

description: I love Philz Coffee. This location has great service and delicious drinks! My favorite is the Mocha Tesora Iced with no cream or sugar!
author: Diana F.

description:
The coffee here is fantastic. If you drink decaf the Swiss Water Decaf is the best I've had.
Check out a full review with pictures here - http://beanaroundsf.posterous.com/philz-coffee
author: Nate G.

description: 815 reviews, 4.5 stars.  Do I really have to write more?  Ok, I'll just state my favorites.  If I get a cuppa in store then I go for Ambrosia with light cream and sugar.  I usually buy it by the pound for French Press though and for that nothing but Jakob's Wonderbar Brew will do for me and mine.
author: Rayn D.

description:
I'm a maybe 3 times a year coffee drinker. I love the smell of coffee, but I'm not a coffee drinker. It never tastes as good as it smells.

..until I met Mocha Tesora at Philz. It's so good. I love chocolate and it's so full of flavor and has such a great body to it, that I drank my cup and could have had another if I wasn't worried I would be up for 3 days straight. (As a non coffee drinker I'm just a tad sensitive to the effects of caffeine.)

I love Philz. The baristas are always really nice, and provide excellent service. I love the attention to quality and the customer experience. Each cup is brewed individually and they were even happy to play 20 questions with me. 

I think I've just become a Philz coffee snob. I'm not going to drink coffee unless it's from Philz...
author: Lily L.

description:
I love this place!!! 
I was very happy to see how passionate and helpful the baristas were. They know what they're selling (so you can ask questions) and they do it with a great attitude (soooo, you can ask questions :D). This is exactly how I imagine THE perfect coffee shop (oh, yes: the coffee is just as good as you'd expect).
Thank you, Philz!
author: Zsofi Z.

description: I love the artwork that they have displayed at this location. This place is cool and the staff are great. The coffee is delicious. Who knew that mint and coffee paired so well together!?!
author: LM D.

description:
Never again. I work next to Philz and enjoyed the good coffee and convenient location.

I'm never going to visit this one again though because of some major attitude I got from an employee there. 

Here's the story. I brought an interviewee there to chat after he visited my place of work. We did the usual ordering thing in the main bar area and then went to pay for our drinks:

CASHIER: Hey there.
ME: Hi, how's it going? We got two small Ambrosia, and yeah, that's it.
CASHIER: Don't ask someone how it's going without waiting for their answer.
ME: Sorry, um.. wait, what?
CASHIER: You asked me how it was going then didn't let me answer.
ME: I'm sorry. Wow. OK, how's it going?
CASHIER: Good, that'll be 6 dollars.

The exchange was super awkward and embarrassing for both me and my candidate. Maybe the guy had a bad day or was over-caffeinated or something, but it was not the way I would ever treat a customer. And I'm pretty sure I wasn't out of line! Anyway, they lost my business.
author: Alexander L.

description: Careful on game days. It will be very crowded. They have a new app where you can order ahead and pick up. but the bad part about this is that if they make it before you arrive, it just sits there. so it might be cold.
author: Anita W.

description:
ABSOLUTELY PRETENTIOUS!

This weekend, right before heading to the Treasure Island Music Festival, we circled the blocks to look for coffee as we waited for other friends. We had passed by Philz and my sister began ranting about how she had heard of them and wanted to try it because she had heard such great things. So, after circling for 15 minutes in the rain for parking, she opted to drop me off to keep circling the block while I picked up this "amazing" coffee she had heard so much about. 

When I stepped in, the menu was a bit overwhelming and I didn't want to hold anyone up, so I asked the barista if they had a white mocha or something similar (I meant to say white chocolate mocha). She laughed, turned to her coworkers and goes "White mocha? What is that? Does anyone know what is in a white mocha?" laughs again and sarcastically says "Welcome to Philz".

My apologies for never having stepped foot in your establishment and perhaps because this country is swarming with Peets and Starbucks, this seemed to be a normal order for me. But it really wasn't neccessary to ridicule an obvious first time visitor. Thanks for the good coffee, but I won't be back.
author: Candy C.

description: I LOVE Philz!!! I mean, I am a huge fan!!! Met a friend at this particular location today and was a little disappointed. The coffee, as usual was AWESOME!!!! It was sooooooo loud inside we could hardly hear each other as we set next to each other on the most uncomfortable couch on our planet!!!! Our knees were up to our ears! Really? Buy new stuff!!!!! It was do windy outside we HAD to stay inside!!! Her son suggested a different coffee shop but I insisted that Philz had the BEST coffee. I wasn't wrong about that but boy was the surroundings a mess! Too bad. Go here if taking out only!
author: Barbara N.

description:
I am a huge Philz fan. I just moved to SF from Palo Alto and have been going to the Philz on Middlefield and Alma for years. This morning I went to the Philz on Berry Street before catching my train down the peninsula. I arrived at 6:30 to give myself plenty of time. My coffee was ready at 6:56, one minute before my train was supposed to leave. And it was cold (not an iced beverage) but at that point I just wanted to get out of there because I had already been waiting for so long. 

Bottom line: getting a coffee at 6:30 am shouldn't take 26 minutes. I won't be coming back to this Philz on weekdays because I love the coffee, but it isn't worth missing my train and being late to work.
author: Amy J.

description: Ah yes, I think this visit has completed my SF tour of all of the Philz locations.  Gotta say that I think the Mission location is the best -- ample seating, cool ambience.  The SOMA location serves the coffee you're craving (the most important thing), but there's maybe 4-5 tables max, some comfy armchairs (one of which I was lucky to snag), but that's about it.  Also, this location had this large gnat problem -- too bad -- such *amazing* coffee, but when one of those bad buys buzzes around you mid-sip, you gotta take away a star.
author: Mel G.

description:
Oh. My. GOD! This coffee is delicious! My cousin and a friend of mine kept telling me to try it, and I finally did! The Sooo Goood is AWESOME! I couldn't stop taking sips! 

It was as if there was a coffee party in my mouth and everyone was invited! I don't know how they prep the coffee, but the temperature isn't too hot, and it's just right. There's a really good balance to the flavor. Just writing this review has got me thinking about how good that cup of coffee was. The breakfast burritos are pretty good too!

Philz Coffee, please open a location in Santa Clara!
author: Jay A.

description:
I have been a regular at this place for a while now and well... I'm hooked, hooked bad.

I used to think coffee was just coffee. I used to think that paying more than $1.50 for coffee was moronic. Then, like being reborn, my whole perception of such a simple caffeinated beverage was transformed into something new.

Philz is not just plain ol' coffee, its an experience that everyone who appreciates drip coffee should have. Like many others who have written reviews, I am not a fan of espresso. If you are going to come in looking for a non-fat latte, than head over to blue bottle. But if you are looking for a cup of coffee that lacks acid, provides a nice caffeine boost, and tastes amazing, you need to try Philz.
author: Nicolas M.

description:
After hearing a lot of hype about this place and reading good reviews on yelp I was excited to try it the other day. I was down with their model of "make while you wait" and I was even down with the chaotic service factor. A good cup of coffee is worth it. The line was decently long but the coffee didn't take long to make. I asked for the best brew they're known for...black, in a small. They recommended the "Tesora". I have to say I wasn't impressed at all. It was too hot, too acidic and lacked all the complexity of what the description had to bear. 

I'm a fan of a good blend and a company that takes pride in their blends. To me, this is what makes a great coffee company. I liked that they take pride in their process. Aerating it before serving is truly a good way to get to know a cup of good coffee. 

Unfortunately my Tesora tasted like anything you could get from a french press with a darker than average blend made a little strong. Neither the process nor the blend seemed necessary for what I tasted. Even the cup was reminiscent of something you'd get at costco. 

If you insist on Philz blends, you're better off going the french press route and doing it yourself in a mug. Definitely not worth the time or the hype to get a cup to order. (to me) Fortunately there are plenty of companies in SF that take pride in their coffee. I would encourage anyone looking for their perfect cup to keep looking, there is definitely better and there's not much that Philz does you couldn't do yourself in your cube. 

I realize I'm only going off of one blend. I'd try others, but not not in a hurry to go back any time soon. Having said all that my wife loved her decaf, and I do respect a company that carries more than one option for decaf.
author: Glen C.

description: Just a drop in the bucket here, but what a great experience. Not only were the iced ecstatic coffee and the silken splendor wonderful, but the staff are so friendly and accommodating. This is one of those rare gems with wonderful service and great goods.
author: Teddy N.

description: All time favorite coffee place. Iced Mint Mojito? To die for! I'm a seattle area native so i'm picky when it comes to my coffee and i have to say this is probably better than most of the coffee places back home! The set up is so unique and customized which i love. With their drip coffee,  I especially love that they sweeten and cream it up to your liking. ITs still hot when you leave which i love. They are definitely experts at this! WIsh they had one in Oakland and closer to my other locations for work though. The staff is very helpful if you aren't sure how to order and what to get. Love this place! Its $3 & $4 for a cup of joe but sooooo worth it!
author: Tia J.

description: I recently read a review in the chronicle for Philz and since I was in the hood, I decided to check it out.  I ordered a 1/2 decaf/regular and was amazed that they grind the beans and brew it right in front of you.  They actually put the cream and sugar in it for you which was a little strange, but then when I tasted it. Wow. Amazing coffee. Deduct 1/2 star because seemed a little bit pricey at $3.25 for a large cup which is the size of a medium at most places.
author: James H.

description: The wait in line is well worth it, love to see the employees put their heart and soul into making each and every cup of coffee at the time.
author: Vlad M.

description: Being from LA, I tend to think that most coffee places are overrated and overpriced for semi-decent coffee with fun pictures in the foam so when I visited Philz I didn't have very high hopes. But I really have to admit, that this was the best damn cup of coffee I'd ever had. I wanted to mix blends but the barista suggested that that was a "pro move" so I settled on Julie's Ultimate - light cream and sugar. Amazing coffee and cream (normally I go with black coffee but I heard the cream was worth trying and it definitely is). I've been dying to get my hands on it ever since I left the bay.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Hand poured coffee is divine, don't get me wrong. Each cup delightfully to taste...

But the real stand out is that everyone here is nice. Always.

Today, I wanted to treat myself to their mocha, a deep earth nudge to chocolate, not one of those sugar bombs from the others. I came a few minutes before my train and pushed it close to the wire.

Mr. Coffee man in red with the red rose in your hair: thanks for making sure I got the perfect drink -- and the little green "don't spill as you run" device was the literal icing for me. Much appreciated!
author: Charla W.

description: I love this place.  What can I say, I judge most places by whether or not it was worth the money.  This place is definitely more expensive than my other coffee spots. But, I gladly pay every dime because it comes out pretty much exactly how I like my it every time.
author: Tony H.

description:
I moved back to the San Francisco Bay area a few weeks ago, after having spent a few years in a degree program in New York City. Living in Manhattan's Canyons of Steel felt a bit like living on Trantor - or Coruscant, for those who prefer their space opera on celluloid, not cellulose - with everything else existing out in the galactic hinterlands. I know better, of course, having felt the same way in other places I've lived, e.g. Tokyo and London. I speculate there's a psychological dynamic at play here akin to placing one's self in the "center" of an inflationary universe: anywhere the observer stands is the center. 

The One Thing I really missed about San Francisco's food scene was the apparent superabundance of good coffee shops where I could feel perfectly at home nursing a cup of decent coffee for a few hours with a good book or a laptop. Yes, there are "coffee shops" in Manhattan, but no, you can't really dawdle for hours in the ones that serve the Good Stuff, can't park it without molestation. And that's OK, it's consonant with New Yorkian charm, but it's not "coffee culture" in a more informed sense of the phenomenon. Like truly good Mexican restaurants in NYC, or simians in the Bois de Boulogne of Eddie Izzard's "Le singe est sur la branche" standup sketch, it's "monkeys: thin on the ground."

So, where was I? Oh, yeah: genuinely good coffee in a place I can treat as an office of sorts. Philz is a place like that. On my first visit, I immediately laid it out to the counter help: "So, hey, first timer here. Heard of this place, read the reviews, wanna try, hit me with something you guess I might like," to which the java slinger immediately replied, "Tesora. I think you might like the Tesora. Give it a try?" I did, and loved it. And I admit that I was a bit tickled simply by the brewing arrangement, which resembles nothing less than one might imagine the prototyping lab for Keurig's K-cup, a slightly-messy profusion of individual ground-holding blotter filters capping the individual cups. 

Screw Tyler Durden: these are *my* kind of Single Serving Friends.

I would give this place 5 stars if they were graced with the facilities and pasty selection of the nearby The Creamery, but otherwise, I'm cool with their oddly sterile location across from China Basin. Not being personally acquainted with the shop's history, I'm guessing from clues around the physical plant that they've been elsewhere in the course of a few years, and the present location is the latest enclosure for an enterprise of genuinely long standing. The "free" internet access is decent. The staff are helpful and they seem to love their craft. If you're near the Caltrain terminus, consider dropping in on them. Order a Tesora and chat up the charming girl with the tattoo of a caffeine molecule on her arm.
author: Russell W.

description: So glad this place is SO close to mission bay... I know starbucks is closer... but eff it ... ill bear the freezing coldness of the stupid bay and run my butt all the way over to phiz ... the coffee is just SO much better. tesora... and the jacobs ...i ask for the blend because the tesora kinda of lightens the boldness of the jacobs. The mint adds a different element too. Use mint with caution... ask the barista what they recommend until you have a feel for how bright you want your coffee. :)
author: Mish L.

description:
I don't have chest hair nor do I want any, but a cup of the Tesora is strong enough to put some on you, enough to knit a sweater and maybe mittens if you order a large.

Voted best coffee in SF according to their little sign.
author: Chris K.

description: First of all, the service is generally great at this location.  Second, if you come definitely ask for Brie and have her make you a Tesora with honey (not sugar).
author: John E.

description: Starbucks quality at about 40% higher prices. And they don't even let you put in your own milk. Did I mention how slow the service is? I'm back to Peets. Even though it's more out of my way on the trip to work, I still make up for it in faster service.
author: Bret F.

description: Highly caffeinated and delicious!  They only make drip.  They have great snacks too, including vegan pepples donuts!  Line gets long in the mornin and after lunch, but you can preorder and pick up using the OrderAhead app.  Try the Turkish, Jacob' Wonderbar and Philtered Soul.  Warning: its really strong!
author: Alex B.

description:
Despite the wait and the fact that I never seem to remember what blend I'm given (I try something different each time), I love Philz. The people who work here are pretty helpful and resourceful; as for my order routine, I just tell them what I want to drink that day (strong, sweet, whatever) and I leave everything else in their hands.

One large cup of whatever the blend-of-the-day is works perfectly, and I'm set for the day.
author: Cheri R.

description:
This place is a little too hipster trendy for my taste. People stare at you if you don;t have the right vibe, so it actually is a little unwelcoming to us regular joes of the world.

That said, that chai I ordered was pretty damn fantastic.

Update: good customer service because following this review, that was not that bad, I was contacted by management to apologize for my lower than average experience.
author: Caitlin H.

description: It was the most difficult thing to not give them 5 stars...  I use the OrderAhead app and it is amazing!  Yet still 3 out of 5 times, they seem to misread and put sugar in my coffee... which is a terrible thing to do to me and my coffee.  I pay a lot for their grinds and expect it to be made the way I want.  Unfortunately I am unable to correct the order either with little to no time in the morning - hence using OA instead of just standing in line.  I still love Phillz and this location, sugared coffee or not.
author: Marisa-Lee C.

description: Seriously though, I love this place. Some people complain that it's expensive, but for $3, not only do you get amazing coffee, but you get amazing employees and support a local small business and Phil of course.
author: Roxana O.

description: Wow!! This is one of the best coffee places I've been too! It is a whole experience because every coffee is hand made. We ordered the Tantalizing Turkish and the Jacobs Wonderbar and they both tasted amazing. The atmosphere has such a positive vibe and the customer service was genuine. Our barista gave us a sample of the Philtered Soul which was also delicious and a sweet gesture. On our way out, a man who we later found out was the CEO gave us a sample of the baklavas. My co-workers and I just found our new favorite coffee spot.
author: Samantha S.

description: Philz never disappoints me. I've been back many times, usually to the 24th Street location or the one over by the Caltrain station. Their Mojito is the best cold coffee drink I've ever had. They have everything I want in a coffee shop: good coffee, personal service, comfy seating, interesting ambiance, free reliable wifi.
author: Anna L. C.

description: God I love this place.  I love the silken splendor and their mocha tesoras.  I just, love this place.  I generally don't mind a coffee now and then, and only when I feel like I need a pick me up.  Philz, I go for pleasure.  My husband and I are addicted.  How it took us this long to find it, I have no idea.  The location is awesome too.  We walk the embarcadero after grabbing a cup.  Perfect morning!
author: Aza T.

description:
I wanted to like it, really I did! 

I've been here twice, first had the iced mojito coffee (minus the sugar, which the girl kindly removed for me!) but sadly.. i felt like I was mixing last nights party with  the next mornings hangover cure.. =(

The next time i got the "soooo good" which sadly was not so good! Combined with my organic/gluten/free whatever the heck made it taste like cardboard chocolate croissant and i was sad! The line out the door, the comfy sofas and chairs and excellent staff were all great... but my coffee was like... blagh! =( Also, I'm not a fan of having someone else put in how much cream and sugar I want... 

Sadly don't want to go here again next time I need a coffee fix. Don't let my experience deter you because the selection is great, the custom blended idea is great, and so are the staff.
author: Diana R.

description: I'm new to the while Philz experience & I'm pleasantly surprised.  Abby saw me looking lost & walked me through how it works, asking me a series of questions & recommending the Sooo Good.  And yes it is indeed so good.  Abby said "I love newbies & I can't wait to see how you like this!  I'm going to find you the best mint leaf.". I'm particular about my sugar & milk but Abby made it just like I like it.  Definitely coming back.  Bonus it's right by the CalTrain station.  Double bonus they keep a jar of dog treats for the furry guests
author: Dana F.

description: Okay, so I'm giving Philz 5 stars cuz the hubby went on and on...and ON about this Iced Mint Mojito coffee drink.  We were visiting our friends for the weekend and they live conveniently right around the corner and knowing how we LoVE our coffee we had to go check it out!  I had the Jacob coffee and, yes, it was a perfect pour.  The hubby had the iced mint Mojito and like I said he adored it.  I am a coffee purist (please, I'm not serious)...but really I like my coffee bare bones ( no cream, no sugar, def no mint)...now keeping that in mind, I did not care for it but for all those that like a flavored style coffee...this ones for YOU!!  Enjoy....
author: SARA S.

description: I'm in San Francisco for a week long business trip.  Everyone that I know who lives in San Francisco always raves about Philz so naturally I had to go check it out for myself.  I was definitely not disappointed.  I got the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee.  I can't say that I have ever had a coffee experience like Philz.  I've already been back on this trip, and I'm sure I'll be back again.
author: Beau T.

description: Good coffee, terrible service. I love coffee, but I prefer it with a bit less attitude. Some of Philz employees (not all, but enough to make me avoid the place) really, really do not want to work there. Don't believe the hype--this place is a fad. You can get great coffee in lots of places in San Francisco, and you'll get much better service, too.
author: Dave G.

description: Damn dude. Why so expensive man? Let me just get a hit of that. Just a little bit. Thanks men. I appreciate that but yo, can I get a discount though. You know what I mean. I come here all the time but you just be like hell nah! But I gotta get my sh*t though, you know what I mean. I gotta get my fix. Damn dude. Come on!
author: J C.
