description: This is definitely my favorite coffee spot in San Francisco.  I occasionally order the Jamaica blue mountain; I mean it's $10 for a large cup of coffee and it's absolutely amazing.  I even tried to brew this at home and I don't even come close to how they brew it one cup at a time at Philz.  Simply amazing coffee here.
author: Richard N.

description: Great service. Amazing coffee. A Bay Area must.
author: Mia D.

description:
OMG coffee, I love coffee. I was only in SF for like 5 days and came to Philz everyday, some days more than once! 

Price: it's standard  coffee shop pricing not really much to say expect to pay between 3-5 a cup for their coffees.

Drink: I like the bolder ones I think I had a Turkish and it was amazing. They add cream and sugar for you and well adjust the coffee to your taste if you feel like its not sweet enough or too sweet. I prefer mine closer to black. The mint mojito was pleasant still prefer some of the other coffees more. Definitely better than what Starbucks can make.
author: Justin C.

description:
#6 Eclectic Iced Coffee, DELICIOUS!

I wish Philz would replace every freaking Starbucks in the world :)

The baristas are always super friendly and chat with you while they make your drink. The drinks tastes exotic and different, which is why I love this place.
author: Jing F.

description: No, I'm not riding the bandwagon,  Philz has the best coffee in town.  They write out the flavors for each of their blends to take the guesswork out of choosing your cup of joe.  Duh, right?  Why isn't this a best practice again?  Everyone behind the counter is great.  It's a hell of a challenge to find seating but that's what happens when you're awesome.  If you do find seating though, you win - they don't limit their wi-fi like some of the other cafes in the area.
author: Adrian K.

description: I met up with Anna D here after an interview several weeks back, nabbing a cup of the Jacob for $3.25. Simply put, Philz eases my concerns about leaving Seattle coffee behind. I can't recall the last time I enjoyed a cup of simple black coffee so much, which is something they really focus on here, offering a variety of differently flavored brews, along with descriptions of the flavor differences. And if their descriptions don't make sense to you, the baristas are more than happy to help you make a decision.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Nothing like a personal brewed cup of coffee to start off the day. I was obviously new to this place because I was standing in the wrong line... but the staff was amazing at helping this Philz' newbie and showing me the ropes to their extensive blended coffee selection. 

Phil is to coffee like a vintner is to fine wine, blending different varieties to add more complexity to the flavor and texture, balancing out the flavor characteristics making a perfect marriage...a complexly captivating coffee creation.
author: Kristina L.

description:
Coffee: always a touchy subject, especially when dealing with the residents of San Francisco, who are more than a bit spoiled by the copious amounts of great coffee shops in the city.

Personally, I feel Philz is just one of the standard coffee boutiques that have sprung up recently in the city: nuevo and unique, yet subtly bland. However, the coffee here is a step up from the rot gut that you would get at any other chain establishment. With savory and sweet treats like the Philtered Soul and bold and crisp knockouts like the Ether, Philz has a bunch of roasts to accommodate everyone. All of them have lovely flavors and different personalities, but there's little to separate Philz from the rest: great coffee, but standard fare.

My personal favorites are the Philtered Soul and the Mocha Tesora. Make sure you ask for medium sugar and medium cream at most. You don't want to drown out the nice chocolate flavors in either of those drinks. The Philtered Soul is lighter than the Mocha Tesora, but both give a nice nut+chocolate combo. It's almost like Philz somehow extracted the essence of Nutella and put it into their coffee. Maybe that's why I find myself coming back from time to time.
author: Frank Y.

description:
Do you pay $3 for a small coffee because it's Philz?
Or is it Philz, so you pay $3 for a small coffee. 

Ponder that over a small cup of coffee from Philz (Silken Splendor).
author: Annie L.

description:
For those of us who can't drink coffee, sometimes it's hard to find something yummy when we go hang out at coffee shops.  My particular vice is hot chocolate, and Philz does it well.  They have slightly sweet cocoa they mix with mostly water, and a bit of cream.  It's chocolately and tasty without being overly decadent and heavy.  

Another reason to visit Philz is the music they play - zippy enough to be interesting but one can get a little work done without being distracted by it.

Now, if they'd just bring back those vegan wheat-free banana nut choco chip muffins I'd be giving them 6 stars!
author: Robin C.

description: Best coffee I've ever had. Every cup of coffee is made with love by hand by cheerful hipsters.
author: Reagan C.

description: wow what a great cup of coffee.  Rich and smooth.  It took getting rid of the espresso machine to make a good cup of coffee.  They take great beans, grind them to order and pour hot water through a filter to brew coffee.  Simple but fantastic.  For espresso style drinks, they will triple pour the coffee.  So rich and strong.  You will never go back to that crap they serve at starbucks or the bitter nasty excuse for coffee and the Panera across the street.
author: Scott C.

description: Philtered soul or the Caltrain ride back south....good times on a beautifully crisp day in SF! A have a special place in my heart for the Berry st location. There were many times when I lived in SF and was Caltraining down to Palo Alto only to get bumped(i.e. bike car full) from the train. The only saving grace was rollin' over to Philz for a cuppa joe. It always made me smile and turn the other check to get on the next train.
author: isaias J.

description: Delicious coffee, friendly baristas, chill vibe. I've done many quick coffee runs here and I've also spent time here working on stuff. Either way, it checks out :)
author: Thuan N.

description:
Made a pitstop here on the way back from HouseboatLand.  Happy to support a local business.  

They have a good assortment of coffee and pastries, including Dee's Mini Organic Donuts. They are these super cute itty bitty hoops.  You can pop a couple and not feel guilty.

Comfy vibe to kick back for a while.  Mix of couches and wooden tables + chairs.  Nice staff too.

Conveniently located across the bridge from Mission Bay, near the CalTrain-Muni junction.
author: Cathy K.

description: This place rocks! If you are anywhere in the SF/Bay area, definitely stop in for a great cup of coffee!
author: Luke V.

description:
I don't actually drink coffee, but I brought my Aunt here. She was visiting from Germany, so she wanted some really great coffee.

First off, the dude at the counter told us, "Our coffee is like crack." He wasn't joking.

Second, they really know their freakin' coffee. He told her to try this certain coffee, and he said that it would remind her of the tropics. She tried it, and was like "This reminds me of Hawaii." Then she wanted some sugar, so the dude put a tiny bit of sugar in there and said "This will be perfect." 

Her response: "Damn, this is like Australia. Aussie aussie aussie, OY OY OY!"

The last part was added by me, but let's be real. She loved the coffee.

*I'm Yelping this place for her.
author: Louis N.

description:
Love Philz Coffee - a jolt of caffeine to add just the right amount of panic to get me going for the day! 

The Order Adhead app is brilliant.  Never waiting in line again!!
author: C S.

description:
i probably waited 15 minutes before they took my order today, but it's totally worth it.  this is one of those places where i don't mind waiting.  i get a number of things here, but my top orders, in no particular order, include:

1 - Silken Splendor with almond milk and light sugar
2 - Mint Tea with honey
3 - Istanbul Treat with almond milk and honey
4 - It's the Best with almond milk and light sugar

try it. it's worth it.  better than blue bottle because of the variety.
author: Tina L.

description:
Off the hook coffee!!!! Yum!!
I was a 1st timer today and I ended up stopping TWICE for their coffee! 
I seriously hope you have a branch down in San Diego! 
I got the Philharmonic and the House (decaf) during my 2 stops. major yum factor!
author: Tara R.

description: BEST COFFEE EVER!!! So glad there's not one around the corner from me because I'd go broke amped up on coffee all the time! But really, the quality of the coffee is out of this world and so is the customer service. They take coffee here seriously with a flair of fun!
author: LuLu M.

description: A little pricey, but the coffee is always delicious every time. The people here are very friendly and it has a lot of chairs to do work
author: Nathan S.

description:
It might be a bit pricey for a cup of java but its damn good for the soul.  I tried the Anesthesia and reading through the blend description,  its one of the most caffeinated blend.  My courteous barista added sugar and cream to my cup of Philz and I couldn't ask for a better coffee.  Running on few hours of sleep, few sips of Philz was def much needed.  

Only con is that they should nail the description board overhead so it doesn't seem like Im staring @ everybody's buttocks as they order.
author: Rovie T.

description: Ice mint mojito...just do it! It's cold, minty and refreshing! Philz is an excellent place to sit and study. There's amazing coffee, great snacks, interesting people and walking distance to the ball park! It can get a little crowded from time to time from people getting the same idea of getting some amazing caffeinated beverages so choose when to go carefully. All the coffee blends are amazing, but if you want something to keep you up definitely get the lighter roasts!
author: John L.

description: Believe the hype. Iced Mint Mojito is delicious. Super positive energy in the space. I'll be a regular.
author: Nicodemus F.

description: Love the coffee, especially the mint mojito! Haven't tried a coffee I don't like so far. Baristas are so awesome and chill. Only one thing, WHY DOES A BLUE JAMAICAN COST $7.50??? Omg! That is absolutely ridiculous.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I tried Philz for the first time, and picked the Philharmonic without considering its ingredients.  Although the cardamom aftertaste was not the most desirable, the layers of flavors in the cup were impressive.  I already know that I will never be fully satisfied with one-note Starbucks coffee again.

This Philz location is prime for those catching a night game at the ballpark - one cup will not only provide additional cheering energy but give a head start in staying warm against the bay breeze.  I might never go to a night game without a cup of Philz again!
author: Andrew M.

description: I am not one to spend money on coffee when I get it free at work, but Philz is def the exception. I can honestly say that it is the best coffee I've ever had and I lived in Italy for a yr - better than my mother land. That's saying something.
author: Rick P.

description:
Philz and me, we go together like a gin and tonic (was going to think of witty coffee banter but my mind went splat).  Surely it was meant to be given there's one 3 blocks from my apt and now I've discovered another one 3 blocks from where I work.  And there's not that many in the city.  This must be a sign.

The funny thing is that I'm not even a big coffee drinker.  Meaning I don't regularly drink coffee unless a) I know I'm in for a very long and boring meeting at work, or 2) I'm going out with friends and want to hang out and socialize over a hot cup and cake.

This location is great.  I mean, it's a great location for me, but the place is great.  It's much larger than the Castro location and it's very welcoming.  The guys who work here really know their stuff and they don't get annoyed when you enter and are overwhelmed with all their coffee choices, and they don't turn up their noses at you when you really can't say what you want in a coffee other than something that tastes good.

Which isn't too difficult to satisfy at Philz.  Their coffee tastes fantastic!  I've never drank a cup of coffee and been amazed before.  Usually, it's like, yeah, this is coffee.  Now it's like, yeah, this is REALLY coffee and the taste buds light up.  I guess it's my coffee moment or coffee epiphany.

They make it drip style using a paper filter and will ask you ahead of time whether you want cream or sugar and how much.  Then after making your coffee they'll ask you to taste it to make sure you like it.

I feel like Philz must be the big brother of the Orbit Room or something.
author: Jean K.

description: Incredible coffee, gives Blue Bottle a run for its money, with a fraction of the line.
author: Arvindh K.

description: Best of best. just try once you'll forget all other coffee. COME TO NEW YORK please!!!
author: Yadong W.

description: The first time I went here was with some gift cards I got for looking at a condo.  Now that I live in the area (not at that condo) I walk by the location a few times a week.  The coffee is pretty good and I like the fact that you can enjoy them outside with your dog.  The bad news is that unless you can leave your dog outside while you order, you can't go inside to even order coffee.  Unfortunately, I am almost always alone when I walk by and they won't let me bring my dog in for the minute or two it would take me to order coffee.  If so, I'd gladly give them a higher rating.
author: Scott L.

description:
So much artisan coffee in SF, I sometimes wonder what differentiates one from another.  What I most enjoy about Philz is the amazingly friendly and welcoming service.  The employees seem to sincerely want each customer to feel special and they take pride in each delivered beverage.  The coffee is great and it is custom made according to your preference (that does take more time than say a Starbucks order), the Pepples donuts are too wonderful, and their green chili breakfast burritos (heated to crispy in an oven, not a microwave) are memorable.  
Thank you Philz!
author: Ellen W.

description:
Yum Yum.
This is a stand out coffee in San Francisco.
author: Leigh S.

description: This is one of my favorite Philz coffee locations in the city! They are always crowded but the Baristias are always helpful, friendly and ready to take your order with a smile. I have ordered the philhoramic during 2 of 3 of my visits.   The plus side is that the service is stellar, that's why they are getting 3-Stars, but as for the coffee, it seems a bit less flavorful then other Philz locations that I have visited.  They have a choice of a wide variety of beans, but the potency of the coffee  to the water was lacking.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
best coffee, best atmosphere, best owners, excellent staff, comfortable environ.  free wifi and power.  I am really going to miss Philz when I move to New York in May.  I will need to have them teach me to make my cup of Jacobs or Julie's Philz Way so I can order it online and try to make it myself.  

Philz Killz :)
author: dave b.

description: Phil has traveled the world to hand select all the beans. He's developed the blends that you see on the menu himself. Not only is this a superb cup of coffee, but the people that work there are all good vibes. Great representation of the brand. Say bye bye to Starbucks and hello to real coffee :)
author: Alma V. R.

description: I'm officially addicted to the "It'z The Best" here.  Best damn coffee around.
author: Roy C.

description:
I wish I knew more places like this. This place just screams coffee connoisseur. 

After browsing the menus, and with some recommendations from the workers, I went for a darker roast with the Jacobs Wonderbar blend. It was full body and had a nice smooth flavor without being overly bitter or harsh. 

I also got a chance to try my friends mint mojito. It reminded me more of a creamy tea than coffee but still good.

Too bad there aren't any locations  in socal. I'd definitely make regular visits.
author: Andrew L.

description:
What's to say that hasn't been said?  How about...

Perhaps you didn't know this, as I only recently learned this after being a regular (as in at least once each day) for 18 months.

The light roasts have more caffeine than the dark roasts.  The beans lose caffeine during the roasting process.  The darker roasts, having been roasted longer, therefore have less caffeine.  

That was counter-intuitive - to me, anyway.  I always associated dark coffee with strong coffee.  Turns out that was false.

The Soooo Good thus has a lot of pop.  On flavor profile alone, however, I prefer the Turkish.

Two weeks ago, I had my first Iced Mint Mojito - now one of my regular orders.  The "mojito" is good even if you make it diet-friendly.  The baristas make it with cream and sugar, but I order my large sans cream, and 3 splendas.  A fantastic drink.

One more tip: You can buy this 24 oz. mug from Philz for $16 (or so).  They'll fill it up for you, while charging you the price of a small.

If, like me, you stop by daily: You'll have the mug "paid off" in a month or so.  Since its plastic, it won't break, either.  You also get more coffee, since a Philz large has only 16 oz.
author: Michael C.

description:
Warning: Philz has drip coffee.

If that's your thing then this place is probably great for you.

If, on the other hand, you're Antipodean or like espresso based coffees prepared by skilled baristas, then Philz is not your place. Go find a Blue Bottle instead.
author: J S.

description:
This is where my love for coffee started...I might add that it went from disdain to love.  I was purely a tea drinker until a friend recommended Philz on Berry.  From then coffee at Philz become something I couldn't get away from.  

The experience is incredible as your meet a new Batista each day that is excited to converse with you, sometimes about something truly meaningful.  The product speaks for itself...simply incredible (except for Philtered Soul--I'm not a hazelnut fan).  It's also a great place for a remote entrepreneur to get some work done and meet some great people that often work in similar spaces.
author: Brenton G.

description: Great, friendly service, easy parking, doggies everywhere on the weekends. I just wish they carried morning buns like their Palo Alto location. Skip their choc croissant - its a faux rendition of the real thing. Chocolate chips... lame.  Anyway, the coffee is always great, line out the door on Sat. morning. Its a hot spot!
author: Carolyn F.

description:
I have a few friends who are coffee fanatics and absolutely swear that this is the best coffee in SF.  I, however, am not a coffee fanatic and usually can't tell the difference, but even I say it is pretty darn good.  I would give it 3.5 stars (damn u yelp, when r u going to get the ability to give 1/2 stars??).

The iced coffee, med sweet is the best iced coffee I have had in SF so far.   If I could say this coffee tasted homemade, would you understand what I mean?  Frothy, just a hint of sweetness, and a great almost nutty flavor to it.  I've had something else here too but I just can't remember,

But what I do remember is that I always get some sort of pain when I drink their coffee.  Before, it was a headache (which I assume is due to the fact that I don't drink enough water).  Recently it was a stomachache.  I don't know.  Any theories?  Maybe their coffee is too strong?

EIther way, it doesn't taste like it and to be quite honest, it's not going to stop me from drinking here.
author: C A.

description:
You're ready to hop on Caltrain, or need a jolt before heading to the ballpark.  You could go into the new Panera, but keep going just a few more feet.  Philz is open - sort of.  Furniture is still being delivered, but they are serving.

The staff are friendly, and the coffee is sublime, as expected.
I learned (the next day) that it's actually family owned - Phil was there, and his kids are working behind the counter. 

What do we call the employees?  If Starbucks has Baristas, are they Philistas?  Philistines?  Crack dealers?  No matter...

I see only two problems for the newest Philz:
1) Their coffee drinks start at $2.75, and they have no low end product like Starbucks (a tall drip for $1.50).  I'd love to see them rotate in a daily special (small for $1.99) from their 30 or so different selections.
2) I'm addicted to Mocha Tesora.  But that's my problem, not Philz.
author: dan s.

description: I wake up excited if I know I'll have  time to swing by Philz to get fix of Canopy of Heaven or Mint Mojito in the AM. Their coffee is amazing and their staff is patient and kind. I love Philz.
author: Brittany M.

description:
This is coffee! If you are in San Francisco must try Philz Coffee. It was my first time and the server was very nice to explain how Philz serves coffee. Each cup is made from freshly ground coffee beans. They even add the cream and sugar/splenda. Absolutely delicious coffee. 
There are several varieties of coffee to choose from. Cant wait to try a different flavor tomorrow morning. 

Philz is also a cafe, so you can chill on the nice sofas with friends (in some locations). 

If you're going to a chilly SF giants ball game, dont forget to stop here and grab your coffee. Its just 2 blocks from the stadium. If you are going to have a yummy breakfast at Brenda's go around the corner on Van Ness and grab your coffee.
author: Brendan J.

description: Best coffee ever. Menu is overwhelming, but the staff is more than happy to help.
author: Scott M.

description: My very first time coming here.  If you're not used to ordering from a pale like this you will get lost! BUT the staff here are great in leading you in the right direction!! This is not a laté frap mocha whatchamacallit kinda place.  It's a place for personally brewed cups of coffee.  I was told to order a Mint Mojito by my sister so I ordered that.  The persons there explained what it was and I went a head and ordered that.  It was nice...a cold drink. Before I paid for it they ask you to taste it to make sure it's just right which is great.   I only wish there was a way to speed up the process.  You definitely have to make extra time to stop in if you plan on going before work. I would stop by another if it was on the way to wherever I was going but I don't think I'd crave it enough to go out of my way.
author: Elvin T.

description: Come here every day for my coffee, can't live without it. Best drip coffee I have tried to date in general. Love the place, frequently spend weekends sitting down and working. Can't recommend enough!
author: Alex G.

description:
6 STARS!!!

I LOVE coffee and philz knows their coffee!!!! My faves are the New Manhattan and the Silken Splendor.  If your looking for a flavored mocha or some other girlie cup of sweetened coffee drink then this may not be your place. If you *heart* a good cup of coffee, than this is the place. It is made to order from your own personal barrista. They will add whatever sweetener or milk product you want to your liking. Before leaving, they insist that you taste so that it is perfect before you walk out. Have never been disappointed!!! Now if only you could order a cocktail like this..... no please add a little more vodka, I like my drinks stiff ;-)
author: Gina H.

description:
If you want a regular cup of coffee, this is the place to get it. In terms of coffee, it is difficult to find a better place. My favorite is to get a large, black half Ethiopian Yirgacheffe/half Ethiopian Harrar. This is the only place I know where I can get a freshly roasted cup of Jamaican Blue Mountain.

The bad: these people have absolutely no understanding of workflow. The scene is chaotic and confusing... it almost ruins the experience. It is so chaotic, if someone wanted to get a free cup of coffee every morning, they could easily do it. Horrible way to run a business, but... perhaps all of this is on purpose? Accidents are more organized.

All this being said, extremely friendly staff and I keep coming back. If they ever figure out how to manage the flow of customers, I will upgrade them to 5 *.
author: Matthew C.

description:
Trill feedback: 
This Philz is a GREAT spot. The staff are really cool people who are courageous/confident enough to always be themselves, which makes for a super chill and comfortable environment. People who come here seem to be attracted to that, myself included, so we are ourselves when hanging here. It's people just enjoying/living life and sippin on their awesome coffee. The manager, Marcus, is a great role model for his associates and a very friendly representative of his organization when dealing with customers. He keeps it trill/friendly always. 

Constructive feedback: 
This place deserves 5 stars just because it's THAT sweet, but it could invest in more comfortable seating to make it feel like you're in friggin' HEAVEN (aka get more seats/chairs as comfortable as those awesome red couches).
author: U. Malacai M.

description:
The coffee-lovers equivalent of a wine bar -- come back often and work your way through the vast assortment of only-available-at-Philz blends -- all brewed and served one cup at a time.

If you can get past the fact that they spell their name with a 'z', then this is one of the best coffee shops you'll find anywhere -- at least for actual, American-style drip.

If you're one to follow the corporate-herd mentality, then perhaps you'll be swayed by the fact that this is the coffee served at Facebook HQ -- a sign that the in-the-know cool kidz (note my trendy adoption of the z!) consider Philz the it-coffee purveyor of the moment.

So much better than Ritual, Four Barrel, and Blue Bottle.  However, a close contender, and possibly the most underrated coffee-afficionado's coffee bar in the Bay area is "The Movie Groove and Grind Coffee Bar" in Redwood City.  I recommend trying both The Movie Groove and Philz.
author: David L.

description:
Hands down, BEST COFFEE I HAVE EVER HAD! Philz got it right. Thank you. Thank you so very much for introducing me to what I have been missing all my life!

As much as I want to, I hesitated giving 5 stars to Philz. As wonderful as the coffee, experience, and service is.. it is a little pricey. But you pay for quality, right? My friend recently gave Philz a 4 star rating so I justify my 5 stars since the two reviews will average out to a 4.5 ... lol

Anyways, staff is great and always willing to answer any questions you have! Each cup is individually brewed and customers have a choice of about 20 or so different roasts - light, medium, and dark! I always feel a little overwhelmed since there are so many roasts to choose from! But so far, everything that I've tried is good. I think I'd have to say the Silken Splendor and the Anesthesia to the Upside would be my favorites thus far.

On a hot day, try the mint mojito iced coffee!
author: Brad Y.

description:
Cold-brewed, shaken with soymilk and ice, rich, dark, perfect.  

The selection here is over the top.  The barista was very concerned that my drink turned out okay, and looked ready to take it back and re-make it *immediately* if it didn't meet my standards.

I am glad it's on the "other" side of the Caltrain, because otherwise it'd be inordinately busy.  As it is however, nobody seems to know!

Sometimes I try and pretend I am too healthy to drink coffee, but this place is too good to pass up.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
after a tough morning waking up at 5am.. coffee was required for me to continue my day. i was one grumpy mofo. 

this was the first time at philz coffee so i was a little intimidated. i ended up with a small philtered soul with vanilla soy milk. the "burst of chocolate" totally won me over when trying to decide which blend to try. next time i will add some sugar.. i assumed the vanilla soy milk would take care of the sweetness. 

i like that the coffee is hot but not so hot you have to wait for it to cool down. no burnt tongue for me! 

although one person started my drink.. someone else finished it. they were both very nice. the third person making drinks seemed a little new because several times when calling out a drink.. she had to correct herself and say "i mean a..." i purposely did not order from her because i didnt want the wrong drink made. she would call the drink name out and then move on.. and once during my short wait someone grabbed the wrong drink. possibly could have been prevented if she let them try their drink first.. or waited and made sure she had the correct name for the drink that was ready. 

try the apple croissant. it's amazing!!
author: Lena H.

description:
I use to live near this Philz, and really love the passionate hand-crafted effort for making coffee and tea. I've never quite seen coffee made this way at an individual level, and it is quite welcome.

This would get 5-stars from me if I actually drank more drip coffee, but since I prefer espresso I don't get as much utility from their presence. When I explain this to one of the staff members once, he kindly showed me a blend they use just for espresso fans like myself. It was nice and strong, but it still wasn't espresso. That's OK though, I don't fault them. This i a drip place, and that's their niche.

I'm really proud of their focus, and that it's a family-owned business that is doing well in an industry full of corporate competitors.
author: Kevin E.

description: Best coffee in town. Period.
author: Mehdi A.

description:
DRINK:
1.) Ambrosia? I forget. 

SERVICE:
Pretty nice, they let me have another coffee bc I didn't like the one I ordered :P hehe.

ATMOSPHERE:
Not bad, kinda matches the Soma neighborhood. Kinda big roomy high ceilings, some couches, some flat screen tvs, but also some live plants. Somewhat industrialized yet homely at the same time.
author: Angela L.

description: Love love love the unpretentious nature of this place and their delicious coffee. I always feel like I'm walking into a neighborhood secret but who are we kidding?! Everyone who knows about this place loves it and comes back with 5 more people. STAY AWAY PEOPLE, I WANT SITTING SPACE!
author: Anu K.

description:
I'm not a hardcore coffee drinker, but Philz is probably the best I've had. I've been working in the city for a few years, and I try to grab Philz at least once a week. My usual is Silken Soul, medium/medium, but you've never tried Philz, I would suggest starting with the Tesora and trying the different options until you find one you like. At least that's what I did. 

On a side note, my friends and I got to meet Phil himself at one of his cafes, and he is a great guy. We chatted for a while and he gave us each a free coffee!

The Order Ahead app can be a little unreliable in terms of the time estimate, but as others have said, the line moves pretty quickly, so it doesn't take long to pickup your coffee in person.
author: Jacob C.

description: The tesora is so good! I've been to two locations and they were both great. Beats all the other coffee chains. Speedy service too.
author: Brenda I.

description: Best coffee in town. Weather you're buying a fresh brewed cup or taking a pound of beans home, Philz is the best
author: Gary W.

description: Since my last review Rob, the manager of the Philz reached out to me and apologized for the inconvenience, and offered to make it up to us. I really appreciate the gesture Rob - even without the comping. I'll be by again. Great customer service.
author: Leo G.

description: Okay, I know I'm going to get a lot of flack for this 3 star review because 1) I'm not from norcal...I'm from the far superior socal o__O, and 2) I thought to myself after having Philz for the first time, "how is this any better than Starbucks?" Well, I'm not here to start a fight. I just don't get coffee and therefore, I don't get Philz. Or any other trendy, hipster, anti-Starbucks establishment out there...
author: Aaaa A.

description:
If I had only knew that this Philz was so close to the ballpark, I'd probably go to a game more than once a year. It's literally tucked right next to AT&T park which makes things super convenient. This Philz is a decent sized location and actually looks really nice. Since it's in the newly built area, Philz itself looks like it was built within the past 3 years.

Inside, it's the same Philz as the other locations, order what you want at the bar and then pick it up when it's ready. Very friendly staff, and even their snacks are tasty. If you're not familiar with Philz, the primarily only serve straight coffee. You won't find fraps nor espresso drinks over here. 

All you have to do is choose your blend, and if you want cream or sugar. Then, you'll see them make your cup to order. From grinding the fresh beans, to hand pouring the cup.

Out of all the spots that I've been to, Philz has always been my go to spot. If you're a true coffee lover, you definitely won't be disappointed here.
author: Michael W.

description: Starbucks? Peets? or Philz? Philz, hands down, best coffee in town, and when you fly on virgin america :). I guess it boils down to the creation process and the friendly people behind the counter who ask you "try it and make sure it is how you want it". Since when did someone say that at Starbucks or Peets? I must admit, at times there is a wait, but don't let that deter you away. I was never a fan of coffee, Latte's used to be my drink of choice, so i admit, i got swayed. Tesora, my favorite!
author: Mikhail S.

description:
I've only been to the one on Van Ness, and when I came here I was just surprised at the size and decor of this place! I thought the Van Ness one was the best, but this one clearly takes the cake!
Just one block away from AT&T park, there's NO EXCUSE not to come here before a ballgame!
Staff here is just as awesome and friendly as the Van Ness location and order ANYTHING on the menu, as everything here is awesome. (Mint Mojito if the way to go if you're indecisive).
I think I've gone to more ball games just for an excuse to come here for coffee!
author: Jerald B.

description:
I had heard about Philz awhile back through a friend but never really got a chance to try it out until last week.  At first I was a bit overwhelmed because there were so many different flavor selections and the line was literally out the door.  

I figured I would just go with my usual Mocha, but the barista offered to give me a different spin on it.  Feeling adventurous I gave it a try, but she assured me it would change my life.  My fellow Yelpers, I'm not even blowing it up, it did! I no longer can go back to regular office coffee or even a Starbucks.  

In return for this new addiction of mine I now have to do 3 random acts of kindness as per this Barista's request. :)  I'm paying it forward as we speak.  

The name of this?  Mocha with Jacob's Brew, add cinnamon.

Goodbye Starbucks Peppermint Mocha, you are officially retired!
author: Daniella J.

description: You can't compare Philz coffee to Starbucks because the concepts are totally different. I love both. The reason Philz does not get a 5 star is because they use fatty milk in their coffee. I'm not a big fan of all the calories, but on the other hand the coffee does taste AMAZING. On days where I have time to doppy doo I head to Philz, otherwise it's Starbucks for faster service.
author: M W.

description: Good cup of coffee. Lots of variation if you want something different than an average black cup. Though, it's not a GREAT coffee considering they brew each cup individually, there are lines out the door, and a black cup costs as much as a cappuccino.
author: Katie L.

description:
Came in here for the first and had to take a seat because i was blown away by their list of coffee blends. This was followed by another minute of description reading below the counter. 

As if i wasn't indecisive enough debating between iced or hot on my walk here, i was definitely indecisive now. Did i want a light roast or a medium roast??

In the end i couldn't resist the ecstatic iced coffee that claims to be one of the best in the universe. So iced coffee it is!

Cream and sugar? Yes, but light on the sugar. 

And my drink came up and i took a sip. Hmm...good.....sip......something about this coffee.....so many notes i cant even place it.......sip......must be the creamer also, something about this creamer....

I'll eventually figure this out :)

But i likes.

update: their iced coffee is the last drippings of their last few coffees so it'll be different everytime. the first time i had it was great. second time.....meh.....
author: Thuy M.

description: I'm not much of a coffee drinker and if my friend didn't bring me here, I would not have ever known about this place. He ordered for us but he got me just a regular coffee while he got himself a mint mojito iced coffee. I wish he just got me the mint mojito iced coffee too because after trying it, I just wanted to trade!
author: Connie Y.

description:
If you want the highest concentration of caffeine combined with great taste in handmade coffee.  THIS IS IT.  Lately my favorite is #8 "Anesthesia to the Upside"

Aside from the quality of the coffee, you should be very pleased with the personable service. :)

WARNING: YOU WILL BE BUZZING HIGH OFF OF CAFFEINE. 
After my initial Philz binge, I backed off, and really don't do Philz anymore unless I want that high.  I'm a serious coffee lover, and Philz keeps me up until 3am even if I drank it at 9am. :P

I'm generally a lot happier with a macchiato or short latte.
author: Oren F.

description: This is the only place that I've found that incorporates anise in their drinks. I had my tea with anise. Beyond rare & delicious. The staff is really friendly and if its your first time they really help you customize your drink.
author: L T.

description:
the people working here are just so darn helpful and friendly. the menu of coffee beans is enormous so i was advised to try the tesoro since i wanted a medium roast. the coffee is delicious! but beware, it's also STRONG. i usually dont feel the effects of caffeine, but i was wired by the time i got to work. (productivity ftw!)

oh thumbs up to the super clean bathroom! a little awkward since it's unisex but with two stalls...so when a man opened the door and saw me washing my hands, he immediately went "SORRY!!" and ran away before i could tell him it was okay for him to come in. 

if you can snag a table here, it's a great place to get work done.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Many of my friends have been raving about this coffeehouse for so long and I was finally able to stop by and try the famous Mint Mojito Ice Coffee a couple weekends ago. And it was by far the BEST coffee that I have ever tasted!
author: Donna I.

description: Their coffee tastes like heaven. Their crew are extremely friendly!  Though I need some tips as what type of coffee I should choose if I don't want to use Half&Half milk.  Once I tried low-fat milk, it's like you get kicked out from heaven.
author: Jason D.

description: Ugh, I wish they had a Philz out in my neck of the woods (Danville/Walnut Creek)!  This is my coffee shop when I'm in/around San Francisco.  The quality of the brew is unmatched by the larger chains, and the employees who work here, are hip, friendly, and remember your beverage of choice.  It hard to go to Starbucks, or another place, once you've tasted the quality of this cup of coffee.  It's more expensive than your stale Starbucks brew, but I'd pay extra for the individually prepared and better tasting cup that you get from Philz.
author: Mike M.

description: How could you not love this place? It's a block away from Caltrain, the staff is great and the coffee is ahhhhmaaaazing.  The only thing that bums me out some mornings is that I don't have enough time to wait in line and wait for my coffee.  I like the interactions with my coffee peeps so ordering in ahead of time is a no go for me.  This place is really busy right before the trains leave so there's a little anxiety but It's worth it to wait for my personal cup of Philz (wanted to say Joe but that would be offending...lol) and a sprint to catch my train.  I've tried almost every type of Philz coffee and now I choose my roast by my mood on that day.  My favorites are the Ether, Code 33,Tesora and of course the Philtered Soul.  I give this place a bunch of smileys and likes.  Philz makes my mornings happy.  :)
author: Marita S.

description: Tastes great & has selection of milk and sweetness levels. Always a wait and limited and crowded seating. It is more of a "go on your way with coffee in hand" shop than a "comfy use their wifi for three hours" place.
author: R C.

description:
love philz coffee!

sadly the location isnt the closest to me but luckily my friend loves it so much she has no problem making the drive

this location for philz is pretty nice right next to a dog park and close to the water 

the workers are super nice and do their jobs super well i think 

overall just great ppl and great coffee, always happy to make a stop here
author: Matt F.

description: Service is great, staff is friendly and the coffee is awesome!!!
author: Brian P.

description:
Aside from good coffee (yes the Tesora IS good!) and good people, Philz has the best 4 bucks you'll ever spend: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee:

1) Wakes you up

2) Enjoy a cocktail before you go to work

3) No chance of a hangover

4) It's breakfast

5) It's dessert

6) Minty fresh breath

Enjoy.
author: Snuffles B.

description: i think i may like this location the best. it's tucked away, and nice open layout. just not much around tho
author: Alvin D.

description:
Open the lid of your Philz coffee 20 after minutes ordering it.  What are those oily bubbles? That's fat from the manufacturing cream that's been added to the coffee.  Gross, right?  No. Mix it up and keep drinking.  mmmmm!  

There's a reason Philz was recently voted the #1 coffee shop in the city (by SF weekly).  They don't give you a cup of their brew from a large tank like Starbucks or Peets.  They make each cup by hand and it's completely full service.  A barista takes your order, grabs the beans, grinds them, brews pour over style, adds cream/sugar, "tosses" the coffee which cools it and introduces a whipped like texture with air bubbles suspended by the fat and finally adds mint.

Yell out how much cream (or fat free milk), sugar, mint, etc. you want and they take care of the rest. My two favorites are the New Manhattan and Tesora.  I always order it with a bit of cream and no sugar.  It's excellent!

Things to know about this location: Parking here is a bit of a challenge.  Since each cup is made one at a time, it can be a while from when you first put in your order to when your coffee is ready so bring extra quarters for the meters.
author: Samir C.

description:
After a coworker of mine brought some Philz coffee(Silken Splendor) to work, I was hooked. I've been white grande mocha regular from Starbucks but after having a small cup of some Philz Coffee, I am hooked to getting some Philz coffee over Starbucks any day of the week but only if they had more locations, preferably in the peninsula. 

I've tried the Mocha Tesora and it tasted too much like hot chocolate and wasn't feeling it at the time. I like my coffee to taste like coffee and not hot chocolate. 

At any rate, if you want to taste some great coffee and haven't tried it yet, you should try it. You won't regret it. It's not as expensive as Starbuck imo.

It's the only coffee that I can drink black without the wired jittery feeling that I get from Pete's or Blue Bottle coffee.
author: robert c.

description:
Summary based on 1 visit:
--stopped here while killing time on a work site visit
--somewhat put off by the approved language deal.  You can't just order a double shot latte with non-fat milk, but have to be quizzed on what you like.  They were so nice about it, though that I can't penalize them.
--standard prices
--ok place to do a conference call (though I always wonder if the people around me think that)
--no parking of course
author: Rich H.

description: Customer service is wonderful here.  Even with people who order crazy ish like "mint mojito with soy and 4.5 packs of splenda" and then change it because it's better regular with CREAM... *hangs head* sorry.
author: Tokki M.

description: Love this coffee. Great service. Have yet to find a better coffee in San Francisco.
author: Kennie B.

description:
As far as coffee goes, I can't think of a better place than Philz in SF.  It does the caffination job sooo effing well I lay awake thinking about it at night...LITERALLY.  I usually feel the same or maybe slightly eless sleepy with other places **cough* Starbucks *cough* but I feel like I downed a bottle of adderall mixed with speed after Philz.  

Tantalizing Turkish? 10.0

For the more mild caffinated beverage try the Iced Mojito.  Tastes earth-shattering.  Yes, that good.

Job well done Philz...Job. Well. Done.
author: Paran Y.

description:
I love this part of SF and Philz is tucked away nicely not far from CalTrain.   I drove in early today (just me and the rising Sun), and was not looking forward to Starbucks, until I heard the calling of Philz.  I drive right past 4th and King, and Berry is just a hop/skip/jump off the path, so to Philz I went.  

I'm really bored with Starbucks and Peet's seems to be less strong than before. Is it just me?  Philz fits the bill perfectly.

The staff at this location is great!  Super friendly and chatty.  I got the Jacob's brew and a couple of others were suggested for next time.  Honestly, it's 7pm and I'm still buzzing from it.  :/

--------

Updated 3.18.10:
I've had the "New Manhattan" blend and YOWZA!!!!!  Wow, it's awesome!!!
author: Sparkely K.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE.... good thing we live right by here (and its definitely a factor to the reason we renew our exorbitantly priced rental each year)!! 

have tried a lot of coffee's over the last couple of years, but absolute all time favorite is the Handmade Espresso (but with creme and sugar - a friend from Boston who ordered it actually led to my discovery of it) and So Good (i mean with a name like that, its just gotta be, right? yes, right!)

Also, only here did i learn that Light Roast has more caffeine than Dark Roast! its obvious once you think about it, but i know there are others who thought they should be ordering the dark for a nice string cup of Joe! 

The service is great, the ambiance is kinda hipster, a lot of people studying, working on their computers. Their food selection is OK. Not a real fan of anything really (tried the samosa, the scones, muffins, the burritos)
author: Sapna E.

description:
I broke up with Peet and moved on with Phil, sorry Peet!

Philz has so many different blends of coffee that sometimes I go bonkers cause I want to try them all (then I'd really go bonkers)!  I always order sooo good and it really makes me say "mmm this is sooo goooood."  It's a medium blend and gives the perfect tingle to my tongue.  Each cup of coffee is freshly brewed, made to order, and is given the amount of sugar and milk to your taste.  

Philz is on the complete opposite side of the city from where I live, so whenever I go watch a baseball game, I MAKE SURE I visit my Phil.  It's about 4 bucks a cup, which is on the pricey side, but it's a nice treat from time to time.  The coffee is strong, rich, and bold-just the way I like it!  The girl always asks if it tastes alright.  If not, no pahbum!!  Easily fixed.
author: Cheryl Q.

description:
Good coffee, prepared well. Don't buy coffee anywhere that doesn't make it on-demand. 

One star off because I've had more than one experience with baristas there who know VERY little about coffee in general (or Philz coffee in particular.)  One time I asked which of their many blends would be strong in Ethiopian coffees, and they had no idea.  Another time I had to explain to the barista that "Harrar" referred to a growing region in Ethiopia. 

After that, I wasn't even about to bother asking what the roast date was. 

Philz, please give your staff more training, so I can give you another star!
author: Phil F.

description: Great coffee shop! I stopped by for a afternoon cup of coffee and it wasn't too busy.   They have a really fun menu, and a huge selection of drinks.  The staff was really friendly and happy to help explain the different drinks.  I ordered the "Ecstatic Iced Coffee" is was better than any iced coffee I've had from Starbucks.  It takes them a couple minutes to make your drink but it's worth the wait. Nice shop in a fun part of town and it's a unique place to hang out and work or chat.
author: Daniel W.

description: Philz has turned my coffee hating husband into a coffee loving one. He only craves Philz though. Particularly the dark roasts like Aromatic Arabic or Jacob's Wonderbar (our favorite). On occasion I'll go for the Herbal Mint Tea and ask them to add a TON of honey in it mimicking Moroccan mint tea that I'm in love with since visiting. Philz cares about customer satisfaction asking you to try your drink to make sure you like it. Don't think about adding your own cream and sugar. The baristas know best. Trust them and trust me. The coffee going down just Philz so goood.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Absolutely can't visit San Francisco w/o getting a Philtered Soul. And the man who made my coffee was friendly, helpful and cute!  ;-)

Philtered Soul.....it's so good.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Philz cannot do wrong. Different locations, yet same great quality coffee. Went with a large Iced Mint Mojito this time and my day was made. :)
author: David P.

description: holy cow!!! this is like an orgasm in your mouth! philz... they're so good, you can't even compare them to all the other coffee joints around. their slogan is something like one cup at a time. and that's that. the drinks i'd die for... philtered soul (medium blend) w/vanilla soy. as far as the iced coffees go, everyone has to try the mint mojito! it's so creamy and has just enough sweetness! uh oh... i need my philz fix... NOW!
author: Ann T.

description: I discovered Philz Coffee when I was on the first date with my bf and I loved the Mint Mojito until I started to customize it and it just tastes different every time I ordered it. Later on I tried the Tesorra and it became my new favorite. They don't have one on the East Bay, unfortunately..
author: Emma Y.

description: This place is amazing. I'm not a big coffee drinker, but this place is giving me second thoughts. Outstanding coffee.
author: Jason A.

description:
Who needs Prozac when there's Philz coffee?

I was having a particularly hard day at work.  You know, the kind where all of your hard work is unraveling before your very eyes, and you can't think of a single thing to do save it?

Yeah - well, the first thing that helps in this situation is a terrific friend.  Enter JK - and I checked that box off.

The second thing one needs is good food.  JK and I had that at Primo Patio Cafe. Second check.

The third thing you need is an outstanding stimulant - and this is where Philz saves the day.

The weather was dreary and cold.  The level of disappointment in a few people was incredulously high.  The stress was so intense you could cut it with a knife.  Years were coming off my lifespan at that moment.

But one cup of their Wonderbrew and I kid you not - my entire outlook began to change.

A strong, bold cup of piping hot, freshly brewed coffee with Philz Special Heavy Cream concoction and brown sugar.........


And all was well with the world again.
I was wired for the next eight hours, basically bouncing off the walls, but it's all good.

This is what coffee was meant to be.
author: Grace K.

description: Coffee is pretty good. Most of the reviews talk about iced coffee or a mojito which I could never try. I'm a coffee purist....nothing added...just brew it. I wouldn't rank it above Pete's. Also it usually has a ridiculous line to get in the place. Maybe I missed something, but if the lines short I'll stop. There are other places on my way.
author: Brian S.

description:
Only a couple long SF blocks from mi casa & around corner from Giants Ballpark.. my latest on foot find..

Omg omg omg I knew nothing about Turkish coffee but peel me off the ceiling now...I have been so out of the loop..but no longer!  As if I needed more buzz to annoy muni passengers all I can say is watch out now.

I may have to stowe away on the next boat to Turkey or make a trade. Wowza. Can we replace a few or all of those awful over priced Starbucks in the city. Now I have Philz (not my favorite name) but coffee & words with "Z" will make it a destination along with Peets (they give me free stuff)
author: Bryan G. W.

description:
It's expensive

It's a little snooty

It kinda takes a long time

But damn is it tasty!

So far "it's the best" is my favorite blend but I've only tried a few. The tesora was ok, but I think my experience was marred by the cream. I like whole milk or 2% in my coffee and I didn't think to ask for it on my first visit. 
The pastries are tasty also. Try the big oat bar if you're looking for something to really tide you over till your next meal.
author: Melanie V.

description:
I get Philz almost every morning and love it! I'm a light roast person, because I like the caffeine and I don't care for the carmelized flavor of the dark roasts. The Canopy of Heaven, Ambrosia (medium roast), Anaesthesia (also medium roast), Soo Good, and the Greater Alarm are all in the rotation.

I justify the $3.50 for a cup of individually brewed drip coffee with how much more productive I am after it.

My coworkers have been proselytizing the wonders of the Ancho Chile burrito in curing hangovers, so I finally tried it after a night of sucking down delicious Churchill cocktails and it's confirmed: warm, cheesy, egg filled deliciousness.
author: Alex V.

description:
Dear Philz,

I regret to inform you that you will not be worthy of 5 stars until you start offering a free cup of coffee with purchase of a bag of beans. But I will continue buying both and hope for a better world.

Sincerely, 
Me
author: Carnley P.

description:
I love Philz!!! With exactly the same amount of precision as the city's legendary rivals Blue Bottle Coffee Co, Four Barrel, and Ritual Roasters, Philz ranks among the elite roasters... The baristas are all very warm and certainly know how to brew a great cup of joe. My favorite is the Philtered Soul because I tend to prefer things on the sweeter side. My favorite barista is Phil (not the owner, but knows how to serve it to me as sweet as possible). And, where else in the city can you get a good burrito AND a coffee in the same joint?? My only complaint for this place is I wish they brewed larger cups so I wouldn't have to keep going back every few hours...

Word to the wise: You will incur a wait if you go during lunch hours. Well worth the wait though, and they certainly have something for everyone's drinking taste buds.
author: Tammy H.

description:
We had to walk with our other friends 2 miles to where we were actually staying.  But it was definately worth the wait and walk....

The coffee here is individually made as made to order, one cut at a time and they add the sugar and cream for you too....made to perfection...not too sweet or not Not too sweet...just right....

The aroma of just a coffee drink just opens the senses in my nose and it literally tasted bold (which I love) creamy, piping hot and like a cafe latte...but as strong as a coffee.  Great place!!!  Just wish there was one closer to the south bay area....i'm gonna miss you Philz!!!

Keep up the great work...and a great place to chill and watch the World Cup Soccer game too..too bad the women's team just didn't have enough at the end to close it out....just gave it away...let the Japanese hang around too close at the end..   :(
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Delicious!!!!!

The Ambrosial coffee certainly was godly and I'm for sure going to come back.

My friend and I visited just before heading to the giants game and it was just what we needed in order to keep warm during sf's chilly nights.
author: Veronica D.

description: So good. I love their coffee. Glad they are opening stores all over. Phil and Jacob are great guys. Their teas are super d-lish also. I like that they offer savory breakfast foods.
author: Heather B.

description:
If you like inconsistent coffee, long waits, and paying 2x as much as SBUX come here!!!

So, I've had a dozen or so coffees from philz over the past few weeks because it is close to the jobby job and although the concept is compelling it doesn't really work. Each barista will make your coffee different than the rest. This is particularly the case if you like a little sugar in your coffee because everyone seems to have different concepts of "medium sweet". You are better off adding the accoutrements yourself (at the risk of offending them). The only way around this inconsistency is to try to order from the same barista every time, but even this has inherent variability when you are talking about hand-made anything. The only way to REALLY have a consistent single brew is the Starbucks Clover system which is amazing, but still isn't available at all locations. Clover coffees are only a couple dimes more expensive than their regular drip which is pretty great. 

Lines can form quickly (right out the door by 9am at this location) and you can wait a long time to checkout as baristas often double as cashiers.  Today, the wait was quite long and the barista seemed flustered and put cream in my coffee when I had asked for none.

The good news is that they have nice comfy sofas, free wifi, a plasma TV for sports, and people have generally been nice. Also, about 20% of the time when they get things perfect the coffee is heavenly. But at this price-point, I will take SBUX (fast and consistent for the past 18 years I've been addicted to coffee) over Philz anyday.

Candy C. is right that the menu can be absolutely intimidating to the first time visitor and they could do a lot more to orient newbies with better customer service, maybe a little cheat sheet "how-to" menu, and clearer instructions/signage on where to line up to order. It is ironic they would make fun of Starbuxians when SBUX made Philz possible to exist at all. 

Frankly, and this may come as good news to locals, the Philz concept is unlikely to be able to scale the way Petes and SBUX have for the above reasons so there is probably little chance they will ever become a successful corporate behemoth and spread around Cali or the country. 

Bottom line... I'll still come here on occasion if I am walking by and crave a brew and have $3-4 to spare, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
author: Shawn C.

description: The staff are Coffee geniuses. I usually tell them what I am feeling, and they make magic happen.  Their coffee puts Starbuck's in the Hurt Locker and I like me some Starbuck's too! Philz, if you can hear me, open up in the North Bay like Petaluma!
author: Jeff B.

description: Same great coffee and service as the original Philz on 24th, but the corporate or commuter feel (not unexpected, given its proximity to both Mission Bay and the Caltrain) lessens the charm - for what you're paying for coffee (vs. the Starbucks & Panera two blocks away), wouldn't you want to stick around for a while?
author: Alan C.

description:
Stop!  No more!  I simply cannot develop a finicky taste for yet *another* comestible!

I'll probably never go back to Philz, to be honest with you.  It really was one of the best cups of coffee I've ever had, and the end user experience is incredibly positive (these are baristas who've had some training in the coffees they pour, how they're made, what they taste like, etc), and so on.

But at $3.25 for a large coffee, we're getting close to doubling my usual coffee splurge, which is the $1.95 large over at Peet's.

Look, the experience of eating, of drinking, hell, of jerking off... these are all experiences which can be refined.  They can be elevated and taken somewhere new and, frankly, more enjoyable.

But there's a price to be paid for this enhanced experience, and it's always a larger pile of coin.

I just can't do it.

Organic produce, heritage beef, free range chickens, I mean FUCK, it just goes on and on.  I get it, the stuff tastes better, but seriously, I'm like lower middle class, and I simply cannot AFFORD to have "the best" all the time.

It doesn't work, with apologies to the cult of Michael Pollan.  What am I going to do, put off my pipe dream of buying a house back *another* five years so that I can have wild buffalo steaks and heirloom arugula?  I mean, I would *like* to have those things, but the math... it's always the numbers that say "don't be a fucking idiot, dude, your money doesn't split that many ways."

So, while Philz is truly fantastic coffee, with stellar presentation, and an unparalleled eye to customer experience in the coffee house world, it's really a gateway drug to "the finer things."

For me, it's not a realistic option.  I envy people who have either the discretionary income or sufficient joie de vivre that they can engage fully with a cup of Philz and just enjoy it for what it is:  great fucking coffee.

I can't do it.  I just see another stone in my financial tomb and I taste ashes.
author: Martin W.

description:
One of my fave 3rd wave coffee places.  Philz has the best ice coffee around.  I can't recall the exact name of the drink but I believe it was something like minty soul?  No biggie, you can still go in and tell them what you like and the trained baristas will be able to take care of you, no problem. 

As for the decor, very comfy place.  You can easily find a nice comfy couch to read and enjoy your coffee.
author: Karen N.

description: Loving the Yerba Mate. Used to come here daily when I worked around the corner.
author: Michael K.

description:
Now that I've started to take the caltrain to work every morning, this is my first stop. 1 large red secret, medium cream and sugar...or...1 large ambrosia and I'm set. Occasionally I'm weak and I add a warm chocolate croissant to the order :)
Thanks for making my train ride more enjoyable every morning!
author: shadi m.

description: Philz does not need another 5 star review but this is for my keeps on my eats. I get excited inside thinking about the Mojito iced coffee. It is so good it can motivate me to actually go to class (from the Outer Richmond to China Basin commute!) The small size is intense enough to cause me palpitations, though.
author: Vicki T.

description: My so far favorite Philz location! The staff here are always super friendly, and the coffee and tea is always wonderful! It's usually pretty easy to grab a seat and read, get some work done, or chat with friends. There's extension cords conveniently placed around seating areas so you never have to worry about your laptop giving out.
author: Heather U.

description: I live right by it.  I'm glad it's here.  Coffee is good but the place is over hyped.  I don't like their pastries.
author: Aban E.

description: Baristas are so friendly and helpful and coffee is to die for. Iced Mint mojito and decaf Swiss water are my go to drinks.
author: Caroline P.

description:
Oh my goodness this place is good. I used to be a cup-a-day coffee drinker, and I'm glad I kicked that habit..because it would be a dangerous here! This place is right by my work, they have vegan pastries, and about 25 different types of coffee. And everything I've ever had has been delicious. 

I'm still a big fan of the S-bucks for a usual Americano, but if you're in the mood for something special, definitely stop by Philz. It's a bit slower than Starbucks, but that's because they're making that cup for you (just for you!) and they want to make sure it's delicious. 

Make sure you tell them you want cream and/or sugar (they also have 2 kinds of soy!) because they'll mix it for you. They'll also make you taste it to make sure it's a-ok...something you def won't get at another coffee spot.

Ground to perfection: Yummy coffee, lots of flavors, soy and vegan options, friendly staff, decent prices ($3-4)

Bitter and burnt: Parking is crummy at this location, outside seating is freezing 90% of the year.

Make sure to enter by the door on the right!
author: Sarah K.

description: Knowledge comes with time. More than a year later and I can definitely appreciate a real, GOOD cup of coffee! (Although I still need sugar in my coffee.) Quality coffee here indeed. Especially LOVE the iced mint mojito on a rare, warm day in SF. It's a real treat.
author: Jacqueline V.

description: Totally lived up to the hype. The coffee is perhaps the best I've had. Atmosphere perfectly acceptable, enjoyed a rattan chair on the sidewalk.
author: Nomad T.

description: I love their coffee! I think their ecstatic iced coffee is the best I've ever had. I'm going to miss it when I move :( The line moves a little slowly, and sometimes but the workers are usually considerate and let you know theyre going to get to you soon (-1 star)
author: Sean S.

description:
Ughhhhhhh PHILZ.. how I love thee. If only I lived in the city, then I would have you every day!! Yes.. each cup is hand crafted with your preferred ratios. They even got my sugar preference perfect: somewhere in between medium sweet and barely there. 

I've had a few different drinks there, but I am in LOVE with Tantalizing Turkish -- it's so dark and mysterioso. YUM.

Yes, Blue Bottle does have good coffee, but this place has good coffee AND a wonderful, patient, and happy staff. If you want to look up someone's nostrils feeling like they just stepped on your puppy, go to Blue Bottle. But otherwise, come here to revel in the gloriousness that is Philz!
author: Penny Y.

description:
This review is strictly for the service on a rainy Sunday. Maybe they were short-staffed? 

I don't think it's very nice if there's a super long line and you continue to chat casually with your co-worker working at an obviously annoyed slow pace. 

It was my first time at this location but my second time at any Philz, so I had some questions on their brews. I only asked one or two and he already looked annoyed and wanted me to make my decision.

It took forever for my brother to get his tea...that shouldn't take long at all because I don't think they brew their own teas too? or maybe they do. 

Anyways, they also had to close an hour earlier that night for some reason. 

Coffee here is awesome....maybe I just came on the wrong night?
author: Christina T.

description: They have a lot of throughput for a per order brew coffee.  It's a made to order by the cup coffee place with pastries on the side.  I didn't know what it was when I went into there.  No espresso is for sale here.  They only do brewed coffee.  Went in with some compadres and it was fun enough.  The coffee comes bucket sized.  However I think that there are too many choices for the casual coffee consumer.  They did help pick.  I went a few times with co-workers and tried several ones.  The quality is fine;  however the flavors that I tried didn't quite suit my tastes.
author: George G.

description: By far my favorite place for iced coffee and I've tried iced coffees from MANY places. I always get iced coffee, with cream, medium-sweet and somehow, they always get it perfect. The staff is super nice and always willing to make changes to your drink if it isn't right. I've also tried their iced mint mojito coffee, Philharmonic, and Ambrosia. They're all really good but I always keep going back to my regular iced coffee. I always get Philz when I'm in the area and definitely crave it if I haven't had it in a while. I'm a lifetime fan of this place!
author: Krishna S.

description:
Probably the most amazing cup of coffee I have ever had, and I hate hippie coffee joints.  It is two blocks from work and I will become a frequent customer...

This guy really does know coffee, and it is good.
author: Andy H.

description:
Oh your God, there's a menu board filled with different blends of coffee beans that can be made into a drink. No, I'm not talking about lattes, and cappuccinos that use the same coffee with different combination of other ingredients. This place has a billion different whole bean coffee blends you can have made into a glorious cup of coffee. (okay, maybe not a billion, but there's a lot) It's a coffee lovers dream!

On top of that, the baristas are really friendly and passionate about what they do. If you don't know what blend of coffee to get, ask them to suggest one. Then they'll grind the beans for your cup, filter it by hand -- not WITH their hand -- and ask you to try it and let them know if you like it. You don't get that level of service, well, anywhere.

This is a perfect first stop after you get off the caltrain.

Plus, there are fedoras!

I tried the philtered soul (AKA #16) and was really blown away. I'm used to coffee having a hint of flavor, but this one packed a punch of nuts and hazelnut. I had to go up and ask the guy behind the counter if it had syrup or other flavoring in it. Nope, that was just the flavor of the pure, black, unadulterated beans. So I bought a 1/2lb of it to give to my parents, which are bigger coffee snobs than I.

Plus all their coffee comes from shade grown sources. Why is that important? Well I'll tell you. Coffee is the second most traded commodity in the world, after oil, and it is wreaking havoc on rain forests which are being clear cut to increase production. Shade Grown means that the coffee is grown in the traditional manner, under the shade of the natural tree canopies and does NOT destroy the surrounding forests (http://bit.ly/P6BSh). Fair trade is good for the farmers, BUT shade grown is good for the environment. Always ask your barista if the coffee they serve is certified Shade Grown!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I haven't drank coffee in almost a year, but hearing about Philz Coffee as one of the best coffees that can compete with Blue Bottle, I had to give up my born again Coffee Virginity to somebody named Philz... 

Being new to the ways of coffee all over again, I asked the barista how should I proceed. After wooing me a little, I decided on Jacob's wonderbar. And she done me right!!! Although it's a little pricey from the $2 bucks a cup, it was definitely worth it!!!

A week later, I have become a coffee slut again... Thanks Philz :)
author: Minh V.

description:
This could be the hardest Yelp I ever write! 
Seriously, I don't think there are enough words to express how fantastically marvelous Philz @ 4th and Berry is. 

Every Philz location gives you the coffee experience you have been longing for, even if you didn't realize you were missing out, one visit will change you for life. 

As Jacob says "its like Grandma's house", its a home away from home and I settle in for the duration whenever I can....which is regularly and easy to do since EVERYONE makes you so welcome..... that's a shout out to you Shauna! :) 

Try a different blend each visit, find a favorite and then change it up and have someone "create" something unique for you...... it's just SUPERB. 

See ya there (I'll probably be on the flowery sofa!!)
author: Kat C.

description:
Overall (8/10)
Coffee (9/10) -  very tasty
Price (6/10) - bit steep, I advice buying a pound and home brewing. 
Atmosphere (7/10) - nice but a bit hectic for me.

TIP - if you want the creaminess of cream, but not the caloric intake, get the low fat version INSTEAD of 2% milk or skim.  


This place is pretty great for coffee.  Is it a place I would sit and talk to someone... NO, but would i grab a cup of coffee yes then I would come here.  My honest opinion is to grab a pound of coffee to go.  All of the great taste, none of the hectic-ness!  If you need help buying something, go ask them for advice.  Tell them what you are looking for, and they will direct you to the right roast.  

Would I come back? YOU BETCHA
author: Andrew A.

description:
I don't consider myself a coffee expert by any means, but I did think I knew a tad more than some.  You go to Philz and you realize how little you know, but in a good way.

I wanted to try all their coffees, but was in heaven with the ones we tried.  And woe be to man who doesn't try to mojito.  It's freaking coffee, but tastes like a mojito.

It's hard to adjust to coffee, post Philz, but I'll manage.  In a way, I feel like spitting mouthfuls of hot coffee on anyone who happens to be nearby.  But again, I'll manage.
author: Philip N.

description:
I'm in my 9th month of pregnancy due any day now, but being pregnant and loving coffee is the WORST! I've gone 9 months without regular coffee - caffeine is restricted during pregnancy. Do you know what that does to someone who can admittingly say they had a slight addiction?!? 

I've tried all kinds of decaf coffee to try to quench my thirst and they've all tasted like cr*p. UNTIL, I was introduced to Philz! I had my first cup of the decaf Sumatra about a month ago and the flavor is ridiculously good. And it's decaf coffee!! Unheard of! If it didn't lack caffeine and I didn't feel like I needed a nap at 1pm, it would seriously fool me for regular coffee! The smell of the coffee in the shop alone is mesmerizing! Looking forward to a flavorful, caffeine blasted cup of coffee once the baby is out.
author: N. Monique S.

description:
My boyfriend just got a job here! So I'm sort of on an unofficial mission to try the majority of the menu and decide on what will be "my drink." 

Unfortunately, I think some workers make drinks better than others (like for instance, earlier today we had a cup of Silken Splendor that was undrinkable) so I'm sorry if you get someone who's lazy with how they brew. 

The drinks I've had so far are really wonderful, like unlike any other coffee you've ever ordered or brewed yourself. One of the other workers said this, "You can buy the beans and make it at home yourself, but it's not the same. It's never the same." 

I think this place might slowly be becoming my favorite coffee shop.
author: Holly S.

description:
This place gives me the jitters... in a good way! 

Philz coffee is the only coffee that can wake me up and keep me awake. If it's your first time, let them know and they will let you know how they work. They tailor make your coffee to your liking without adding all the fluff as some other coffee shops do. Its real hardcore stuff! 

My favorite has got to be the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee especially made by Phil (he's the one with the bed head and scruff). 

If you want REAL coffee, this is the place to get it.

I'm addicted!
author: Peonie S.

description:
I'm a coffee person.  Not an expresso, latte, cappuccino person.  I drink it black.  So Philz should cater to me almost perfectly, but I'll get back to that.

Philz does drip coffee (a bit of a trend these days), so you end up waiting a bit but they're fairly meticulous in how they prepare the coffee.  They have a ton of different flavors to choose from, which is quite overwhelming but the folks there are great at holding your hand through the choices.  The setup at this location is better than most others in the city because its bigger, but it feels like a weird mix mash of tables, chairs, stools, etc.  It's not the most relaxing or inviting seating and table configuration, but most people are just here for the coffee.  I've probably been here over a dozen times and the coffee is good, albiet on the pricier side for coffee.  Unfortunately, there's a bit too many to try and to compare, so its hard to settle down on a favorite.

I enjoy the coffee here but I think I prefer the simplicity of Starbucks.  It's fast and I don't like thinking too much about my coffee.  So I still like this place, but its not my everyday joint.
author: Vu N.

description: Just left there with my Chai Tea, truly the best I have had. Not too sweet, not too strong, just perfect. Forgot to thank the beautiful lady who made it!
author: Daveen L.

description:
Let me start off by saying- I will never be the same again!  I was a bit overwhelmed by all the coffee brew selections.  I'm typically a non-fat latte drinker and was wondering where the Lattes were on their menu.  

The barista invited us up to the bar after seeing my look of confusion on my face.  He was SUPER nice and explained to us the brews and asked my and my boyfriend what we typically drank and liked in our coffee.  You could tell they put a LOT of TLC in every cup so that each brew is perfect for each person.  Like a coffee family.  I've never had such a wonderful coffee experience.  

Since then I cannot stop thinking of the coffee and trying to figure out how to get Philz on a daily basis- even though I work in San Bruno.  Nothing will come close to a Philz experience :(  They've almost ruined me when drinking anything else.

Another plus side they had Scrabble there!  My boyfriend and I completed the entire board.  Love the place and now a super fan of Philz.  Now I know what all the craze was about.  Even if you're not a coffee drinker- gotta try it!
author: Jessica C.

description: I frequent the downtown Palo alto Philz almost every weekday morning, they're great, but Brosnan here at berry just made me one of the best coffees I've ever had. He's awesome.
author: Jesse B.

description:
Coffee and me are a curious thing.  I've been drinking it consciously (i.e., aware of what I'm tasting) at coffee houses for just about 20 years now, so I'd like to think I'm at least approaching connoisseur status if I'm not already there.

But at the same time, I'm quite flexible when it comes to the black elixir.  For example, my daily coffee downtown was merely dictated by the place that was most conveniently on my way to the office.  Way back when, that might have been Pasqua or oh la la!  More recently, Peet's or Starbucks (heard of them???).  Even more, if I'm in a situation where McD's or an AM/PM are the only options, bring it on!

This review relates much more, however, to my long-winded paragraph about being a connoisseur than it does to my run-on paragraph about being easy going.  Once again I have Yelp to thank for first hearing about Philz, followed by a select few friends and colleagues.  But when, oh when, would I ever come across a Philz?

Enter my new job which takes me to China Basin.  Google maps, zoom in, Philz!!!  Next morning, walk in....how does this place work?  It looks like a bar!  Super friendly and helpful staff, guided me toward a Tantalizing Turkish on my maiden visit.  Toss a mint leaf on top and take my first sip o' Philz.

Well people, that's all it took:  ONE sip.  Peet's, Starbucks, etc., thanks for trying.  But Philz takes it to a whole nother level.  And it ain't even close.

But now that you know about me and coffee, you know I will continue to drink Peet's and Starbucks and McD's when it's convenient.  I'm a coffee lover, not a fighter.  But wow....Philz.  Da best.

Stay tuned for a review of my first try at Blue Bottle which took place only a week after my first visit to Philz.
author: John K.

description:
Yum, my friend recommended this place, thanks Andrew!
