Oh my goodness be still my heart... really... be still, im still kinda jittery from my last small cup. this stuff is the REAL DEAL the BEES KNEES! and for the price, why would you ever go anywhere else?
the staff knows their coffee, they make it fresh and fast as they can, great service, super chill and friendly. i still dont understand how they pour the piping hot goodness from one pot to the other, there should be a flaring competition for baristas, the philz crew would win.
there are a few tables and chairs inside and outside, there is free wifi, sometimes it cuts out but the guy behind the counter kept resetting it for us, really nice dude.  the baked goods looked yummy, i think andrew got some chocolate thing, i cant remember, but he gave it a thumbs up as he licked the crumbs up off his chin

just wish it weren't as far away from me, though its worth the walk. i'm pretty lazy, especially in the mornings, so if i can walk a mile to get to this place, you know its damn good
author: Mimi Z.

description:
I am not a coffee drinker because I don't like the caffeine but on certain occasions I would sample some here and there. They have the best coffee in San Francisco............Hands down. Yes..........it's better than Pete's, Blue Bottle, Starbucks, Coffee house, etc. Although Blue Bottle is pretty awesome as well. 

I walked in here with a few friends because they love coffee. I wasn't planning on getting one but the barista said, "just try it and if you don't like it you don't have to pay for it." Got sold!!!! Ok. My roomie had the iced coffee mojito and it was awesome. I had the number 4, I think it was called the jacob? Not to sure if I got the name right. but it was great as well. I couldn't finish the cup............it was just too strong for me. 

I usually don't rate coffee or franchise type establishments but this place is awesome!!!
author: jason g.

description:
Philz hits the spot when you need a good ole fashioned cup of joe made right in front of you! You won't find your typical mixed coffees here, but you will be thoroughly impressed with their different roasts and fresh taste.

Reminds me of French press coffee :o)
author: Bryant C.

description:
i never was much of a coffee drinker... until i had philz. and now its over for me. i have philz almost every day! its sooooo frekkin good! i cant help but go everyday! its right by my work, but i'll even come down here on my day off for some philz. yes forrreaalz its that amazing!!

my fave is the ecstatic ice coffee. i love how its served foamy with a pretty mint leaf. when i drink it its like heaven. ahhhhh! the iced mint mojito is good too if you want something sweeter. i am alllll about the ice coffee but when i feel like a regular hot coffee... i get "its the best" with soy, medium sweet. thats another thing thats great about this place. they let you choose how you want it - soy, cream, skim milk, sweet, medium sweet, extremely sweet, or just black! and they dont charge you extra like s'bux!! 

the teas here are delicious as well! iced istanbul treat with cream & honey ~ ooohhh lala! fancy and tasty!

btw... FYI.. im having a philz as i write this review... YUMM!! ^___^ !!
author: Bobbie L.

description: New store, great for working or studying with comfortable seating. as usual, consistent  coffee, parking might be a challenge, but will do whatever it take to pick up my favourte coffee.
author: Shadi K.

description:
Waking up on weekend mornings to a nice cup of Philz "Tesora" is like waking up on a "Canopy of Heaven" where alarm clocks are replaced by a "Greater Alarm" which directs an entire "Philharmonic" to awaken your soul. Their coffee is freshly brewed with "Dancing Water" and taking a sip is absolute "Silken Splendor" running down to the core of your newly "Philtered Soul". The morning brew is "Sooooo Good" that a solitary cup of the "Ambrosia Coffee of God" works like an "Anesthesia To The Upside" causing you to become so alert you could quite possibly run for mayor of "New Manhattan". 

Philz..."It'z The Best"!!!
author: Sue L.

description:
If you're looking for a tasty drip coffee this is the place to go. They have a huge selection of different coffees which actually do taste different. Also, on a hot day their ice coffee is quite good.

On the location itself: expect a small line as this place is very popular and don't expect to find seating as the coffee shop is small.
author: Simon C.

description:
Phil, I have a bone to pick with you, stop making me crave your coffee! I have to come there EVERY saturday for Jacob's WB. It's like a drug. 

During the week I have my americano's and lattes; but on the weekend, its all me n u, Philz....

this isnt taking a star away, but would be nice to see you get some more outdoor tables and get rid of the bar stools...
author: Just A.

description:
Mmmmmm....coffee.

There is something a bit absurd about the brew by the cup method they employ at Philz.  I almost feel like I'm a coffee church instead of just swinging by for a quick cup before a baseball game.  It makes me giggle.

The baristas have always been really helpful in guiding me towards the proper blend for my mood.  The brew by the cup thing slows down the whole caffeine delivery process.  I imagine this would be annoying in a caffeine emergency.  But if you've got a few minutes and have a hankering for a really good cup of coffee, you can't go wrong with Philz.
author: Renae H.

description:
my go-to philz location is the one on 24th street in the mission but this one is close to work so i come here sometimes and i gotta say... the mission location is far superior.

sure, the coffee is the same (delicious and heavenly, in case you were wondering).  and the space is fine.  but generally, i feel like the employees are a little less excited to be at work compared to the philz on 24th.  there are a few people who have been nice but it seems like there's a general grumpiness with the employees here.

i'm thankful that we have philz coffee in the office so i can brew i whenever i want but sometimes it just tastes better when the professionals do it...
author: Lauren P.

description:
Always great coffee! It was my first time at phliz and I totally fell in love. The employees were super passionate about the coffee and directed me to perfect coffee- Philtered- tasted like chocolate. I got it with cream and sugar, and it was fabulous. 

Venue was FABULOUS. huge area, lots of awesome couches and games. Great for studying.
author: Sirina K.

description:
I go in about once a week even though I work nearby. It's my weekend treat. My girlfriend loves this place and while I think the folks who work there are friendly and the coffee is good (Ice Mint Mojito and Mocha Tesora without sugar!) the staff, pretty much without fail, always delivers to me the wrong size drink. 

I will admit I waiver in my drink size more than I waiver between drink options. But when a customers asks for a large and gets a small or vis versa on a consistent basis it just begins to drive a person nuts. I can't even blame it on being because I get the same person making my drink each week, in fact, just today there was a completely different person making my drink than there has been in the past few weeks.

Part of the problem is that the place gets crazed. The staff are working on four drinks at once and without writing things down I think they mix up the sizes. There are tricks perhaps of remembering which drink they want but what about the size?

There are only two sizes to chose from. Come on folks, you have a 50/50 chance!
author: Jes M.

description:
OMG! Philz Rulez!
GO!
author: Lenora H.

description: Although expensive, these individually brewed coffees are a treat that's worth the splurge. The staff is super friendly and there are bulk coffees and tasty snacks to accompany your coffee as well.
author: Preethi C.

description:
Coffee is good, Julie's Ultimate is my favorite. 
The shop can get overcrowded but I had positive experience
with their consistent good service. 

The street parking is impossible: No kidding!
author: Yoshiko M.

description:
Hands down, BEST coffee around. Philz has made coffee brewing a fine art and it's fascinating to watch. 

Whether it's for a quick stop or a relaxed visit, there is nothing better than Philz! The 4th/Berry Philz is my favorite of all the locations because I feel like I'm at home. Their coffee is like a burst of sunshine in my mouth and it truly makes me happy! The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff are helpful and kind. Everyone is so nice and they are always able to help me find the right blend to quench my need. With a flick of the wrist, Jacob perfectly tops my coffee with a fresh mint leaf. Mmmmm 

The pastry counter . . . OMG! You have to try the best cookies in town--chocolate ginger. They also have pastries provided by Nabolom Bakery and they are to die for. 

Don't forget to check out the lending library. It's filled with some great books to help pass the time while you sip your coffee and nibble on your pastry. 

I have fallen in love with this place because of the staff. This coffee shop is not just a coffee shop; it's a family business. The customers are treated kindly and it is not uncommon to see Phil, Jacob, and Greg behind the counter. I appreciate the personalized treatment I get whenever I visit and I am always greeted with a smile. I usually walk in and say, "make me something good" and I am never disappointed. 

When you visit, come look for me. I'll be sitting outside in the comfy chairs or on the new floral sofa!!! ;)
author: Kim G.

description:
I love Philz Coffee.  It tastes like no other coffee in the world. (For the record I was a barista in the US and have travelled to Turkey, Israel, France, Italy to name just a few, and tried several styles of coffee).  I must say Philz is like no other!  the cardamon and other spices added really bring on flavors both subtle and robust.  I love the way the baristas shake the milks to prepare a distinct latte-like froth and use sweetening agents to your liking.  I've tried all sorts of coffees and teas at Philz, and I loved them all for different reasons and drink them on different occasions.  

With that being said, not all Philz are created equal.  

I started as a regular at the Mission District location and the ambiance and staff's attitudes are quintessential San Francisco: lax, friendly, inviting, and all around enjoyable with a bit hippy dippy to follow suit.  Then I moved and had to find a new Philz.  That one is now the SOMA location.  The ambiance is a lot less distinct with it's corporate-style coffee house decor, which makes sense considering it's closer to the financial district and the customers might be less hipstery and more young-urban-professionals.  On another note, it's sad to admit and report that the quality control and barista attitudes aren't as regulated here.  Sometimes the coffees are phenomenal and at other times they're watered down depending on the barista.  In the same regard, the staff's attitudes sometimes comes with genuine generosity and others are nothing but sour-faced or snobby.  

The potential is there as long as the staff receives a little more training.  I continue as a regular because I'm willing to gamble to get that perfect coffee that I've randomly received at the SOMA location.  Nothing is perfect, but I'm just saying this Philz may have some things to work on to become a 5-star joint from this regular.
author: N F.

description: Quite possibly the best iced coffee in the world! Great baristas and a relaxing atmosphere! Highly recommended!
author: Steve Y.

description:
Seriously the best coffee I've ever had.  They brew your own individual cup of brew.  My favorite is Jabobs Wonderbar.  Lots of deep rich flavor. the baristas are helpful and friendly.  they serve a lot of different roasts so they'll give you some recommendations depending on the type of coffee you like.  

I'd give them 5 stars... but seriously at like $3-4 a cup.  This is the most expensive drip coffee I've ever had.
author: Sam C.

description: There's a point where  a place just doesn't need anymore 5 star reviews but here's another.  I love Philz and this store in particular.  Everyone there is so incredibly nice.  I'm completely addicted to the Turkish and I'm not even a coffee lover.
author: Kris W.

description:
Like a few people on this site, I am not a big coffee drinker nor do I know how to operate a coffee machine. I don't not know the difference between an expresso or cappucino...nor did I ever care to...but coming to Philz has changed all of that.

I have always winced taking a sip of black coffee from Starbucks, Coffee Bean, and only God knows where. To me, coffee emits only one flavor...and that is bitterness--that, and I can feel it decreasing the pH in my stomach. But at Philz, coffee doesn't taste like burnt water.  Instead, their wide selection of coffee, hints at notes of hazelnut, chocolate...and so much more. 

Recommendations:

+Philtered Soul, since that is what they recommend to coffee noobs. Extremely delicious, especially with the cream-sugar-mixture they pour on top. Coffee has low acidity, which is great since it doesn't drive my stomach too crazy. Medium Roast, which means it has quite a bit of caffeine in it, but not as crazy as the light roast!!


Sigh, I regret giving my coffee maker away (I bought it on sale and gave it away thinking that I would never ever buy coffee). I am sad because now I have to go out an buy myself another coffee maker. Damn you Philz! Damn you and your good coffee.
author: Steph K.

description: I can't believe I've never rated the 4th and Berry Philz!  I mean, they earned two mentions plus a footnote in our holiday letter to friends and family, yet I've never reviewed them on Yelp!  I love the crew, the location (which the semi-sterile Mission Bay architecture can't ruin because of all the families with cute kids and dogs always walking by) and the consistently-stellar coffee.  I spend about as much time there as I can manage.  Best drip coffee ever.
author: Nathan P.

description:
Dayam that was money! I still like Blue Bottle but Philz is not that far behind.

The down low:
Philz (milder)
Blue Bottle (bolder)

I drink coffee with a bit of cream only so at Philz i get a nice mild taste. When I drink Blue Bottle (depending on the type of beans of course) I get the full flavor even with the bit of cream added....

But at Philz the baristas are good peeps, so much props to Phillie Philz....
author: Jay C.

description:
I think it's been about 2+ months now since my introduction to Philz. A coworker told me about them and well after returning to work from having a baby I needed a good cup of coffee. I found it!

Philz "one cup at a time" is fantastic! They have so many different roasts to choose from and they grind the beans for your cup and your cup only and then work some serious magic. I've watched them over and over and man, it's a combination of things they use and do. They cream and sugar it for you! And they do it well.

Try it out. My fav flavors are: Jacobs Wonderbrew (sounds like a beer!) and Philtered Soul...fantastic! 

side note: bring your own mug or buy one of theirs and they only charge you price of a "small" sized coffee! Come on people that's awesome! I have their HUGE mug. :) I'm committed.
author: Jenny G.

description:
Barista: Cute

Coffee: EXCELLENT

History Lesson about Philz Coffee: Priceless

Liquor License?  Sadly...Coffee shops in the US are still not that effing advanced! Come on guys, can I get a beer, and coffee at one stop please?!
author: Peter B.

description:
Everyone who says "Philz has the best coffee", is right! 

I work at another local coffee joint and end up at Philz almost everyday. True story. The price is a bit steep but their coffee is so much more than just your standard drip coffee. They use an individual cupping process which takes a little more time and attention to detail but the wait is completely worth it once you have the first sip. 

If it is your first time visiting make sure you talk with the baristas. They are very knowledgeable about their different roasts and mixes and wot steer you wrong. Also, go for it and let them add the cream and sugar, it makes the coffee just as rich and creamy as any latte.

Favorites: Philtered Soul & Soooo Good
author: Katie P.

description:
I came here because I heard it was the best coffee in the city, and I was headed out on the Caltrain so I stopped by.  I walked in to a place that felt like a dream college late-night study spot: chairs and couches and lots of coffee!  It was a little cramped for space, but not uncomfortably so.

The barista could tell that I was new, as I stood overwhelmed by the number of different coffee blends I had to choose from.  She was very helpful in guiding me to the drink that I would enjoy, and it was one of the best coffees I have ever had!  My only regret is not trying something new- I was guided to a drink she knew I would like, and I did like it very very much, but perhaps next time I will ask for an unfamiliar taste.
author: Natalie H.

description:
I love Philz!  Coffee, a touch of cream and a couple of mint leaves - perfect way to start the morning.  

The coffee here is great.  You can't lose with any of the blends.  I fancy the medium roasts - Tesora, Silken Splendor, New Manhattan, 49er, etc.  The Vegan donuts are also delicious and a great morning snack.   

They also have the Nytimes and some nice places to sit and relax.
author: Moe J.

description:
I am a total sucker for great service, and the second I stepped into Philz on 4th St., I was treated to a super friendly experience that keeps me coming back for more. I cannot say enough about the friendly staff who also boast a great knowledge for their products (coffee and pastries alike). Each cup of joe is hand crafted and should you require it, creamed and sugared to your liking. The barista who made my first coffee and today's cup (I've been 3 times in the last 5 days) even put a special twist of honey that send my cup of Euphoria over the top. I want to give big props to the folks at Philz and as long as they keep doing what they're doing, I'll be a fan for life! 

P.S. I love that the staff has offered to heat up my pastries (from Nabolom in Berkeley, TASTY) which adds a nice touch to the great coffee. I really just can't say enough about this place!
author: Christina N.

description:
Hands down, the best coffee I've ever had.   I went at a very not busy time (7pm... and was hopped up well into the early morning), so the barista-lady gave me the spiel about how Phil and his son custom blend the different beans to find a great balance of flavors asked me what I preferred and recommended the Jacob's Dark (I think thats what its called). It had a deep flavor with no bitterness at all. I got sugar and soy in it, and they add it for you and let you taste it to see if its just right. A splash more soy and it was perfect.

All other coffees anywhere else have always disappointed since my first visit to Philz.
author: Ray H.

description:
This update was long due. After my last review about this place being "hit or miss", the owner contacted me and offered gift card as compensation for the coffee I didn't like. I have never seen such care for customers from any other cafe/restaurant in bay area. They truly represent the spirit of San Franciso!

Just one tip, If you don't like what you ordered, immediately let them know and they will correct it for you.
author: PennDesi I.

description:
The Ecstatic Iced Coffee is SO deliecious!  The baristas are so friendly and very accommodating to the customers.  I asked for the non-fat version of the Ecstatic Iced Coffee (because I'm a high-maintenance a-hole) and it TASTED so sinfully good (I hope he didn't sneak in some cream in there...).

I told the barista that I've heard about Philz and that it was my first time there!  He gave me a free piece of baklava (despite my request for a non-fat drink)... it was very sweet of him :).

Overall, the coffee pwns any other coffee shop in S.F.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Scene 2: The Train Station Wait

Location: 4th and King, K/T Platform
Time: 7:23am
Weather: 59 degrees, brisk breeeze from SE
Attire: Shirt, tie, cardigan sweater, jeans
Attitude: Pensive, stoic, with a light splash of optimism

(Jared exits the K/T platform on the far east end)

Jared: Oh man, I got here earlier than expected. Whatever is a boyishly charming guy to do with all this time?

(Boyishly charming guy looks to his left, and like the Phoenix rising or Terrelle Pryor running in a touchdown, sees a shining light appear to his left)

Jared: Is that what I think it is? Did someone just give me a reason to enjoy my mornings? To forget my worries and sorrows? To sip the most delicious, flavorful coffee that South America ever gave us?

(After several nanoseconds of thought, Jared walks slowly (no, cooly) to the entrance of Philz; he barely makes it through the door when he's greeted by a friendly face)

Barista: Good morning. How's it going?
Jared: Oh, it's good (kinda shy when talking to new people). How are you?
Barista: Oh, I'm good. What can I get for ya?

(Jared scans the list, wanting to try something new, but like always goes with the familiar)

Jared: Small silken splendor, please. 
Barista: Cream and sugar?
Jared: Definitely

(Jared takes a seat on the comfy leather chair that's lower and sinkier than expected. After waiting a few minutes, another barista comes from behind the counter and brings him his coffee)

Barista 2: Hey man, here's your coffee. Take a taste and tell me what you think.

(Sip. Slurp. Funnel.)

Jared: It's perfect. Thank you. 

(Jared reflects on how the customer service at Philz is flawless. No matter which one he goes to, no matter who's working, no matter how short or long the line gets, he always gets the same treatment)

Cue Music: "Please, Please, Please Let Me Get What I Want" by The Smiths

(Jared places his earplugs in, walks out the door into the sunrise, takes a long, melodramatic sip out of his brown Insulair and EcoSmart Dixie cup, and dreams of a day when everyone can be fortunate enough to have this type of morning)
author: Jared S.

description: Iced Mint Mojito Coffee was disappointing at this location. Or maybe because we got a runt barista. Bland, watery, and neglected to add the sugar. The remake I requested was somewhat better, but can't compare to the San Jose location.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
My 1st: Creamy ICED Mint mojito tasted like mint chocolate milk. Disappointed. Could barely taste the coffee.

Thumbs up for thick cups; no sleeves necessary.

Parking: Hard
author: Keiko C.

description: My morning hot spot. The only coffe that gives me enough energy for the rest of the day yeah
author: Laura S.

description:
i don't think i can describe in words how wonderful this coffee place is.  even if you don't love coffee, you will still enjoy the quality and delightful taste of their coffee.  every barista who works there takes pride in their delivery and if you don't like the way it tastes, they are happy to make you a new cup.

everything is made to order and you get a 1-on-1 service.  i admit, the first time that i came here i was COMPLETELY confused.  you stand in a line and there's 3-4 different barista stands.  they have boards up for you to make a choice (holy camoly do they have AN EXTENSIVE LIST) so you need to think quick on your toes.  once you make your order with the barista then you need to go to the cash register and pay.  you wait until they call your name/order and ta-da you are ready for an amazing cup of coffee.

The first time i came i had no idea what to order and the woman was more than happy to help recommend a coffee based on my personal tastes.  i wanted iced, i liked sweet, i liked lighter coffee...  ITZ THE BEST!  and oh boy was it really one of the best coffee's i've ever had.  since then i've also tried the large mint mojito ($4.50) which is TERRIFIC.  

ahhh again, words cannot describe.  PLEASE GO, NOW!!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Been here tons of times, have had maybe 6-7 of the blends, always with cream and sugar as that's how I like my coffee. There's no questioning the great quality and awesome selection, but yes, it is a tad bit elitist and pretentious. 

They take their coffee seriously, and it shows with the quality of the drinks. I could suggest that some employees could be a bit nicer to the newer customers who are not down with this high quality coffee movement. Though I must say that many employees are nothing but cheery & helpful.

Blue Bottle is fine, but quite honestly I don't really get the insane hype. I'll take Philz over BB any day.
author: Dan S.

description: philz has majority market share on good coffee for this area. not too crowded. maintains their excellent standard and definitely a go to.  easier to park around here on sundays if no special event parking
author: Rob C.

description:
Mmm mmm! Talk about a nice hand-crafted coffee shop, Phil'z has to be the best one in the city, hands down!

For the first attempt, we've tried the Ambrosia (iced) and iced mint mojito, both were very good. The lady who made our drinks even made extra for us to try (not just a sample, she literally asked both of us to take "large gulps" ot the drink so that she can give us the extra amount that she brewed, what a experience). 

Ambrosia (iced) - this is like your typical iced coffee with more texture and flavor, I was very impressed by the taste - was not too creamy or too light, was just right.

Mint iced mojito - never had a mint flavored coffee drink before, was a bit pricey ($4.00 for small and $5.00 for large), but definitely worth the price to have this unique drink in the hot summer weather!

Overall, Phil'z is very unconventional, but in a very good way. I would definitely recommend going to Phil'z the next time you are thinking about grabbing a drink!
author: Ming S.

description: It is ridiculous how 1/4 of a large Iced Mint Mojito makes me feel like I need to go run 10 miles. Such powerful and heavenly tasting coffee. Once you do Philz, you never go back
author: Jessica C.

description:
Nothing comes close to Philz coffee.  It's the best coffee in SF.

... a Jacobs Wonder Brew for me please!
author: Alex B.

description:
expensive.

long lines.

yeah. its all worth it. 

starbucks is my go-to every morning...BUT if im anywhere in the vicinity, i make my way over to Philz to get my caffeine fix on!  

fyi. if you enjoy drinking Irish Coffee's...get the Tesora and throw a few ounces of Jameson in it. Thank me later by buying me one...deal? deal...
author: Kyu L.

description: mint mojitos.  that is all i have to say.  i'm officially addicted and have had a mint mojito everyday for the past week.
author: Carli F.

description:
It was one of those rare moments when everything was just right - I didn't have to wait an insane amount of time to get served, the coffee was just hot enough for my liking, and there was just enough people at 9AM on Saturday to make the spot bustling without the overcrowding. 

Speaking of coffee, I'm no coffee connoisseur.  My litmus test for a good coffee is anything that is not repulsive enough to drink without having to pile on massive amount of cream and sugar on top.  

And since I'm a creature of habit, I never really ventured past what's tried and true - so this morning, as per usual, before a run along Embarcardero, I stopped by for a cup of small ("teenytiny?" Greg the barista said disbelievingly when I put in my order.  Greg, do I look like a coffee addict?) Philtered Soul.  

Cream? Yes.  

Sugar? No (THIS IS IMPORTANT - otherwise your coffee would be too sweet)

Good? Absofrickinglutely!
author: Ange L.

description:
For you reading enjoyment, an ode to Philz:
----------------------------------------------------------
How I miss Philz,
My heart ever longing.

I wish I could hold,
and sip you my darling.

We will be together again,
this I promise to do.

I wish that everyday
I could enjoy your fresh brew.

Vexed, I miss you,
My stomach's a pit.

Next to Philz...
everything is shit!
----------------------------------------------------------

BEST COFFEE EVER!!!!!  (and I do mean ever)

I worked across the street from here for about two years and had a 2 cup a day habit that was kind of like crack.  After I finished the project I was working on, I moved to Seattle (which is supposedly the "home of the coffee shop") and frankly this place is shit-out-of-luck to not have Philz.  Nothing quite holds a candle to the coffee here and Ive tried EVERYTHING!!!

Must haves:
1) Turkish
2) Mocha
3) Everything Else

I miss Philz more than you know!!!  I cant wait till I move back to San Francisco...
author: Matthew K.

description: It was my first time at Philz. Loved the full service and the deep roast that the barista suggested.  Definitely one of the best coffee I've ever had.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
hands down my favorite coffee place in the city. they grind their beans when you order and slowly drip each cup and cream and sugar it just the way you like it for you. my personal favorite, tesora, has such complex flavor profile to it. it goes down smooth without that burnt and sour taste like some awful coffee iv'e head around the city. and it has a nutty undertone while finishes with a little bit of the bitterness that i enjoy because it completes the whole flavor circle. I also tried their silken splendor, it tastes kind of like a tesora but without the bitterness in the end, so for someone who is looking for a completely smooth blend, that will be a great choice. 

as for their iced coffee, O.M.G. their iced mint mojito is the best iced coffee ive ever had. usually im not into iced coffee at all, but this is probably the only iced coffee i would drink. it's very refreshingly minty and sweet and creamy to make your taste buds happy, i would recommend anyone who likes iced coffee to give it a try, you will not be disappointed!!
author: Joyce C.

description: Mint Mojitooooooooo coffeeeeeee is diiiiivineeee. I love it, they also put in sweetener and cream for you! I've only been here a couple of times and I tried the Itz the best too, but I thought the mint mojito was tastier, probably because it was less coffee tasting? Not really sure how to describe it but it's an overwhelming amount of choices when you walk in so I can't wait to try them all, but so far the Mint Mojito gets an A+++++++ in my books!
author: Fiona W.

description:
First time.  The Tesora was the best cup of coffee I think I've had.  

The system for ordering was a bit confusing at first and I think its best to add your own cream and sugar but I can deal with it.

Nice people, ok atmosphere
author: Aptos K.

description: We had a sub par experience at the end of the last year due to some unfortunate mistakes.  But at the manager's (Rob) invitation we decided to return for a complimentary visit.  We had two coffees, a veggie quick and spinach-feta puff.  I'm happy to report that service was friendly, the coffee was great and food was tasty.  We are glad that we gave Philz a second chance, and will be happy to return again
author: Dan C.

description: Simply amazing coffee . . . not really sure what happens behind that counter of theirs . . . is it some magical dust?  Philz secret ingredient?  MSG?  lots of TLC?  I guess it doesn't matter cuz the end result is sooo delicious!!  They have enough variety to keep you addicted.  The only drawback is it costs a bit more than other places.  You definitely need to get yourself a cup if you haven't tried it yet.  And if you like dark roasts, try their TANTALIZING TURKISH . . . simply amazing!!
author: Leeseuh K.

description:
I'm not a big coffee drinker but the Boyfriend is a coffee aficionado (aka coffee snob). He first introduced me to Blue Bottle and I wasn't a huge fan. Then he took me to Philz and said it was much more accessible. Why didn't he take me to Philz in the first place??

Philz has a special place in my heart. The folks who work here are SO NICE, even at 8 in the morning when there's a line out the door. 

My favorite is the Iced Mint Mojito - I told you, I'm not a real coffee drinker so I like the weaker stuff. You can't really go wrong with any of the coffee here, though. They split the menu into light, medium and dark roasts. I also like the New Manhattan. 

One great thing about Philz is that they always have you taste your coffee. If you don't like it, they'll re-make it for you, right on the spot, no questions asked. 

Parking is a terrible hassle unless you're SFPD. Your best bet is to have a designated driver who can idle for a bit or circle while you grab your caffeine fix. 

Don't forget - your cup is compostable and your lid is recyclable. Also, if you bring your own thermos, they'll fill it for you.
author: Christine P.

description: I honestly prefer the Philz Coffee location on Van Ness; the baristas are more personable and genuinely want to make sure that you're satisfied with your drink. I ordered a Philtered Soul and it tasted NOTHING compared to how Austin makes is down in Van Ness.
author: Juliette R.

description:
Other coffees pale in comparison to Philz Coffee. I am an avid coffee drinker, and it's sad how much I rely on caffeine. I always go for the Mocha Tesora, but I sometimes feel the need to branch out and try something new. Julie's Ultimate is another favorite. The menu seems daunting at first, but the baristas are extremely helpful.

I, unfortunately, have to opt for Starbucks before work since it's so close to my place.. and I'm usually grumpy in the morning. Not because I'm under-caffeinated, but because I'm not drinking Philz.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Aaaaaaayyyyy! I finally got to check out the joint yesterday. After an afternoon of tutoring angsty 6th graders, I needed some relief. Since it was a bit early, Melanie and I decided that some Philz coffee would soothe our souls. And soothe it did. Usually I ain't into the overly friendly service at establishments but the minute we walked in, a guy behind the counter yelled out, "Welcome to Philz!", and I couldn't help but laugh. Like, oh boy, they really friendly up in here! It took me awhile since I've never been so I had to peruse the menu of an array of different roasts and whatnot. I decided on the Philarmonic (since Kat was kind enough to buy me a cup one Saturday morning a few months ago and brought it to our training). Like everybody says, they brew your java one cup at a time. I only wish my cup of coffee was a bit hotter but other than that, it was kool and the gang. 

Melanie and I decided to post up and unwind. Nothing like good coffee with good friends and good conversation. Philz gets 5 stars for the coffee! I wish they had one closer to SoMa coz Mission Bay ain't SoMa to me. 

Carry on.
author: Ivan F.

description:
I literally just went to this place 30 minutes ago for the first time, and its amazing. I am having the Mocha, and I must say its the best mocha ever (better then starbucks and Pete's). Why? Because it goes down smooth, doesn't taste like it has a million calories, is fresh (brewed right in front of you) and honestly tastes great.  Their slogan is "one cup at a time" because they literally brew the coffee right in front of you one cup at a time. 

Only downside, the menu is a little confusing, so i just went with the mocha (safe choice).

Seriously worth a try.
author: Harvinder K.

description:
So glad this place was open very early on a Saturday morning.  I'm a slowpoke lately about packing and being ready for things on time so to make up for this, I'd slept very little but still managed to wake up late.  I always end up paying for too much fun.  I also blame my sister who usually accomplishes so much yet moves at a snail's pace when we are in a  hurry.  It drives me insane and it's pretty much the only thing we ever fight about.  

Once we were finally ready to hit the road, we stopped here for a Turkish brew that totally perked us up and settled our cranky nerves before we picked up the rest of our road trip crew.  Hot, spicy, potent.  Success.
author: Seong P.

description:
4.5! Based on the awesome #6 Ecstatic Iced Coffee that I had, I now understand why there was a line 6 person deep at 3:30p on a random Wednesday afternoon.

It was my first time and my friend, a semi-regular, guided me through the multitude of coffee blends and selections to the iced coffee. At $2.75 for a small, I was thinking, this better be good. And it was!

The coffee is brewed in individual drip style hot and then ice, then cream and sugar is added for you. You can let the barista (is that a crime to use the S* word in a Philz review?) know how sweet or creamy you want it. For example we both wanted light on the sugar. After getting settled in one of the many window side tables, we went to pick up and then pay for our drinks. My friend treated - awesome friend.

My drink came in a beautiful creamy light brown color and decorated with a sprig of mint. How delightful. When you bring your nose down to drink you can get a faint whiff of the mint. Nice touch!

There's free wireless, comfy couches and lots of light. Really chill place with knowledgeable coffee artisans (how's that?).

Can't wait to try the 20+ other blends.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Philz Coffee is delicious.

For a long time I only ordered a Tesora (delicious, tons of caffeine), but I've started branching out and all of the different brews have been great - I particularly liked Philharmonic, it was very smooth and kept me awake after a sleepless night.

Their pastries are great, too.  I love the banana nut bread.

I am too lazy to make my own coffee, but if I did, this would be where I bought my beans.
author: Ben B.

description:
Who would have thought it: A fresh, individually brewed cup of coffee is really, really good. I guess they were on to something. 

It's kind of pricey, but I guess if you live over here you have cash to throw down for frou-frou coffee. And I love the variety, but could I have useful names and descriptions instead of the pretentious, meaningless drivel? Am I buying coffee? Wine? Incense? I wouldn't know if there weren't grinders and filters and all. But yeah, good coffee.
author: matthew r.

description: I have never had Philz before so when we got there it was a bit confusing as it is not a traditional coffee place. As soon as we were asked by our server/barista (not sure what they are called at Philz) he was so helpful and friendly and talked us through what they do and made a recommendation based on asking us some questions. This makes such a change to a quick rush out the door sort of experience and makes going there even better. The coffee he suggested was very good, maybe not my favorite but certainly very good and I would recommend it. There is some very nice looking food and cake there as well which I will try next time, i will definitely be back and update my review again.
author: Wayne I.

description:
OK. I'm going to be blunt. If you love coffee, and if you are not from the Bay Area, take my advice. Just don't come here. Because it is so amazing, so life changing, so mind blowingly awesome, that if you can't have it daily, its not worth knowing that it exists. 

We were told to come here by a friend who doesn't like coffee. We, who are addicted to all things caffeninated , were not hard to convince. You walk in and the menu is immediately overwhelming. But FEAR NOT! The baristas and other employees are totally sold on their product and willing to sell you too. 

We had, on our first visit, the Jacob's Wonderbar Brew (me) and the Tantalizing Turkish (him). I was a little scared, so I asked my barista to add a tiny bit of milk. She knew exactly what I wanted and created for me, a brew of the greatest perfection. It was cool enough to drink immediately, but warm enough that I could taste exactly what it is that makes this Philz most popular choice. My BF is vehemently opposed to ANYTHING in his coffee and so had it black. 

The cool thing about ordering coffee black at Philz is that they make it so that there is a foamy fabulousness on top. The purpose of this is for you to taste the coffee before you taste the coffee. You swirl the (cooler than the real thing) foam in your mouth to ready your taste buds for the rest of your drink. This keeps the brew from tasting bitter. 

On top of the fabulous coffee, they also have the typical San Fran spread of vegan delicacies. Additionally they have (at the Mission Bay store) a set of burritos. We had one on Thursday, the bacon burrito. They nuked it, perfectly, so that the bacon, cheese, potatoes, herbs, etc, were just ... perfect. This is part of the reason we came back the next day. This time we got the Ancho Chili burrito, which was pretty much the same as before - delicious - except sub ancho chili for bacon. They also had a black bean burrito, which even my carnivorous boyfriend would have gotten if we had one more morning in San Fran. 

I got back to Maryland and posted on Facebook how sad I was to drink Folgers again, after two days of Philz. And I had no less than 7 positive comments from locals who had visited Cali and also miss Philz.
author: Beth K.

description: Great coffee! I walked into Philz for the first time the other day, and I didn't know what to order. (There were no lattes or cappuccinos.) The barista was extremely helpful and friendly, however, and recommended one of their popular dark roast blends- Jacob's Wonderbar Brew. It was smooth and delicious, but at $3.50 (for a large), it was also a little pricey for a cup of Joe.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I can't believe I went months not knowing that I had a Philz 3 blocks away from me. Since I've found out, I've been drinking away at least $3 of glorious Philz Coffee every other day. (boo to the price, yay to the taste.)

I work at a cafe and have to fight the urge to ride past my apartment to get a cup of coffee here after a shift.

Besides the life-changing, brew-to-order coffee, the employees are wonderful and put up with my bad jokes - they're more than likely to put up with yours, too.

 The pastries are awesome, and I recommend the potato & lentil sambosas if you're looking  to snack on something that isn't sweet.
author: Anne Marie S.

description: Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I always try to stop by and get a cup of Philz. I love the staff that they are friendly and will get me my perfect cup of coffee every time! I looove the Silken Splendor!
author: Julie F.

description:
I love getting mint mojito cocktails, and when they combine mint with coffee....I'm all over it! 

I absolutely love the iced (slightly sweetened) mint mojito at Philz.  Though the sign says it's new, they've been serving it for awhile.  It's quite refreshing on a warm day.
author: Lisa C.

description:
"Sooooooo Good" with cream and medium sugar.  That earns it five stars.  A few other notes:

1. no espresso drinks here (oh well, the coffee is amazing)
2. large variety of coffee blends, if it's too much, just ask
3. very friendly coffee barista
4. not the warmest coffee shop (oh well, the coffee is amazing)
5. hideous new t-shirts for sale (the barista agreed with me)
6. Phil likes hats (this has no bearing on my opinion)
author: H H.

description:
I've had several flings and one night stands with the coffee in SF.  At first I thought it was love at Blue Bottle.  Yes, I was seduced by their grungey staff and booth at the Farmer's Market.  Then during my second year in SF, I broke up with BB to move on to Ritual Roasters.  Their Mission cafe brought me back to late nights in NYC and rekindled my infatuation for boys in dark plastic rimmed glasses.  But oh no I was not satisfied....until I came across Philz.  I needed some Turkish coffee and they had exactly what my taste buds have been craving for the past few years.  
Philz also has many other flavors to keep me in case I decide to stray and try another.  My latest favorite is iced mint mojito coffee.  Have one and you too will join in the polygamous cult called Philz.
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is the THIRD time I'm reviewing Philz and again, I'm at a new location.

This store on the corner is right by the AT&T ball park, so parking is a little bit of a headache. 

But still five stars because I'm high as a plane and it's 9:18PM and I got my coffee this morning at 8AM. 

I win! And so does Philz!
author: Lynn C.

description:
I'll been looking at the Usual Suspects(Seattle, Starbucks, Peets) with hope that they have good Tea and always dissappointed. 

I really enjoyed Philz' Istanbul Treat.  Light with just enough balance of sweetness and bitter. It's the opposite of Chai Latte(not that there's anything wrong with Chai in general. But not my everyday thing.)  Plus the Barista add the perfect amount of milk the blend of Green/Black/Mint and not sure what else.

I'll probably try the Coffee some day, but meantime, I'll be occupied with their Tea Selection for a long while.

Very friendly Staff as well.
author: Toeknee T.

description: The shop has a great selection of beverages. Free wifi and cozy couches lured me in from the cold and windy day. The place was really busy for the entire hour that I was there.
author: Paul C.

description:
The only thing I hate about Philz Coffee is how far away it is from my city. 

It is by far the best coffee I've ever had! The staff is always friendly and dedicated to making your coffee perfect. 

Also, they sell Taste of Happiness cupcakes which are delicious!
author: Jessica B.

description: Excellent selection of baked goods. Friendly staff. Coffee artisanal. Great apricot crumble
author: Joe L.

description:
It's true, they really do put crack in the coffee at Philz.

I'm not a big coffee snob, but I do appreciate a good cup of Joe (pun intended). I came to Philz for the first time a couple nights ago to grab coffee with a friend. Staring blankly at the extensive menu, we were both obviously newbies, so the server was friendly and recommended #19, the Tesora. It was a medium roast blend of perfection: smooth, rich, full-bodied--exactly the way coffee should taste! No wonder it's their most popular blend.

Although I'm not a coffee snob, I am somewhat of a donut snob (if there is such a thing)--and their glazed vegan donuts were not very good. The donuts, although visually enticing, tasted vegan. They were simply not sweet and fluffy enough for my liking. Regardless, my cup of #19 compensated well.

Kudos to the friendly staff and the warm, cozy atmosphere of the whole place. I will definitely come back again, perhaps with a nice book or magazine, to try the other flavors. 

And to satisfy my crack addition.
author: Joseph F.

description: this coffee/tea cafe was good. picked up a cup passing by last week. atmosphere was decent and selections were varied. With all the competition for our business, both big and small, I will be back the next time I'm nearby and not in a rush.
author: Denny G.

description:
Finally was pissed off enough or impressed enough to write a review on Yelp again.

Philz Coffee is great, but.... the service i experienced was PATHETIC at least that's the impression one knucklehead barista made on me.

Look, I know the deal... there is a lot of waiting when you go to Philz, that's part of the single brew process.. Fine.

I went there recently and was first in line as it was early in the morning.  I waited patiently as other customers drink orders were being filled.  2 minutes go by then someone else gets in line behind me. 3 more minutes go by and no acknowledgment that I'm in line, just still waiting patiently.... Very patiently.
After total of 5-7 minutes of being the FIRST in line, one of the "baristas" for lack of a better term calls forward the guy in line behind me and takes his order.  Apparently the "barista" knows the guy that was behind me and thought it appropriate to serve him before me.  The barista in this case was some young, tall, Latino / Asian guy with one of those annoying, dumb smiles.  
Complete lack of customer service.  Maybe he knew that guy drops fat tips all the time and was trying to get him for the tip, who knows, who cares.  
Poor customer service.  Please send this dunce back to Philz customer service basic training.  You never favor one customer over another and allow one to cut in line in front of another or even allow for that perception.
author: T. k.

description:
Not only this place is unique!

The staff were amazing they know what they are selling. 

I had Philz Fresh Chai it tasted amazing! They also use fresh mint leaves! 

LOVE IT!
author: Conchita B.

description:
Only been here once so I can't speak to the "inconsistent coffee" issue, but the cup I had - I can't forget it. It was that delicious, and strong. Was buzzing from it for hours.

I am a Peets customer - a very brand-loyal, would walk across a raging river for a Peets cup sort of customer. Philz, though,is kind of a horse of a different color; it is a truly hand-made cup of coffee. Peets is about the best cup of coffee you can get via the standard barista methods, but Philz - pretty amazing.

Downsides are that, with essentially no line, getting the cup may have taken 10 minutes. I'd hate to see this place with a real morning commute sort of line. Forget it.

And yes, it is more expensive. Absurd. But, you get what you pay for, and here, you get a hand-made cup of coffee that you won't soon forget.
author: Mister K.

description:
It doesn't sound like this place needs any more props - it seems that until recently, everyone aside from me knew how good the coffee is here.  I was immediately impressed with the upbeat feeling and comfort I felt when upon in.  The baristas here have a special warmth about them.  My first drink was the "Tantalizing Turkish" which they infuse with this Indian spice called "Cardibum" or something.  I've been hooked ever since.  One thing to note - at $5.75-$6 for a coffee and a treat I pay more here than for any of the other places that I know of.  This is my current favorite coffee spot.  

Previous faves in SF:  Blue Bottle, Cafe Trieste, Quetzal Cafe
author: Nathan V.

description:
I have been a Starbucks customer for a while, because I have one in my building and one at my former office. I wanted to check out some other coffee place in the neighbourhood, so I went to Philz. 

The amount of coffee alternatives was the first big difference. I tried a light roast for my Latte. Brewn right there, nice and helpful ladies.  But the Latte tasted strange.

Went there again and asked what kind of coffee I should use to get a good Latte. This time the lady told me that they dont actually make Lattes, and that I should try milk and sugar to make it better.

Maybe ok place for coffee, but Soooo Baaaad for Latte.
author: Kaj HeGe H.

description:
I like my crack with cream and lightly sweetened. Phillz makes it perfect! I get the Philtered Soul its not as strong as there other strains but WOW does it keep me alert! Does the job ;) Soooo many flavors to pick from they all sound, look, and smell amazing! Get your crack today!

Kinda hard to find parking in the area but worth the walk.
author: Cena V.

description: Believe the hype. It's one of the few times you can. Philz is really as good as everyone makes it out to be. So grab a cup and give yourself some time to relax and enjoy it.
author: William S.

description: What can you say about Philz that hasn't been said? I like to try something new every time, though I am still partial to Julie's Ultimate. This location is a bit more posh than my go to in The Mission, but the coffee tastes just as good, and that's all that matters!
author: Shira O.

description:
I hit this place up pretty much 7 days a week every morning. Living so close makes it easy but not necessary for me to go...I go because I love the coffee and the people. The line can get long, especially in the morning but they now have two registers and can move people through quicker. And while the weekend can be a pain due to the army of strollers and big groups it's still worth the wait.

I would recommend for people who feel the coffee's are inconsistent due to the barista or if it's your first time and not quite sure what medium-sweet is...go light and then have them add more to your hearts content...same with cream. I have always had friendly experiences with them when asking for more sugar or cream...they are great group of people and have always found them laid back and fun. 

Every out of town guest I take here loves it and asks me to bring some home when I visit even though they know they can actually recreate it :D
author: Vicki R.

description:
That's some darn good coffee.

I am a huge fan of coffee brewed by the cup. For $3 for a small, however, I might have expected pressed vs filtered. BUT, it came out perfect and I thoroughly enjoyed every last drop.
author: Annie T.

description:
I went the other day on my usual dog walk.
I said... "I usually go to Starbucks across the street. I want to stop. Help me."
They asked me what I like... and I said I usually get a double shot latte. They made me the most delicious coffee... and the staff is very cool. They went outside to give my golden retriever a biscuit. (Brilliant move... he now pulls me to the front door every time we walk by.... :)
author: Theresa N.

description:
the Philz(-es)..
It's a chain, each place is different with it's own character and flaws. I haven't found the flaws yet ;o)
We like to go to the one on Berry. It's a bright place, comfortable, right next to the water and the park and the AT&T park. People who come are all so different - poor and rich, young and old, all ethnic backgrounds. Police likes to hang out there, too. 
It's always very windy outside, no matter how hot the day. The side facing the stadium is less windy, but I recommend a hat, if you are sensitive (like me). 
Staff is usually friendly, some like to talk, some don't, and they make great coffee and tea. They have a unique way of preparing tea..... I love tea a lot and my nails curled when I saw how they prepared it. I was so skeptical, even panicked a little. I tried to intervene (thinking back I am laughing), but they promised me all would be just fine. Guess what? Their tea is a bomb. Seriously. Absolutely amazing, rich flavor, and just simply good. Still today I have to hold myself back to beg them to do it the traditional way. But I am a dinosaur that way - they do great. 
Hendrik, my husband loves their coffee. They don't prepare anything but regular drip coffee in different roasts and flavors. As you can see, I am not a coffee drinker.. But I trust my husband, who is. His favorite is the something silky.. coffee. Again here, fun to watch them prepare. They have a wide variety of coffees. I think it is hard to chose or you have to be adventurous and try them all, one by one. There are NO refills and the coffees and teas both are on the expensive side. Large tea about $3 and a large, which is a grande at Starbucks) black coffee average $3.50..
They will add milk and sugar, honey or agave syrup for you.
The founder of Philz comes there frequently, too. His name is Roger Bories I think. 
Nice place, free Wifi, nice atmosphere, nice staff, lots of sofas, outdoor seating - ah, and delicious vegan donuts!! You can also get them at the Rainbow Grocery in SF.
Enjoy!
author: Sonja O.

description:
This is soul coffee. Tried the New Manhattan recently. At the end of each sip, you are left craving the next as the stream of flavors, intermittent as they come (...earth....tobacco....wine?), enlighten your palate. No reference to bs Sideways monologue; I'm not kidding here. I've definitely had and sadly still continue to drink my share of convenient (=parking lot and on way to 280S) SOMA coffee... ahem...The Creamery (Ritual Roasters), which is completely a downer in each and every sense. The coffee is too acidic, boring and it ends at that. It just makes me crave Philz and wonder if being late for work was just the price you have to pay for good coffee. 

Other blends that I like are the Philharmonic, Soooo Good and the Turkish (a solid dark roast). I like the option of putting some mint in the coffee. The vegan donuts play to my sweet tooth and go very well with the coffee. 

I'm not sure if there is a way to describe the ambiance here. It's just a simple place with some hats. Watching the baristas make my cup of coffee looks like I'm witnessing a science project. I'd like to compare and contrast this place to blue bottle, but I think the two are just so different.
author: Annie Y.

description:
As long as you don't order the oily pastry and you are only looking for amazing Arabic or Turkish Coffee, I give it 4 stars!!!

If you want to have a nice pastry....walk to Panera, it's right around the corner!
author: T I.

description:
Love, love, love it!
That is seriously all I can say. Of course the coffee is super expensive, so better use this one as a treat when you have a bad day or really want to treat yourself.

Every customer service experience I encountered was great as well, everybody is helpful and tries to find you a coffee you will greatly enjoy. 
Yes, you will also need to wait for your coffee but not longer than at any Starbucks....
author: Sonja S.

description: If you're paid salary and have time to spare away from the office Phil'z is one of the best nearby. I got in from Caltrain at 9:40 and power-walked only to find a line at the door.I've tried the one in SJ and am unsure if it was the drink I ordered at the time but this location rocked. I got the Philtered soul and it put a smile on my tired cranky face. The workers are friendly but like everyone else says the wait is long due to its popularity. Paid ~$4 for a large and it was worth it especially as it prepared me for the long ass day of work.
author: phil c.

description: MR: First time I have ever gone to a place where they don't use machines... I have to say they can make a hell of a coffee.  If you are expecting a cappuccino, don't come in here.  But if you are open to trying something based on their recommendation then come on in.
author: Abbey V.

description:
If paying $3.50 and waiting 20 minutes for a coffee makes you feel special, Philz is definitely the place to go. 
Otherwise, there's a number of less pretentious places in the City where you can get great coffee without any aggravation.
author: Dave T.

description:
Very good coffee and much needed in a neighborhood crowded with Starbucks on almost every other block.

I am a fan of their Turkish coffee and their tea concoctions are pretty good too. Not a pastry kind of guy so cannot say anything about them. Staff are friendly and quick. Does take a bit of time to get your order BUT that's part of the experience. I'd rather wait for a bit and get a grand cup of coffee than be shuffled one in 2 minutes flat and not like the taste of it.

On the downside, they are a bit pricey so I don't frequent them that much. They're more of a guilty pleasure I treat myself once every two weeks. But for all the effort that goes into brewing the drinks, that price is totally justified.

Have a nice sitting area with couches you sink into, which I love. Right by the 4th Street bridge so if you feel like grabbing a coffee and walking down Mission Creek, this is it!
author: Amit S.

description:
The location feels open and warm. The coffee is simply amazing.

An iced Ether is the perfect cup on a hot day.

I can't stay away from this place.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I'm writing this inside of a Philz I didn't know existed until this morning.  I used to go to the Mission location, but since moving to the East Bay, it rarely happens.  So today I was on the T heading toward Mission Bay and I saw it!

As my day's activities are at an end, I went back to Philz and ordered a cup of the Kenyan coffee.  So now I'm drinking creamy delicious coffee and using the free WiFi to Yelp about how amazing it is.  Each sip leads to another sentence of happiness.

There goes another one.  Delicious.  

Philz cups are prepared with love by friendly people.  What more could you want?

Their cups say "Tell a friend!" on them.  Mission accomplished.
author: Gordon E.

description:
The Philtered Soul. If you are a Philz virgin, this is what you need to get.

It's a very roasty, fine, smooth, balanced latte, hand-made with love, according to my barista. There's a nutty hints - but it's so well done, it reminds me of how the moment clicked for me in art history class back in college when the professor was explaining the concept of "universality" as it pertained to Piet Mondrian's grid and primary colored paintings.

Or to put it in words my belly would say: yummy yummy in my tummy. Droooooool.........

Also, it was like $3 for a small cup. Kinda pricey, but dude, if you live in SF, how can you NOT come here at least once?
author: Tian L.

description:
Walking in on a sunday I decided, "you know what would be great right now? Some real face slapping good coffee to make me feel great and my taste buds to have a real reason to cheer," and that is exactly what I got from philz. With its brew coffee by the cup it is one of the most crowed places on the block almost always because of how good their stuff is. 

Literally, if  ever were looking for the coffee gods to shine on you this would be where your pilgrimage ends.

The menu is quirky just like the insides of the place with vintage seating and some makeshift living room furniture scattered like it is grabbing for every bit of free space there is. The menu is a little confusing, but it really adds that local coffee shop feel and is not afraid boast its popularity.

I really enjoy the menu drinks and different brews. If you haven't checked it out then you either hate coffee or you live in Richmond.
author: Peter G.

description:
I used to work at a helluva mom-n-pop coffee shop in North Berkeley. I thought I knew a thing or two about coffee. I held up my nose at Starbucks (rightfully so) but would still settle for a Peets or a Coffee Bean from time to time if there was no other option.

Philz has ruined me. If I can't drink Philz, I don't drink coffee. 

I'm absolutely hooked on New Manhattan. I have dreams about it, I hallucinate that I smell it on the wind. It's close to insanity. I might need to get my head checked out. But still, knowing that there is a full menu of good coffee- I try others. I am never disappointed. 

I thought my brain glazed over when I tried Philtered Soul. It has a rich nutty taste with hints of chocolate. It's madness my friend. Madness.

Tesora is bliss. Soooo Good is, in fact, soooo good -- I have a bag of it at my cubicle right next to the french press I got specifically so I could have Philz whenever I wanted and not have to suffer through work's disaster brew. I have had probably 10 different types of coffee from Philz and I have never been let down. If anything, I have been enlightened. 

Thanks a lot Philz. You have made me into a royal coffee snob and an damn-near addict. Not sure if you have made my life better, but it's certainly an addiction I have no trouble feeding....er, drinking.
author: Tawnee K.

description:
Philz coffee tastes great.

They boil hot water, grind up the beans, put the beans in a filter, then pour the hot water over it.  Yummy!

Just the way mom has made coffee at home from 1980 until present.

The only difference is that a Philz coffee costs $3.50.  LOL - whatever.
author: Trick C.

description:
Ok, review, WAY OVER DUE!!

I'm what I like to call a "coffee enthusiast". That said, it comes as no surprise that Philz is getting a 5* review from me considering the enthusiastic and passionate staff. I've probably been to Philz about 4 times these past few months for my home coffee fix. I know what I like; I'm a medium girl who purchases whole beans and brews by the good ole fashion drip method. You'd think it would be simple enough to walk in, select a blend and be on my merry way. Well it is! But not without getting some quality schooling on Philz, their coffees and their blends! Personally, I love it! I'm a coffee enthusiast remember?! Every experience I've had here has made with walk away thinking about how great it is to encounter folks who really seem to enjoy their jobs and who don't just share a passion for a damn good product but who also enjoy educating the general public about the multifaceted dynamics of quality coffee. Yes, I'm a coffeek! I'm not ashamed!

Now then, the blends. I am determined to get through their entire selection (Gasp!). I liked Anesthesia however Ambrosia didn't do a whole lot for me. I picked up a bag of Silky Smooth but  quickly returned it to the shelf once the sticker shock kicked in! $19 bucks for a lb of coffee? I'm sure it's good but I don't even know if I like it. I'm gonna have to hold off on that impulse buy this time around. 

On my most recent visit, I was helped by yet another fantastic barista who took some time to go over a few options. 

"How much do you like coffee?" she asks. 
"I LOVE coffee!" I responded.
"How do you take your coffee?" she asked. 
"With soy milk and no sugar" I replied "so I prefer something smooth and balanced". 
"Great, then let me suggest New Manhattan, let me make you a sample."

I HAVE FOUND MY NEW FAVORITE COFFEE! And that's a huge statement! And to top it off, it's a $17 a lb coffee (well worth every dollar) so that says something! The only thing that bums me out about this discovery is that I was looking forward to sampling other Philz blends which I still intend on doing. I just think it's going to be a while before I veer from New Manhattan but I'll get around to it. 

Thanks Philz for your doing what you do so well and more importantly, hiring and training the right people with great, passionate & helpful attitudes!
author: alexa c.

description:
If you look under "interests" on my facebook profile you'll read "philz in sf omg!"

I cannot believe I lived 22 years before finding out about this place. It's definetly like no other coffee shop I've ever been to and each time I go I am more impressed by how exceptional their fresh drip tastes. 

I've also found the service here to be one of the kindest and most attentive I've experienced. 

Although $3.50 is quite a bit to spend on a cup of joe, I cannot help but indulge in their amazing jacob's blend at least once a week, either when I first arrive off caltrain or when I'm taking a break later in the day from work. 

5 stars! And I'm super excited they have expanded to the south bay now!
author: Kristal N.

description: this location is awesome, they got through the long line fairly quickly, the gentleman making my drink (did not catch his name) was very attentive and asked me exactly how i wanted my coffee, and he made it PERFECTO! he asked that i take a sip before leaving to assure it was made to my liking, i gave him the thumbs up while stuffing my face in the delicious cup of coffee he made for me. great service, great coffee, and next time i will try to catch the gentleman's name and give him credit for the amazing experience.
author: Al J.

description:
This is simply the best coffee in the city, arguably the world.  Blue Bottle has nothing on this place.  The Ambrosia and So-Good are great standard choices.  On a hot day definitely get the iced mojito coffee.  If you're recovering from a long night of drinking, the greater alarm will get you going.

You don't know coffee until you've tried Philz.
author: Jessica J.

description:
They definitely make a damn good cup of coffee.

But at $3.50 for a large it'll have to be for special occasions. Like Tuesdays or something.
author: Terrence M.

description: The only place to get the best coffee in SF.  These guys have a serious passion and make you taste each cup to confirm your satisfaction!
author: Hawk M.

description:
[Green Zebra Coupon: Buy one cup of coffee, get one free; buy two cups, get two free]

I don't give a f*ck about all y'alls hipshtah "atmosphere" and sh*t but this place has the BEST coffee I've had in San Francisco. I've had a lot of coffee. 

Just so you know, none of those stars are attributed to their "variety" bull, their same-old "normal" coffee rocks my socks hard enough for 5 stars.
author: Elena C.

description:
PLEASE OPEN MORE LOCATIONS!

Mandatory:
...one next my work
...one next to my house

Next step:
everywhere else.
author: Rada I.

description:
5 stars for Philz:

1) Amazing coffee (duh)
    a) Huge variety of blends - mostly on the smooth and not so bitter side, which is exactly what I like.
    b) Drip brewing by the cup; takes a few minutes but entirely worth it.
    c) The tesora (house) blend brought me to an almost religious ecstasy.
    d) Garnished with a mint leaf! At least, my tesora was.
2) Amazing service
    a) Super friendly
    b) Precise in helping me determine which of their delicious blends to choose
    c) You can request levels of sweetness if adding milk and sugar. Who knew?
3) Funky ambiance 
     a) Comfy couches
     b) Chill clientele
4) They have fresh mint leaves growing on the counter that they use to garnish!
5) One block away from the Caltrain!

If you even mildly enjoy coffee, GO HERE.
author: Rita E.

description: So much better than Starbucks, Coffee Bean, and any other chain coffee shop!  Tried their #1 Tantalizing Turkish Coffee, medium sweet, and it was absolutely perfect!  It's a bit pricey, at $3 for a small, but it was totally worth it.
author: Amy H.

description: Ok, this will be short. The coffee is AMAZING. The service is very slow. This is a location where you come, sit, play on your laptop, or take a rest from your walk. Not a location to get coffee on your way to work. Don't get me wrong, the workers are very nice and hard working. But they take their time, talk to customers, and enjoy the process. It takes me longer to get my coffee here than to drive in to work 10 miles away, in gridlock. Great Iced Mint mojito coffee though.
author: Jorge H.

description: Best, most delicious coffee in SF.  Even though there's always a long line, the coffee is worth the wait.  The baristas are also always really friendly and that makes it an even better experience.
author: N B.

description: The coffee here tends to be a bit strong, but if I can handle it as a non-regular coffee drinker, anyone can.  The staff here is very good with making recommendations.  If you like ice coffee, I HIGHLY recommend the mint mojito iced coffee.  It's delicious.  The only down sides of this place are the prices and the sometimes long waits.  They also carry Pepples vegan donuts here in the mornings (for $2 - less than what Pepples charges in the Ferry building).
author: B. Y.

description:
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, so a coffee shop endorsement from me is pretty special (or not special at all, depending on how you look at it).

Anyway, the very helpful barista recommended the Philtered Soul, which was spot on. It was extremely smooth, and was not nearly as bitter as most coffee I tried. Paired with one of their delicious fresh muffins, it was truly a surprising treat. 

Given that it's only 5 minutes from my office, Philz may become a habit.
author: David Z.

description: I love this place. We have their coffee at my office which I really like but it's even better at the coffee shop. They have a huge assortment of different types of coffee. The staff is super friendly and they clearly know how to make good strong coffee. If you like strong coffee this is the right place to go. It's a little expensive so I wouldn't recommend going all the time but it's worth it every once in a while. I love the Jacob's Wonderbrew and Julie's (whatever they call it).
author: nick g.

description:
So i have to admit, I came to Philz for the free wi-fi...and didn't even try the coffee..though i've heard some great great things about it!! I know i know! blasphemy!! =P next time i swear.  

I'll definitely be back to Philz.  The little shop was comfy, cozy and the service was attentive.  I must have sat in this shop for hours with my laptop & nobody bothered me though everybody i made eye contact with smiled at me.  

nice atmosphere, good green tea & chocolate croissant..and free wi-fi =) 

I'll definitely be back soon with my laptop & this time, definitely trying the coffee! =D
author: Lulu C.

description:
While Philz in the Mission (24th and Folsom) and in Palo Alto serve up fantastic coffee alongside friendly service in a great ambience, this Philz (in SOMA) sadly serves up a much poorer experience overall. The coffee is, as other reviewers have noted, quite good, but the rude / disrespectful lady (manager?) more than negates that in my opinion (given the plethora of good coffee spots scattered throughout SF). I've visited this Philz a couple of times and, without fail, have watched this employee yell at fellow employees, act rudely towards customers, and disrupt the peaceful vibe that I had previously come to expect from Philz.

Great coffee, great food, mediocre service. If you can go to another Philz, I recommend it; if not, consider ducking into another café in SOMA for your coffee fix.
author: Rishi N.

description:
Dear OMGod,

It's me, Liz C. 

I cheated on Blue with Philz. The temptation was driving me NUTS with all the 5 star reviews being flashed before my eyes. 

I want to repent right now, but I can't seem to kneel without jittering into a spastic state of caffeine frenzy. 

I feel very sinful, but renewed by this delicious cup of Philz Harmonic - bold, savory, yet sweet. 

Sorry, sweet baby Jesus, I'd sinfully do it again and again and again. Will you still forgive me?

OMGod, save me.

OVERALL: The caffeine choices are abundant. But, the helpful staff will lead you into the right direction. Just tell them how you like IT- your coffee that is, using adjectives like strong, creamy, sexy, bold, sweet and they'll fix you up. Now, that's HAWT!
author: Liz K.

description:
I was lucky enough to meet Phil the first week of their opening in SoMa.  Phil saw me sitting empty handed and brought me a lovely iced tea.  I would never normally order this because I find iced tea to bitter and plain, but this was heavenly just like their low acidity coffee.  I'm a big fan of their So Good Sumatra blend and keep their grounds revolving through my coffee maker for my morning high.  Their shop is also the perfect place to study with ample tables, sofas, and wifi.

So, back to Phil.  After he brought me my complimentary iced tea.  I asked him where he was from, a question inspired by his foreign accent.  He responded, "I'm from the US".  I said, "But, where are you from originally?" and right after he answered the question he was avoiding, the meter maid rolled by and ticketed his mercedes clearly parked in a "never park here" zone.  Seeing Phil go from business-man to normal indignant San Franciscan: priceless.  Phil and Philz coffee are a local gem!
author: Elena S.

description:
This is one of two go-to spots for an *excellent* cup of decaf coffee. Philz is special, though, because you can get an amazing, freshly brewed cup of decaf anytime of day. 

I love how they do your cream and sugar for you (and that's 100% cream, folks). It's definitely an expensive treat, but so good. One of the coffee-makers turned me on to the Swiss Water Peru Decaf, which is fantastic. Dreamy.
author: J P S.

description:
This is why I Yelp.  

Knowing I would be spending the day rubbing elbows with regional sales reps and students, out on the Streets of San Francisco, I used Yelp to find a coffee shop with free wifi near my hottest prospect.  Yes, job hunting is a lot like outside sales.  

This was my first visit to a Philz Coffee, and the barista helped me select the right roast and the right sweetness for a new taste sensation.  She insisted that she could make another cup if the first were not to my liking, but I decided to give it a try and let the impression settle in over time.  After all, if I specified only what I already liked, I would not discover new things.  The big deal here is that there is no espresso maker; they drip brew each and every order by the cup.  

And then they put it in a paper cup.  

A cup of coffee and a croissant was $5.00.  Oh, and the wifi worked perfectly.  There was noisy construction going on at this intersection -- as I recall there has been noisy construction at this intersection for 10 years -- and it was a hot day, so the doors were open.  After I reoriented myself with Google maps and Yelp, I moved on to a more quiet location.  

3 stars for the gourmet coffee in the paper cup, +1 star for the free wifi.
author: David D.

description:
Filtered soul, what is that? I urged to try it on my own.  So my first visit of Philz Coffee happened yesterday after moved to bay area for almost three years. 

First step into Philz, staff's charming smile grabbed all my attention and followed with friendly greetings. The menu was a bit overwhelmed for a new comer like myself. Instead of trying to look for something with my limited knowledge about Philz coffee, I asked for help. 

I am a light coffee drinker, so 'Canopy of Heaven' was highly recommended by the lady behind counter, which totally pleased my tongue. The price at $2.45 for a small coffee is a relatively pricey, but hey I'm not drinking this everyday, plus it tastes good. 

Quiet ambiance and comfortable chairs, some sofas simply made me want to sit down for a bit though I was rush to a meeting. 

Besides, its a dog-friendly cafe for it's offering bowls of water for dogs placed outside of the store.
author: Jade L.

description:
So somehow I missed hitting up philz when it was in the Castro, but now that it has become the local spot in my Best friend's hood, I decided to hit it up with him. I went with a Turkish blend. "Careful", my friend warned..."this stuff is strong." I blew that off like any recovering meth addict who had just spent six weeks in southern Turkey would. "Careful" I thought..."does he know who he is talking to?" 

Halfway through my cup I noticed that I began to sweat a little bit.....my foot started tapping Like I was listening to the latest Chacka Khan album.

"Can we, uh ...get up and walk around a bit?" I asked
My friend lowered his cup to reveal the knowing smile on his face.

Philz: It's like crack
author: George F.

description: I'm fairly sure Philz is putting illegal substances into their Turkish with the spice and the mint. There is simply no way anything legal can put you into such a good mood no matter what reason you have for being in a foul one. To call it coffee just doesn't seem remotely adequate. Its more like some new thing in need of a name. I'll call it Uppers.  The staff are wonderful - obviously 'eating their own dogfood' as they are always in as great a mood as I am when I drink my Turkish. They serve a vegan doughnut that goes perfectly with the coffee and might also need a name other than doughnut.  I'll call it Treatestmost.  So, get over to Philz for Uppers and Treatestmost.
author: Margaret G.

description:
I will not kneel before the alter of Philz, for it is a false god.

There seems to be a large fan base swelling beneath this up-and-coming coffee chain.  The praise is not without merit.  Yet, I see some striking parallels between how people talk about Philz today and how people talked about Krispy Kreme about ten years ago.
