Philz is leaps and bound above the quality of coffee you'll find at Starbucks.  No question about it.  But that's not a fair comparison.  That's like comparing Fatburger to McDonalds.  They're both technically fast food burger joints, but all the comparisons kinda fall short after that.

Fast food coffee shop.  That's the problem with Philz right there.  That's what keeps Philz from being a five-star establishment.  Their "one cup at a time" mantra lead me to believe it would be a little more laid back and relaxed like a coffee shop really should be.

I nearly slid Philz rating down a little lower on the old yelp star rating.  The saving grace to the highly caffeinated customer queue is the fact that the employees know their regulars.  I can really appreciate that kind of attention to detail and service.

Philz serves great coffee.  For crissake, I'm paying an absolute premium for this cup of coffee... nearly twice what I'd pay at other coffee shops.  Slow it down a little bit so I can enjoy it.  Or better yet, I'll just take some beans home with me and hit the store when I'm ready for a little in and out action.
author: Christopher K.

description:
I use to go to Starbucks across the street from my office on King St. every week for 3 years 4 months and ordered the same drink every time: venti non-fat, no-whip, zebra mocha.

One day, I casually walked into Philz  last month and I got this piercing look from the workers there (I had my Starbucks cup in hand). I was asked what was in my cup and moments later, I got a free cup of Philz mocha coffee. I thought to myself, "Sure, I'll give this a shot; there's no harm in trying." Little did I know my life would change from that point on.

Since that day, I've yet to return to that very Starbucks I've patronized over the years since I started working in the area. Any addiction is easy to cure; you just have to find another addiction to replace it, and Philz it is.

It's been nice knowing you Starbucks. We'll always have our memories when you'd always wonder in suspense every time I'd walk through your doors and would come up with a new name for my half regular mocha / half white mocha.

My list of names...
-Zebra Mocha
-Panda Mocha
-Black & White Mocha
-Piano Keys Mocha
-Salt & Pepper Mocha
-Orca Mocha
-Cow Mocha
-Tuxedo Mocha
-Penguin Mocha
-Skunk Mocha
-Dalmation Mocha
-Oreo Mocha
-Soccer Ball Mocha
-Michael Jackson Mocha
author: E E.

description:
I ended up at Philz because it was a super convenient place for a meeting. When the friendly guy behind the tall counter asked me "what looks good" I informed him that I don't drink coffee but I did want a warm beverage with caffeine. 

After going through a couple of my options he said "do you trust me?" and I sort of half-smiled and said "with my drink?" and he smiled and said "let me make you something you'll be having dreams about for at least a week" - I agreed. How can you turn down an offer like that?  So he got busy scooping and brewing and filtering and mixing - painstakingly creating this one cup of hot delicious mastery just for me. 

After he garnished the perfect foam with a mint leaf he handed the creation to me and said "taste!" Oh man, I don't even think this qualifies as coffee!! It was so delicious I greedily swished every sip around in my mouth, not wanting a single taste bud to miss the experience.  Of course I was high as a kite { haven't had that kind of caffeine in a LONG time } and the poor guy I was meeting to chat with had to endure my uber- enthusiasm, but man, that's the best cup of coffee I've ever had. Before I left the barista shouted "tell your friends" - you bet I will. 

My fear now, is that they've ruined me... it may just be another 4 years before I attempt another taste of coffee.
author: J.Nichole S.

description:
Having left one coffee shop to peruse another, I was ready to compare bean to bean. It is a little terrifying as there are so many options that I found a little overwhelming - I am not enough of a coffee afficionado to tell one cup from another a lot of the time - but I do like it when someone appeals to my imagination. What does this coffee taste like? Echoes of cocoa? roasted nuts? do you feel rivulets of fruit trickling across your tastebuds? I'm getting carried away now. So, it's a little stressful walking up to the barista when you have no idea what you want. You may do the same as I did and asked for a mocha with a sweetness rating of between 3 and 5.

err, yeah. 

They ask you to taste the coffee before you go up to pay. That is rather cool, although I was worried about scalding myself (I didn't). The coffee I had was rather rich which pretty much finished me off for the afternoon. I found our barista to be pretty friendly as well - we had fun with him and he had fun with us -  a pretty good deal I think.
author: Catriona C.

description:
East Coast flashback alert....

So some years ago I was sitting in Toscanini's in Central Square, Cambridge, MA, bathing in the glory of being a young grad student with little/no responsibilities, free to spend all my days writing on my laptop and slurping down the absolute finest coffee I've ever tasted.  Since I was living above the location at the time, I was with Tosci every day, and never once did a bad brew pass from their hands to mine.  Exceptionally aromatic and strong, with hints of chocolate and almonds.  And, widely available.

Now I have a $400/month loan payment, anxiety over inflated food costs* and an acceptance of the dearth of good coffee to drown my troubles in/hop me up so that I can be the kind of productive that justifies said loan payment.

OK OK, so there's Blue Bottle, Trouble, and on occasion Cole coffee is in the ranks.  And, whatever this may reflect about me, Peet's does it for me a good portion of the time.  Enter: Philz**.  The king of them all.

Philz looks at coffee like fine wine.  You select from a menu (that makes everything sound worth trying) and they make your single cup for you there as you wait.  This process is championed by many purveyors these days, and I find it rather inefficient for the sake of novelty but am open to being wrong about that.  After all, it yields a beautiful cup.  Today I tried the Philharmonic and found it smooth, spicy, and strong, with a hint of nutmeg and walnut.  I'm told that all their coffees, no matter how strong, never come out acidic.

The decor in this particular location is fairly sterile and nondescript - that seems entirely a function of it being in the new complex in China Basin.  The natural light let in by all the windows and it's being on the sunny side of the city work in its favor.

*mainly in that it limits my ability to go home and talk about said food.  OK and there's that whole survival component.
**if anyone wants to help me add to this list, by all means...
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I'm dating a boy who lives right by Philz.. (Shouldn't this have an apostrophe?)  Since I want him to like me, I guess I need to bring Phil into the relationship.

I liked the atmosphere, but the mean girl behind the counter told me that I ordered my non-fat latte incorrectly and I should say "skim" in the future.  Then she brought me a skim mocha.  Umm.. sounds like she HEARD incorrectly.  

She begrudgingly made me a new non-fat..err...skim latte and it tasted delicious. 

The sprig of mint was great.  Way to go, Philz (I'm pretty sure it DOES need an apostrophe).

Also, they have these healthy vegan cookies that are surprisingly tasty. 

Minus 1 star for the mean girl behind the counter.  Minus 1 more star for me apologizing to the girl for her being rude.  I hate myself when I apologize after doing nothing wrong.  Being born overly polite is a curse.  *Sigh*
author: Janney B.

description:
These guys are some serious coffee-making mofos.  Indeed, they've practically reinvented the genre--coffee will never be the same again.

No, you may not order a half-caf soy raspberry frappuccino with whipped cream.  No, you may not order food, aside from a few token pastries that are best ignored.  You may only order a cup of coffee.  But then, to call these one-cup-at-a-time, hand-conjured potions "coffee" is like calling the sun a lightbulb.  Your tastebuds will be prostrate before the all-consuming flavor.  No surprise that they sell fedoras on their website--this is the kind of stuff I always pictured those hardcore Mods to be drinking in their Italian suits and motorscooters.

As for what kind of coffee to order, well I'm clearly out of my league here, but Philz recommends starting with the house blend, Tesora.  I tried out the Tesora Mocha and wow--it's like they fused the cocoa and coffee at the molecular level or something. 

PS, props for being one of the very first indie businesses in Mission Bay.  I'll have to check out their Castro location as well for weekends.
author: Wes M.

description:
I work here, drink coffee here and enjoy every moment of it! It was the Ecstatic Ice Coffee that initially got me hooked to Philz.  Now I am an employee for Phil and truly enjoy my job. I am proud to be part of such an awesome team of baristas. We make it our mission to give you (the customer) the best coffee experience possible! Thank you for your business.            
Much Love,
Shauna
author: Shauna B.

description:
Okay- its good coffee- I always supported it- its local- and nearby for me. 
The wait is becoming intolerable. just intolerable. I swore it off for a few months, came back today- at 5pm on a Saturday- 20min. 1 cup of coffee. it is just not acceptable. Jacob- hire some more people!
author: Bassem A.

description:
the coffee here is the best in the bay area. i would actually say its better than blue bottle and the service is excellent. personalized drip coffee ftw. it's been one of the things i miss the most since moving to a different work location. i would drive from san carlos to sf if i really had a hankering for good coffee. going to the giants game? stop by on your way and grab a cup to go. the police even park in the muni lanes to get their coffee when there are other coffee shops with real parking...enough said...

try the mocha tesora and the iced mint mojito
author: Jessica W.

description:
Can't go wrong with this formula...

+ Jacob's or Mocha Tesora individually dripped coffee

+ Fresh mint afternoon tea with cream and honey made to order

+ Numerous selections of specialty coffees and teas

+ Fresh baked ginger snap cookies and oat bars

+ Free wifi

+ Friendly staff

- Pretension

= HAPPY ADDICTION!
author: Lis A.

description:
Even though I only live 5 min away, I've only been to Philz a few times and only gotten their cofffee. I never really enjoyed them because I thought they were way too strong for me. I normally drink lattes, and one time they attempted to make one for me that was similar to a latte, but I didn't like it.

However, today, I am a convert. I had their Iced Mint Mojito. It was SOOOOOO GOOD!!!! I almost crapped my pants (actually, I was wearing a skirt)!!! Even though I haven't even finished my first ever mint mojito, I'm already planning my next visit. I'm looking forward to trying their ginger snap.

PS: Just to describe how I felt when I had my first sip...it's similar to having really fresh uni for the first time...toro that melts in your mouth...super fresh oysters...etc.
author: Wanda K.

description: I would like to apologize. On my original review I stated I always got the coffee/espresso drink and loved it. That was a little misleading. Philz does not have espresso they do however triple brew fine ground coffee and call it "espresso like". The drink is called a Red Eye. Sorry for the confusion! Still love it though.
author: Patrick R.

description: The baristas are my favorite part about Philz because they're so nice and attentive to the customer. My least favorite thing is not noticing the price on a small Jamaican Blue Mountain latte and spending seven bucks. Oh God, I'm reliving it.
author: April M.

description:
Damn, they have good coffee!

Free wifi and lots of outlets to plug into
Comfy seats

This is my favorite spot in SoMa!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Before Philz, I was one of those..... 2-Pump-Grande-Mocha-Extra-Hot kid of people. I THOUGHT that I was one of these people that needed the sugar and that steamed milk and oh, that whipped cream wasn't bad either.

But luckily I read a bunch of reviews from fellow YELPERS before going in there and luckily I did because I would of looked like a complete ASS if I went in there and attempted to order my usual.

A really nice girl asked what I usually liked and I did, ahem, tell her. She suggested the number Four from the board which is the Jacob's Wonderbar Brew. I asked why she suggested that one and she said because it hints of nuts and chocolate without a lot of bitterness. YEAH! She added sugar and milk or cream and it was AMAZING.  The texture, the flavor was wonderful.

The cost of about the same as I was paying at the 'other' place so I am cool with that. I also love that people can bring in their well behaving dogs, which is also nice.

I highly recommend all you other "2- Pump- Grande -Mocha-Extra-Hot kid of people" get off your tushies and give this place a try.

One question though, what is that mint on the counter for? I have no idea but I am very intrigued.
author: Christine S.

description: The only drip coffee I like - everything else is a pale substitute. Canopy of the Gods or New Manhattan are my favorite blends, with 2 Splenda and cream.
author: Greg J.

description:
Ambrosia Coffee of God has been my elixir for 3 of the last five days.

This stuff is crack.

:-)
author: Tysen C.

description: I fell in love with this place after the first sip. I had the Turkish brew but I want to try all of them. Too bad I was flying back to Canada in a few hours. They should open a few cafes up here north of the border, or at least in Seattle.
author: Raza M.

description:
The son following,
his father's Java footsteps,
Best Coffee Ever.

I walked in and the swarthy coffee smith eyed me up and down.

"Like coffee?  You a coffee Drinker?" he growled.  I wasn't prepared for the steel behind his tone.

"Not really, it's ok, I guess, but not my favorite," I replied shakily.  Where was this leading?

He jabbed that cold stare into me, pinned me to the door frame with his glance and a hush seemed to fall over the room, "We'll fix you."

And he did.  The coffee at Philz is to the rest of the joe-slinging establishments in the city as the Mona Lisa is to Basquait hurling in the bushes after a night of drinking with a highlander.  It's simply unreal how incredibly good it is.  

Don't take my word for it.  Just walk in there with a chip on your shoulder and mention a little too loudly how you've never really enjoyed coffee and find yourself two weeks later dazed under the bridge with a shopping cart filled with your worldly possessions, mainlining Philz and begging for change for your next hit.  

Trust me.
author: Mason G.

description:
- Jacob's Wonderbar Brew:  Balanced and delicious
- New Manhattan:  Full Bodied yet approachable
- Ether:  Whoa! That's strong, but tasty :)
- Philharmonic:  Mmm Mmm good

This isn't my exclusive coffee joint, but it is my favorite coffee by far. Each cup is brewed with care and consistency. I have tried many of their roasts and haven't been disappointed. I will say, however, that the Mocha Tesora was a little too rich for me, but I usually only like a hint of mocha if I'm in the mood for such. For chocolate lovers, this one's for you.
author: Aaron W.

description:
After a long day, I was craving a sweet treat.
oh, I think it is time for Philz.
It is very calm in there at 3PM. 
I think I will be holding some casual afternoon meetings there since it is so close to the office.
Really sweet staff. 
I picked up a few different coffees to bring back to the office, cause I roll like that. 
Wow, the coffee is strong and I am already feeling more productive.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great coffee, but some of the most stuck up baristas. I'm not a coffee-holic like most patrons that wait in the long lines everyday here, but I do appreciate a great cup of coffee that's distinctly more flavorful than any other cafe. However, every time I've been here, there's been a heavy aura of condescending attitude, furtive glances at the next barista hoping someone else will take my order, no sense of welcoming, raised eyebrows (as though my order is too simple), cashiers that don't even say thank you after receive payment, etc. I would come here much more frequently if the service was more friendly, but it's just not quite the neighborhood gem I would like in a local coffee shop.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Danger Will Robinson!

I was stunned to learn from a friend and fellow Philz coffee addict that a new branch had opened a block away from the Giants ballpark, and 2 blocks away from my work.  He nicknamed it "yuppie Philz."

All the same great coffee, brewed the same way, by 2 or 3 hipsters who are friendly once they've seen you a few times.  The Danger part being it's expensive... $3.25 for a large, multiplied times 7 by the fact that I could now easily visit every day of the week, over a $1.75 cup of Peets.  hmmmmmmmm.

HANGOVER CURE: Philz Anesthesia on the Upside.  I promise this works... and now I can get it on weekdays!!!

The scene is entirely different from 24th St.  It's in a new building, it lacks the funky vibe, but what are you going to do?  I'm generally not there to hang out, I have to go back to work, but it has nice seating and lots of natural light if you're into that kinda thing.

I did have a gripe that's now moot.  The first time I dropped in I asked for a piece of this banana bread, not realizing it was part of the "Tartine Bakery section" of breads.  $4 for a slice of bread?!?!  I mean seriously, what's next?  Tartine will start leveraging a city tax so we can have the privilege of living and breathing near Tartine Bakery?  fuck them and their communist bread lines and $4 slices.

Since then... no surprise here... there's no "Tartine Bakery section" of breads anymore.

Anywayz, Philz rulez.
author: christoph s.

description: decent coffee, not bad and the place was packed when my friend and i came in. For some reason, it screams hipster inside. lol
author: Anne A.

description:
YAY! Philz finally opened on Berry St.

It took a while but was worth the wait. The staff is exceptionally accommodating and friendly. It's a beautiful space and the coffee is ridiculously good. The mint leaf on top is brilliant. Ok... enough gushing, but seriously, it's amaaaazing! GO!!!!
******
Just an update: I met Phil's (or is it Philz'?) son, Jacob. He brews a great cup of coffee and takes such pride in the business - aside from the amazing coffee, it's really special to support a place that cares so much about their customers. When I came in to buy some beans for home, Jacob brewed me a small cup so I could make sure I liked it. How cool is that? And for the record, yes, it was delicious.

My favorite brews so far are the Aromatic Arabic (a medium-dark roast) and the Dancing Water (a medium-light roast). They usually put in cream. And, as we all know oh too well, cream is delicious. However, if you are cholesterol-conscious like I am, I definitely recommend getting low-fat milk rather than non-fat. It complements the coffee amazingly well, without overindulging.
author: Jill M.

description: Delicious. There's a flavor and taste for everyone, regardless of whether you like light, medium, or dark roasts. Best in SF.
author: Amit P.

description: I prefer bold tasting coffee. Tesora was a good selection. It's the first option on their menu. I had it with cream and sugar. No craziness to my coffee. It had a strong flavor but not too bitter and goes down smoothly. I'll be looking them up again when I return to SF next time.
author: Gen L.

description:
OMFG.  Philz coffee is *awesome*.  For the uninitiated, lemme start you off properly.  Say the following words to the friendly baristas:

"Hi there.  I'd like a large Arabic with some cardamom, double extra cream and a floating mint leaf, please.  Thanks!"

Drinking Philz coffee is like taking the red pill.  You can't go back and unknow what you now know.  You have been warned.
author: Caroline E.

description: Returned to Philz after a couple months. Except this time, I tried the SOMA location and I'd like to confirm that the coffee still has crack in it.
author: Jess C.

description:
This place is heaven.

Each cup of coffee is hand-crafted to your specs. The atmosphere is perfect. On a sunny day, you can sit in here for hours and not have a worry in the world.

The netz are free and fast. 

If you are a tech geek, you might see Scott Beale hanging out here sometime too!
author: Andrew M.

description: Best coffee in the city, totally worth the sometimes confusing ordering process.
author: Brooke N.

description:
I like this Philz better than the one in Castro. It's bigger, airier, with large floor to ceiling windows, and most importantly, it's very close to the train station! 

I'm not a coffee drinker, but I love their tea. With a touch of cream and honey, it's amazing tea. Sit here and enjoy the ambiance on a stormy, cold day, sitting on the couch. It's a great little place. Their baklava is also excellent.
author: Frank B.

description:
It saddens me that a city that knows no bounds to culinary excellence...still drinks crap coffee.

As a (coffee) industry insider, I can tell you that this place is better than Starbucks or Peet's....and that's about it.  When I went, I asked for their best coffee...I forgot what it was now, but they recommended it.  It was burnt, bitter, overextracted, and completely simple.  There was not complexity, nuance of flavor or anything indicating how much I just spent on it.  

The staff seemed condescending, a trait which is unfortunately all too common in the industry.  The layout is confusing, crowded and inefficient.  Even the bathroom sucked.

I for the life of me cannot figure out why people would give this place anything higher than 3 stars, even if they were not aware of the great coffees that awaited them at Ritual or Four Barrel.  (Or even Blue Bottle).  Come on SF, there is so much better coffee out there.

Also, it is no wonder that they have 4.5 stars.  For some reason my review was removed earlier.  Seems sketchy to me.
author: Jay V.

description:
Update: MMMMmmmm.....

Update: It's opening tomorrow morning.  I'll be there.

Update: Looks like it's almost finished.  Can't wait till they open and I can write a real review.

Coming Soon my ass!  This place has had a "Coming Soon" sign up since I moved into the building across the street many moons ago.  This better be some damn delicious coffee.
author: Dave G.

description:
I welcome and will gladly patronize any independent coffee shop that is not Starbuck's or Peet's but this one was more than indie. I was down by the S.F. Public Library Mission Bay Branch killing some time and discovered this place. It's like a coffee bar with 31 flavors of coffee beans on the wall. Actually I don't know how many flavors there were but it was reminiscent of an ice cream shop I know of. You order your flavor and they grab just the right amount of beans out of the appropriate bin, grind them on the spot, and then brew it one cup at a time. It should give you the perfect cup of coffee.

Funny thing is that I didn't get any coffee. I had just finished a double capp from another coffee shop a few minutes ago but I was hungry so I got a bacon/cheddar bun and a Fiji water. Still, this place seems way cool and I'll prolly go back. They also sell fedoras and t-shirts with the Philz logo and slogan, "One Cup at a Time."
author: Hunter G.

description:
San Franciscans know that counting on MUNI to get you anywhere on time is like playing Russian roulette. Thank goodness that on the mornings that MUNI's failings causes me to miss my Caltrain, I know that I get a cup of Philz as a consolation. (Even if I'm on time for my train, I'm tempted by the fact that it only takes approximately 9 minutes to walk from the Caltrain station to Philz and come back with a cup of coffee.)

Philz's Harmonic and Silken Splendor are my two favorite coffees right now, but they have so many different blends, I'm sure there are some other treasures in there. They've got a few good teas as well.
author: Joseph R.

description: Great coffee by great people. They take the time to make great drip coffee and will happily add sugar / cream to taste or even re-make it if you don't like it. One of the best coffee shops in the city. They don't really do espresso so if like your coffee black, this is the place to be. This location a mojito iced coffee which is a little pricey ($4.50 large) but unique. Tastes like a coffee, cream, mint that's well-balanced, tasty and interesting.
author: Brandon O.

description:
When I first tried Philz, I was brought by a coworker who told me to get a mocha. It was great, but I'm not a huge mocha fan. The next time I went there I tried the Jacob's blend. I was blown away. It tasted like no other coffee I had ever had. I tried to drink some Tully's the next day. I used to think Tully's was really good, but after Philz it tasted like brown water.
After a lot of traveling and being too busy at work to make the 3 block walk to Philz, I realized it had been about 2 months since I had been there. I thought, "Maybe I am over hyping this place in my head. It's just coffee, it can't be that incredible." I went back again yesterday to see if I that was true.
It's not. I wasn't over hyping the coffee. It's that good.
If you're lucky, Jacob (the owner's son) will be there and make your drink. Everyone there makes a great cup of coffee, but Jacob's is magic.
author: Justin F.

description: Very tasty coffee...I bought a pound and it is very smooth and enjoyable, just as promised.
author: Judi O.

description: I don't even drink coffee really but I am addicted to the mint mojito. I just want them to open up more locations.
author: Roman I.

description:
Ended up here because: my friend John D. highly recommended the coffee shop. Knowing my own weak spot for good coffee, I begged for us to stop by after lunch.  

Impressed by the: intimate setup of the shop and the "stations" where you order and watch them hand brew each cup.  

Must try! the: Ambrosia Coffee of God, with their special "creamer" (you won't regret it!).

Because: it tastes exactly like what it sounds like. Ambrosia Coffee of God.

My concluding thoughts: I'm having a really difficult time determine if Philz is better or the velvet latte from Uptown Espresso, Seattle. Help!
author: Jessica Z.

description:
My friends know the two drugs I cannot handle are caffeine and nicotine. But even I found something so incredibly delicious at Philz that I had to yelp about it.

While P specializes in top quality beans from Jamaica and Ethiopia you can also get amazingly fresh tea with or without caffeine here. I ordered the mint tea iced and was pleasantly surprised. My iced delight was as fresh as if the mint was just plucked from the ground.

If I drank coffee, I would come here every day. I'll be back for more tea.
author: Jessica M.

description: My favorite is the Jacobs.  Good coffee.  But if you drive in (like we did) tough to find parking sometimes.
author: Ken L.

description:
When I'm in a bitchy mood because it's 7:30AM and I had to wake up and drag myself to work, your Philharmonic is always there to cheer me up.  Thanks Philz.

When I'm falling asleep in my cubicle and need an extra boost to keep me going, thanks Philz for that extra caffeine boost.

For all the times I went to work feeling like crap because of a long night of alcohol consumption and a lack of sleep.  Thank you for consoling me the next morning and helping get through a looooonnnnng day of work.  Philz, you really are a good friend.

Let's just hope this honeymoon phase of ours last for a long time.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: I came to Philz Coffee for the first time with my girlfriend this past Sunday afternoon. My sister loves their coffee, so I'd figured I should try it out since I'm in the area. I had the Soo Good and my first impression was "WOW!" It was seriously the best coffee I had ever tasted! I also requested soy milk with a sprinkle of sugar, so that made it even better! The workers at Philz Coffee are extremely friendly. I told them it was my first visit and they introduced the coffee and whatnot. Overall, it was a very good experience. Expect me to visit Philz Coffee every time I'm going to a Giants game!
author: Edgar G.

description: mojito iced cofee, period.. Best darn iced coffee in the universe. Well everything there is world class... I would much rather have Philz than that stuck up Blue Bottle bitter coffee that I really dont understand why people are going crazy for.. Seriously, it aint good. You wanna spend your money here folks... Don't be intimidated with the staff, sometimes they look mean but that's because they make the meanest cup o'joe you'll eva eva have...
author: Christopher J.

description:
I've been converted. I wasn't a big coffee fan (straight up masala tea for me)...until I heard about and tasted Philz turkish brew--with cardamom and mint. Incredibly flavorful.  Be forewarned: the staff there is over-the-top friendly..so you can't just walk in, order and leave.

 I jogged in here on a sunny saturday morning after a run to grab a coffee..little did I know there was a random party going on inside. The staff wanted to simply celebrate the sun and had lots of food and treats out for people to try (proscutto wrapped melon, fresh mozzerella & tomato, lemoncello drinks).  This was all too much for my sweaty, post-run self..just came in for a quick coffee and was overwhelmed by the friendly staff, the food, and all the cheeriness. The barista kept asking me what he could make me (as I was staring at the menu reading there 20+ options)- until finally he said- let me make you something special. Sure enough, I got a delicious iced coffee with mint and cardomom flavor.  I'll go back for sure- but will ask them to hold off on all the cream (it was way to creamy for me).
author: Sonia S.

description:
I was worried that with three Starbucks and the Borders cafe within three blocks of this place that it may have trouble, but Philz fits in a different niche.   There's no espresso.  Instead you've got various varieties of coffee made to order one cup at a time (the tagline actually is meaningful), and what I have tried so far is quite good.  As an added plus Phil made my first cup. 

I have gripes about the pastries.   The selection can be rather limited at times.  I've been having a cup of coffee and a croissant for years now, and for some reason the croissants are rarely available.

For humor you can watch the poor souls endlessly waiting for the T Line outside.   I need to see if wifi works there, odds are you can piggyback off of the Panera Bread or Library signal, as Philz is directly between the two.

*EDIT*  There's about 13 wifi signals within range of Philz.  The SSID "MissionCreek" appears to be open for use.  Also some leather couches showed up today that weren't there yesterday.  Power plugs are behind the couches below the window.

*EDIT 2*  The cute female coffee makers work here on weekend mornings.
author: Beau G.

description:
It's a tough review to write. The coffee (I had two cups, of different blends just to make sure it wasn't a one-off) was mediocre at best, and occasionally just bad. Maybe I've been spoiled by great coffee from Blue Bottle or Ritual, but this just wasn't up to snuff. 

so why is this a tough review?

Because the people are great, the atmosphere is wonderful, the chairs are comfy, and the food is awesome. My wife had the tea and liked it. So, perhaps the two blends I had were bad. I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt since everything else was great. But I won't be going back just for a solo cup of joe.

UPDATE: After being wrangled by some true believe friends to return, I have to admit that the coffee was great - second time. And third. And ever since. Changing score to reflect this.
author: Brooks B.

description:
I went to Philz today after lunch and realized why everyone claims this is the best place for coffee. I ordered my usual small decaf and the barista said she would add the cream and sugar for me. OK. I browsed the pastry section and admired the cute little doughnuts. The perfect size for a bad treat. I ordered a chai mini doughnut. I checked out the ambiance, very cool. The folks behind the counter were friendly and hipster. The alternative music playing in the background added to the whole effect perfectly. It was a bit Seattle'ish and resembled the movie Singles. I love that movie. 

During this brainstorm, I remembered that I was still waiting for my cup of COFFEE. The perk about not ordering espresso drinks is that there's no wait, so I was a bit annoyed about having to wait for my cup of DECAF.  When it was ready, I looked at this frothy cup of coffee. I realized that Philz made custom cups of coffee, newly dripped. The barista had blended the cream and 1 bag of Equal into my cup of decaf and converted it into a heavenly drink. It resembled a European espresso without the speedy caffeine bite, mmm mmm good.  

Even for a measly cup of decaf coffee, this place rocks! I'm re-thinking my limited coffee intake...
author: Patty V.

description:
Pluses: quick service, vegan donuts and cookies, soft seating, close to Muni and CalTrain
Minuses: can be crowded with no place to sit, too breezy by the door, not a place to hang out for any length of time
author: Bob G.

description:
Let's take a look at our neighborhood coffee joints, in the style of cyclist stereotypes:

Blue Bottle (the garage): Working messenger on a sublime unmarked 1955 Cinelli track ride
Blue Bottle (the lifeless cafe): Talented art school student walking beside her trailer queen Kid Robot one-off (click-buy now, never ridden!)
Starbucks: Aged immigrant aiming a Sears mountain bike down the sidewalk at night dressed head-to-toe in black 
Ritual Coffee Roasters: Working messenger on a rasta-rattlecan 1970s Raleigh Grand Prix
Philz: Sheldon Brown

Philz gets it done.  They have every style of coffee you could possibly want, there's a few convenient locations, it's affordable, and it's tasty.  The staff and ambiance are not East Village funky, but they know their beans.  Yay.
author: K M.

description: Coincidentally, more often than not majority of the time I get free coffee from Philz..  Last time I came, they felt really generous so my friend received a gift card for no particular reason.  This past saturday, I order my coffee and approach the counter to pay and BAM! their cash register is down.  The coffee was on the house.  The coffee is to die for and I waited about five minutes for my personal freshly brewed cup of Jacob's wonderbrew.  It's a perfect type of dark roast for my tongue.  The only thing was that I ordered my coffee iced and it came hot, but who wants to argue over some free coffee?  This place definitely rocks and I will always come back if I'm around this area.
author: B T.

description: My favorite Mocha in SF.  I haven't been wowed by their other coffees, though.  This location has cute dogs.
author: Erika C.

description: This review is not particularly for the Berry Street Philz but for Philz over all.  By fiance and I love, love, love Philz Coffee.  They just make one of the best.  The concept of one cup at a time...genius!!!  Our favorite...gotta say...are the iced coffee (Mint Mojito and the Ginger Snap).  We reward ourselves with these after a hard work such as our Saturday morning run.  Highly recommended!
author: Dimps I.

description: Mmm I got the mint mojito coffee and it was pretty good. Make sure to sorta swirl or mix it cuz the mint leaves and syrup are on the bottom. It was on the sweet side so if that's not your thing. Don't get it. The only thing I disliked was how disorganized it is cuz I didn't really know where to stand after ordering. There's really only a line inside for paying after you get your drink and the other "line" is sorta just at the door. I don't know how the other philz are and maybe I just haven't been here enough but I still think this coffee place is great only after going once :)
author: Casper W.

description:
Sometimes I wonder if I get shit faced so I can head into Philz the next morning with my shades on so they can "resurrect me from my grave."  

I actually feel like Lazarus every time I come out of Philz with coffee in hand.  Yes, its safe to say that their stuff is so strong you could raise the dead.  

I think Philz should pay me for the slogan.  I'm thinking a free cup every time I come in.
author: Dennis M.

description: The coffee is great, but the service is lackluster. Especially the big guy with the blonde hair. First time I have had him as a barista, and the last. Service did not come with a smile and he could use as much friendliness as he can coming his way. Although, how could I not be drawn to that ever so appealing personality. I think this location has become too comfortable and only the "regulars" get the smile and the endless conversations. But, you all can go on and on and on while there are people lining up to order.
author: S. F.

description:
Finally... This is how coffee is supposed to be. Philz has a great selection and very knowledgeable staff - if you don't know what you want just ask and they will guide you through the choices. 

The Turkish blend (tantalizing turkish) is a very complex coffee, dark roast with cardamom and mint. I also like the New Manhattan blend. More expensive than your run of the mill Starbucks, but that's sort of the point...! 

Highly recommended.
author: Paul G.

description:
This is so good. 

I walked in here on a random Wednesday afternoon, went up to the barista and admitted I was a Philz virgin.  He said he had just the thing for me, and whipped up a delicious cup of Jacob's Wonderbar Brew, perfectly creamed and sugared.  Let's not overlook that - a complete stranger perfectly creamed and sugared my coffee.  

I'm hooked.
author: Patricia K.

description: I've tried plenty of different coffee here and none of them disappoint.  The service is also awesome.  There are some days that I just want to quit my job and be a Barista here for life.  That's how happy I feel every time I come in!
author: Cindy B.

description: Hands down the best coffee you can get in the United States of America, lol.  We all know European coffee is better for some reason.  Will be here all the time.  I like the Ambrosia blend as well as the Anesthesia.  Give it a try!  You won't want to drink Starbucks again. (Blue Bottle is ok!)
author: Jonathan L.

description: I'm not a coffee drinker, but had heard so much about this coffee, I wanted to try it.  I definitely understand the hype now!  I told the girl who helped me what kinds of tastes I liked (rich, chocolatey, not too sweet), and she picked a coffee for me and sweetened it a little with cream and sugar.  It was perfect!  Very delicious and smooth!  I also had a cheese croissant, warmed up perfectly, flaky, very yummy.  The staff was all really nice and knew their coffee!  The place is nice, lots of room with couches, tables, a couple outdoor tables.  Definitely a busy spot, popular.  It's casual and comfortable, there was everything from people coming in post workout to people reading or using computers.  Good spot!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
imagine telling a barista all the flavors you love in and outside of coffee. and having them really listen to the eccentricity's of your tastebuds and making a cup of coffee just for you.

for me: hazelnut (love the H flavored creamer), chocolate (from the countless mochas I've had in my lifetime), and cardamom (from the Indian Chai i grew up having). A Philz barista listened to my dream coffee blend and managed to put those flavors together into what is now called a 'flirty mocha'. A drink specifically tailored to me. I walk in, they know me and my usual, and I'm out the door w/ the most perfect cup of coffee i could fathom. It's a blend of all the flavors I love that come with experiences and memories I grew up with. 

I loved Philz's Tesora, Mocha Tesora, and Philtered Soul even before the 'Flirty Mocha'  was concocted for me. But now I'm in love with this coffee establishment for their impeccable service and one of a kind coffee.
author: Maria A.

description: Love that I can get my fav coffee at home in the stro and at work in mission bay! Blows Starbucks out of the water!! I need strong coffee not watered down crap water!!
author: sam m.

description:
Ah, this is really good coffee. I walked over from CalTrain, and was a little confused as to what I should get.  I simply told him what I liked, and he gave me exactly what I was craving....something smooth, and sweet but not too sugary sweet....their Philtered Soul.

I also had a slice of their cranberry (?) and rosemary bread which was different, but still tasty.

I wish there Philz Coffee would replace the Starbucks that is right next to my office....pretty puleeze!
author: Jen C.

description: Philz Coffee is definitely my favorite coffee shop at this time.  My friend insisted I try both Philz Coffee and Blue Bottle, but I will say that Philz has won my love.  I tried the Iced Mocha Tesora and it was awesome.  The mocha complemented the full bodied medium roast coffee very well.  The ambience was great and the employees were somewhat friendly as well.  Philz is a must everytime I visit the bay area from now on.
author: Gina P.

description: Came in yesterday because someone told me it was the very best cup of coffee ever. I was so excited! Then I looked at the menu and did not warm to the idea of 1,000 different cups of coffee, it was a little overwhelming. So then we ordered our coffees finally, and sat outside to wait. That was nice, watching all the people and cars go by...for 20 minutes...and still no coffee. Went back in, and they had totally forgotten to make our two coffees. It wasn't even that busy! Finally, when the coffees did arrive, they were quite delicious; very foamy though which I am not used to in a cup of coffee. Good location, decoration, and coffee, but major lacking in customer service and efficiency.
author: Baylee C.

description:
Nice sunny, well lit place with a pretty yummy cannoli and free wi-fi.  You can find some street parking across the bridge.
Can't really comment on coffee - I"m not a huge coffee person sorry :(.  
The ambience is nice - the tables are a bit randomly scattered and it's really loud and busy, so not the best place to hang out.
author: Cathy L.

description:
At $4.50 a pop, some would call it a guilty pleasure (or rip-off), but I consider a large semi-sweet iced mint mojito coffee an earned pleasure and an aid to economic productivity. 

In terms of sweetness, I find the semi-sweet mochas here perfect; just sweet enough to temper the full-bodied coffee, but because Philz uses cocoa powder instead of corn-syrup-based "chocolate" syrup the taste of cocoa really comes through and is not overpoweringly syrupy. 

I also like the service here. Philz is pretty quick considering that each cup is made to order via slow-drip and the baristas are always friendly and knowledgeable. I also appreciate that they did not hold it against me when I first walked into the store and I tried to order a sandwich.
author: Chris T.

description:
Best coffee in San Francisco, and the free samples of sweet confections don't hurt. The folks at the coffee bar obviously love their coffee. Don't make the mistake of going in and ordering a latte though because you'll be scolded.

New favorite brew: Ambrosia of the Gods
author: Vikram K.

description: Happily skipping into the office with my Tesora in hand. Then onto morning Yelp reading when I just spilled it all over myself. Is my day ruined because I just destroyed my white blouse?? Nope, its ruined because my Tesora has gone to waste =[
author: Marti L.

description:
This was my first time to Philz. Why the hell did I wait so long? Well, my own stupidity, I guess. 

I tried their #6 and their Mint Mojito coffee on my first visit. Derek helped me both times, and now I am addicted to the Mint Mojito. What a strange combination that feels so good for the few and far between hot SF Indian summer afternoons.

I'm going again this week; looking forward to going again and again and again!

THANK YOU for making awesome, handcrafted coffee. /swoon/
author: dj z.

description: Is it expensive for drip coffee? Yes but this stuff is brewed with soul, its got character and really addictive. First time I tried a Jacobs Wonderbar Brew, my wife asked me how it was and I literally sat there silent for a few seconds before answering "best cup of coffee I have ever had". It has never disappointed.
author: Will C.

description:
I know I've been giving out 5 stars like crazy lately.... but holy crap, I wish I had a Philz next door to my house in San Diego. The adorably nice scruffy guys, delicious baked goods, and what you will never find anywhere else, THEY BREW EACH CUP OF COFFEE. What you say?? Your kidding me! No, I am serious. Don't drink the burnt bean juice from *tarbucks if you live near one of these babies, once again Im jealous of San Franciscans...
Oh and best Chai tea, I dont think I drank anything so fast, and I was already craving another one later that day...
author: Courtney S.

description:
I can't believe that I was a virgin to Philz Coffee until last night.  What a wonderful slogan...One cup at a time, is soooooooo... true.  The cushy couches and the relaxing music made for the perfect backdrop for conversation between friends.

Tesora, you kept me buzzing during a long, long walk on the Embarcadero and kept me warm on a cold SF night.  I am glad that the nice staff helped me select the "right" coffee for my tastes (light on cream, light on sugar/sweetness)

Philz proves customer service and coffee can meld together BEAUTIFULLY!

(P.S. - the Almond croissant is good)
author: Hiromi N.

description:
it's true... it's really one cup at a time!

proven through accidental taste test experiment! i've been ordering the mocha tesora with request for "less sweet" and of course last time we went my boyfriend copies me and orders the exact same. and when we got our cups of coffee, mine though good was a litte too "less sweet" for my taste, while his was a little too sweet for his. we switched and realized the switched cups were just right for our tastes. the bottom line is that though we ordered the exact same drink, each cup tasted a little different! 

to caveat this review... i've only ever ordered the mocha tesora, it was so good that i may never allow myself to try anything else. i don't live in SF, but whenever we drive up, i want a philz!
author: Irene L.

description: This is my first time here and I've heard many people rave about it so I just had to see what all the fuss is about! I had their famous tesora and it's delish! However, I personally think $3 is a bit much to pay for a small cup of coffee. Perhaps it makes up for the fact that they brew YOUR cup on the spot. Nonetheless, it was definitely worth the trying.
author: Sharon G.

description:
My husband and I happened upon this place the last weekend.  We had about 45 minutes before our Cal Train came to whisk us home, and I was not about to sit in the station for that long.  We decided to take a walk around, and lo and behold, a short block away, we found Philz.

The second we walked in we were greeted by the two friendly Baristas.  Given that I had already had a bunch of coffee that day, we each ordered a Chai.  I have to say, that I usually find chai a little too sweet, but this places custom blend is just perfect, and the barista (whose name I am sad not to remember) made us his special "low sweet" version, all the while chatting about the "one cup at a time process" and the history of Philz.  The cups were topped off with fresh mint ... a wonderfully delicious addition.  

After we retired to drink our spicy elixirs, the barista returned to offer fresh, and FREE, bakalava samples for everyone in the shop.  Now, I am gluten intolerant, so that means I could not partake, and that there were no options for me to eat (hence the 1 star off)... but the gesture was not lost on me.  My husband did however accept the freebie, which he assured me, was perfect.

I plan to return here, and to visit the other locations, so I can try their coffee.  We did leave with some of the Wunderbar roast blend, which we have yet to try, but it smells divine.
author: Karly L.

description:
The first time I ordered a coffee here, I was a little put off by the fact that they don't make lattes, but the barista recommended that I order a Philtered Soul, which was sweet enough for my Starbucks-acclimated palate.

After a hour and a half of loafing on the couch, we were greeted by the same barista, who had walked over a large coffee for us on the house. Great customer service here! The drinks are also shockingly less than $5.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Don't go here if you want a latte. Go to get a strong cup o' joe that'll kick your ass. And yes, it really will. You know how Monday mornings kick you in the face? That's what Philz coffee will do to you every day of the week and twice on Sunday. 

This little body can't handle all that goodness on a regular basis, but I plan on going in for round 3 and trying a different roast (it's like 31 flavors).
author: Allison B.

description:
I was in the neighborhood walking my friend's dog and noticed the place.
I can here for a cup of tea not coffee, so my review here probably doesn't justify the rating since their speciality is coffee.

I had a mint tea, which the guy didn't use any tea bag but a real set of mint. I thought that was pretty cool and the tea was very flavorable. That was a real mint tea!!! However it was a bit of pricey for a medium of cup of tea. I guess you have to be a bit of pricey in that neighborhood.

It look like a nice place to hangout and service was friendly. 
I definitely recommend this place.
author: Leon C.

description:
It's good.
All drip coffee, all fresh beans, all the time.
Not manicured like a Starbucks, the inside might as well be the outside.

Yeah Philz!
author: Leslie C.

description:
The beauty of good coffee is the way it makes you smile when you think about it long after you have tasted it.  If it's done right, it's more than a beverage it's an experience.  Unfortunately, this concept was lost on me until recently.  I was served an incredible cup of coffee by a mobile vendor (Storyville.com) and like the holy grail, I've been searching for that experience ever since. 

After doing research on Yelp I was led to one of the BEST coffee experiences I've ever had at Philz. The individually prepared mug of coffee is not new.  Most people are familiar with Blue Bottle, but I'm here to say that Blue Bottle doesn't hold a candle to Philz. 

Not only is the coffee amazing, but the service is stellar.  All we had to say was "we've never been here before, what do you recommend?"There was no attitude. We had questions, they had answers.  They prepared sample coffees to explain different roast flavors, and went in to details.   When they asked if I wanted sugar and cream and what amount, I was befuddled.  Wasn't that my job?  I went with the flow and said 'medium" sugar.  I don't know how Cecil did it, but it was PERFECT. I'm smiling as I remember the way it tasted like a warm hug. 

Oh yes, I will be back.
author: Kim S.

description: Everyday before work I come here to get a small Jacob's extra sweet.  The coffee here is delicious and does it's job in keeping me up for my long shift at work.  The staff at this location are very friendly.  There are times when the lines are pretty long, but the workers at this location are pretty fast and make a great cup of coffee.
author: Marvin C.

description: I must retract my sworn loyalty to It's a Grind. Philz satisfies my thirst for an intensely dark, artfully made cup of coffee. The darker the brew the sweeter the flavor is the infamous saying.. no? Well this is undoubtedly true for Julie's ultimate, a glorious cup of orgasmic joy. Each sip reveals a distinct aspect of the brew's character,  and expresses a varied stimulation of scent and taste. When infused together, simply drinking Julies Ultimate transforms into an indulging, intimate experience.
author: Gabriella C.

description: Lots of great reviews below...just adding my two cents.  There's no reason to suffer through an overly "commercial" cup of coffee in San Francisco.  Love the hand poured drip coffees and the level of service at Philz.  I'm not a Starbucks hater, but I definitely would choose Philz any time I had the option!
author: Amy M.

description: BEST place to grab breakfast after taking the overnight Megabus to SF from LA. I *might* actually make the trip more frequently (under the guise of visiting family) just to have breakfast here. Hands down, this has made my weekend.
author: Jen H.

description: It just doesn't get any better than Philz. Go on in, explore the offerings, do yourself a favor and dart all over the board while you figure out what you really like. The staff is friendly and always helpful, and very good at helping make a choice depending on your taste preference. Each cup is made to order with care. One taste and you're hooked, enjoy. Current favorite is ambrosia. The only downside at this location is parking :(
author: Rob B.

description: I love this place. I always come in for my mint mojito, read a book and just enjoy this place on a beautiful day especially because they have outside seating. I also always come in here right before I go to a giants game, which is perfect, I come to the city, get my mint mojito and then I get to watch baseball ;) Jetta and brosnan are awesome. they're really sociable and always knows how to make good recommendations. They always get my drink spot on perfect.  They know how to make the coffee, cream, and sugar all mix well as opposed to having more coffee=more bitterness to me and not enough cream or sugar.
author: Jeanine I.

description: Yo! They got coffee here, it's pretty fuckin good! $3 is kind of expensive for flavored water, but fuck it bro, shit's worth it! Can't go wrong with the Tesora son!
author: Thomas P.

description:
So many reviews already, so I'll be brief--

1.  The skill of the staff varies.  There are some people I try to avoid because there coffee isn't that good.  There are some people who for some reason give you a lukewarm cup of coffee every single time.  So don't judge this place based upon a single visit.  

2.  There is a really nice young Asian guy who has a beard and always wears a hat of some sort.  He is without a doubt the best coffee maker they have imo.  (short term advice I realize but if you see him, I'd wait for him).
author: J Y.

description:
I am not normally a coffee drinker, but Philz might change that.  I love that they put the cream and sugar into my coffee for me.  Kind of like Dunkin' does, but Philz does it better.  So much better.   

And super great service to boot!  A big shout out to the green eyed cutie that walked me through my first Philz experience.
author: Jackie D.

description: Philtered soul= deliciousness. This is the best coffee I've had, no lattes or fancy stuff, just a ton of different coffee flavors and roasts to choose from.
author: Tami W.

description: seriously good. had the Mocha Tesora. why do they not have this in LA already? they would give Starbucks and Coffee Bean a run for their money. the level of quality, and the fact that each barista single-handedly makes the entire drink for you, then asks you to taste to see if it is to your liking is way more customer attentiveness than i even need, but is reflective of the pride they take in their product and service. the level of anality of some Starbucks fiends would totally lend itself to Philz patron philosophy, although I imagine long lines would be commonplace. with coffee this good, and not even being really a coffee drinker myself, i may just wait it out if they would propagate in LA.
author: Junsu H.

description: They reached out and made it up for me- offered an explanation (spilled hot chocolate) and a free drink later in the day. I didn't take them up on it, but it was a nice gesture. THanks Philz!
author: Gary S.

description:
Damn you.

Before you, I swore I would never become a daily coffee drinker.

Before you, I mocked the jittery movements, afternoon crashes, pearly whites becoming muddy browns, and the physically questionable ability to expel more liquids than you actually drank.  

You broke me.  I will never forgive you.  5 stars.
author: Eyal C.

description:
I needed real coffee yesterday morning. I had a rough morning which was compounded by hotel coffee which was reminiscent of hot water, and office coffee which would have been reminiscent of burnt hot water. A coworker recommended Philz and, somehow, my life changed.

So yes, this takes a while. Each cup is brewed individually but I didn't see this as a negative. My barista helped guide me to a blend I would like and ultimately I went with the Tesora. It was creamy, delicious, and exceptionally well-balanced - easily, easily the best coffee I'd ever had. Ever. Anywhere. It was so good that I had to buy a pound of the stuff.

I was warned by said coworker that Philz was "expensive;" a 16 ounce cup runs, on average, $3.25. To be honest with you I don't see this as expensive. If it's up to me... and it is... I'll pay more for a better quality coffee. Unless you go with a drip from Starbucks, for instance, it's hard to get out of there for under $4 and this is in a whole different league.

I didn't see Philz as pretentious at all. I've been to coffee shops that are pretentious and/or intimidating, and this isn't it. My experience was positive all around, and I'll be back.
author: Paul M.

description: Stopped in on our way to AT&T Park for an afternoon Giants game. Coffee quality is up there amongst the best. Thanks Philz!
author: Mike S.

description: Fantastic, I am particularly drawn to their darker coffees. This is one of the few coffee places where I always drink the coffee black. It doesn't need anything extra.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Def a 'walk in' kind of place, so that means it is mostly folks from all the apartments in China Basin.

I only gave three stars bc I am a meany. The crowd here just doesn't float my boat. I like gritty, tattooed, arty. This is mall, perfumed and dyed blonde. 

Tried a decaf with the sugar and cream works, they were right, very low acidity but why was I still feeling jacked? hmnnn, you are duly warned. 

Decor is scareily Starbuckian but if you are jonesing and in the area or facing a drive home after a Giants game, this is your ace.
author: Miel H.

description:
2 reasons to be in this part of the City:

The hometown 9 (Giants) 
and now...Philz Coffee. 

It's a cleaner location and it doesn't seem as busy as the one on 24th, although that one will remain my primary coffee joint. You just can't beat the awesome combination of the great service and the quality of the coffee beans.
author: Chris C.

description: If God drank coffee, he'd drink it here. Even the silly 3 star reviews have nothing but great things to say about it. Single cup press. Describe how you like to feel about your coffee flavor and they'll make it up for you as your one cup special. Conveniently next to the ball park, but worth the trip on its own. Far ahead of any other coffee ever. Worth a sixth star.
author: Nick L.

description: Lately, I just can't seem to get Philz outta my mind! I've been trekking to the Berkeley location from work as much as I can, and on the way to SF the other day, yelp showed me I was about a mile away from this one! My barista that day was especially nice and was chatting with my niece and even brought my drinks to me. I went for a Philz doughnut and my niece grabbed a mini red velvet cupcake. Perfect treats for the muggy sf day.
author: Trina A.

description:
The menu was a little confusing for someone that was looking for something simple- but the staff was more than friendly. I told them what I was looking for and they came up with a yummy drink for me. This is a great place for a real coffee conasure. 

5 stars for amazing staff- I haven't met this friendly of a staff in a coffee shop- EVER!
author: Melinda Q.

description:
I don't know what's wrong with Parker W down there but I think Philz is awesome! Parking sucks in SF you should have ridden on a scooter!

This morning I had Philz Chai which is my new favorite thing. Ever.
author: Scott H.

description: Great coffee! Usually has lines that coincide with the caltrain getting off...Totally recommend it. Love that each cup is hand dripped and the cream they use is awesome, probably not the healthiest though... I have also tried the pumpkin muffins which are a little small but really good.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
This is not only the best coffee place in San Francisco, this is the best coffee place in the 24 states and 15 countries I have been to. The coffee is what makes it so, not the ambiance or price or staff or parking or whatever, it is the coffee. Some cups are better than others, but make sure you try the Ether, Tesora, and Jacob's Wonder Brew. I make this part of my Saturday morning routine and (sadly?) look forward to it on Friday nights. 

On the corner of 4th and Berry, this place isn't in the tourist area at all, so it is missed by many (though Philz has other SF locations). Is the place you went to in Athens that looked up at the Parthenon at sunrise better? Better olocation certainly, but I swear, not a better cup.

The baristas are friendly, talk it up with you, and make sure you try a sip before you move on. They handcraft each cup, so it takes a little time (or lovin'). It isn't too expensive and they are very green. Mission Bay packs this place at any time of the day on any day of the week, so catch it before it blows up into a city-wide phenomenon.

When we move, Philz is one of the things we will miss most.
author: Dave C.

description:
Location = Extremely convenient location right off Caltrain and Muni! If you don't mind parking a few blocks away, there is plenty away from Berry.
Decor = There's a great vibe in this cafe. Always people on the go and folks pounding away on their laptops seated on their random couches.
Staff = 2nd to the fantastic taste of their coffee, the staff is AMAZING. Good smiles, fun personalities and they always serve up consistent cups of coffee to my liking. 
Food/Drink = I tried nearly all the coffees, my current favorite is the Dancing Water. Smooth and delicious. I take it medium milk / medium sweetness. Try their iced coffee - It's like no other.
Special Note = Hey Phil, let's talk. Wanna open up a cafe in my neighborhood.
author: Vibby V.

description:
It's a good thing that I won't be working down here much longer or I may have to just hand over my whole paycheck to Philz. Singe cup brew coffee, so tasty, perfect morning pickmeup.

Work is so much more pleasant today. Thanks Phil. 

Yipee.
author: Cat S.

description:
The number of blends this place has to offer was impressive.  It was a little overwhelming at first.  Fortunately, the the helpful and bubbly barista asked me what kind of coffee I like and made good suggestion.  For the first time, I didn't finish my coffee.  I normally think that there's no such a thing as too much coffee, but last night. I was satisfied before I finish my coffee.  Next time, I'll just get a small cup.  

The deep couches were comfortable.  It was a very cozy place.  The reason it gets four stars instead of five is because the soy latte tasted like coffee with soy milk rather than latte.  It didn't make the coffee less good though.  I'll still go back for small cups of coffee with soy milk.
author: Vivian H.

description:
This place rocks! On the real I am not a trendy coffee/latte sipper but this place is sweet! One of the best things are the people. Normally I feel uncomfortable going into a hip coffee bar if I am not a regular but they always make me feel comfortable. The staff is really helpful in helping me remember what it is that i like hahaha!
Well they don't get these review for nothin' check it out!
author: erika l.

description:
i heart Philz coffee. really i do.
this is the place i go to first thing in the morning before going to work ... just to get that cup of hazelnut goodness ... mMmm ... philtered soul.
you are too delicious...

screw starbucks.
come here and get your cup o' joe just the way you like it.
author: Christine P.

description:
$3 for drip coffee with 2 cups of cream? That is NOT a latte.

People, you're getting ripped off.
author: Ryan M.

description: What an annoying poorly laid out establishment.  Hate the concept and "it ain't no blue bottle"
author: bill l.

description: I've been to many Philz and they're all so good to me! I tried the Mint Mojito for the first time here and it was amazinggg... :) I was a little hesitant at first because of my bad stomach but my tummy was fine! I also tried the Istanbul Treat which consists of tea AND coffee. I am never disappointed at any Philz!
author: Yumi H.

description:
A coffee place that is as good as it damn gets.

I'm not a big coffee guy. I generally prefer the tea. McDonald's sugar-free vanilla iced coffee makes me happy. So that's where I'm coming from. However, I do think I can confidently profess that Philz is in a league of its own. And it's not just because of the coffee (favorites are Turkish, Jacob's Wonderbar Brew for dark brews, the perfectly sweet Philtered Soul amongst the medium brews and the blend-of-whatever-that-day iced coffee), it's also the people who work there. They greet you warmly, give great suggestions and make sure your order is to your liking. And it's like that every time without fail.

Little did I know Philz had other locations throughout the city, I just thought it occupied my small slice of the city. Foolish.
author: Michael S.

description:
I live fairly close by, and it is worth the walk over there. I don't know of any place that hand brews the coffee right there, and it shows, the coffee really is amazing. A little pricey even compared to other coffee places ($3.25 for large cup), but I think it is worth it. 

I alot of coffee, probably the best place in the city (even compared to all the palces that serve Blue Bottle). 

Plus people are friendly and give good service.
author: Brian P.

description:
Short review: Wow

Longer review: This coffee is grade A, primo java. They make it fresh ground, filtered by the cup. I met a friend here, and we tried the Soooo Good (that's actually the name). Well, pun intended. Before I knew it, I had had three cups and I was talking faster than an auctioneer. 

The staff is all very friendly, and they put your cream and sugar in behind the counter...somehow, it just tastes better when other people do it!

Next time I go back, I might check and see if they have a decaf option...
author: Sharon H.

description:
Philz Coffee is truly one of the best things about living in San Francisco.  I remember my first trip to Philz - thinking, "Wow, $3 is a lot for a cup of coffee."  I was never a huge coffee fan.  Well, after my first sip of Philz, I was sold.  It's worth every penny.  It's like a warm, sweet hug in a cup.  My hubby and I are addicted.  Philtered Soul is my personal favorite blend.  Mmm.  Just writing this review is making me crave a cup. I have also tried their iced coffee and iced tea, and they rock as well.

When we have guests in from out of town, we always bring them to Philz, and they are ALWAYS blown away.  Aside from the amazing beverages, the staff is really incredible.  They are all so enthusiastic about the coffee, and they make you feel so welcome - like your visiting with friends.

Love it, love it, love it!
author: Tina C.

description: God I love this place, its got everything: excellent coffee, comfy couches, tons of light, friendly non-judging easy-going baristas (although I enjoy an intense judging barista every once in awhile, they add a certain zest), and outside seating.  No wonder it is often packed.  However, even though a seat might be a trick to find, they keep the line moving at a good pace.  Reliably awesome.
author: Andrew M.

description: In my opinion the best coffee in the SF Bay Area. Love me some Greater Alarm.
author: Kevin H.

description:
This place highly lacks in quality customer service.

I went to Philz Coffee yesterday with my friend before heading out to a concert; we stopped by Philz because it was near Nama (Japanese restaurant) and because we still had time to kill.

We went in and were ignored for ten minutes because the baristas behind the counter were too busy complaining about rude customers and carrying on side conversations with each other. My friend and I stood there and tried to order but were ignored the whole time until one barista was finally not distracted by everything else and took down our orders. Mind you, the place was NOT busy at all, so I felt very offended by how rude they were being to us by giving us the cold shoulder.

Granted, when we did finally get their attention, the baristas were okay. Still, it took them a little too long to serve us our drinks. I am giving Philz Coffee two stars for the sake that one barista did offer us a free movie screening ticket that she received from another customer...if not for that, this would be getting one star. 

I personally feel that my friend and I would have felt a lot better if we had just gone to Starbucks a few blocks away.
author: Helene K.

description:
In my opinion, Philz has the best coffee in the city. I'm not a coffee snob, and so all 30 or so options they have are lost on me. I just order the Tesora with cream and sugar every time, and it's consistently great. 

It took me a while to adjust to Philz. The people there are perfectly friendly, but I don't think it's unfair to say the place has a kind of aloof vibe. For that reason, I almost always take the coffee to go and enjoy it on Muni or on Caltrain.

Their blueberry scones are also delicious!
author: Nick B.

description: I've heard a lot about Philz through people I know, along with pieces I've read about them.  Went here with a friend before a Giants game to try out the Mint Mojito Coffee hype.  Different set up from what I'm familiar with, you wait in line then place your order with whichever barista is available then you go to the cashier on the other side of the counter to pay.  Your barista calls you back over when your drink is ready and even asks you to take a sip to see if it is exactly how you want it.  I thinkt that little touch is pretty good for the customer. Kind of like when you go to the barber and your barber makes sure you like your haircut before you leave.  I took a sip of my Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and it was pretty damn refreshing! I'll be stepping through the doors of Philz again!
author: Cee D.

description:
Holy crap.  Good coffee. Finally in San Francisco, coffee worthy of making a special trip down to SOMA.  This is one wonderful cup of coffee.  The fact that they let you bring your dog into the coffee shop makes me LOVE THEM!  All is well in the world or at least my city, when there is such a place.  
This place just became number one on my SF coffee list!
author: Nilu r.

description: o philz, how tasty art thou! how can someone make coffee this good? it baffles me. besides the slight nuance that is their steep prices($3-$3.5), i have nothing but praise for this local coffee shop. a cup of philz is a weekend treat that i always look forward to.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Moving to San Francisco, I was mourning the loss of my beloved Dunkin Donuts coffee. Starbucks and Peet's coffee just don't do it for me. 

Thank goodness I found Philz. Each cup is individually brewed so it is always fresh and you can pick from a variety of beans. The list, albeit a little overwhelming, has something for everyone. They break out each bean by light, medium, dark and decaf - and have great descriptions so you know what you are getting. The staff is also always helpful if you don't know what to get. I tend to like my coffee light to medium, which is probably why I don't like most other coffee places in the city. They also put the cream and sugar in for you which for some reason always makes it taste better. I was also impressed because I have seen a barista remake a cup when a customer didn't think it came out right and they often offer to let you taste it to see if it needs anything else. These people value good coffee.

I have tried the Sooooo Good (light), Philtered Soul (medium), New Manhattan (medium) and Ambrosia of the Gods (medium).  

When I recently moved across the country from NYC my boyfriend met me at the airport with a bag of New Manhattan beans for my coffee pot. Since SF was going to be my New Manhattan :) So far I think i like the Sooooo Good the most to go, but love the New Manhattan from my coffee pot.

Now if only they would open one closer to me so I didn't have to drive across town to get my fix on the weekends! Aka - I'm obsessed.
author: Katie W.

description:
I know my review may get lost in the sauce...

But can I just say Phil'z gets a thumbs up because :

01) They do not charge extra for soy milk. I LOVE THAT. Why do people do that? Hosting cows is far more expensive then hosting soybeans.

02) They ask is "How is it?" .. And I am led to believe that they DO care.

03) The coffee is Delicious.

04) They have Vegan dough nuts. 

05) They show revolving artwork. I like that.

Thanks Phil'z for the Canopy of Heaven. That's the good (god?) stuff.
author: Kellie P.

description: Very nice coffee place.  Friendly stuff.    Like some other people mentioned, place doesn't look too inviting from the outside.   But it's not bad.
author: Nelly B.

description:
This location doesn't quite have that same charm as the location at 24th & Folsom--- but it does have the same damned good coffee.

Its not as crowded (yet) as the other location either, so if you're simply craving the best handmade coffee on the planet... here would be a good place to pop in and out.

Philz coffee is the most amazing coffee on the planet-- and that's a strong statement comming from a complete caffine-hog like me.

I'd like to point out that technically, I"m going to give this location 4.5 stars, because there's absolutely 'O parking anywhere, and its right next to the ball park, so if you happen to run over there at the wrong time, you're bound to be stuck in traffic for at least 25 minutes, which is just no fun at all.
author: Roachie D.

description:
What I had: Large Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, less sweetened

I decided to go for a nice long walk during lunch break... to Philz Coffee. It was a 40min round trip walk, but it was well worth it, and I would do it again. I've had the Ecstatic Iced Coffee at the Berkeley coffee shop, so I decided to go ahead with ordering a large here because I knew it would be good. I finally was able to try the mint mojito iced coffee. The barista was super nice. She said that it usually came sweeter, but she would adjust it for me to my liking. I love that she listened to me and accommodated my taste buds. When I tasted the coffee, it was just heaven. The coffee leaves a delightful aftertaste--nutty, earthy, and flavorful. It was beautiful. The mint was a great touch that complimented the coffee very well. I will be having more lunch breaks there, when I don't have too many meetings. Oh yeah, and I also love how the baristas get individual areas to make the individualized coffee orders. It's like a bar, for coffee. Excellent!
author: Vera W.

description: Coffee was very good... but I'm still a Blue Bottle Coffee fan... but to me that's like saying you're a Beatles fan and prefer Sargent Peppers over Abby Road... both are great!.
author: Brian A.

description:
This is one great locally owned cafe. The service is awesome. You order from their elaborate choices of flavored coffee and you also tell them cream or not and how much sugar or sweetner to add. They take care of all of it real time for you. 

They also have a great pastry counter to order a snack. They are located right off The MUNI T and/or N Lines at the corner of 4th and Berry Streets. Plus, I just live down the street at 420 Berry and this location is very convenient.

The personality of this cafe is great. It smells good and flavorful. They sell Tshirts and hats and odds and end. It's very comfortable and you can even sit outside the cafe and enjoy good weather. 

The guys that work there are also very sweet and helpful and a few are very good looking.  I've seen my share of the gay boys walk in and support the cafe. This is a must, check out Philz Coffee Shop. There are two location in SF but I've only been to this one so far. 

Salute'
author: Donald P.

description:
Things I love about Philz:

The coffee is always just the right temperature for drinking when it is handed to you. Sure, it doesn't stay hot as long as other brews, but it's meant to be drunk right when you get it.

They cream and sugar your coffee for you. This is great because I trust those Philz people to do it just right, depending on the bean, the size of the cup, and maybe even what they think I would like, just by looking at me.

It's never too busy. It's busy when I go in there, but not insanely busy, and I can get in and out in 5-10 minutes.

They do one thing and they do it well. Drip coffee. This is the same thing I appreciate about In N Out Burger (yes, I am making a vague comparison between Philz and In N Out) - they have a short and sweet menu of things that taste great and they can do well quickly and easily. A+ for simplicity.

I'd say that's enough things to warrant 5 stars. It's clean, it's friendly, it's pretty fast, it's delicious - it's everything I'd want it to be, except cheap. But I can accept this because of its superior level of goodness.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I haven't had a cup of coffee this good since... well... ever!  Jacob's Wonderbar Brew is perhaps the greatest cup of perfection I have ever tasted.  It's a dark brew that is full of flavorful goodness.  I'd highly recommend it!

The atmosphere is great with plush couches and tables to sit at and do some work or browse the internet; the wi-fi is also fantastic since you can literally sit down and connect.  There's no connection page you have to browse to at places like Starbucks and Panera, etc.  It's just simple and easy--like it should be!

The staff is extremely friendly, fun, and great at taking care of you.  This is my favorite coffee shop around!
author: Aaron M.

description:
I got a gift certificate for Philz from a friend at Christmas one year.  I carried it around for well over a year before I had a chance to use it.

It may be the best gift I've ever received.

Reminds me a lot of places back home in Austin.
author: M M.

description: I love this place! The baristas and cashiers are always very friendly, and are great at advising which drinks to get. This Philz is not as home-y as the original one on 24th street, but the drinks are just as good. I, like most of the workers there, recommend the iced mint mojito.
