It is very, very popular, and for good reasons.
author: Samantha M.

description:
They brew each cup of coffee individually when you order it...fresh.

Ridiculously good coffee once you get past your anger over the price and your coffee stained clothes.  If you serve a $3.25 cup of black coffee, how about upgrading the leaky and flimsy cups?
author: Scott W.

description: Philz Coffee is delicious.  I'm really loving trying out their different blends, and this is always a fun stop when I want a short walk with the dogs.   My husband loves their tesoro blend (very smooth), and I'm going through their more full bodied beans.  ^-^
author: Tasha D.

description:
Really true - this was indeed "the best cup of coffee I ever had".

While $3 for a small cup of coffee is pricey, they brew each cup to order.  That's right, they grind the beans, and brew your coffee after you order.  I tried the "Philtered Soul", and the coffee was amazing.  It tasted sweet without any need to add sugar/Splenda.    In fact, the first sip was such a "wow" moment, I had to sit down.  It wasn't until I was half way done with my coffee that I noticed that I hadn't paid yet (whoops!).  Worth the money for fellow cofffeeholics.
author: Timothy L.

description:
Amazing coffee. The place is a little overwhelming if you're not used to the culture, but just walk up to a free barista and tell him/her the blend you want from the extensive menu and whether you want cream and/or sugar.
For my first Philz, I blindly chose Philtered Soul from the description and told the guy I wanted it with cream, but "not that sweet". I don't know how he figured out how to do it, but he made the PERFECT cup of coffee. Creamy, but slightly bitter, slightly sweet. So delicious! He had me try it before I left the counter so that he could fix it if necessary, but there was no need. But the thought was definitely appreciated.
I've since converted two of my friends to Philz as well. The outcome does change according to your barista (e.g. levels of sweetness vary according to each person), but for the most part, it's very deep and aromatic coffee. Highly recommended if you're a coffee fan!
author: Jen T.

description: There is always a long line out the door so be prepared.  Since moving to San Francisco, I have been here several times, but with the first visit, I definitely didn't know what to expect.  They brew the coffee fresh for each cup so you get the robust flavor and full body.  If you've ever been to Costa Rica and ordered coffee there, you will appreciate this.  There are several coffee options within each category: light, medium, full body.  My favorite is the Filtered Soul.  The coffee here is strong!  I instantly feel recharged after a cup of this stuff.  Try asking them to add mint in your cup--it adds another flavor dimension.  Don't expect them to have your latte, vanilla syrup, cappuccino options here.  This place is for coffee purists.  The people who work here are super friendly and will help you pick something if you're uneasy.  I would say the only downside is the prices are pretty steep for a cup of coffee and seating is limited.
author: Tanichka B.

description:
It was about 2 years ago...

I was on my way to work and I stumbled along this place, and am very pleased that I have! The coffee was more "addicting than crack" so to speak! Now, I am a regular here and they all know me. Where would I be without my Philz?
author: Sandy F.

description:
03/09/09 - I was working one afternoon and actually stumbled into Philz Coffee on 4th / Berry Streets at Mission Bay by accident.  I walked in and immediately noticed that it was a quaint, jazzy, chill, and positive joint.  The patrons here are mainly part of the neighborhood enjoying a cup over their iPods, a laptop (internet is free), or good company.  The staff is chill and easy-going.

I've been everywhere for coffee and by now, it's part of my job description.  This place is the real deal.  If you visit Philz, I recommend the Philharmonic or Turkish Blend.  The Phil is a lighter version of the Turkish.  And at 3.50 a pop, you really taste the difference.  Its not your mud water at Pete's or the default coffee fix at Starbucks.  It's as light as drinking water from a meadow...hahaha...ok I'm exaggerating, but it's THAT good.  

Highly recommended.
author: Roland L.

description: I don't get the haters. Drinking Philz coffee is like being French-kissed by the coffee god.
author: Brian W.

description: I was on such a roll at Philz that I got cocky, and it burned me in the end.  I don't drink coffee.  I am much more of a tea drinker and it is almost always tea I brew myself.  Putting these two things together makes it so that my mouth easily burns when drinking scalding hot liquids.  I went about ordering my tea and things were looking good.  I asked for no sweeteners so it was really simple.  Then, when the guy handed me my tea, he said to try it to make sure it was ok.  Looking back, I should have just fake sipped it and said yes, as it really was just hot water and a tea bag, so there isn't much to screw up here, but I cracked under the pressure and took a real sip, and my tongue burned because of it.
author: Jason P.

description:
I can't decide which is better, the service or the coffee. After two red eye flights in 4 days, I drank 2 cups of coffee here to have some sense of wakefulness; both were incredible.

I also met the handsome blue eyed guy people write about. He's handsome indeed. And nice as hell! He and the other two guys there went out of their way to ask my name and make coffee that they promised I "will love." I totally did! I also took some whole beans home with me. I'll be back often.
author: Chrissy Q.

description: Mint mojito is forever my favorite. I love it with soy- hot or cold.
author: Samantha Sydnie S.

description:
There is NO place better for coffee than Philz.  What could be better than 20+ blends of coffee from light to medium light to dark, with names like Sooo Good (light), Dancing Water (medium light), Tantalizing Turkish Brew (medium dark), Silken Splendor (dark)?  The Ecstatic Iced Coffee makes me ecstatic (if you think I'm exaggerating, my coffee expert boyfriend in his review likens the coffee here to an orgy).  They add cream (nonfat milk for me) and sugar to your liking, and they even have sprigs of fresh mint that you can add.  I'm gonna keep coming here until I can recite the drink list like the alphabet.

This location is spacey with a lot of sunlight, free wifi, and comfy armchairs, so it's a great place for some reading or light studying.  Easy access from MUNI too!
author: Erica Y.

description: BEST COFFEE IN TOWN! Staff is ruthlessly efficient and yet unflinchingly friendly. Love PHIL!
author: Robert M.

description:
When I fall off of my No Caffeine wagon, it will be on the sidewalk in front of Philz. My first time with Philz coffee was after a good three month stint of Swillz from the barrels 'o coffee in some other local chain joint. Taking that first sip was like a flavor foot kick to my mouth, cardamom, mint leaves, cream, oh my! You don't change Philz, it changes you.

Coffee made for you, one cup at a time, at twice the price, with ten times the flavor. There are so many beans to choose from, you can spend weeks just walking down the list. 

Starbucks and its vile ilk can now be taken behind the building and put out of its misery. Philz for the win.


Update: Fell off wagon, and as predicted I get my hook-up everyday at Philzzzzzz.
author: Aaron C.

description: Another good cup of joe to make me happy..even in this stormy weather.
author: Eva L.

description:
Yay for Philz in SOMA. Love it every morning. I had no problems with the wireless, and the coffee just went down so well.
My Favorite is definitely the Jacobs Wonderbar with Creme & sugar. 

Ahhhh... So good.
author: Jason B.

description: Philz?  You the man!  Plain and simple.  Best coffee in San Francisco!
author: Tony K.

description: It's been a week since I went to Philz for the first time and I think I am still feeling the buzz from that first cup. The joe here is strong and I swear there is more hair on my chest after having had a cup.  Now if only I lived or worked closer....
author: Gary L.

description: My favorite place for coffee in the SF Bay Area. Quickly replaced Blue Bottle. I get the Silken Splendor or the Mocha Tesora if I'm craving something sweet.
author: Lilian W.

description:
Hands down, the best coffee I've had in the city--even better than Blue Bottle (and way less pretentious...you can leave that turtleneck at home). I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I love the Philtered Soul blend--it's flavorful and smooth.

Bottom line: The coffee's great and the people are extremely friendly.
author: Rishi M.

description: Seriously, how many baristas ask you to taste what they just made "to see if it's to your liking?"  Now THIS is customer service!  I've been kind of a Starbucks junkie for years now, with the occasional Ritual, Dolores Park Cafe, or Jumpin Java thrown in but now . . . I'm a total Philz convert.
author: Heather B.

description: It's ok. I prefer to doctor my own tho'!
author: Kirsten L.

description:
Although the location is a bit random, the coffee is top notch!  

Watching the staff making you a cup of joe at Philz is half the fun.  Kind of a science lab meets cooking show sort of experience.  

The coffee itself is of course, delicious.  A lovely little place to chill with some tasty coffee.
author: Jiajia C.

description: I am a coffee fan and Philz is always that pick-up I need. Customer service is top notch and their coffee is like liquid legal crack- in a good way.
author: Bob M.

description: I love PHILZ  I am a coffee fan! By far they have the BEST Mocha ever!  The only thing I dont' like is the chaos of knowing where to stand while waiting for your drink, it is usually pretty packed there.  It is soooo worth the wait for a delicious "made one cup at a time" coffee... YUM!
author: Sheree A.

description:
My 2 cents as a non-coffee connoisseur is that, while okay, the tesora wasn't as amazing as expected from the reviews (and the description on the board). However, I do love the green tea, mint tea, and Istanbul treat - definitely let them add the cream and sugar! Weird to me to put that in green tea but ended up delicious. Just watch out for all the mint leaves...
And the staff is nice too!
author: Jennifer S.

description: I like this place. They have another location in Palo Alto that I have been ot more, but it's the same quality here. The ordering can be a little intense as you look at pretty much a wall of coffee choices. I personally go for the turkish cofffee. Smells and tastes great. Now I know this sounds lazy, but if only this location was actually on the other side of the train station it would be awesome. However on that same sort of point, if you are waiting for the caltrain and need some coffee, the subway in the station doesn't serve it past 10am, and you may be tempted to go to safeway or panera, but just walk one more block and and you will find this great spot :)
author: Greg G.

description:
Plus: 
-Coffee is very strong and reliably brewed well. And, there are lots of choices (but I seem to always get the Turkish) 
-Free Wifi
-Good attitude. Cool people.

Minus:
-Paper Cups Only (compostable, but still wasteful). Bring your own cup!
-The seating isn't bad, but the place is so small, you can't go there expecting to be able to sit and read while you drink your coffee.
author: Ethan B.

description: After all the hype about how good Philz Coffee is, I had to give it a shot. Biking around SoMa, I stopped by for a quick Saturday afternoon cup. After telling the funky cool barista that I wanted a medium-bold blend, she recommended Jacob's brew. It was absolutely perfect. So smooth and just the right type of coffee I love. Will come back whenever I have the time, since it does take longer to make individual cups.
author: Danny C.

description: Pricey coffee but totally worth the money. I am a coffee fanatic. I have to drink coffee at least once during the day or I would not be able to survive. Having said that, I cannot believe I have never tried Philz until this summer. They have so many different blends of coffee and they grind the beans for your order, specifically. Super fresh, great tasting, and doesn't leave a bitter after taste. The customer service is really great as well. The people are always friendly and have a sense of humor (when I brought in my Starbucks tumbler for a refill). If only I had a paying internship, I would come here every day but unfortunately, I am on a budget and can't splurge all the time. A MUST TRY FOR COFFEE LOVERS!
author: D S.

description:
In a city with so much amazing coffee (namely Blue Bottle and Epicenter in my opinion) Philz fills a void that I rarely ever realize until I'm experiencing it. Something like gourmet Dunkin' Doughnuts brew Philz coffee isn't exactly the epitome of the artistic coffee culture. Nor when it comes to demonstrating coffee mastery does a large Ambrosia come close to the sweet nectar of a well pulled espresso. But sometimes a big cup of sugary, cream filled, bright coffee, with a small sprig of mint, really does hit the spot. Not for everyday, but it's definitely enjoyable.

The SOMA location is quite convenient if you have an extra 20 mins before catching a train (like if you just missed one), but I stick to the Mission location for actually hanging out with a laptop for awhile, though I appreciate all their locations have wifi and aren't stingy about plugs.

For a medium roast check out Anesthesia To The Upside, sweet and with cream. For a real start to your day nothing beats the light roast Greater Alarm (crafted for the SFFD), again with cream and sugar, and a mint garnish.
author: Scott R.

description:
I work right across the street from Philz, and I had never been until this week. 2 of my co-workers decided it was time for me to experience the wonder that is Philz. I was sort of skeptical because I am not a huge coffee person, but I ordered an Its the Best, and - wow - it was the best. 

I thought my Tuesday trek to Philz was going to be a one time thing, but its Saturday morning, and I am trying to decide if I can find a reason to go all the way down to SF to stop into the office so I can have a cup of Philz. Why isn't there a Philz in Belmont!!!!! 

(Incidentally, I got Philz coffee on Wednesday,Thursday, and Friday . . . but, I wouldn't say its a wonderful, magical, addictive substance. No, not at all. . . . )
author: Alex G.

description: Perhaps I'm not enough of a coffee connoisseur to appreciate what Philz has to offer. I heard about this place from a friend, so I decided to take a long walk and give it try. When I walked in, I was instantly overwhelmed. The menu was located at the bottom of the bar (if there was one on the wall I didn't notice it) and people were standing in front of it waiting for their coffee so I couldn't anything. The drinks were descriptive, like where the coffee was from, but it just confused me more. Do I like my coffee strong? Do I care that it's from Columbia? I'm not sure really. I ended up ordering a mocha. I went to the cashier to order and was told that I had to order from the barista first. I didn't know! I get back in line and order. The barista made sure I liked the mocha before he let me go pay for it. Super cool! All in all, the mocha was good and I paid for the "personal" service from the barista. Would I go back? I guess, but I wouldn't go out of my way to make a visit to Philz.
author: Adelina W.

description: I go here every day and will wait 30 minutes for my coffee if I have to.  Service is well above par for a place that doesn't need any more reason to stop by to get a cup of heaven.  Absolutely the best coffee you will ever have...Jacob and his staff are extremely friendly.  This is the first place I take anyone from out of town, and they've all been blown away.  Especially the coffee snobs in the pacific northwest.  Can't be matched is what they've said.  Pure joy!
author: Francis L.

description: Mint mojito iced coffee is just as good as everyone says - you must come try it!!! Baristas are all very friendly and not hard on the eyes ;-)  And of course another plus, I walked up to order my drink and got it for free...just because...no particular reason...score!
author: Amanda C.

description:
There is no doubt that philz makes a mean cup of coffee. The staggering amount of coffee they have to choose from gets this place to 4 stars, and the taste and service tips it over the top.

Name one starbucks where the barista asks you to taste the coffee and then tell them if it's ok with you.

Yup - you can't do it.


If you live in San Francisco, you need to check out philz.
author: David D.

description:
I have to personally thank Alex H. for showing me a coffee shop that almost beats Blue Bottle Coffee... almost.

Really this place delivers the best cup when you need it most. I am a huge fan of Greater Alarm and have spent a lot of working hours enjoying the cool SOMA / South Beach atmosphere. The fact that there are other locations means that the fun can be had anywhere.
 
A great place to go if you have to power out a project for a deadline or want a break from a long bike ride or run.
author: Mario G.

description:
Philz has ruined every other coffee shop in the city for me... this is the gold standard, people! My mom comes into town and this is ALWAYS her first stop. We are all hooked. 

However, they do need another cash register.
author: Mia T.

description:
I'm basically a tea drinker, on a limited budget, but I LOVE Philz Coffee.  
When I do splurge on a cup of coffee, it better be good!

Starbucks is across the street from my office, but it's worth walking the extra few blocks and paying a bit more for an exquisite cup of coffee from Philz.   I'm gradually tasting my way through all of them, current favorite is Tantalizing Turkish, which was a perfect after lunch brew -- like drinking dessert, it tasted so rich.

As good as the coffee might be, it's the staff that really distinguishes Philz;  I haven't been to the other locations, but on several visits to this Philz, I've felt welcomed by the very friendly baristas, who seemed to be genuinely enjoying their work.
author: Barbara B.

description:
I could give it an extra star for a good people watching time, everytime Ive been there. This is like seeing a blast from the past and every dotcom2.0 re-incarnated nerdy new building dweller creeps from around the area. 
Asides that,  no cream nor sugar Julie's it is for me and move over that the cushy sofa belongs to me baby!

BEANS: their own mixes, platonic names for them.. lovely
author: ninja M.

description:
Awesome cafe. Nice and cozy. Comfortable sofa (on which I can type away all day long). Got power plug. Got free wi-fi. What more can a tech geek want from a cafe?

Their mint tea has real mint leaves in it!
author: Ryo S.

description:
Update:
The more I come here, the more I love it. I love studying on their comfy couch in the morning on weekdays when it's not busy, having a silken splendor or istanbul treat with a piece of Baklava, and then get an oat cake for lunch. Um.....that's life. Oh, I have to mention the dog treats they sell there. They look so yummy that I want to get a dog and take it here everyday.

Why do I write another review for Philz? Because this place so awesome. Philz is awesome, but this PLACE is even beyond awesome. Why? THE COUCH!!!! If you are someone who goes straight to the couch booth whenever you step into a restaurant/cafe, here's your place. Comfortable couch, and many of them. I personally have never let down because they are all taken. In other words, you always get the couch if you want it. 

What to get? 
Philharmonia, Silken Splendor (personal favorite), Istanbul treat with honey and cream, AND a piece of Baklava. Best baklava in town besides twilight cafe. 

Dear Police officers, isn't it more important to do your jobs than park your cool car in the middle of the street and sit in Philz and chat forever? Well, I'm not complaining since you then give out less parking tickets.
author: Yuchi C.

description: Really good coffee. I had an Ether and it was really good. I'll try the #13 It'z The Best next time.
author: Gabriel S.

description: So since I wrote my review, I have had stellar service. It seems as soon as I got the system down people have been kind. Lily (manager , I guess) wrote me and made it better by offering two free drinks. I've been in almost everyday since.
author: Nicole M.

description: Tried their ambrosia coffee and it is the coffee of the gods!  Each cup is made to order and dripped temperately.  The staff is super friendly and helpful especially when you don't know much about coffee.  I described my perfect cup of coffee to the barista and she came back with exactly what I ordered which was a cup of heaven!   I love love love Philz Coffee and highly recommend it.
author: Super F.

description: All I can say is  best drip coffee ever. I am addicted to this stuff...
author: Mark S.

description:
Damnit! I wanted to be the first one to review. Oh wells.

OK so Philz finally opened.  I was starting to hate on the Philz coming soon sign. It was taunting me every morning as I walked my dog. I read reviews of the other location and really was dying to try it.

So this morning I went inside Philz and went straight for the Mocha Tesora. Make a good mocha and you got me as a customer.  I watch my dude ( i think it may have been Phil himself!) make my coffee.  First they grind the beans and then they put the coffee is some kind of seeper (not sure if that's what you really call it...i only have a plain mr.coffee at home) and pour in hot water.  I watched my seeper intently.  Mr Phil asked if this was my first time...I shyly said yes.

Phil: "Here you go...let me know what you think..."
Me (taking a sip) :"MMMMMMMMMMMMMM"

Lordy that was one sweet first sip! But I love me chocolate so I was sold.
author: Mary L.

description:
I love the fact that I can have a variety of different drip coffees (like, thirty) fresh by the cup, and they actually do all taste diffferent. I like that they put the cream and sugar for me (and they use a lot of sugar-good for me-, and heavy whipping cream to give it that thickness, although sometimes I would like to add my own sugar and that's apparently not an option). The coffee is brewed a cup at a time, somewhat like Blue Bottle, except Philz uses a filter with more holes so the coffee comes out faster. I also think it tastes less strong than Blue Bottle perhaps because the water doesn't sit in the grinds as long. If you ask, they will pour it through a couple more times for you though. Interestingly, this is how they make "espresso" at Philz; pour the water once and the coffee three more times. No thanks, if I want espresso I want espresso. Call me a traditionalist.
In short, I still prefer Peet's for the taste and strength of the brew, but Philz is closer to home, has waaaay nicer seating, and the variety is kicking! The crazy girls that work here are absolutely insane and high on caffeeine all the time, which makes for some really fun conversation. 
My one big complaint is the dessert selection. In all four times I have been here, the pastries all look like they fell off a truck two or three days ago then were put on a tray. I haven't tasted them and never will. PLEASE PLEASE if Phil is reading this...find a new caterer. Meanwhile, I'll bring in my own desserts from Whole Foods or Panera.
author: Johnny O.

description:
This place is for "real" coffee lovers who can appreciate the infinite varieties of exotic coffee beans with names like "Sooooo Good," "Anesthesia to the Upside" and "Dancing Water."

But I'm not a "real" coffee drinker and much prefer the watered down lattes at Starbucks. Philz is just too bitter for me even when I ordered the lightest kind they offer.

Also worth noting is the staff at the Berry Street location. How should I say this... They're pretty passionate about coffee... !
author: Tommy T.

description:
The coffee here is superb, no question.

I've now worked my way through most of the selection (22 varieties I think) and my favorites are:

Dancing Water
Philharmonic
Turkish with cardamon

However, there are a number of thing I'd love to see Phil improve at this outlet:

***Flies in the pastry cabinet***
I've often peeked in to eye up the pastries and I've seen tiny flies buzzing around.  To me, it's inexcusable - if you have flies you have a hygiene problem... you throw all the produce away, disinfect the cabinet and restock. = no flies, unless the flies are coming from source - in which case get a different supplier!  It's actually pretty gross.

***Their ice coffee sucks***
The downside of making 'one cup at a time' is that they don't really do a good ice coffee.  They seem to have a container at the back that they pour a cup off coffee into time-to-time to keep a small batch of cold/ice coffee, but it's not really very nice.  In the summer months I like a nice ice coffee and sadly for that I have to visit Peets.

***Erratic closing hours***
I guess this is San Fran-casual but they close at different times of the day which is very frustrating.  It seems to be based on what they feel like - there's no pattern I can tell (like staying open late on ball game nights, etc).  I can go down there at 7pm after work and they might be open, they might not.  It's a lottery, which I now tend to avoid out of disappointment and otherwise coffee abandonment with no other decent joints nearby.

***Location***
Don't get me wrong, **so glad** to have a good independent coffee shop in SoMa.  However the location is not great and it's a shame Philz didn't open up in one of the new units actually on King.  If I have to ride the CalTrain unless I'm like very early for the train it's just a little too far away to quickly grab a coffee a few minutes before the CalTrain pulls out (the lights across King and also across 4th take forever to change to let you cross, cos of the tram way).


So ok, there are a few bad points, but I gotta say this is the best coffee in Soma and so I can't give it anything less than 4/5 even with the bad stuff.

Oh and in addition to there being lots of WiFi around as previously noted, I'm pretty sure they have an "official" hotspot too.  Either way I've never had problems logging on, and power supplies are in abundance
author: Ben M.

description:
So I got into work early this morning and decided to get a cup of coffee. Instead of going to Starbucks I decided to venture out to this non-franchised joint, Philz Coffee. I walk up trying to read the menu, but not quite understanding all the java jargon. So I tell my barista "Could I just get a non fat Latte?" and he then asks, "With what kind of coffee?".

 They have listed on their walls about 30 different types of coffee beans you can choose from. He figured out right off the bat that I was a newb and decided to give me the #19 and he'd do it my way, a latte. 

 Everyone was extremely friendly. As he handed me my coffee he tells me "Next time, just say I want a #19, my way, and I'll know what you mean." 

I may have to say Sianara Starbucks.
author: Rana A.

description:
All you have to do is ask the baristas at Philz to make you something amazing.  They'll do it.  Philz is the most delicious coffee I've ever had.  Ever.  And my life's ambition is (in part) to find the best cup of coffee.  (Many coffee adventures ensue!)  I think they add fairy dust, because that's the only way I can think they get the magical properties they do in each cup.  They are the best coffee in the bay.  I can't say in the world because I haven't been around the world to try coffee (even though I understand from Wikipedia that in Japan McDonald's coffee is the best because they suffer through coffee in a can.  I can guarantee this is 20x better than coffee in a can.)  

The SOMA location has super-friendly baristas.  SUPER friendly.  If you don't want to have a conversation with the person making you amazing coffee, try the Mission location.  It's not that they're less friendly, they're just less talkative.  Say, you could read a book while you're waiting instead of having to have a conversation about the dog in the corner.  But, in the end, I prefer the SOMA location because of their big comfy chairs, the cute male baristas (one of whom knew what Powell's was!)
author: Margee B.

description:
Tasty, tasty coffee and friendly, friendly staff.

Sucks that I can't bring my dog here any more after those evil, evil health inspectors caused trouble...
author: Patrick C.

description: I love the coffee here. Hand-crafted, strong, good selection, and they even add spices to certain varieties.
author: Philip T.

description:
I love coffee.  Let me repeat, LOVE coffee.  I can taste the difference between an americano and a regular drip coffee.  And usually I prefer americanos; extracting coffee goodness via pressure tastes better.

I've had siphoned coffee, cold brewed coffee, french press...you name it, most likely I've had it.  So yeah, you could call me a coffee snob.

Philz may be a little confusing for the first timer - just tell them what you like (sweet, not sweet, strong, light, blah blah) and they'll recommend choices for you.

Fresh roasted beans, ground to order and dripped - with cream and sugar exactly the way you like it.  The coffee is at a perfect temperature, not too hot, not too lukewarm.

Perfection in a cup....only flaw is that it is a tad expensive for a cup of coffee, but as they are my little occasional treat, I view this splurge as well worth it.

Never stuck around the shop too long, I usually just grab my coffee and go back to work.  But the chairs look very comfortable, and everyone who works there is super friendly.
author: Mary M.

description:
Oh, my god! Coffee

Great people preparing amazing coffee. You cannot fail with that. I don't even bother to try the coffee before putting the lid. I know that they put the perfect amount of cream and honey. 

Try "Four Horses"
author: Javi V.

description: Ok so my first few experiences here were meh so so but since I've been going back and forth between there and the starbucks by my house, I realize how much I really like Philz coffee better. We also realized that we actually enjoy hanging out at this location. So big ups to this Philz and a bump in stars. "Yay! I'm a fan."
author: Hyung L.

description: I already reviewed Philz in Palo Alto so we already know I LOVE their coffee. I'm only writing this review to say that I have been working in this location for a few hours and not only is the vibe great but the staff is literally the happiest most joyful group of baristas I've ever had the pleasure of being around. I mean....I think they geuninly like their job! And thats so rare these days. A+ for this location!
author: Stacy L.

description:
If you want to treat yourself to a cup of coffee, go to Philz!

The selection(!!): My first time here - I walked into a plethora of coffee selections.  You can get over 20 different types of coffees!  Overwhelmed by choice, the guy behind the counter recommends something for me, after I provided him with my coffee preferences.  Each cup is individually brewed.  Delicious!!  Smooth, smooth coffee - just right.

Cost:  The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is because a large coffee was over $3!  This is not your everyday cup of joe - figuratively and literally.
author: Nutmeg Y.

description:
I'm a Starbucks junkie but I've been going to this Philz every so often since I live nearby. I don't quite get the hype, but even my unrefined coffee palate can tell that this stuff is richer than some watered down Starbucks. I usually order a Tesora or one of the lighter roasts, or a Mint Mojito if it's a warm day.

What I love the most here is their cheese croissant. It's buttery, flaky, and has warm melty cheese and herbs inside. Just be prepared to wait quite a while for them to toast it.
author: S L.

description:
I've been looking for a great cup of coffee since I got here. And I found it at Philz Coffee. It had the strong kick I was looking for without the bitter or burnt flavor (which a lot of the coffee shops here have). 

The only not-so-good thing I noticed was they served their coffee in paper cups. I prefer my coffee in mugs and I'm hoping they'll make the switch!

I didn't try the pastries though. The coffee was enough for me. Maybe I'll try it next time.
author: Jaclyn A.

description:
ecstatic iced or ether.

one cup at a time.  the way it should be.  my father is a coffee roaster so you'd think i know a thing or two about beans and good coffee.  even if i don't, it doesn't matter, because you will love philz.

if you're in the mood for something dark and eye awakening, do it ether. a casual coffee? ecstatic iced.  get it "lowfat" lest you get a mouthful of heavy cream.  though you might be in to that... hrm.

don't come here if you're in a rush.  starsucks is down the street if you want some brown water.  nice people here and they move about as fast as they can for making one cup at a time.  coffee like it's meant to be... enjoyed.
author: Steven C.

description:
Philz Coffee is flippin amazing.  The workers aren't only hip, knowledgeable and friendly, but are impressively trained at making a kick @ss cup of coffee.  I tried Philz for the first time this week, and have been back on three separate occasions - each time impressed.  
Overall: Great service, awesome coffee, good prices, and free wifi. Highly recommended.
author: Louis N.

description:
I just moved to San Francisco from Victoria, B.C. and one of my first priorities was great coffee.
My husband had already been here for a couple of weeks and was raving about this coffee shop that "hand squeezed" the coffee. I was a little skeptical as the shop was a block from our house and I thought he liked it out of convenience and gimmick, but I liked the coffee he had bought from Philz to brew at home so I went to check it out.
Well I can't say enough about this place! Not only did they not roll thier eyes at me for ordering an "americano", but they were so laid back and cool about my ignorance of how to order and casually informed me on choosing the right blend for me.
The coffee was fantastic, the best I have had so far....it easily blows away another so-called top coffee shop I was referred to, which had a similar brewing technique but the coffee tasted like dishwater and the place was full of pretentious hipsters! No thanks, I've found my flavor.
author: Nicole S.

description: Philz is a true neighborhood coffee place. Friendly service and great coffee. Love how they cool off the coffee before serving it to the customers - a bit of a show and incredibly practical. Try Tesora.
author: Kris M.

description:
Coffee made to order created by friendly staff.

A bit pricey but worth it...  no attitude just great coffee.

Greater food selection would have given it 5 start.
author: Max L.

description:
Damn...I can't give Philz 6 starz.

OK, so the first time I tried Phiz at the old 18th/Sanchez store was a month or so before it changed ownership and stopped being Philz. (sigh) But now I see by Yelp that Philz lives at at  new location - and the Folsom / 24th location is alive and well. 

All is right with the world. A smooth Arabic blend awaits!
author: masugu m.

description:
This is the best coffee I've ever had. I know a lot of people say Blue Bottle is better. They're mistaken. Get a Philharmonic (they grind Cardamom into it!) or a Jacob's Wunderbar. I know it's like $2.75 for a cup but it's so worth it.

We just need them to reopen in the Mission/Castro area.
author: Raj T.

description:
I live on the same block where Philz is, so I tried it couple of times and really tried to like it, as it will greatly increase the chance of me riding muni. 

Well, although I like hand-drip coffee, this is not my type of coffee.
And they really need to revamp their pastry selection.

Still, when I have friends visiting and if they ask me about Philz, I'd say 'it's pretty good. You should try it'
author: Angie Y.

description:
Philz is the that friend of yours who is the shiat but is modest about it.

I was falling head over heels for Blue Bottle until Philz brought me back to reality. Philz does coffee. Really well. 

The guy working behind the counter was more knowledgeable about coffee than any barista (baristo?) I have every interacted with. He knew his stuff and he wasn't pretentious about it.

It's impossible to not find a blend that isn't heaven on your taste buds. And if you're not a coffee person, their chai tea is also pretty good according to a friend.
author: Kelly S.

description: My love for Philz is strong and unbreakable and now I cannot drink any other coffee.  I made the mistake (or was it a mistake?!) of going to Philz every morning before work.. I thought I'd give my bank account a break so I went to Noahs and was totally let down. Matter of fact, my coworker saw me walking down the hall with my Noahs and he said he nearly slapped it out of my hands.  I've tried just about every dark roast on the menu except for Ether. I love the Jacob's Wonderbar!! Oh, Philz..
author: Ninette B.

description: The coffee here is ok.  The staff is not.  They seem unhappy or have an overinflated sense of who they are/what they do.  Their rudeness is more than enough to send me across the street to Starbucks for a Blonde brew served up with no personality, no rudeness.
author: Julie H.

description: Great coffee and we love their chocolate peanut butter giant cookie.
author: D D.

description:
3 starbucks, one creamery, one coffee place next to Farmer Brown's(330 ritch), one panera bread, and other coffee joints separate me from Philz. But I just walk on by. It's crack and the baristas are good fam. 

WMD right chere right chere!
author: John B.

description:
Forget Starbucks!! This is the place you wanna go to if you want great coffee...I tried their nectar of the gods..Ambrosia !! Fresh ground coffee never tasted any better!!
They have great seating outside as well as inside.
author: Amit G.

description:
This made my day. There's now a Philz by my work!!!

I went there this morning- the baristas were very nice- and of course, the coffee was....

 "the best cup of coffee in the whole damn city!"
author: sarah d.

description:
Philz is incredible. The counterpeople are very knowledgeable and very friendly. The coffee is beyond amazing and entirely worth the wait. If you're lucky, you'll show up on a day when Phil himself is around, and then he will school you on the world of coffee. There's a lot to learn.

I work in SOMA, and until Philz opened recently I rarely had an excuse to walk south past Brannan. Now, thanks to Philz, I'm making the trek regularly. You should do the same!
author: Lane B.

description:
Oh Ambrosia, where have you been all my life?  

Being one to always shun coffee from the "S" word place, I had been a Peete's devotee.  But I gotta tell you, Philz is fantastic.  The "one cup at a time" is exactly right- and none of this add your own moo and schweet- they do it for you.

I'm wired from the large cup this morning and still not ready for lunch- very kewl.  Can't wait to try the Turkish coffee other reviewers here have raved about.

Haven't had the pleasure of a cup made by Phil himself, but Cal does just fine on his own.  Very fine. I'll be back for certain.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Wow,
Much more my speed than Blue Bottle.  The people behind the counter were nice, the coffee is good, and, if I desire to sit down and enjoy my beverage, I can!  BB is probably better for the Hayes valley hipsters, who don't really have the time or inclination to actually enjoy anything (I'm kidding...flame-throwers off) but for the 40-something B&T crowd coming in to the city (their Berry St. store is right off the 4th St exit for 280) it is fantastic.  Plus its a block from the office.

My only complaint is, thanks to Ed U. I can't get that damn ONJ song out of now over-caffeinated brain (I probably shouldn't have gotten the large coffee).  Ah for the pre-wardrobe malfunction, pre-MTV train wreck days.  Not that I'm a big ONJ fan, but at least you could at least hear her real voice since it wasn't all computer-processed up.
author: Mike B.

description:
After searching for three years, two months, and twenty-nine days, I have a found a coffee on par with that of the Mudhouse in Springfield, Missouri: Philz' Coffee on Berry.

You must go.

You MUST go.

It ain't the ambiance...they decorate the place like a Santa Cruz coffee shop or a Pottery Barn. It's the coffee. You must taste the coffee.

For, I tell you, all God's little children, they make each cup fresh as you order. That, and they have about fifty flavors of coffee. And they add the cream and sugar if you want it. And a mint leaf on top. And I am babbling and I DON'T CARE...I haven't been this in love in a while.

That, and next door to the library and two doors down from the willow trees. So I am pretty much sold.

So smooth, so rich, so well-brewed...God loves me today.
author: Jo S.

description:
Best coffee around period; also the most expensive cup around (3.75 for a large).  Guess you get what you pay for.  

Love the Turkish or Silken Splendor - free wifi, live jazz music on Friday nights, cool people, dog friendly.
author: Brian K.

description:
To my joy, there is a Philz Coffee near the Caltrains station, YES!
I just discovered that in 12/07, much to my joy :-)

They are open before 7am, so it makes for a perfect stop for me first thing in the AM after I get off Caltrains, before I hop on MUNI downtown.

Always with a smile and welcoming greeting, even at 6:45am.  Much appreciated.  

Good strong coffee that is fresh and hand crafted.  I'd rather give Philz my $3 than Starbucks.
author: Yelper H.

description:
Love the place! Can't get enough!

I hardly go into the city but when I do, I go to Philz. Great friendly and informative service and superb coffee!
author: Rebecca J.

description:
I missed Caltrain on a Sunday. This meant I wasn't going anywhere for an hour. I started wandering around the new, unfamiliar face of SOMA/Mission Bay. I wasn't in the mood for Starbucks even though their new Skinny Vanilla Latte is half decent. 

I stumbled across Philz after rejecting the idea of Panera too.  I walked into Philz and the extremely friendly staff noticed my confused look. The menu is extensive and vague. The woman behind the counter asked me some questions to figure out what I liked: light, medium, bold; sweet or savory; cream and sugar; etc. I told her to make whatever she thinks is good. She quickly recommended the Philharmonic.

When she handed it to me I was surprised to see mint leaves on top of my coffee. Mojitos maybe, but coffee? Weird. It was really good! The mint was a perfect addition. The coffee was served at a perfect temperature. Not super hot but still hot.

I finished the cup in about twenty minutes. Ten minutes later I became dizzy, nauseous, and jittery. I normally have four scoops of grounds in my morning coffee, but this one large cup absolutely destroyed me. It was the exact opposite of taking four shots of Grey Goose. I felt awful for about an hour.

It was delicious but be warned: their stuff is STRONG.
author: David K.

description:
Not a place to grab a quick cup and run.  The coffee is brewed individually.  I'm usually take my coffee with nothing added, but the "Ether" brew with cream/sugar is a hearty, rich cup that almost seems like a mocha, instead.  My wife ordered mine with a sprig of mint, which was a nice touch - after I gagged because I thought there was an uninvited guest in my cup.

Parking is challenging, especially if the Giants are playing.
author: Collin W.

description:
A cosy place, but I find it a little pricey for the quality. I guess the cool location has a price...
The couches are so comfy. Great napping spot !
author: Fred M.

description:
Philz has ruined me.  I can no longer drink Blue Bottle, Peets or that nasty stuff at Starbucks.  

Thanks, Philz for making the most amazing iced coffee in the world. If I only you opened earlier in the morning for those of us working east coast hours!
author: Stacy N.

description: There's no venti, soy mochachinos at Philz. That's vocabulary you need to take elsewhere. Because Phil'z is a one of-a-kind SF fav that just serves  coffees and teas. Mint Mojito iced coffee? Yes please! Philz is the best spot in South Beach hands down.
author: Alex H.

description: Philz rules my face.  Bottom line.  The best coffee I've ever had by miles and miles.  A nicer and more polished vibe here vs. the original shop in the Mission, but the coffee tastes just as awesome.  Looooove Philz.
author: Sean H.

description: I haven't wrote a review in a while but after stopping here was all the inspiration I needed I remember hearing this place was good and  probably would have never of came but i happened to be walking my dog by and thought i try it out very good each cup is carefully made with love the lady behind the counter ask me to try it and tell if it was okay (the amount of cream and sugar) and well lets just say ill be walking my dog by here more often.
author: Nader F.

description:
My first experience at Philz in the mission (24th st.) was not all that great, but the new one on Berry has a nice ambiance and serves up some of the best coffee in SF. 
My first visit to Philz I ordered the Philharmonic, which I gathered was a signature coffee with cardamom added. I thought it was pretty nasty though. I am a bit of a coffee purist (no sugar, no milk) and the additional cardamom definitely crossed that line. I didn't go back for awhile after that, but after returning and ordering a more normal coffee, I finally appreciate their coffee genius. A bit expensive, so I don't go there everyday, but it is definitely a treat!
author: Peter M.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco, I found a place on the corner of 24th & Shotwell.  My first Friday night there I didn't really know anyone, was pretty tired from moving my stuff, and just trying to get settled.  I walked down the street for a burrito and on the way back saw this place on the corner of 24th & Folsom.  Feeling like I could use a pick-me-up I went in and thought I'd landed in some hippy loft in old SoHo.  That cup of coffee (a mocha tesora btw) turned my night around.

Two years later Philz is still my favorite coffee stop in the bay area.  They make each cup turkish-style, and have what seems like innumerable different blends for you to try.   I ship their beans to friends all over the country who can't get enough of it.  When they visit, within the first hour inevitably comes the question "So... when are we going to Philz?" .  When I lived on the other side of the bay, I used to bring my laptop in the mornings before work and knock out a 1/2 days work in an hour. 

Great atmosphere, better coffee, free wi-fi.  A slam dunk.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Philz has changed the way I think about coffee.

You think I'm kidding?

I'm dead serious.  I now judge every other coffee establishment by a new standard.  And some of these places, frankly... I know they can *legally* call their products "coffee", but why bother?  Now that I've had Philz, everything else is just hot, brown, flavored water.

Their pastry selection could be stronger; however, as long as they keep stocking the Cinna-minis and Ginger Spice Cookies, I'll be happy.

They even have dog treats behind the counter for the many fine neighborhood folks who bring their pups in.

Oh: And my personal fave is the Arabic dark roast, with a pinch of cream and sugar.  Mmm...
author: Erik R.

description:
the selections of coffees and teas are extensive and very good. my boyfriend loved the coffee and i liked the mint tea. the only thing that we didn't like was the lid - such good beverages were always in danger of spills because of this terrible thing. 

the decor looks like a nice typical cafe - clean, modern, and lots of natural lights. a great place for a relax time.

the staff is always friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable. 

phil - if you are reading, please do everyone a favor and change the lids.
author: huong n.

description:
Maybe I'm a bit of a purist, but I like my coffee fresh (ie. brewed single cup within 72 hours of roasting) and free of distraction, black. Granted I am in the minority, but the greats can offer this. Granted Philz is producing amazing roasts far superior to what I am capable of in my kitchen and serving single cup brew, but most of what was being served when I walked in was a week to two weeks old; and why on earth are they recommending using their secret sauce concoction of a cream substitute in the coffee? They wouldn't tell me what was in the secret sauce, but insisted it was special. Without going "there," I say No Gracias.

Overall, Philz is heads above the majors (eg. Starbucks, Peets, Seattle's Best, Tullys) in freshness, brew method, and complexity of cup. I will definitely go back if not provided with the best-of-best alternatives.
author: Patrick C.

description: I have had many wonderful cups of coffee at the Philz on 24th. Today I gave the Philz on 4th a try for the first time. My coffee was barely warmer than room temperature. I'm sure it was a fluke, but for $3.50 they can make sure my coffee is actually hot.
author: Julia G.

description: I finally figured out what ordering from Phil is like... it's like ordering from the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld!  Man, is it worth it!
author: amy g.

description: I like this place. It's as simple as that. There isn't enough tea offered, but it is a coffee place so that's not a valid complaint! What is nice is that they are very friendly and you can talk to the baristas to give you the kind of coffee you really enjoy. Reading the description of coffees isn't as helpful as just talking to a person. That said, I think some people won't like that. You have to tell the employee how much milk (or cream) to put instead of just doing it yourself. It's sort of like going back to the "full serve" gas pumps of yesteryear. Overall, great place!
author: B C.

description:
I had heard so many good things about philz, and they turned out to be true.  I was in there just last night and met Jacob (Philz son).  I tasted two excellent coffees, I look forward to going back again and again and again.

Sure the coffee is a bit pricey, but the friendly baristas, excellent hand crafted cofee and warm cozy atmosphere make it well worth it.

no espresso, but who needs it with a coffee selection like this?
author: Luke G.

description:
Why can't I give it 4.5 stars?

One of the best places to get coffee in the City. 

Come by...support...enjoy your coffee...
author: Ricky P.

description:
I got a large cup of Tesora today at around 10 am.  I drank about half and it is almost 10 pm and I am still shaking.  I am a caffeine lightweight, but this is some seriously strong stuff.  I know caffeine is considered a drug and I now know why.  

This was seriously good though.  I was a little worried when he said that he puts the cream and sugar in, but he did it perfectly.  I wanted to down the whole cup so bad, but when I couldn't get it up to my lips without shaking it onto my shirt, I knew I had had enough.
author: Colin D.

description: Personalized service - individual cup of coffee made to order. Jacob's brew - Yum.  The coffee folks here at Philz are quite helpful and knowledgeable. A sip of fresh air.. Coffee service here reminds me of NY - as they add the sugar/cream for u.
author: Johnson H.

description: Obviously the coffee is amazing so I feel the need to mention that the Chocolate Ginger Cookie and the Spinach Feta pastries are amazing (Please bring back the Chocolate Ginger cookie! I haven't seen it for a few visits!!) I swear by Julie's Ultimate...so yummy with such a depth of flavor it tells a story in your mouth :)
author: Jessica H.

description: Just wanted to add that the woman with the longish dark hair is also great.  I ordered a low-fat Silken Splendor with milk and sugar and it was fantastic.  Also, the guy I referenced in my previous review got a haircut.  The "bushy" no longer applies.
author: seema s.

description: Philz saved my morning... really woke me up after a sleepless night! Still a huge fan :)
author: Seema M.

description:
I had a genetic profile done recently. As a descendant of Europeans, I have a gene marker for being a fast caffeine metabolizer. This may explain why I like the coffee at Philz so much. :) It's single cup drip coffee in all cases. There's a tremendous range of blends with knowledgeable staff to help you choose one that's right. If you don't like it they'll make you something else (no extra charge). This is service a man could get used to.

I also love the idea of, and supporting local business. Too many things come from a bland corporate experience. If I want the McDonalds of coffee I will go up the street to Starbucks (there's 2 on the same block in King St, WTF). Philz is never bland. 

Extra plus for the final 5th star (my first!). Wireless, and fedoras. And sometimes Phil. Go there.
author: Nick W.

description: It's no 24th street Philz but if you close your eyes your mouth will think so.
author: Constance C.

description:
Famous drinks by hand
Suspect heavy cream, but still..
Will be back for sure
author: Scott S.

description:
Coffee is IN.CRED.I.BLE. 

If you're looking to try something new that tastes drastically different than overprocessed and cliche Starbucks fare, head to Philz. But beware, because the coffee is super strong! 

Atmosphere isn't wonderful inside... they generally leave both doors wide open, so there are sometimes flies. Yucky. It's more of a place where you stay for a few minutes and then leave rather than really do any work there or hang out for hours (although I have seen others doing things like that). 

Service is a crapshoot. Twice I went there, and was helped by a friendly guy eager to teach me about the different types of coffee and make recommendations. Last time, we had some fairly indifferent people who were all business and just wanted us to order as quickly as possible. And no, it wasn't based on them being busy- we were the only people in there the last time we went!!!

So maybe it's not the homey place were everyone knows your name. But the coffee is incredible, decently priced, and full of new and exciting flavors (cheesy as that sounds). 

Get it "to go", and prepare to be amazed.
author: Angie B.

description: Ok. Best coffee I have had in SF.  I have been to ritual and blue bottle and all the others...but for some reason this place is the best.  I think it is all the choices, the individual drip brewing of each cup of coffee.  Not a place to go to if you are in a rush, but if you want an insanely good cup of straight up coffee this is the place.  Decent snacks...try the sambosas...like samosas I guess...a little spicy.  Wifi, books and newspapers, not super cozy, but nice enough.
author: Steve P.

description: I recently started working 3 blocks from this Philz.  The coffee is fantastic, the employees are super-nice, totally focused on great service.  Perfect combo.  I was fed up with the attitude of the employees of another coffee place (rhymes with Steamery), so walked to Philz - at first, I was overwhelmed (a little intimidated) by the menu, but the barista took me in and walked me through the entire process.  And then asked me to sip my cup to make sure she got the brew just right - she did.  I love the place.  Great coffee, great service.  Will become a regular here I'm sure.
author: Sean F.

description:
5 Stars for the coffee! - Literally the best cup you will ever have, made one cup at a time with tons of options to choose from.

Minus 2 stars for the pretentious uppity attitude of the staff, They swear like they're curing cancer or something and you are bothering them by even being in their space. 

I go here sparingly even though it's on my way to the train station because I feel like I'm a bother by even being in there. So while the coffee is far superior at Philz, I usually choose Starbucks for the service.
author: Brian S.

description: I had the Manhattan blend.  It was tasty. A little pricey for a coffee, but a good deal on a Manhattan.  Except this Manhattan gave me a boost on office productivity, while the other Manhattan will give me a boost on pointless conversations.
author: Floyd F.

description: WTF...I asked for French Press grinds and when i get to my office I almost choke because the grinds were too fine.  I called to ask if they could replace what I bought and they said that "Philz French press grinds are finer than anyone elses, soooo....I guess its useless to return them?????? "....
author: Giants F.

description:
Sat in here and worked a whole afternoon. 
Good atmosphere. 
Gave it 4 stars because the WiFi didn't work. 

Try the mint iced tea, very very good.
author: Jacob E.

description:
so i learned san francisco is known for their brewed coffee and seattle is for their espresso. i didn't think i could be a fan of brewed coffee but i'm in love!

there are so many choices of coffee depending on the roast: medium roast, light roast, decaf. they provide a description of each coffee to help. i was a little overwhelmed and just had the barista choose my stuff. the baristas are like bartenders, making your cup of coffee one cup at a time, adding your sugar and cream on how you want it and with their expertise. 

they also make a wonderful chai if you are not into coffee.
author: Chanda I.

description:
I've been enjoying Phiz Coffee since my first visit there - and every trip back has been a treat! Coffee is presented as a personalized experience for the Customer; you get to watch YOUR cup being made, chat with the friendly folks behind the counter, maybe learn a little something, all in an atmosphere that's easy-going and non-pretentious.
Thankz, Phil!
author: Lou B.

description:
HOLY SH!+!  This has got to be the best tasting coffee I have ever experienced! I love iced coffees and here, they serve it with a couple of mint leaves, and a dash of cream and sugar...it tastes like an exquisite coffee drink, but its their version of an iced coffee. As other reviews state, they make each cup to order so its totally worth the 3min wait! A large is rather small BUT it is equivalent to 7 cups of regular coffee! Their service is great too! 

I love you philz!!
author: Kelly K.

description: Most AMAZING cup of coffee I have ever had.  So much care put into brewing one little cup by their friendly staff.  I'm a Phillz fan!
author: Yun W.

description: In a world of cookie cutter mass garbage coffee like Starbucks on every corner it is nice to visit a place where the staff actually cares about the quality of the cup of coffee they serve you.  The fact that they serve a cup at a time ground and dripped individually then gently blend cream and/or sugar as desired is a good start.  Add in the large variety of roasts and you are bound to find the perfect cup for your taste.  And if you don't like it they will make you another.  The best in San Francisco, hands down.
author: David R.

description:
Before I moved to San Francisco and began graduate school, I was not a regular coffee-drinker. Now, a year-and-a-half into my program, I need at least a giant cup to start the day, and maybe a cup or two in the afternoon. I may have to get an IV drip by the time I graduate.
 
The thing is, as I've noted in other reviews, I don't actually appreciate the taste of coffee very much, and usually cover it up with lots of sugar and milk. That is why, when I heard from someone in the lab that a Philz had opened up nearby, and that their $3 coffee was worth the price, I scoffed. The shitty coffee in the bookstore downstairs is only $1.25, I thought to myself. But I was up for a walk and a change of scenery, so I figured I'd give it a try. And damn if the house coffee wasn't the best cup of coffee I've ever had, and perfectly complemented by the mint sprig on top.  Very enthusiastically served by Phil's daughter, too. How did I know she was his daughter? Because she unsuccessfully attempted to wake the man in the fedora, who was sound asleep on the comfy leather couch, by yelling, "Hey Dad! Dad! Phil!" when a customer wanted to talk to him. Apparently opening a new store really took it out of poor old Phil. 

I have a feeling that I'll be inevitably drawn back here until I've tried every single one of the coffee varieties. The only question is whether that will occur before I complete my thesis. Hah--who am I kidding? I've got years of Philz coffee-drinking ahead of me.
author: Rachel J.

description:
i'd never seen crema (the foam that sits atop expresso) in a cup of coffee until i went to philz.  smoof coffee here.

i'd write more, but i'm feeling a little nauseous from all the caffeine.  and i only drank half a cup.  they should limit employee intake here - the last guy who helped me was bouncing off the walls!
author: Josie M.

description: Don't hate me because I am one of the rare people that likes Starbucks here in CA. But my eyes have been opened to the vast realm of coffee outside of Starbucks. Thank you Philz! We stumbled on this place en route to the library with some friends and they were raving about it. I was amazed at how many roasts and types of coffee they had. I got the Tesora which was done to perfection! It was so good... I cant bring myself to go back to the Starbucks now.
author: Pooja S.

description:
although $3.00 for a cup of coffee is pretty steep, watching them pour  and mix the flowing coffee between cups make it worth the while. =)

the coffee here is AMAZING, as well as the teas, mochas, and cupcakes.  YUM!  my fave is the "jacobs soul" - a hearty mix of dark chocolate flavors and hazelnut beans.  PLUS, they always put in just the right amount of sugar and cream.

the only problem with this location is the lack of parking, and the constant rush of people getting their java flow...

but overall, i raise my coffee cup for  phillz!!
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I remember the first time I ever tasted coffee- It was so bitter and repugnant that the only choice was to regurgitate it back!  I would not   try coffee ever again- even through late nights of studying in college or even to appease a night of drinking.  
Little did I know that coffee would someday be a factor into social status a means to show one's income and personal growth.
As a check to check worker- putting in time for on call hours at the hospital- was how you earned your merit, your badge of honor - it entailed going in at 2, 3 4 am and working through the afternoon shift!
I was 'lucky' enough to live near one of those ostentatiously fluorescent  coffee shops where the donuts were as big as your head- this kind of coffee was just that passive stimulant to get you  through the day...
A few years into work- and starbucks coffee has become a twice a day habit-- and seems like everybody's liking it...frappuccino this machiatto that...why not add SBUX to the portfolio please.  It became a requirement that starbucks be the choice of beverage from pharm reps & med reps... I felt like I was on my way....
Then I read about the hostile take overs, of the company's unfair trade practices...I looked for something more- something that will suit my conscience as well as my now enslaved palate.
This was when I found Philz Coffee.  Coffee that is from the heart- a passion to make the best cup of coffee possible.  With the help of his son, they've assembled an array of blends that will cater to your taste! 
Coffee should be brewed fresh- not stored in a vat and pumped out in a hurry.   It should be chosen- and discussed- much like talking with a friend about a menu. Stand by close to your coffee attendant- as she/he grinds your choice and gingerly pours hot water over the granulated beans,  washing all that oil and fragrant ambrosia, funneled into ONE cup- YOUR cup.  
Service of this quality is seldom heard of- especially in this business- when one rarely thinks about the preparation or the thought behind all of it.  I am able to appreciate that now.
A cup o' joe is now a cup o' philz...

PS- They'll even add cream and sugar for you ;-)
author: Arissa C.

description: I tried Jacob's and it was the YUMMIEST coffee I have ever had in my whole life. Can't wait to go back there for a new flavor!
author: Jelly G.

description: One cup at a time is what they do. I am more of yummy white mocha or steamed cider girl, but they make some great tea and their coffee and service is excellent. They always remember you ( that's probably because we've become somewhat of regulars) and they are good at what they do. There are always little samples of their goodies for you to try and I love their little maple donuts. Just enough. The location is nice there are alot of comfy couches and chairs to sit and enjoy your coffee in.
author: danae k.

description: yeah, it's overwhelming...but in a good way.  these guys also know their coffee.  with the sheer number of options that philz provides, i'll be coming back more often to give it a try....the couches are really comfortable too.  if you're more of a casual coffee drinker like i am, who loves his typical options of just a "vanille latte" or something, come here prepared to read, or at least ask for recommendations.  i had the ambrosia and my barista sold it perfectly: good for new people and it's very smooth.  right on the money!
author: Jeff N.

description: I like the coffee selection, but I every time I ask for "not-much cream," and every time I get off-white coffee. This time they even threw in some unrequested sugar. After 4 times, I've learned my lesson.
author: bill l.

description: Philz has become one of my favorite coffee shops EVER. Thank you Groupon for introducing Philz to us. There are a variety of bean choices and brewed at your like. The service has been great and the baristas really care about the quality. On top of good coffee, the pastries are also very delicious. Give the scones a try and I guarantee you'll love it!
author: Yi-Bing Z.

description: Philz has the best coffee I have ever had. The many varieties of beans (mild, medium, strong, and both decaf and caffeinated) will suit even the most sensitive taste buds. The baristas at Philz individually make each cup of coffee ordered, freshly brewing it as you wait. While the long can sometimes get long at busy points in the day, it is well worth the wait. It's also nice that Philz sells snacks and pastries to accompany their delicious and gourmet coffee (and not just typical Starbucks-esque cuisine...delicious muffins, breakfast burritos, and puff pastries, etc.). Overall, getting coffee at any of the Philz locations is a MUST for anyone living or visiting San Francisco/the Bay Area!
author: Maggie C.

description:
wow.  while normally i dont love coffee.  but this would convert me to loving coffee.

being someone who doesn't love coffee, nor is addicted to it (quite yet), i think this is tops.  while in my previous life (before 5pm today) i couldn't taste the difference between different flavors of coffee . . . 

all i know is, i used to be blind, but now i can see.
author: Jason J.

description: Upscale hipster Philz, but I won't hold it against them. Coffee superb as always, but Wi-Fi was hinky so no 5 from me today.
author: Bruce R.

description: This is a pretty cool place to go if you like to see hobos making poo behind the counter.
author: Colleen B.

description: I went to Philz Coffee today and i had a mocha but i wasnt that impressed with it.. i drove all the way there from burlingame (SFO area) because I wanted to try it and was craving for coffee but in my opinion.. blue coffee company is much better in taste and always more crowded then Philz coffee..
author: Elina A.

description: Loved it! The coffee was rich and dark, not to mention brewed when I ordered it. I like to drink my coffee black and always end up with so-so taste because it's been sitting there forever! This was a perfect cup and wish I lived closer to one. I'd blow all my money on another perfect cup of coffee.
author: Ashley H.

description: Prior to going here I went to Starbucks out of convenience (since they're on every damn corner), but am now a die-hard Philz fan.  They're totally easy going (possibly bordering on disorderly unfortunately) but the end product is still amazing.
author: Matt S.

description: My morning doesn't start off right with my Philz "sooo good" or "canopy" coffee. I was introduced to Philz through a friend and I was blown away. They brew everything cup by cup so it's always especially made just for me! It's a litle pricey compared to other coffee places, but it's sooooo good.
author: Lindsay A.

description: 5 stars because they let my needy dog Spammy come on inside to hangout while I waited for my delicious drip coffee.  Another 5 stars because they add fresh mint to the coffee.
author: Jen C.

description:
been here a few times as it's the coffee shop we hit up when we need a longer escape from the office. famous for it's "one cup at a time" method, philz has some pretty good coffee. actually, it's the people behind the counter we walk four blacks for almost everyday. they make the whole event worth it. 

so, about that "one cup at a time" thing.. i like to add my own sugar and stuff. not because i have to do it myself, but because i am very self-conscious about how much processed sugar i put into my drinks - usually so much that my family oh-so-lovingly asks me (thinking it's funny each time they ask), "hey! you want some tea with that sugar!?" bastards gave me a complex. so, when the nice girls behind the counter ask me, "sugar? cream?" i say "yeah" in a totally convincingly nonchalant manner that belies my desire to just fucking fill the whole cup with sugar. but then those damn mint leaves save the day.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Having just moved into the city, I'd been seeking a replacement for my beloved Lux (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lux-coffeebar-phoenix) when a co-worker took me to Philz and *wow*!  I was expecting just another espresso place, but at Philz they make you an individual drip brew with freshly ground beans.  My first experience was the incredibly tasty Mocha Tesora and since then I've tried several other varieties which have all been excellent.  It is really hard to drink coffee anywhere else!
author: Will A.

description: I do love a good cup of coffee and that is what I got here.  The staff was very welcoming, offered an explanation to ease 'the first time' experience and then it was a seat on the comfy sofa with a good book and half hour of people watching.  NICE... A pleasant change after the frenzy at Blue Bottle on Mint.
author: Ash A.

description: soooo good coffee is delicious, but my sister's right, it is decadent and can be too much. really good.
author: Margaret Y.

description: I visited several of the Philz locations and I think their coffee is alright...  I sometimes get a bag of the Tesora to brew at home and I feel like the coffee roasting is inconsistent.  Sometimes, it's good--just like the baristas make it.  And other times, it tastes really burnt--like there are too many burnt beans in this particular blend.
author: Trinh N.

description: man i love phillz coffee. i have yet to taste a cup better than coffee from here. great service too. they are very fast, especially for slow drip coffee
author: Cameron M.

description:
please get some vents installed in this place!!

phils is wickid and we all know this, but this phils doesn't have a ventilation system in it for some reason. you'll stand for just 5 minutes and your clothes will stink like cigarettes and coffee breath for 2 days...i guarantee this...go try it if you don't believe me. super shame.

and don't sit-down on the seats...those are brutal too!!!
author: Razmig M.

description: Let's put it this way:  Philz has me leaving the house 10 minutes ealier in the morning and paying twice as much a day for coffee.
author: Bailey S.

description:
I decided to try this place again, and I am so glad I did. I went at a completely different time of day, and the incredibly rude barista was nowhere in sight. Instead there was a really friendly guy who discussed brewing and tasting coffee (and beer) with us, while brewing our coffee and and, since there were no customers coming in, continued to have a nice conversation with us about a number of things. 
Most important, though, is the coffee. This time, when I asked for soy milk, this guy offered me a choice of regular or vanilla. Clearly it's not a policy of Philz to discourage the use of soy milk, just a weird passion of that one rude barista girl. (In fact, after I asked for soy milk, both of the employees there at the time started talking with us about when they preferred soy and when they preferred dairy.) And then the coffee--Tantalizing Turkish--was as excellent as I could have hoped for. Thor got the mocha and was equally impressed. 
We will definitely go back, if it is late afternoon to evening time. Any earlier, though, and I think we'll pass just in case.
author: Rachel G.

description: Excellent coffee and one of the best kept secrets in the coffee world. I rarely can tell a different between one type of coffee or the other, but when you try Philz, you know right away it's no ordinary coffee. My favorite is Arabic and Filtered Soul flavors.
author: Arkady I.

description: Can't believe anyone would give this place less then five stars. Come on, you high maintenance types!....seriously! 3 stars because they asked you to taste the coffee to make sure it was to your liking.?..because that made you felt "on the spot?" Ok, aside from my rant, let me just say that the coffee is amazing and the staff always super friendly. If you think about it, it's not too expensive considering what people spend on various lattes, fmochas, rappuccinos, etc.
author: Dan E.

description: I couldn't have been more delighted that this coffee lovers haven has moved into SoMA.  Philz has hundreds of different coffee beans and combinations from your light to dark preference.  It is fantastic to finally find a coffee place that actually brews your coffee when you arrive, rather than having a pot of coffee burning and turning gross on the back burner.  Thank you Phil for having the best coffee in San Francisco!
author: Alena G.

description: Really good coffee but one star off for lack of consistency.  The coffee turns out differently in the hands of the different "baristas".  When the owner's son makes the coffees, they are truly amazing - the iced ecstatic coffee is cold, creamy and smooth.  In less skilled hands, the iced coffee is watery and lukewarm with half-melted ice cubes. They all need to reach the same level of coffee making to merit 5 stars.
author: Anna S.

description: Great coffee, but kind of expensive for what you get.  Also, be warned that it can take a long time to get your coffee.  I recommend the turkish, the mocha, and on that rare, warm SF day, the mint mojito.
author: Ian M.

description: Great turkish coffee and super friendly baristas.
author: Shane V.

description:
I guess it depends on your caffeine tolerance. A cup of Philz coffee gives me headache, heart palpitation and trouble sleeping several hours later.

The coffee tastes great though. I just can't handle it.

Also not a big fan of mint leaves in coffee and paper cups.
author: Eugene O.

description: Philz - how I love thee.  Although it make take a bit longer to get your coffee, it's totally worth the wait.  I love that I live right next to Philz and that it's so convenient.  The baristas there are so friendly and they really care about your coffee.  I also love buying their coffee and giving them as gifts. The grind smells soooo good!  You should also try their breakfast burritos and baked goods.  So yummy!
author: Annie T.

description: My heart sunk a little when I saw the menu. "How many different drinks to they have?!" I said to myself? "Just what is an "Ether"? Air and coffee? Ugh." But then my wife alerted me to the menu legend and all was right with the world. There was nothing difficult about ordering: the descriptions of the coffee was so clear and precise. A very fine cup of coffee.
author: Ross G.

description: Wow! This has got to be the best coffee I've ever had!  It's made fresh, one cup at a time.  I've only had the Tesora, with cream and sugar, and they made it just right!  Even after my coffee got cold, it still tasted good!  It beats all those other coffee places hands down.
author: Fran H.

description: Peets is great coffee.  I love Peets but sometimes I treat myself to some Philz coffee.  Awesome coffee!
author: David M.

description:
rating the coffee alone, i m just speechless. so much aroma and a much bolder taste in  a cup of coffee... the personalized feeling also brings out the difference in this coffee shop. but i don't feel like it has been fully established just yet. the layout of the shop is a little bit messy at times, they have things all over the place, and the seats and tables are not cleaned up regularly. But apart from that...a GREAT cup of coffee!
Try: Tesora, Sooo Good,...
author: Sarah O.

description: Philz has the best coffee I've ever had and the staff is always smiling and helpful.  However, I have to mark them down a star because of the decor.  There are better places to sit and sip your coffee.  Of course the coffee won't be as good but that's your choice.  Also, to get great coffee you have to pay the price.  At $2.75  for a cup of regular coffee you probably don't want to go there more than once a day.
author: Garrett D.

description: I LOVE PHILZ COFFEE. I love the friendly people that work there and I love the incredible delicous buzz I get from drinking that creamy sweet madness that they serve. I get the Philharmonic or the  Philtered Soul. I just love that little mint leaf that floats in there making the whole thing taste special. I don't like the decor at all but no stars off because the coffee makes up for bad decor in a big big way. Thanks team of nice people at Philz. Especially flirty Jacob, Phil's son, you can't help but leave with a smile with all the attention that guy throws your way. Sigh.
author: Val G.

description:
this is the best cup of coffee i have ever had.  it will make you wonder if there is a god and how he/she could create something so tasty. i've never seen single cup brewing like this before and i have to admit that it makes a great cup of coffee.  complex, with many layers of carmelly goodness, it's just what you need before hunkering down in the library next door.

seriously, try this coffee.
author: Corey F.

description:
we FINALLY made it here & we FINALLY tried 'em!!!!!   

let me start with the AMAZING SERVICE -- never experienced this level of customer service in a cafe.  .........as soon as we walked through the door, my hub & i were immediately welcomed by warm & friendly service by  the man behind the counter.   my hub found out that this man was actually phil's son, jacob!!!  good man who really knows his coffee!!! he not only cares &  takes pride in their coffee but REALLY takes care of their customers!!!!
