moving on to the AMAZING COFFEE!!! jacob asked us what type of coffee we typically drink.   my hub loves the really strong stuff -- dark french roast, so jacob promised to make him the BEST coffee -- don't remember the name but it was #4........my hub agreed, he definitely loved philz drip coffee way more than blue bottle!!!!   jacob looked at me & knew i wasn't a coffee drinker, but a sweet mocha drinker  & made me an AMAZING cup of mocha!!!    

great spot (except parking sucks).   nice, mellow &  chill at that time -- early weekday afternoon.  great place to read, surf the web, hang with friends, possibly do work (definitely at the time we went, but not sure how it is in the morning & late afternoon).............

can't wait to go back!!!  want to try the sesame cookie that my friend told me about, they were out that day.  definitely can't wait to check out the original 24th st. location with the mission vibe.  

will be back soon!!!!!
author: Cindi N.

description: The last past few days I was hit over the head with a club, beaten down and dragged to Starbucks for coffee by my catering manager. I knew what I was getting myself into as soon as I was getting into line @ starbucks. Weaker coffee then del a hoya in his prime. It should be called dancing bitter water. This is the stuff that is made from the gods and puts hair on our chest and back - unfortunatley. If you have the patience to have someone skillfully to make your coffee and accept what REAL good coffee is. Walk in and be patience for a quality beverage. I can't wait for Sunday morning!
author: Bronson M.

description: I loved it! You get to choose your beans and they make a cup of coffee for you, FRESH. Soooooooooooooooo far from the Dunkin I'm used to in Beantown...
author: Flora B.

description: HOLY MOTHER OF GOD if you like your coffee stronger than Schwarzenegger in his hot days this place is for you.
author: Cheryl J.

description: I'm all for high octane, handmade coffee, but I have to say that the wait is often longer than even handmade coffee should require. And with occasionally rough counter attitude.
author: Caterina F.

description: Simply love Philz.  On a lazy Sunday morning we go walking to Dolores Park and then up to Philz for some "Anaesthesia to the Upside" blend.  Also, the barristas are warm, friendly, and down-to-earth.
author: karl m.

description: I have to say I recently have been making the trek from NB to SOMA in order to fill my fix for Philz coffee and the trek is well worth it! I stopped by the other day and they made me a cup of Love. I have no idea what type of coffee it was, but they took care of me like a good business should for the die-hard devotees. Philz coffee always brings a smile to my face and I look forward to their SOMA location like I look forward to a cold beer on a hot day. Thanks again guys!
author: Stephanie J.

description: The is  gourmet coffee shop with a few tables where you can take your laptop out and work a bit.  They really take their coffee seriously and  you should definitely try this place out if you are a coffee aficionado.
author: Byron W.

description: My second favorite drink is coffee and I have never had a better one anywhere else! The the decor is pretty cheesy, but one sip of your Philharmonic and you'll happily sink yourself into one of their cushy pleather arm chairs and drift away...
author: Madame X.

description:
i love the love of this place and though I'm not a coffee drinker (AT ALL) I am a bit of a tea junkie and philz is pretty damn good.

their magic bars and cupcakes (when they are in stock) make it even better.

But is their Cardamom in the Istanbul & Chai Tea or Not!? Every time I go in I get different answer depending on whose working.
author: K B.

description: Parking was tough and with it being as busy as it was, it seemed a bit unorganized in there.  Coffee was good though.
author: Parker W.

description: Damn this is good coffee!  The man himself set me up this weekend with a lightning bolt in a cup and it carried me through big time.  Arabic blend, cream and sugar is a winner if you are fan of the latte.  Excellent addition to the hood
author: Porfirio R.

description: It comes down to taste.  Other cafes focus on external ingredients like syrups, sprinkles, and whip cream concoctions to enhance their coffees.  IMO that is not needed at Philz.  They have over a dozen beans to choose from and it is the best I've tasted period.   I'm glad they opened up shop near my neighborhood.
author: Chad C.

description: I wish I could give this place 5 stars, but I don't do drip coffee so I can't. The folks were really nice, the space was great and the ambiance was perfect. The only problem here is that I don't do drip coffee and they don't do espresso drinks. That being said, if I was going to drink drip coffee, I would go here. I had the New Manhattan coffee (their recommendation) and it was pretty good. I could almost see myself drinking it on a regular basis... Almost. I may decide to upgrade this place to 5 stars should I decide that this is the best drip coffee around, but it's not the best coffee in the city, so for now, it's 4 stars. I do feel a bit bad about it though.
author: Erik S.

description: Cam you say the best coffe ever????  There seltion is beyound anything.  It's like wine tasting for coffe drinkers with crazy coffee palets.  THey make it to your flavor with cream sugar so nothing is needed when you get your coffee.  A great spot with a truly knowledgable staff who is always nice and on top of it.  If you haven't had coffe from philz well then you haven't had coffee
author: Jason W.

description: Well now this is just getting ridiculous. As if getting my 'condition' treated at Peet's every day wasn't  enough. Now they have gone and built the coffee house of my dreams, and put it directly in the path of where I travel to work. I would have to go out of my way NOT to come here every morning and sample a new great-tasting coffee. In a comfortable chair. With free net access. I mean, come on. Am I living in some kind of personal Matrix-like simulation heaven now, or what? I don't think I would have betrayed Neo and the rest of the brave crew of the Nebuchadnezzar for a reward like this..or would I? I don't want to know... I just recommend that you go there and try it. And bring your own reusable cup for Gaia's sake. They don't appear to have non-disposable cups (the only drawback!)
author: Pete C.

description: My favorite coffee hands down.  Love it more than Blue Bottle.  The best!
author: kathy c.

description: Great coffee, warm atmosphere (the couches are oh, so comfy!), and friendly staff - Philz is my ultimate go-to spot for delish, one-of-a kind coffee! I've tried 5 or 6 of their coffees, my favorite by far is Jacob's! Minus 1 star for the fact that the tastiness of the cup is dependent on who your barista is - some are simply better than others at adding the right amount of sugar and cream.
author: Erin R.

description: Delicious coffee (try Jacob's), enthusiastic service, and vegan donuts. And all 1 block from Caltrain!
author: Emily B.

description: I came here on Saturday with my husband and we ordered a cup of coffee and pastry.  I picked up the coffee on the counter, as the guy asked me "can you taste it, see if it's okay".  I felt a little weird as being asked to taste on the spot like that.  It did not taste as I wanted, so he added more brown sugar and the result was...way..way to sweet...I just wondering during rush hour....I would suggest give the customer the options, to mix their coffee themselves or have the barista to mix it....if it's not busy..I guess this concept will work, but still the caveat is...you just don't know how people like their coffee....
author: Pikachu P.

description:
I LOVE Philz.  I moved into the neighborhood recently and tried this place out and I have to say it is possibly the BEST coffee I've had in my life.  I love the choices in beans (adore the jacob's), and the fact that they hand brew each cup and how they somehow know the perfect combination of cream and sugar each single time.  I'm never going to starbucks again (if I can avoid it).  On top of it all, the staff is super cool and friendly.  I've brought several friends here and they all agree with how good it is!

Seriously, if you haven't been yet, what are you waiting for?? GO GO GO!!!
author: Alessandra M.

description:
How can people even compare Philz to Blue Bottle??? Blue Bottle can be compared to starbucks or something, but Philz is on a whole different level. Philz is the BEST coffee I've ever had by FAR. Everytime I go, I like to try a different roast, and I've never been let down. Every single roast is excellent, although some are certainly better than others. Too bad there's just so many, that I can't even remember which are the best now. I love how they put in cream and sugar for you if you want it, because they put in perfect amounts every single time. 

Sure it's a little bit pricey compared to other coffee shops, but it is no doubt worth that extra dollar. I like this location just because its a little bigger and nicer than the other ones I've been to (one on Van Ness, and one on 24th street).
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
I recently had to switch locations at my job.  It kinda sucks having to go from a 15 minute commute to one that is almost an hour, but the biggest saving grace of the whole experience has been getting to go to Philz Coffee everyday I work.  
  Having worked at a coffee shop for over 3 years I consider myself something of a snob when it comes to brewing a damn fine cup of coffee, or at least I thought I was, until I tried this place.  The best coffee I've ever tasted, hands down.  The menu offers everyone under the sun their perfect cup of coffee.  And the best thing, they brew it one cup at a time, no old stale coffee taste for you folks, no no, only the best.  You order it  and they will grind the beans right there, and brew the freshest tasting cup you've ever had.
  The staff is really friendly and are always way chipper than I am at 7am, which makes me wonder how many cups they've had before I'm even through the door.  Whatever the answer is I don't care, so long as they keep me topped up with their finest brews. Try anything on the menu, or if you're not sure what you want, just ask the people making the coffee, and they'll recommend something that will blow your mind and taste buds away!
author: Nathan C.

description:
i just read through some of the reviews here and had no idea that the quaint little store right behind our house was such a rage! :)

checked it out this weekend for the first time and yeah, it was really wonderful. we were all taken aback at how each coffee cup was made one at a time by one person and given so much time and attention. was all the more surprised when they added our milk and sugar for us too :)

my friend ordered a chai and went back to get some more sugar in it. seems like he and the guy behind the counter struck up a short conversation in which my friend told him how the chai tasted a little different from what he'd thought and you know what - the guy actually made him another cup of chai right there...*just* the way my friend liked it! talk about great service yeah! :)

liked the laid-back ambiance of the place. will definitely be going back for more :)
author: Shradha B.

description: Best coffee I've had since moving to San Francisco.  The coffee is flavorful, strong, and made to order.  The barista was a bit over-enthusiastic for me to face in the morning, but hell, it was warranted!
author: Shawna S.

description: I've been waiting for Philz to open, and wouldn't you know that it's open and I''m leaving my job across the street.  Philz is unique, individually brewed cups of coffee, and all those varieties to choose from!  I 've tried the milder ones and they are really good - like coffee is meant to be.  Sit outside on a nice day, sip your coffee, and enjoy life.  Thanks Philz.
author: Janice P.

description: There are three Starbucks within two blocks of here, so if you just have to have your venti soy latte with two splendas, go there.  If you want real, handmade, brewed to order coffee, then go to Philz.  Get the Anesthesia to the Upside.  It'll blow your mind.
author: Kevin M.

description: There is something quintessential San Francisco about being able to walk into a Philz and get a fresh brewed cup from over 20 varieties of beans. It's fantastic coffee, and the brilliant one cup at a time process only adds to the experience.
author: Jason B.

description: This is some damn fine coffee. Really good stuff. Probably the second best I've ever had. But I have two questions: 1) Why are the breads stale? The two I got today (gingerbread and lemon-lavender bread) tasted and felt like they had been sitting out for a few days. What's up with that? And 2) Why do they shake the milk vigorously before pouring it in my coffee? It's seriously odd. A little disturbing. Won't keep me from returning, but I'd like to know the answer.
author: J. C.

description: One cup at a time!  I love, love, love philz!  My kidz like the hot chocolate.  My wife enjoys the yerba matte.  I enjoy the philtered soul or swiss water decaf.
author: Aaron L.

description: Nothing like a cup of Philz to get you moving in the morning.  Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.
author: Virginia R.

description: Superb Coffee, very top notch!!! I love how every cup of coffee is custom made to your preference. This is the only coffee shop I've been to where the Barista's are actual Barista's and not, push button monkey's.
author: Marco M.

description:
As a deprived Brit brought up on freeze dried Nescafe instant coffee and having discovered coffee in SF I have to ask "Does it get any better than this?'

Besides, the barista who recommended me a New Manhattan is too cute for words.

... so no, I think this is pretty much as good as it gets!
Yours, addicted exile.
author: Jonatthan G.

description: Thank you, Trolley Dances, for causing me to accidentally stumble upon the  wonder that is Philz! There's a slightly overwhelming selection, but the baristas are perfectly friendly and helpful, and the flavors are decadent. Yummmm.
author: Sam S.

description: Awesome doesn't begin to describe it.  Designer coffee, if there is one.  Brewed to order.  Snooty? - sure.  Tasty? - you bet your ass it is.
author: Iggy V.

description: The Turkish coffee brewed here means business. Although the staff seems less-than-excited for customers on a slow day, the cup of bliss handed to you is well worth their frowns. It's not that they're UNHAPPY, just. . . well, bored with the confused customers that wonder about the non descriptive coffee names. As they might say, "parlak." ("splendid.")
author: Liz L.

description: I heard of Philz from several people..mostly how expensive it is...so I was on my lunch hour with time to kill so I stopped in for a afternoon cup of coffee....I had never been and I guess it was obvious this was my first time...im usually a latte kind of girl....the barista asked what I liked...I told her dark...she said she would brew me her favorite...and I forgot to ask what it was!!!! now I can't stop thinking about that incredible cup of coffee and want THAT coffee...but I don' t know what it was!!! she even blended it with cream and sugar perfectly!!! Worth the money....worth the travel....going back today...and tomorrow and they day after
author: Nancy P.

description: I am a big Philz fan and a regular weekend visitor. I usually surpass this place in the mornings because I'm rushing, but when I have the time to ponder life, it's always better with a cup of Philz in my hand. I used to wonder why anyone would pay around 3 bucks for coffee. I mean, isn't it just coffee? Well, no not really. The coffee is good, very good here and I'm now spoiled rotten because of this place. The snacks here are also delicious, from the savory cheese and ham concoctions to the blueberry bran muffins. Then, the last piece of the trifecta is the service. People here are really nice and not overly sugary sweet nice, but good people nice. I'm really glad that Philz is in the neighborhood because it's now part of our weekend routine. So if you see a couple with a little dog and boxer say "Hi!"
author: Charlene C.

description: I was killing time before the Giants game last night and was delighted to see an old favorite in a new neighborhood. As usual, my cup of coffee was delicious and worth the wait. So great. They are right next to the new Mission Bay library branch, so grab a book (be sure to check it out, no stealing!) and come to Philz for some coffee....
author: Rachel M.

description:
peanut butter and jelly
mac and cheese
wine and cheese
chocolate cake and milk
Philz Coffee and SF Public Library

all great combinations--what can be better than a delicious freshly brewed cup of coffee (Philtered Soul or Jacob's Brew), friendly baristas, free wi fi  and a stack of books?
author: Smruti S.

description:
it's not blue bottle, but Philz is some damn good coffee.  their dark brews are guaranteed to please even the hardiest coffee drinkers, those like myself who enjoy putting (even more) hair onto their chests and stimulants into their bloodstreams.

it's a novel concept, having your coffee prepared from individually ground beans.  thanks to the filtration you are getting a spectacularly tasty cup of coffee, minus the oils that penetrate a french press plunger.

this is an excellent local chain alternative to starbucks for those who want variety.  with over two dozen roasts two choose from (and they are mostly unique), you can spice it up every day.

downsides: still a bit pricey for a cup of coffee (sorry, it's the philadelphian in me, it should be cheaper).  also, barista-blended cream and sugar gives you little creative control over the finished product.

kudos to the staff here, who are always smiling and patient with newcomers, and seem to have fun with each other - such as experimenting with coffee and watermelon (it just doesn't go, guys, let it go).
author: davide g.

description: FABULOUS coffee!!!   I like to come here on the weekends and try their many brews.  The staff are knowledgeable and are helpful when deciding which ones to try.  If you're looking for a great cup of coffee, then you'll enjoy Philz.   I think the only downside is parking.
author: Suzanne C.

description: Wins. These guys care about coffee, it comes through in the product for sure. It was recommended that I have the Jacob's Wonderbar Brew. Good recommendation.
author: Jason P.

description: Great filtered-drip coffee.  The coffee doesn't taste burnt like Starbucks and Peets, but still has loads of flavor.  I've been trying to get myself off coffee and drink tea instead but Philz is the one exception.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Sandy W.

description: I was introduced today to Philz by a colleague as we were preparing for a presentation at UCSF Mission Bay Center. I really enjoyed the service and the "Iz the best" coffee. Philz has a good thing going. I hope they find their way out to Danville where I live.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Wandered in on a Sunday morning from the Caltrain station. Just wanted a cup of coffee. I'm not picky. Ordered a small cup of house coffee, not looking at the menu.

WTF? $3 for a cup of coffee? Whatever, I wanted coffee. So I'm waiting around for my coffee -- what's taking so damn long? It's a frickin' cup of house coffee. Then I realize they're _making_ the coffee one cup at a time. Well, no wonder it's expensive.

When I finally got my $3 cup of coffee, I was stunned. It was the best cup of coffee I'd ever had in my life. F'ing amazing.
author: Helmut W.

description:
mmmm mmm mmmm
mmmm
mm mmm
coffee as good as at the Mission location and better seating because you can sit outside more comfortably when it's sunny.  Love LOVE the sesame cookie i wolfed down, too.  so glad to have another location!!!!
author: Today Y.

description:
who cares about blue bottle when they sell liquid crack with cardamom here.   best coffee in the city.   possibly the country even.

update:  oops i already reviewed philz  2 yrs ago (http://www.yelp.com/biz/philz-coffee-san-francisco#hrid:Zkj_86Od6qEwjvu5siKYlA).  well, what i said.  glad they have more than 1 branch and hope they open more
author: X X.

description: I love Philz.  The Philharmonic is the best and I love that its right by the General, so I can get a cup when I need it the most.  Plus there's just something so nurturing about having someone ask you how you take your coffee.  Reminds me of my dad making me cafe con leche when I was a little girl.  Seriously though--- Philz makes me happy and I love their shop.  Call me old fashioned I like a coffee shop with character and warm indoor spaces.  A place I can sit down and kick it.
author: Ona E.

description: Awesome coffee here and excellent service.  The only problem is that whenever I have their coffee, I seem to have trouble sleeping.  This sucks, as I intend on continuing my consumption of their coffee (I can't stop), yet also need to get some sleep.  Bah!
author: Naomi N.

description: Quality seems to be going down a bit. Coffee wasn't as good when it was when the shop opened several months ago. There is a high turn over rate of employees there and the only ones who know how to make the coffee right are Philz offspring. Its still better than starbucks, but if their consistency doesn't improve, its not worth it to me to go down there and pay for something that is below my expectations.
author: Cat B.

description: Usually, I don't really care about coffee. However, this place is unique and different. The staff is friendly, the place is cozy, and the coffee is strong and hella good. It's a bit more expensive than Starbux but it also taste a lot better.
author: nik t.

description: Great coffee!!  Such great selections. I'm a coffee lover and I was in coffee heaven. They've got good bakery items as well.
author: Style M.

description: blue bottle, please step down.. this place takes the coffee king throne for me.  amazing selection and service.
author: Fotos C.

description: While the coffee is great, something is a bit off about this location.  I much prefer the Philz on Van Ness.  The service is a bit hit-or-miss and I don't know...for a place charging $3 for a cup of coffee I would expect a bit nicer decor.  It more or less has the decor and poor lighting of every crappy cafe I studied at in college.
author: Chris R.

description:
My son has been talking about Philz for years.  A few years ago, I was 'devirginized' on a Tesora latte at another of Philz locations and have been a fan ever since. Best damn latte ever. EVER. No kidding. And as I don't live or work in SF, I don't get to Philz often enough. But one day my Domestic Accomplice and I were leaving the city through the financial district and I called for information on the closest Philz location. I was given this address. I walked up, saw lights on, people at work, but the door was closed. I knocked and someone came to the door and said: "Sorry - we're just getting this location up and running - we're not open yet." 
     My face fell. 
    "Come on in, we'll fix you something, it's on the house." One Tesora Latte and one Jasmine tea and a lot of good will later ... for their very first customers. Way to do business, Philz!
    When one of my sons is in town they bring me a pound of Tesora. Way to make points with mom.
author: MsM R.

description: Great coffee, and I am a self-professed coffee snob.  They have at least 20 different types of beans, each one singly ground and brewed for you.  Service is very friendly and helpful in navigating the array of choices.  The pastries they have in-house are only so-so, but the coffee is unbeatable.
author: Michelle C.

description: Wow!  That's some incredibly strong (and good) coffee I get there in the evenings!  It's good thing I did not get a large size or else I'd be up for the entire night!  The fresh sprig of mint was the perfect compliment, too.
author: Rick E.

description: Best coffee in the city, hands down. But don't take my word for it. Go there yourself. Do it now. I'll wait ... Oh, and can you pick me up a large Tantalizing Turkish while you're there?
author: Josh E.

description:
1.  i walked past and made fun of the name, and then made fun of that fact that a small coffee shop was trying to compete with my beloved starbucks across the street.

2.  i went in and had a coffee at a friends request.

3.  best coffee of my life, i am now a 100% total philz fanboy
author: Jason H.

description: I ordered TESORA blend which is medium roast and will makes u go mmmmmmmm........! It's great to visit Philz with ur dogs! (park is right near on the street.) Fresh coffee and nice view*** Also, I got 1lb for souvenir,full of joy.
author: Erika Y.

description: I'm a coffee snob from Seattle and absolutely LOVE Philz! Each beverage is individually crafted and poured to perfection. It might even beat Cafe Ladro and Joe Bar back home...
author: Carly J.

description: I never write reviews, but I had to add this: Philz coffee is amazing, and the staff are super friendly and knowledgeable. BUT, the pastries, particularly the croissants, are super greasy! I bought one this morning, and ten minutes later, my brown paper bag and napkin were SOAKED through with grease. It of course tasted good in all of its greasiness, but Philz needs to step up the pastries. I say, go to Philz for just coffee, but if you want coffee and a pastry, go to the Creamery. And it pains me to say that, because I really like Philz.
author: M G.

description:
THANK GOD!
Philz opened in my neck of the woods!
I also got to meet the man behind the caffeine ecstasy, Phil himself...what a classy dude! He's generous and his excitement about his creations is contagious! 
The rest of the staff is just as awesome and they're kind to pooches too.
June 8 I heard, is a grand celebration at this location... 
So get in there!!!
author: Sara K.

description: I'm not a coffee person. But if I were this might be my favorite joint.  The staff are really, genuinely nice, the space is lovely, and the coffee was SO fresh and flavorful.
author: Ms K.

description: JACOB'S WUNDERBAR is the best coffee I've ever tasted.....I do like to fix my own cream and sugar...which I didn't like the girl doing for me!  It's a good place to go...one cup at a time ensure's freshness but even Howard Schultz doesn't charge $3 for a large coffee!
author: John B.

description: Do they roast crack into there coffee because it is strong and addictive. The strongest best tasting coffee I have ever had and the service is excellent.
author: Jason M.

description:
when i used to live on treat and 24th i would go to philz in the morning or noon time, have a smoke, then run home as fast as possible because 2 minutes later the turkish coffee was vacating my system.  its goddamed jet fuel and i get .01 to the gallon.

before the other location was created on 18th and sanchez then sold or whatever happened; phil would talk about how he wanted a line of coffee stations in the shop with a beautiful girl at each pot, prepping the coffee.  It was a beautiful dream for a while, because really, how easy is it to get stupid hipster girls to work coffee stations for 4 hours at minimum wage, just cause its '"cool"?  that phil was a man among men on the 24th street strip.
author: regan g.

description: Nice setting, pretty solid coffee.  I tried the Jacob's something or other and it was nice.  Service is also really friendly.
author: Sahil D.

description:
Ok, so I have never written a yelp review, actually i just made an account solely for the purpose of posting this review.  
I went to Philz Coffee on Barry street on a tuesday afternoon i think..and did not know what I was walking into..I had bascally the shittiest morning in a while, and for some reason could not get out of this funk all morning.  I had work coming up and needed something to keep me curling up in bed and missing work. so i stopped in for a boost.  
My initial thought was, sh*t I know nothing about coffee, this is overwhelming, im going to look like a dummy walkin in not knowing a darn thing about coffee.  
Then, a cute girl smiled and asked what I would like..long story short she helped me find a wonderful taste that fit me perfectly without saying one thing about coffee.
Next, as I was heading to the register to pay, another cute girl, who obviously had her coffee today was shimmying and smiling behind the counter and said, "I have found it is impossible to shimmy and NOT smile.."
this made me smile.  
but this doesnt end, she made light conversation then gave me the most delicious cupcake I have ever had, and in one bite hit all my senses right to leave me with a perma grin for the rest of the day.  I mean damn..that was probably the best costomer service I had had in a long time..and it flipped my day from complete crap to actually a pretty good day! :)
PLUS
they had water outside for my pup to sip on while i went to get my fix!
A + for the whole shebang!
author: S B.

description: Hands down the best and most consistently good cup of plain ol' joe (although it's not really plain) that I've ever had. I usually go with the Philtered Soul: it's fabulous. It's not cheap...but mmmm is it good. A nice treat once or twice a week...
author: Tim S.

description: Philz has the best coffee imaginable... really superb. Just go!!
author: L T.

description:
I usually am a coffee person so I will probably come back to try their coffee at some point, but when I was last there, it was 4PM so I got a chai latte (less caffeine?). 

In any case, I have never had a chai latte SO watery in my life! It was completely bland and watered down. My friend ordered a hot chocolate, which was also similarly entirely watered down. Maybe we should have stirred? There was a layer of condensed sediment at the bottom when we got towards the ends of our cups, but it looked and tasted watered down when we initially got our drinks! We were very disappointed.
author: E M.

description:
Start your day off right get a coffe at philz 
The staff is supper eficient and a great cup of cofee every time
I like the sooogooood but there are many many good choices here
author: roger d.

description: I don't drink that much coffee, I'm just not much of a coffee fan.  But  will come back for more after tasting my first cup here.  It was not bad, kind of pricey, but hey everything is expensive now a days.  Fast, friendly and efficient.
author: Goose C.

description: Mmmm... silken splendor.  This place makes fantastic coffee and the people are so friendly.  You can ask all sorts of questions about the different coffees and their recommendations have all been great thus far.  What more does one need in their neighborhood coffee joint.
author: Serena L.

description: Philz Mocha Tesora is soo good, I gulp down the first half in one unstoppable swig, and the rest so very slowly lamenting that it'll all over too soon. Their other coffees are great too, and I like how the barista makes sure every patron gets their coffee just the way they like it.
author: demaws o.

description:
dang phil. why you gotta hire such foxy baristas? isn't it enough to get us hooked on your magical mystery brews that practically induce hallucinations? 
no. you have to steal our hearts as well. 
sigh.
author: Abi K.

description:
I don't normally drink coffee...but will indulge when there are rave reviews like Philz gets.  The mocha and the iced coffee - heavenly.

I will now be a coffee drinker on the rare occasions I venture to the neighborhoods that house Philz.
author: Melind H.

description: Philz is without a doubt the best cup of coffee I have ever had.  The blends are a little confusing at first, but every single cup is good.  I'm not sure what it's attributable to - I'm guessing it's the tons of coffee beans that goes into a single cup (or the heavy cream and sugar), but it's soooo freaking good!  The service is awesome as well.  Every other coffee place is dead to me.
author: David H.

description:
After reading all the great reviews of this place on yelp I decided to test it out. The décor was inviting and the seats looked very comfortable. Since I got there so early there was hardly a line. The layout is confusing. You have to pass by the register to place your order then backtrack to pay. There were no signs to make this very clear. I didn't think the service was anything extraordinary. I get same type of service when I go to starbucks or peets. So I ordered a mocha from the menu and was very disappointed. The coffee was only luke warm and tasted very chalky, kind of like hot version of Ensure. It wasn't a soothing or tasty cup of coffee I was hoping for. The barista attempted to fix it however it tasted worse. I still ended up with the coffee however after a few sips of my large coffee I ended up throwing it away. 

Honestly their coffee was just very average street coffee.  Next I will just stick to my soothing latte at Starbucks. I really wanted to like philz cause it's walking distance from home.
author: Meredith L.

description: cult coffee 20 menu cup each grind brew wifi big couches not wa wa like mission all day police love clean tropical plants no parking nowhere no park no microsoft no bull train train train if you dont philz you dont exist go apple
author: Gil S.

description:
last monday morning i rolled myself into philz coffee at 930am for a coffee date with one of my girls. i was visiting from so cal so i let her pick the place. having just moved from seattle a few months prior, i've been to more than a few coffee places within my years. i've seen some "meat markets" disguised as yuppy coffee houses and met a few snooty baristas and even had the pleasure of making monetary transactions w/employees who would not speak a single word to you nor glance in my direction. 

i was very pleased as i stumbled up to the counter, half asleep, to order one of my "usuals" - a vanilla soy latte.  they not only helped me figure out their unique ordering system but they were absolutely pleasant in doing so.  they picked the bean they thought would be closest to my latte, confirmed the roast and sweetness level. once i ordered, the gentleman who was going to be taking my dinero was not stunned at the least when i had no idea what my order was...i just referred to his colleague that hand picked it for me. i sat down w/my girl for only a few minutes when my barista walked my drink over to me and asked me to taste it first(!!) before he walked away to make sure it was right. not only was it right but it was perfect. and there's nothing in the world that would upset me more than messing up my caffeine bright and early on a sunday morning.

not only would i go here again. i would suggest philz coffee to anyone living closer in proximity than i. enjoy!
author: joanna l.

description: Phil is the man! This is what the coffee experience is all about. Ordering a double short-double fat no foam soy latte makes you a douchebag in my book. I would be embarrassed to order a frozen carmel machiato (even for a girl I'm hooking up with). That being said... this is straight forward handcrafted cups of coffee. Just coffee. There is almost fifty different blends to choose from. My favorites: Phillharmonic, Ether, and It's the best.
author: HiFive E.

description: don't walk in here expecting a mocha or latte.  individual drip coffee is their specialty.  quite the selection.  i had a light roast which was damn strong...but just what i needed at the time.  i wanted to use their Wi-Fi but could not get on for the life of me...oh well.  check it.
author: Jen S.

description:
good coffee and a nice staff, but not a place to go to if you're trying to get work done or relax as it is quite loud. 

jacobs wonderbrew and the philz green tea (with mint and honey) are delicious.
author: A K.

description: Best cup of joe I've had in a long time, better than even Gorilla or Stumptown if you ask me! They also warmed up my chocolate croissant.
author: Molly M.

description: After hearing about Philz coffee for years, I was glad to move into a place near this cafe. The cafe itself is comfy, the staff great, and the location suits me wonderfully, but I am not with the crowd on their coffee. It's not bad, and what I have had there is interesting, but I'll take Ritual or Blue Bottle any day over Philz. Also, the prices here are crazy -- a dollar more than what I am used to paying even for premium, brewed one at a time coffee. I'll keep going occasionally out of convenience of the location, but since both Blue Bottle and Ritual beans are brewed nearby, Philz will not become my new usual hangout.
author: Dan G.

description: if you like to enjoy a nice fresh black drip coffee, then philz is your place...  they don't make any fancy espresso drinks that are standard at starbucks and pete's... when i used to work at arterra down the street, coworkers and i would frequent philz for a nice of joe to break up the afternoon joys of work... h-100...
author: Herb F.

description: I am not a SF native sadly, but if I was I would never go to another coffee place but Philz!! The choices of whole bean coffee are easily over 15 and the iced mojito coffee was out of this world delicious! The price is high at $3.50 a cup for a "regular" coffee, but for pure coffee bliss comparable to none I have ever had, so worth it!  If you live even remotely close to a Philz and haven't been, it is a travesty!
author: K Y.

description: funny, when I was a broke arse college student the pour-hot-water-over-the-single-cup-cone-thingy was right up there with generic jam on my list of things I couldn't wait to trade in when I had my own income.  Now it seems I am happy to fork over 5$ for someone else to make me that cup of drip coffee, and thank you for serving me!
author: Fallon C.

description: Ahh ... mmm ... love this coffee! I was really worried that this place took itself too seriously, and I was freaked out by all the obscurely named coffee options. In fact, I still think this place takes itself a bit seriously, and I'm still dizzied by the options. But, boy, does Philz put out a great product! It blow doors on Starbucks, whose coffee just tastes ... burnt.
author: Midori S.

description:
i told Phil i love him.

i'm not a gushy emotional chick but Phil just brings it out in me. He and his coffee are just warm and rich and full of character. i'm a Peet's person during the week because, well, Peet's is across the street from my office; but whenever i have time to savor a good cup i make a beeline for Philz! mmm goodness.
author: Tracy C.

description: i very much get the happy claps when i have a minute to run to philz to get some coffee. when i have the whole week off, i'm down there almost every day and would be down there twice a day if i wasn't afraid i'd be labelled a philz stalker/ groupie. the people are very nice, coffee is excellent for the most part. love taking my out of town guests here - totally spoil them for starbucks once they go home! happy claps, happy claps!
author: Elena N.

description: When I read the reviews, I  had super high expectations. When I have high expectations, the reality tends to be worse. But WOW, high expectations = reality. The coffee was soooo darn good. They gave me the newcomer's coffee blend, which was the Tesora (#19). It was the perfect cup. The employee even added the right amount of sugar! Usually when others add the sugar for me, it's overly sweet, but the guys here know the perfect combination of cream, sugar, and coffee. I can't wait to try the other blends.
author: S. H.

description:
the coffee and the folks that work here are great.  always friendly, always good cup of coffee the way I like it.

Ambrosia, cream and sugar.  I'm hooked.

Bye bye Starbucks.
author: John D.

description: the "tesora" is perhaps the best cup of coffee i've had outside of costa rica. careful though: this stuff is STRONG...prepare to be cracked out for days on a single small cup. pastries aren't bad either. getting an extra star just for being in my hood.
author: dusty d.

description: Now this place makes good coffee drinks, but I'm not really able to tell if the coffee itself is really better than some of the instant coffee due to the amount of sugar and Industrial Grade Cream they put in the drinks. I tried their coffee without all the standard stuff, and it didn't taste any better than any other coffee I've had.
author: Roger R.

description: I finally understand how people get addicted to drugs, sports, whatever...  I'm a tea person but is it bad that I always think about their coffee and create elaborate plans to get my next "fix"?  This coffee is ammmaaaaazzzzing!
author: Molly R.

description: As someone who works out of a CAR or a coffee shop, I like when I can choose the location of the meeting and make it Philz.  It is a great place to sit and chat, and introduce a new person to a new cup of coffee.
author: William W.

description: Ether, cream no sugar. Sure, it's an expensive cup of coffee, but it's a freaking good one. Seems like there's always a police car outside and officers getting ther caffeine on inside..
author: Linda M.

description: Incredible coffee, great service. The new location is a reason to get up and go to work in the morning and they open at 5:30am! A piece of heaven just far enough from the ball park crowds. And, you can hop off the T-line, get your coffee, and watch for the train to hop back on.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Philz Turkish coffee is such a treat.  The only coffee...well, only drink really, that I go out of my way to get.  Atmosphere seems to be lacking a bit but with coffee that good, they don't need it.
author: Amanda H.

description: Best Coffee ever. The staff is great. I try to every day .
author: Felicia R.

description: Very good. A bit strong, but superb flavor. Very sad the SF Health Dept won't let the dogs inside anymore, but that's not Phil's fault. Perhaps adding an outside heater would help when it's frigid (which is practically always..). Outstanding staff. Will be back and often.
author: Elle E.

description: a friend told me this was the best coffee place around so i made a stop when i was in the area. the place has got more varieties of coffee than i know what to do  - over a dozen each of mild, medium, and dark roast and great descriptions to go along with all their coffees.  this place is great for people that like to change it up and to keep coffee fresh. philz brews their coffee one cup at a time and they make it strong which makes this place refreshing in this overly commercial  coffeeshop climate. after philz, all other coffeeshop coffees just seem plain dull.
author: B S.
